column7: 2008년 5월 16일 개관하였다. 명칭은 건립자인 유창종(柳昌宗)이 자신의 성과 아내인 금기숙(琴基淑)의 성을 따서 지었다. 법조인이자 한국기와학회의 명예회장이기도 한 유창종은 검사로 재직하던 시절부터 옛 기와에 매료되어 기와를 수집하였고, 2001년에는 25년 동안 수집해온 1875점을 국립중앙박물관에 기증하였다.

column1: 유금와당박물관에는 유창종이 2001년 이후 한국과 중국, 일본, 태국, 베트남 등지에서 수집한 각국의 기와들과 일본의 이우치 이사오[井內功]의 아들로부터 기증받은 1300여 점 등 총 2700여 점이 전시된다. 이우치 이사오는 1987년 국립중앙박물관에 한국의 기와 1082점을 반환한 인물로, 국립중앙박물관 2층에는 유창종실과 이우치실이 나란히 있다.

column7: 정말 좋습니다

Absolutely beautiful and well-organized tour. No pictures allowed, except in one area of a courtyard. You have to remove your shoes during one part of the tour- I'd wear shoes that easily slips on and off. Remember to make a reservation and English tours are not available everyday. Worth it!
It was a great way to learn about the way people lived in Joseon dynasty. The guide was fantastic, but we wished the guided tour was a little bit longer - it was only an hour and we felt rushed.

It was a great experience at the museum. We walked around with a tour guide and about 20 people total. The guide was very through with her descriptions and the place was very well maintained. The guide also took great pictures of my group during the photo opportunity.
Beautiful museum with a great collection. The tour is excellent and very informative. The price is a bit high, though, compared to the prices of other museums in the city.
Worth to take a tour. Only problem is to get there and no f&b service for tour guest.

구로 공단 거래처 방문
Checked out this year's Da Vinci Creative. What a great exhibition with many visually inventive installations!
Great art residency

The best selections, choices n most of all, price with friendly n helpful shopkeepers
The price of flowers are crazy good but you have to clean your flower by yourself and to be honest it was very hard for me 😂 the price of plant was not that good I think
It's the main market for flowers and plants. Looks and smells amazing. There are a lot of purple orchid shops. Prices are very reasonable.
It is one of the best place to buy flower , gardening stuff and pot
Perfect place to buy a variety of flowers. The prices also range greatly, from small 3,000 won plants to expensive ones over 200,000 won. There's much to see, and very vibrant.
관세청 개청 30주년을 기념하여 2000년 8월 27일 서울세관 본부에 설치된 관세관련 특수박물관이다. 관세는 수출입 물품에 대하여 부과되는 세금으로 우리 나라에서는 1878년 부산에 두모진 해관이 생기면서 근대적 관세업무가 시작되어, 오늘날에는 관세청 본청 외에 전국의 28개 세관과 14개 출장소 등에서 통관·심사 및 조사와 감시업무를 수행하고 있다.

column1: 박물관에는 수집된 1만1천여 점의 관세관련 유물 및 사료 중 1,500여 점을 상설 전시하고 있으며 관세청 및 세관의 활동 등을 영상물에 담아 상영하는 홍보실도 운영하고 있다. 전시장은 환영의 장, 역사의 장, 이해의 장, 정보의 장, 국제의 장으로 구성되어 있다.

column7: 전시실.공방.카페
ここをどう見るかは人によって変わるかな。リサイクルをより超えたアップサイクルの考え方はいいですが、結果的にリサイクル止まり。週末にはフリーマーケットや作家の講演会などが行われ人も訪れますが、まだ知名度がないのと、アクセスの不便なところにあるので、住民が利用する施設には思えませんでした。今のままでは、リサイクル、というより大きなゴミを作っているようなものでしょう‥

Well organized and maintained. Heart of transportation for seoul. Variety of restaurants and snack shops available. As usual in Korea, breast feeding and baby dress change rooms are available. That's always a 5* point.

Extremely huge station. It takes a while to get from the Airport Railroad Line to the main overground tracks. There are information counters here to help you get directions. Lots of shops before the tracks selling bento boxes. Go look for these instead of the shops you find inside the station.
Big central train (and busses) hub, impressive. Busy. Plenty of eateries, shops, etc. Old Seoul Station next door (museum now).
Nice! It will be the fure' ov' the world!
Kind helpful information desk guiding us to easy to get to places. Clean city from the spots we went to.
It's a toys museum. You can cover it in half hour.

It is a great place to visit, I wished so much that kids were with me! Animation figures are just so fun. It is very easy to find, if you do Namsan cable car. Just walk 10 minutes downhill and you are there. I did not plan to visit, it was completely unexpected, but a very pleasant surprise.

While exploring the remarkable electronics parts markets in cheonggyecheon I stumbled across FabLab.

column1: I was welcomed in, and invited to have a look around. It looks to be a well equipped workspace with some interesting tools with which to be creative with.

It was fairly quiet early Tuesday afternoon, but there looks like quite a bit of space available when it does get busy. Nice views out across the river from one of the higher floors of the building too.
I'd definitely make good use of the space if I lived in Seoul !

column7: Fantastic crew and tool. Come here to build your maker project!

The best hackerspace in Korea. They got literally everything from lasercutters, 3D printers, CNC machines, power tools, electronic production, modeling/designing all available for use once taught by the highly qualified employees there.
Best makerspace in Korea with qualified managers. Small space is the downside.
If you have interest to make by yourself, you must visit here.
The rooftop lookout has a nice view.
So many random stuffs here
Not a big fan of this place but you can buy almost any electronic device here.
not good
great
이움피움

Having traveled through many Asian countries, I'd say this was a lesser impressive market. Not only were the food stalls shelling out mostly the same things, but the prices were as if I was at a regular food hall or restaurant. When coming to any market, I expect low prices with minimal service. Definitely still worth a gander and if you're in town for a but, stock up on the fresh Kimchi selection for your fridge.

Nice market to eat street food. There aren't too many options, the stalls are kind of repetitive but it's nice to have everything in one place. From fish cake and pork feet, kimbap and live octopus. There's plenty of food to enjoy and it's nice the market has a covering so you aren't in direct sunlight during the day.
Busy market with many interesting sights and kind vendors. Mung bean pancakes are delicious. Street food is yummy in general! Had some tough tteokbokki though :(

Lots of colours and interesting to see. Whilst it looks like a lot of food most of the vendors sell the same things and of the same quality. Very few sweet things to eat. Got very warm and stuffy during summer. Borderline unpleasant due to the heat so best prepare yourself for that.

It's become increasingly touristed but it is a true market experience. Honestly even though I live in the city I feel like a tourist here as I rarely have need to buy the things out on sale there. However, the street food is still great and authentic, and the used clothing market is aleays a great place for wandering and rummaging.
Almost everything a musician would need to buy in one big music mall. Also fun to just walk around and just browse

Please visit Kyung Eun Acoustic if you are looking for the acoustic guitars and anything you need for your guitars. There are Martin, Taylor, Gibson, Larrivee and A lot more Korean guitar brands. Please check it out this cool guitar shop! The best!

Amazing selection of instruments and music electronics. The prices for imports are a bit high but keep in mind the first price they quote might not be the price you pay. I got a 120,000 "discount" on a 700,000 won guitar when it seemed like I wasn't interested. Knowing 지금 Korean will help.

Nakwon Sangga is a massive mess of musical insanity. Two floors about a football field long of musical gear store after musical gear store. You'll find lots of strange rarities, but have problems finding something you'd expect to be common if you're not from around here.

column1: Some things are overpriced and some are a steal. Anything made in the USA or UK will cost you your first born. Better to aim for made in Japan or Korea, though those items tend to be more randomly priced.

I find it improves my shopping experience greatly if I go in with the intent of coming out with whatever neat thing I happen to find rather than plowing through store after store looking for something very specific. In the case of the latter intent, the Internet will serve you better.

Memorial hall for the contemporary history of Korea. Permanent exhibition is less interesting but visual arts they use is quite good. The region is agglomerated with graves of the independent activities among Japanese colonization times & April 19th National Cemetery.

I really enjoy coming here because they always have some quirky and trendy exhibition going on, drawing a younger crowd. Many of the workers are voluntary students as well which makes it more approachable and charges the area with a youthful energy. They also have a large arts, crafts and design shop, and an arts bookstore on the second floor I believe.

The lower level of this place is a wonderful spot to see independent films.  Probably a good idea to make reservations, though, as they seem to sell out most shows.  Note that shows start exactly at the stated time.

column1: There is a stationary shop on the ground level.  There are art spaces elsewhere in the building, but I haven't visited.

column7: EDIT: They are open again. As good as before.

column1: It used to be a nice shop for gifts. However, they are closed now. Not sure if this is temporary or if they will open again after renovations.

column7: Best place to find unique stationary and home bits. There is a coffee shop on the third floor that served one of the best coffees I had in seoul. Definitely coming back!
Very nice design producta from stationary to little pieces of furniture.
Very good and clean local market to explore local Korean snack and restaurant.

양화교 인공폭포, 인공폭포산이 쥐산이다. 근처에 있는 선유도가 고양이산이다. 고양이산은 공사로 인하여 지금은 없어졌다. 인공폭포에는 한강방어 백골부대 전적비가 있으며, 백골부대는 3사단을 말한다

They offer various conference rooms and spa + hotels but I enjoy coming here for the buffets at the end of the year. They have a great selection of meat, seafood and dessert. Top it all off with that chocolate fondue 😯😯😯😯 Its near the Yeoido Han river park (my favorite) so stop by if you're in the area.

₩13,000 to go to the 63rd floor for the night view, when you could just take a short walk down to the river for an equally impressive view (for free, too!) The ladies behind the ticketing counter were extremely unhelpful and rude. There's not much else that's affordable to the average traveller in the building, so I'd say there's no point going there.
Good to see but difficult to get there with out schedule and crowdy coach. Cool to be blended into an art gallery from local designers in the same venue.

Their buffet is really nice. Lots variety and non-typical buffet food.  I've also been to the buffet at The Plaza hotel (?) in more downtown seoul area. I must say, the buffet here is much better than the plaza.

column1: I have more "North American" palate whereas my aunt is super Korean (she has lived in Korea all her life and doesn't venture outside of Korea much..). And we both preferred here than the Plaza.

column7: My family went to the aquarium at the 63 building. My thoughts on the aquarium come in comparison to that of the aquarium at Coex. The 63 Aquarium was less crowded, cleaner, easy to navigate, and my young son enjoyed the mermaid show. If we decide to go for another aquarium visit, it will definatley be at the 63 building. The only downside to this aquarium is that it is a bit on the small side.
Lovely area, right in the center of the financial district of Yeoido. There are little gardens, ponds and activity areas. It's common to find seasonal events hosted here as well.
Very nice park to take a stroll, jog, or even ride a bicycle or Roller-Blade around. There is a rental shop for bicycles and rollerblades.

column1: The open compound has a market going on now (15 April 2018) celebrating the blossoming of the cherry blossoms it seems. Lots of food stalls, game stalls and stalls selling accessories or clothings.
There is an aircraft C-47 on display in the open area and visitors can climb up to take a look at the aircraft interior.
A nice place to spend a leisurely morning, afternoon or evening.

column7: Great park with beautiful scenery and one of the largest parks in Seoul. So big that you cannot finish walking all areas of it in 1 day. There are many seatings here and ample toilet stops. You can also rent a bicycle here. One thing to note: you cannot smoke in this park.

There are so many little gardens!  There are places to sit and eat lunch with friends, plenty of flat grass for picnic, about 6 outdoor gyms, a bike trail and walking trail that run around the entire park, ponds here and there, and so many rentals! There is ice skating in winter, and now that it's spring you can rent bikes, roller blades, basketballs, and scooters. I love walking around this park!
Amazing gem in the middle of a busy city. Large Plaza and nice pathways came here during cherry blossom season and I do not regret visiting this gem.

It was so nice to find a piece of memorable place from my own country. We had a wonderful day over there and shared our strong relationships and feelings with Koreans, our blood brother country's citizens.
샛강바로옆 KBS 별관앞에있음. 소공원규모임.

Great park. This place was originally a purification facility. It has evolved into a wonderful park. You can see very various plants.
Little Island in the middle of Han River. Its nice for a stroll or just to enjoy the nice weather.
The island in Han river that has old rain reservoir which renovated to park for people to visit. Very nice view, you can walk around the park. Can access by foot, bus and car.
Wonderful oasis for busy Koreans in Seoul even though it's just a park. Very few tourists.
Nice combination of nature and an old industrial property. Loots of links between the history of this place and water , plants combination.

Absolutely love the Atrium Grill and Frank! The food is always hot and delicious. I love their breakfast menu and haven't been disappointed yet! My new favorite is the breakfast burrito w/ chorizo and potatoes!
This place is pretty legit! I have only gone to this place for breakfast with the new owner and never disappointed! Stay Golden!
Great food and a very helpful staff.

My lunch break is only a half hour and you guys always manage to get my food to me in time to get back to work regardless of how busy it is. Also, friendliest staff around. See you guys at lunch time ;)

I've enjoyed every dish I've had here, but my absolute favorite is the chicken quesadilla...it's perfectly seasoned and the salsa is amazing! The Atrium Grilll has a great environment with wonderful and enthusiastic employees. I highly recommend this place if you want quick, friendly service and great food!! #supportlocalbusiness

It used to be my favorite place in Seoul but the feeling has changed in time. Nevertheless the place is still a good place to go with friends (though usually you can find a lot of couples there). It's good for picnic. I noticed that many people build a tent there. I think there are tent rentals around the area. It was very windy when we went last Sunday so make sure you protect yourself from the dust. There are also bike rentals and from late afternoon to night time, there are street performers that will make your stay lovely.

Great outdoor place. Always has people but it's very spacious so more than enough room. Nice place to go with friends, always performances around. Rented bikes with my friends and rode along the river.

We had a great time having chimaek (chicken and maekju/beer) with friends by the Han River. Summer is the best time for "camping" and laying mats on the grass and relaxing with friends. There are many restaurants nearby and you can just order food and they'll deliver it to you in the park. You can rent bikes (solo or use a couple bike for two) and ride around the park. It's also a great place for running. Expect more people during Fridays and weekends.

It is a great park. We went for international fire cracker festival in October. It was exceptionally crowded. People start pouring in the park from 10 am in the morning for  show starting 7 pm. It's like a big Mela. It's lot if fun as there were some groups performing also before the fire show.

Large, expansive park. Many locals come here to pitch a tent and picnic for the day and evening. Always has a LOT of people, but there’s a lot of space. You can walk along the Hangang river and watch cruise ships go by as well as live performances.
It's great and comfortable park near Yongdeung-po station, there is a fitness tools available. It is also used by Indonesian Muslim to perform Eid Prayer.
Cozy place for jogging, walking, or picnic. Wide open space. And standard facility for outdoor gym
Nice place date courses
Good view and convenience for exercise

Such a fun place. Our group had 2 rambunctious twin boys age 4 and 3 girls ages 8, 9 & 10. We all had a great time. The outdoor play area has so much to do and learn. The indoor was just as entertaining. I would recommend a membership simply because the outdoor play ground can keep your child entertained for days. I also love the fact that they have guides that show you how to so you can play on your own or have a guide play with you. Can't wait to go back.

Perfectly maintained! The entrance will greet you with an amazing innovative scene. Free entry available on Saturday and Sundays within specific time period. Of course restroom available and many other recreational activities. You could spend the whole day here without getting bored. My main suggestion is to include new researches and models by encouraging science forums to co ordinate accordingly.

column1: For families seeking a place to visit with their children, this would be the best outing.

column7: I was so not impressed. There were so many “out of order” experiences. The food is not that great either, even though it says online not to bring your own food, no one checked. I wish I brought my own food. I took my 2-year old so he didn’t notice the machines didn’t work, he was just happy to press buttons and be able to touch everything. The best area is on the lowest level, kids of all ages can build a bunch of stuff. It could’ve been cool if more things worked.

I highly recommend the family membership for those living in the area with young kids. Between the preschool playroom (with train table, lofted observation deck, and other cool hands on displays) the science playground, and space exploration themed mini golf, there plenty that keeps the little ones busy. The price is great and pays for itself quickly since it includes admission, parking (otherwise $10), coat check (otherwise $2 per item), 10% off food and merchandise, and science playground admission. The cafeteria is only okay, but outside food and drink is permitted.

I was unhappy with almost everything. Multiple broken exhibits (I estimate at least 1/3 were broken or inoperative), the 3D movie was more like 2 1/2 D (no special glasses handed out), and the playground, which I had paid admission for, was closed at 5 even though the museum closes at 6 on weekends. We lost the money that I paid for the playground admission. If you buy extra admissions to the playground, movie, golf, do not waste time, get those done first and save the broken exhibits for last.

column1: The food in the diner was your average reheated frozen processed stuff for exorbitant prices. The only thing that was made from fresh was the soups. Definitely bring your own food. Or buy one banana or apple for $1. Or dine out at a nearby restaurant after you finish touring the museum.

Decent indoor rink. Entry fee is quite cheap. Ice conditions are very good. Future gold medalist train at this rink. Downside is only one hot dog and coffee joint for food. Don't forget to bring your jacket....there are 2 rinks and one of them is super cold.
Can rent the skate at this place. Very local Korean place. Quite decent place to skate especially teaching the young child.

Very nice place to ice skating. Provide us helmet, gloves, and ice skating shoe. There are trainer in the court to. Looks like its a hockey court originally. Recommended for who want to ice skate in soul

한줄평 - 여기서 10만원 가량을 퍼붓고 훌륭한 경험을 했습니다.

column1: 내부 모습 - 한쪽은 경기용 공기총사격장 다른 한쪽이 제가 꼭 해보고싶던 실탄사격장으로 나뉘어져 있었습니다.
외부모습 - 실내운동장이라 찾기가 다소 어려울 수도 있습니다.
가격 - 9MM 권총 두번(Glock18c,USP9), 기관단총 30발 사격에 9만원정도를 소비했습니다.
개인평 - 취향저격 스팟입니다. 밀리터리, 정밀기계에 대한 애정이 깊으신 분들께 추천드립니다. 실탄이라 한번 사격에 약간은 부담되는 가격이지만 경험해보셨으면 합니다. 국산제 무기가 아니라 유럽제 무기를 쏠 수 있는 기회는 흔하지않습니다.

Beautiful place. Made on a site where previously was a water management facility. You can still see some remaining structures kept intentionally. Also old water pipes can be seen everywhere changed to benches etc. The whole park has a rusty metal theme. Being very close to Gimpo airport every one or two minutes a ready-to-land airplane passes over the park.

Nice place to hang around for an afternoon or evening. A variety of locations makes for some nice walking. The main around-the-lake path can get a bit busy, but there are other places to walk and play as well. In the wrong season, the mosquitoes can be a bummer when near the forested/brush areas.
Great place in free charge.
Small stadium with European standards, but still enjoyable if you choose the right match to watch. In terms of possibilities, there are many things to get from ttopokki to more conventional snacks.

column7: Nice and fun, but could be better. Things appear cheaply done, obvious cameras and ride triggers for example. Others are poorly laid grass turf and stuffed animals in rides.

column1: Nice prices for food and souvenirs etc (much better than Disneyland). Cheap stroller rentals with an easy process. No real stroller parking that way marked though so busy 'wherever' worked.
Great time for the children with lots for them to do (ages 5, 3, 10 months.) Great rides they loved and a fun parade etc.

Some staff not very enthusiastic and seemed to be just putting in their time while others were great. One concern was one of the ride workers checking her hair in her phone while securing the kids to the moon/Sun ride. Way to many staff had their phones out and weren't paying attention.
Overall a good experience and definitely worth a visit if you like theme parks. Awesome for kids and great baby facilities.

column7: Fun amusement park with a good amount of rides to last about half a day. Definitely don't recommend you come from first thing in the morning, as you'd pay for the full day. We went on a summer weekend day and still managed to ride everything we wanted despite getting there at 4.

Great indoor theme park as well as the island! I suggest going after 4 pm because there is a discount on the price. Also, if you are a tourist wanting to visit Lotte World, make sure to bring you T Money tour card for a discount. The rides were nice and safe and there is something for the whole family to enjoy. Food is expensive though.

Lotte World was pretty enjoyable. However, when I visited, some of the rides were under renovation. Most of the queues moved quickly. Indoors, the hot air balloon ride has one of the longest queues, so be prepared to wait up to 1 hour for your turn. The hot air balloon ride was nice to see the entire indoor Lotte World. If the monorail is working, I would take that instead.

Great place to bring kids. Plenty of food and the rides are very enjoyable. Unlike other theme parks and such they have places where you can reserve a spot at a ride for a certain time and so you don't have to wait in line at all. There is also an app for free fast passes. The shows are fantastic with a lot of energy. Especially the center stage and the parades.

Worth a visit! A peaceful and resting place in vivid Seoul. The park is a great place to enjoy a walk either with the family or more lonely. You can also jog, but I would recommend to attend earlier in the day. Nice path through trees, view on the Olympic stadium... I had a great time.
Huge park to go for a quick sightseeing. Drop by the alone tree for a photoesque site. You will see free roaming rabbits here!

Lovely park in any season. I recently went here to run the 89th Seoul Marathon 10K. It has numerous things to do and enjoy within and around the park. Take your time to visit this huge park on a sunny day in spring. You will love it and make good memories here!
This huge park is so incredibly breathtaking, I felt at peace just by being present and appreciating nature. There are also gym stops with equipment, where you can do a small workout.

I dream about this park, if ever there was a successful post Olympics venue this is it, massive rolling lawns, fantastic events, and art thrown around the place like it's no one's business. One could easily spend days here at what I would consider the earliest of parks. Oh did I mention the entrance? It's spectacular, an engineering achievement.
For children, it looks nice to learn "the street". Thanks to Mercedes who supports it.

column7: 진짜 실망했슴. 입장료+스케이트세트 16,000×2 32,000원 냈는데 안전상 목장갑을 따로 구입하라고 함 700×2 구입안하면 입장불가. 신발 넣기위해 락카500원 써야하고 빌리는스케이트는 휘겨스케이트만있고 그러면서 가운데쪽은 레슨한다고 못들어가게하고 빙판은 엉망이라 넘어지기 쉽상이고 위험하다고 사진도 못찍게하고 그럴려면 뭐하러 오픈했나? 도대체 뭘 하라는거야? 휘겨스케이트신고 갈갈이파인 트랙만돌라는건가? 절대 비추....별 -100개 하나도안하면 등록이 안돼서 했슴.

column7: I had the pleasure of seeing the American cast of "Dreamgirls" here and it was absolutely fantastic! The cast was beyond talented, and the production values between the lights and the beautiful costumes, were out of this world. The theater was gorgeous and clean, but that staff got a bit pushy when my friend moved over one seat after intermission so her view wouldn't be blocked by the man in front of us anymore. Would have been a 5-star review if it weren't for that rude exchange. All-in-all, a great experience though.
I think world class theater for musical or other performance. Parking is terrible so strongly recommend to use public transportation.
The place is nice. The staff is nice and helpfull. If u cannot buy ticket online. They sell ticket on the venue 2 hour before show.

column1: Nice prices for food and souvenirs etc (much better than Disneyland). Cheap stroller rentals with an easy process. No real stroller parking that way marked though so busy 'wherever' worked.
Great time for the children with lots for them to do (ages 5, 3, 10 months.) Great rides they loved and a fun parade etc.

Some staff not very enthusiastic and seemed to be just putting in their time while others were great. One concern was one of the ride workers checking her hair in her phone while securing the kids to the moon/Sun ride. Way to many staff had their phones out and weren't paying attention.
Overall a good experience and definitely worth a visit if you like theme parks. Awesome for kids and great baby facilities.

column7: Fun amusement park with a good amount of rides to last about half a day. Definitely don't recommend you come from first thing in the morning, as you'd pay for the full day. We went on a summer weekend day and still managed to ride everything we wanted despite getting there at 4.

Great indoor theme park as well as the island! I suggest going after 4 pm because there is a discount on the price. Also, if you are a tourist wanting to visit Lotte World, make sure to bring you T Money tour card for a discount. The rides were nice and safe and there is something for the whole family to enjoy. Food is expensive though.

Lotte World was pretty enjoyable. However, when I visited, some of the rides were under renovation. Most of the queues moved quickly. Indoors, the hot air balloon ride has one of the longest queues, so be prepared to wait up to 1 hour for your turn. The hot air balloon ride was nice to see the entire indoor Lotte World. If the monorail is working, I would take that instead.

Great place to bring kids. Plenty of food and the rides are very enjoyable. Unlike other theme parks and such they have places where you can reserve a spot at a ride for a certain time and so you don't have to wait in line at all. There is also an app for free fast passes. The shows are fantastic with a lot of energy. Especially the center stage and the parades.

Worth a visit! A peaceful and resting place in vivid Seoul. The park is a great place to enjoy a walk either with the family or more lonely. You can also jog, but I would recommend to attend earlier in the day. Nice path through trees, view on the Olympic stadium... I had a great time.
Huge park to go for a quick sightseeing. Drop by the alone tree for a photoesque site. You will see free roaming rabbits here!

Lovely park in any season. I recently went here to run the 89th Seoul Marathon 10K. It has numerous things to do and enjoy within and around the park. Take your time to visit this huge park on a sunny day in spring. You will love it and make good memories here!
This huge park is so incredibly breathtaking, I felt at peace just by being present and appreciating nature. There are also gym stops with equipment, where you can do a small workout.

I dream about this park, if ever there was a successful post Olympics venue this is it, massive rolling lawns, fantastic events, and art thrown around the place like it's no one's business. One could easily spend days here at what I would consider the earliest of parks. Oh did I mention the entrance? It's spectacular, an engineering achievement.

We really enjoyed this park! The fountains and water features are really unique and relaxing. The kids all love the splash ground (it does get really crowded mid-day when it's hot out, so be mindful if you're bringing a younger child). Our favorite though was the Olympic fountain music and light show in the evening. Such a fun free activity for the whole family. Plus, the park is really pretty all lit up, especially the torches.
This park adds some beautiful greenspace to downtown Atlanta.

column1: One end of it has a nice playground for kids. Between the center of the park and the other end, there is a fountain with the shapes of Olympic rings that kids enjoy playing in. But the fountain seemed little different from other fountains I've seen elsewhere. Only by looking at the base of the fountain did I recognize the Olympic ring shapes. Still, it's a nice touch.
Educational plaques at various places around the park provide information about the Olympics and other things. I enjoyed reading those, but persons less interested in history might not.
An amphitheater is located near one end of the park (the end farthest from the playground).
A concession stand in the park offers snacks and drinks, and it even has a small amount of indoor seating. But it was closed when I walked by it late Tuesday afternoon, May 15, 2018.

The park offers a nice place to enjoy nature in a sense in the downtown area. And it is conveniently located near several downtown attractions such as the Center for Civil and Human Rights, the Aquarium, the World of Coca-Cola, the College Football Hall of Fame, and CNN studios.
The Atlanta streetcar has a stop across the street from the park. MARTA also has stops nearby.
I urge persons in the downtown area to take a few minutes, or perhaps an hour, to walk through the park and enjoy it.

column7: Great place to sit in the sun, have a snack at the food stand, and run through the water fountain. We have visited thisnplaceany time with our grand kids, they love it. There's always new friends for them to meet and play with. You can also bring a blanket and have a picnic in the grass. There's a huge area for chilling. It's located in walking distance from the Ga. Aquarium and Coke museum

Nice place, especially the Olympic fountain, great for kids on a hot day. But lots of homeless and really, not much of anything else. Nice to look at and walk around but I won't go out of my way next time I'm in town.

This is beyond the best public park to visit in Atlanta. A must see having so many beautiful trees, seating areas, and water sites. There's always people from different walks of life enjoying the park .

Don’t be misled by pictures of multi-floored indoor gardens—that’s not part of the “spa”. The actual jjimjil spaces are very small and gets overcrowded really quickly. You could barely sit in the hottest room because it was so crowded. While there are amenities such as movie room, individual caves, book cafe, video game rentals, etc., it’s either ridiculously overpriced or so crowded that you can’t use it. The shower facilities are pretty big and nice to use—I guess people just come to the spa and camp out. It’ll sort of get the job done but not recommended.

If you expect good service, dont go here. After 40 minutes after payment, they told us that they were out of ingredients. Dont sell food in the first place if there are any shortages. Crowded place with no staffs.

It was a great experience because it had caves where you can sleep in and it had ice rooms and hot rooms but the only bad thing was that when I was sleeping it was to hot so I woke you at 6 o'clock and I constantly had to go to the ice room every minute.

column1: So next time turn the A.C. to around 21 degrees.

column7: This site offers High quality service. I recommend it instead of another hotels. It opens 24 hour. So you are in Seoul and looking for a place to sleep,  must visit here
Very clean and nice SPA but they don't have sleeping room

Commonly known as a citizen park. It has two lakes with boulevard running around and in between, with a jogging course and walking trails along the lakes. There are few restaurants and coffee shops directly on the surrounding grounds as well as number of hotels with good view. Very picturesque during cherry blossom season - beginning of of April.

A must-visit park during cherry blossom, because the lake will be surrounded by pretty pinkish cherry flowers. It's recommended to stroll in the evening as it'll be illuminated... perfect for couple to have a romantic date.
Visit in the morning and checkout the cherry blossoms which was very nice. The presence of the lake is so calming and relaxing. Several people jogs in here during the morning. Seats are available.
Great place to relax or see a small performance.  Even better when there isnt too much screaming coming from Lotte World.

Honestly, this place wipes all the stress away, like a sponge. No wonder koreans make their evening eacapes here or somewhere along the Han river. April is the cherry blossom season, so it is very beautiful. Otherwise, you can just enjoy the amazing view or just go for a walk or sit on a bench. Perfect place for couples to whisper away all their thoughts. ;)
Good place to exercise
별다른 기대없이 동네에 있기에 가본 오금공원.

column1: 큰 길가에 있지만 나름 나무가 꽤 있는 곳

column7: 오월이 주나 초롱이 오금공원 주차장에서 만날수 있는 방랑냥이들.  밤에 데이트 하러 오는 커플들~ 거기 조용한거 같아도 산책 하는 사람 많아서 쪽쪽 거릴만하지 않으니 딴데가요.
오금공원 운동을 하는데  제대로 둘레길을
아기자기한 걷기 코스. 야생화 군락. 운동장과 각종  구기 코트. 놀이터 게다가 최고의 시설을 갖춘 깔끔한 화장실을 갖춘 지역 명소이다.

We have been living in Korea for almost 7 years and my kids are pretty proficient in Korean. Decided to take them for the first time. Big mistake! So expensive (138,000₩) for the four of us for the morning shift and they were able to fit in TWO activities in 5h time frame! Even if you try and get to the activities according to the timings in front of the stations.... you end up waiting 45min to an hour between activities!!! It is a great concept but with how busy it is, it needs to be reorganized.

Superb idea but poor execution. The idea to give kids hands on work like experience packaged in a fun manner seems great in theory. However when they don't do crowd control or have limit on how many patrons they allow into the center the experience sours immediately. The activities take 15 to 20minutes a piece however the wait time can be up to an hour or more. At least they could have provided some other activities while waiting. This seems like a complete missed opportunity.
Great place for kids. It opens from 10 am. Reservation is recommended. Military training and wall climbing are favorites. Running shoes are needed.
Hmmmm.......kids loved this place but it definitely reorganizes the admission system that too many kids and waiting lines were too long for each section.
Nice place for kids to learn and play.

column1: The real life of kids! They do police activities, firefighters, doctors, and more.

column7: Kendrick Lamar concert. 30 July 2018. Great outdoor venue.

Had a great experience walking around the Seoul Olympic complex. It was like visiting a time capsule back to 1988. The old stadium is beautiful and a great part of Olympic history. Seeing the tiger mascot 'Hodori' brought back many good memories from a memorable Olympics.
Big stadium. I took my a daughter to a concert here and it is formidable for that purpose.
Well i went for umf and it was big and lots of dirty toilets
Nice place to do sprints and experience the place where the 88 Olympics took place.
Nice park but there are better ones
Very good

여름에 그늘이 있어 한 낮에도 산책하기 좋음 강아지 산책으로도 좋음

column1: The performance was good although completely in Korean (even the classical rock songs were translated). The building is modern and fresh and the staff is very helpful and friendly.
Had a bit hard time finding there because the hall itself isn't clearly pointed out in English on any map.
They have a cafe but no bar.

column7: 올림픽 공원에 위치한 공연장. 예전 역도 경기장을 재활용한 듯. 그래서인지 좌석 배치가 일반 공연장과 약간 다른 듯 함. 주차하기 편하고 공연장 시설도 만족스러우나 입점한 카페가 좀 비싸고 불친절함. 공원 내에 식당이 없으니 바깥에서 먹고 들어와야하는게 불편함.
공연 봤는데 무대도 넓고 좌석도 많으며, 공연장 좌우 커피숍과 화장실 등 편의시설이 잘 되어 있어요.
공연관람하고공원산책하기에좋음...3시간이하는주차비후불제가유리.3시간이상[공연+여유있게산책]계획이면선불로5천원결제하면주차요금걱정해방됨
자동차를 이용하여 방문할 때에는 남2문을 통해서 들어가면 좀 더 편리합니다.

It is quite nice free museum in the Olympic Park. If you take a walk in the park, pls visit this museum. From last this month(June 2018), till Aug 19, there is special exhibition on tea cups from Song Dynasty of China. Those were found in the ocean in Korea, from the wrecked ships. I recommend this special exhibition, which is also free.

It's free. If you are around Olympic park, it's worth a walk thru, but nothing to write home about. The restaurant on top floor is fairly pricey. Walk across the street to Vicentes for decent Italian food
Immersion on a very first Korea kingdom. Amazing place, no doubts after exit you will be have a new vision about Korean peoples.
Well managed museum since opening only 6 years!
There are so many peopel.
Honestly, it is one of the best aquarium I have ever been. Not only because it's big (The biggest in Asia) but also because of the variety of species and the overall presentation.

column1: There are many explanations in English but still there is a lot of room to improve on this topic.
Definitely a must go if you have enough time to spend a whole morning there .

column7: Not a huge aquarium but kids can enjoy for 2 hours or less. It's a beautiful place but the entrance fee is a bit expensive. For the family of 5 it cost 90 even after i got a discount. I Shouldn't have gotten out instead i shouldve roamed around more inside. I thought they had more things to see. what a waste!

column1: I wish they sell the souvenirs cheaper. After paying 100 for the entrance, not many people would want to pay more for them. I would like to go see the aquarium again but not with the full price.

column7: Nice place if a like cozy as with most things in Korea. Beluga whales and large ocean tank with walkthrough tunnels are the highlight. Not a ton of variety and doesn't take long.

This aquarium have different marine species and it have many rooms to see and interact with the fishes. It's kind of expensive, therefore, exist special offers for foreigners and groups. I've been in 2 or 3 other places, but this one, was very good.

A modern, medium-sized aquarium which is 2orth visiting, especially if you are with kids and have time. The main attraction is the beluga which is a white whale that resembles a dolphin.  They have two at the aquarium and they are very impressive creatures, definitely worth seeing and interacting with through the glass.

Lots of cool places to shop, including a surprising number of Western brands. The aquarium is ginormous to say the least, taking up two hours of my six there, and when I got out, the gift shop was absolutely packed. This venue is doing extraordinarily well: lots of young Koreans love coming here. I do too.

column1: The view? Take a look for yourself and you decide.

column7: If you plan on going here, be sure to buy your tickets early because they only allow a certain amount of people up at a time. We had to wait at least 2 hours after purchasing our ticket before going up the tower. Luckily the mall is right there, so we did some shopping to kill time. I'm not sure if our timing was just bad, but I think one of the elevators to go to the top was broken. There may have been signs in Korean stating this, but it was never told to us in English. Once we entered we waited in line for over an hour until we got to the top. We also noticed the workers saying things in Korean and people bypassing our line to go to a shorter line. We finally asked someone about this and that line was to go up in the elevator without a video. Once we got to the final line to go into the elevator to the top, they again only spoke in Korean. I again asked what he said and he showed me a pamphlet in English. For Lotte being such a big company, I think they need to put a little more effort in for English speaking visitors. It was helpful that the workers spoke English, but if we didn't ask, then we never would've known what was going on. Once at the top, the view was beautiful. I liked that there was a glass bottom section that you could walk over. However, for the price, view, and experience, I preferred the Namsan Seoul Tower over this tower.

It is primarily a mall, so that's what you should expect going in. There are plenty of shops, a wide variety of restaurants, and other atypical mall amenities, such as an aquarium and art museum. Let's not forget to mention the world's 3rd tallest observation deck and the tallest in Korea. Beautiful views over-looking Seoul, including the famous sites you can see from each spot. Only 1 minute up and down on an elevator. Observation deck is 6 stories tall and includes outdoor areas and glass floors in parts.

Lotte Tower is a shoppers paradise! The new building has a myriad of high end shops and restaurants. The restaurants are local or international and the food is delicious! Look for the food truck restaurants and you will not be disappointed. There is also an observation deck for the more adventurous people out there, with a glass floor balcony looking down hundreds of feet below you. Definitely an experience to remember. The view is absolutely amazing, 360, and there are several coffee shops and souvenirs available.

column1: The elevator ride to the top is around $27 but well worth it.
Don’t forget to check out the extensive water park outside!

column7: This is the tallest building in Korea for the moment. It's really tall. Like, mind-bogglingly tall. When you stand next to it you have no idea how large is. There's a concert hall in here. There's a place where you can have tea time. They're actually a bunch of buildings connected all together. So most of the shopping you do isn't in the mega Tower. But I think at least some of the shopping to do is in the mega Tower. I can't think of another word to call it other than make a tower. Maybe Lotte World Tower. That sounds like a good name for it. Let's use that. Let's also discuss some reasons why you probably shouldn't buy a home on the 100th floor of the building. Mostly it's because when they were creating this building the lake next door suddenly started to disappear. Where did it go? Well who knows. But doesn't that make you nervous? It certainly would make me nervous. But it's a nice place. I dream that I would have a home there. And my office also there. And then permanent guest home inside of the hotel up there. You never have to leave unless you wanted to go golfing. I think I have hit the character limit on this review. Here are some more words to test that. I guess I didn't.
Nice and peaceful place, but this place so quite and suitable for old people.
So calming place. Isn't that known by tourists in Seoul but if you stay nearby it's quite worth a visit.
Great place for family with small kids

column1: 숲속에서 작은 옛 정취를 늦길수 있음

column7: 아이들과 산책하기 좋으며 도심 가까이 있어 접근성도 좋음. 단 주차장은 협소하니 대중교통을 이용하는것도 바람직함. 정각 11시 , 2시, 4시에는 설명도 해줌. 입장료 있으며 성북구민은 50%할인(500원)

1992년 12월 28일 사적 제378호로 지정되었다가 2008년 1월 8일 명승 제35호로 변경되었다. 지정면적 1만 4,407㎡이다. 조선시대 민가의 조원(造苑)으로는 서울에 남은 유일한 것이다. 조선 철종 때 이조판서를 지낸 심상응(沈相應)의 별장을 의친왕이 별궁으로 사용하던 곳이다.

column1: 공간구성은 쌍류동천(雙流洞天)과 용두가산(龍頭假山)이 있는 전원(前苑), 영벽지(影碧池)와 폭포가 있는 내원(內苑), 송석(松石)과 못이 있는 후원공간 등 자연지형에 따라 조원된 세 개의 공간구역으로 나눌 수 있다.

column7: 조선 최고의 정원은 보길도로 가세요
보수목적인지 앞을 못보게 가려놓아 볼수없었다
Easily reached by mass transit, and good price. The ice could have been cleaned more often, but not a bad afternoon.

About a 15 minute walk from the subway, good price, well maintained. As a foreigner, I was unaware that gloves and a helmet was required. They provide helmets free of charge and simple gloves for approximately 75 cents a pair.
Perfect place to enjoy ice hickey!!!!

가성비로 강북에서 스케이트타기 젤 좋은 곳.고대학생은 일반 스케이트화 대여 합해도 5000원입니다. 학부때 누릴 수 있는 드문 혜택이니 있을때 열심히 이용하세요.(졸업생은 웁니다) 올라가는 길이 좀 고되므로 고대정문에서 학교셔틀버스 타고 가시면 됩니다.

Small but beautiful Buddhism temple. This is an iconic tour spot in Seongbukdong.
Favorite temple in Seoul.
Quiet and simple. Good place to clean up your thoughts
Just great if you like old culture buildings

An excellent Korean restaurant for tourist but exlensive
It is one of the best place to visit to enjoy Korean food. But the unti price of dishes is very expenssive. If not, I will give 5 stars...

보물로 지정된  목각탱 (목각아미타여래설법상)이 있습니다.정릉에 오시면 자장율사가 창건했다고 하는 경국사에 들러서 꼭보세요.
Dropped by here and hiked the mountain trail long time ago.
경상남도 양산시 하북면 용연리 천성산(千聖山) 중턱에 있는 사찰.

column1: 대한불교조계종 제15교구 본사인 통도사(通度寺)의 말사로, 한때 내원암이라 불렀다. 신라 문무왕 때 원효대사(元曉大師)가 창건하였으며 창건 설화가 《송고승전(宋高僧傳)》에 기록되어 있다.

중국 당나라 태화사의 승려들이 장마로 인한 산사태로 매몰될 것을 예견하고 효척판구중(曉擲板求衆)이라고 쓴 현판을 날려보내 그들을 구해준 인연으로 1,000명의 중국 승려가 신라로 와서 원효의 제자가 되었다. 원효가 이들이 머물 곳을 찾던 중 내원사 부근에 이르자 산신이 마중나와 현재의 산신각 자리에서 사라졌다. 이에 원효는 대둔사(大芚寺)를 창건하고 상·중· 하 내원암을 비롯하여 89개의 암자를 세웠다.

조선시대 의천(義天)과 용운(龍雲), 해령(海嶺)이 1646년(인조 24)과 1845년, 1876년(고종 13)에 각각 중수를 하였고, 조선 중기에 이르러서는 대둔사 및 상·중 내원암은 없어지고 하내원암만 남았다. 1898년(광무 2)에는 유성(有性)이 수선사를 창설하고 내원사로 개칭하였다. 일제강점기에는 혜월(慧月) 혜명(慧明:1861∼1937)이 주석하면서 많은 선승(禪僧)들을 배출했다. 6·25전쟁으로 완전히 소실된 것을 1955년에 수덕사(修德寺)의 비구니 수옥(守玉)이 13동의 건물을 재건하였고, 그뒤로 꾸준한 불사를 거듭하여 오늘에 이르고 있다.

현존하는 당우로는 법당인 선나원(禪那院), 선원(禪院), 심우당(尋牛堂), 정처헌(靜處軒), 불유각(佛乳閣), 송루, 사문(寺門) 등이 있으며, 암자로는 미타암(彌陀庵), 성불암(成佛庵), 금봉암(金鳳庵), 원효암(元曉庵) 등이 있다. 문화재로는 경상남도 유형문화재 제58호로 지정된 금고(金鼓)가 유명하며, 절 일원이 경상남도 기념물 제81호로 지정되어 있다. 대표적인 비구니 수도원으로 알려져 있는 사찰이다.
주변에 내원사 계곡이라 불리는 계곡과 제2의 금강산이라 불리는 천성산이 있어 절 주변은 관광지로도 유명하다. 계곡 곳곳에는 삼층바위가 첩첩이 서 있으며 절벽에 ‘소금강’이라는 글자가 뚜렷이 새겨져 있고, 병풍모양으로 바위가 길게 뻗어 있어 병풍바위라 불리는 것도 있다.
사찰 주변에는 통도사(5km), 배내골(5km), 천성산, 통도환타지아(6km), 홍룡폭포(4km) 등이 있다.

column1: 尋牛莊을 풀이하자면 ‘소 찾는 집’인데, 불교에서는 대개 소가 마음을 상징하는 뜻으로 쓰인다.
집은 응달진 언덕에 북향하고 있는데, 만해가 남쪽에 있는 조선총독부가 꼴 보기 싫다 하여 일부러 북향으로 지었다는 말이 전한다.
님은 갔습니다. 아아 사랑하는 나의 님은 갔습니다.
푸른 산빛을 깨치고 단풍나무 숲을 향하야 난 적은 길을 걸어서 참어 떨치고 갔습니다.
황금의 꽃같이 굳고 빛나든 옛 맹서는 차디찬 띠끌이 되야서, 한숨의 미풍에 날어갔습니다.
날카로운 첫 '키쓰'의 추억은 나의, 운명의 지침(指針)을 돌려 놓고, 뒷걸음쳐서, 사러졌습니다.
나는 향기로운 님의 말소리에 귀먹고, 꽃다운 님의 얼골에 눈멀었습니다.
사랑도 사람의 일이라, 만날 때에 미리 떠날 것을 염려하고 경계하지 아니한 것은 아니지만, 이별은 뜻밖의 일이 되고 놀란 가슴은 새로운 슬픔에 터집니다.
그러나 이별을 쓸데없는 눈물의 원천을 만들고 마는 것은 스스로 사랑을 깨치는 것인 줄 아는 까닭에, 걷잡을 수 없는 슬픔의 힘을 옮겨서 새 희망의 정수박이에 들어부었습니다.
우리는 만날 때에 떠날 것을 염려하는 것과 같이, 떠날 때에 다시 만날 것을 믿습니다.
아아 님은 갔지마는 나는 님을 보내지 아니하얏습니다.
제 곡조를 못 이기는 사랑의 노래는 님의 침묵을 휩싸고 돕니다.

Pleasant mid-size park.Wifi,store,exercise equipment,badminton and baseball courts but no facilities for young children.The museum,a former prison,is interesting but again some of the exhibits are unsuitable for youngsters.

The independence gate is located in Dongnimmun and it's close to other hot-spots just as Ewah University and Gwanghamun. Seoul Station is rather close as well. The Independence Park as toilets, a convenient store, is clean and well maintained. The Seodaemun Prison Museum is also located in the park. A traditional market is just across the street.

This is a great historic park in Seoul. It is the place of the independence movement march. The best time to visit is March 1st, Independence movement day. Transportation is well connected to subway and buses. Its a good place to roller blade or walk around. It is also close to the path to a mountain trail and a historic Japanese prison museum that held independence leaders during Japanese occupation.
If you visited Seoul you should come to Doknim mun park. ( Independence gate from Japan)
We visited here when we went to Seodaemun  Prison History Museum. This is related to the Independent movement in Korea against the Japanese rule.
If you want to visit traditional Korean temple but don't have time to go out of Seoul, Bongwonsa Temple would be a great choice.

4) But I don't have time to go out of this city!
To visit, take a bus at Anguk station, Gyeongbokgung station or Dongnimmun station.

column7: 한국의 역사에 관심이 많은 여행객이라면, 이곳을 놓치지 않는 것을 추천합니다. 이곳은 한국의 역사에 있어 굉장히 유서깊은 장소이기 때문입니다. 공원의 이름에서도 알 수 있듯이, 서대문 독립공원은 과거 일제강점기 시절 수많은 한국인들이 착취당하고 고문당하였으며, 사형당하였던 슬픈 장소입니다. 대표적인 독립운동가인 유관순또한 이곳에서 형장의 이슬이 되었습니다. 잠시 그녀에 대해 묵념하는 시간을 갖도록하겠습니다.

column1: 개인적으로 이곳은 제가 나온 고등학교 바로 옆에 있는 장소여서 추억이 많은 곳입니다. 고등학교 때 만난 첫사랑과 행복한 시간을 보냈던 곳이며, 지금은 비록 떨어져있지만 그 시간은 항상 제 기억속에 행복한 모습으로 자리잡아 있을 것입니다.

Definitely worthwhile stop to see the struggles the Korean nation has overcome.  It’s a 5 Star museum but 4 stars for the international visitor.  Not very much effort was put into maximizing impact for the non Koreans.  There was so much more I wanted to see and understand.

This was one of the most interesting museums I've been to in Seoul. It provides a comprehensive history of the Japanese occupation and the Korean freedom fighters. I won't lie, it's grim (there's a model room showing where bodies were collected after they were hanged AND an interactive video where you can superimpose your face onto  someone being tortured (?)), but it's laid out well and there is a lot of space to walk around the various buildings at your own pace. The people working there are friendly and helpful.  Unlike a few museums in Seoul, this one also has English-friendly descriptions and signage.

My ancestors have been brutally tortured and eventually killed. People of all ages have been killed. But I’m happy that Korea got their peace and freedom. However Japan has one of our land and lies that it’s their land.

An amazing museum about the Japanese occupation of Korea. The descriptions in English are very well-done. The museum reminded me a lot of Kilmanhaim Gaol in Dublin--many parallels between the British occupation of Ireland and Japan's occupation of Korea. Definitely worth a visit!

It's a nice place to see the horror Koreans suffered from the Japanese, and the pathway toward democracy. It has a good amount of English, but could use a little more in some sections. It's about three dollars to get in and takes about a hour and some change to get through.
Especially good place for elementary schoolers. Well organized and you can explore the many variety of natural things from rocks to space. Very educational place. I highly recommend it.
I took my two year old on a weekday and we had a blast. Not a lot of parking, so get there early.

Ce spa est absolument magnifique, j’ai eu une merveilleuse expérience. La décoration est très belle et les soient magiques. C’est un endroit parfait pour découvrir tous les bienfaits du thé et ressortir zen, avec une très belle peau. Le personnel est adorable, très serviable et de très bon conseil. C’est réellement un spa haut de gamme, de À à Z.
Trop cher pour ce que ça vaut... 106€ pour 50 min de massage ...

column1: Jai eu en bon de cadeau que jai utilise avec 3 j de retards. Ils m'obligent à prendre un soin de 25min pour 55€ en plus... et en bonus ils te contraignent à l'utiliser dans le mois, avec leur agenda le seul créneau possible cetait dimanche matin première heure .... super !

column7: J'ai adoré ! Cynthia m'a fait découvrir le soin bien meri'thé et franchement ça m'a fait un bien fou ! Après bébé, rien de tel que ce soin. Je suis ressortie légère et détendue !!! Que demande le peuple ! Merci Cynthia! Et merci themae ! Thé glacé servi en arrivant, thé detox servi à la fin du soin... su-per!
Un délice ! Nous nous sommes délectés de ce plaisir. Accueil, soins, détente, saveurs, bien-être. À refaire plus souvent...
Un pur moment de bonheur, sous les doigts d'une fée, la magie opère. ... une décontraction totale, et après 75 minutes d'un massage singapourien divin, j'ai dormi comme un bébé.
A interesting place to see the hangang-river and the busy expressway, from a site with history. Good stopover on way to Mangwon Hangang Park.

It's a nice place, Mr. Sung brought me here. A 25 minutes walk from the church. Need to take off the shoes & taking off the shoes after 1 day in it feels heaven. After we head back to the nearest subway station, hapjeong.
cozy historic place not big.

column7: 난지한강공원은 서울의 서쪽에 위치한 공원 중 가장 주목할만한 공원이라고 할 수 있습니다. 한강과 함께 조화를 이루고 있는 수풀은 굉장히 아름다우며, 강변을 따라 천천히 거닐며 주변의 분위기를 느끼는 일 또한 즐거운 일입니다. 단지 난지한강공원 자체를 즐기러 가는 것도 좋지만, 그 주변에 있는 하늘공원, 서울월드컵경기장 등 다른 공원/시설들과 함께 코스에 넣어 즐긴다면 좀 더 효율적이고 알찬 경험을 할 수 있을 것입니다.

column1: 개인적인 팁을 적자면, 따뜻한 계절에 방문하시는 분의 경우 주변 공원을 거닐다 보면 가족이 함께 나와 피크닉을 즐기는 것을 쉽게 볼 수 있는데, 이런 따뜻한 광경을 쉽게 볼 수 있다는 점이 이 장소의 또다른 장점이라고 생각합니다.

column7: 날도 더운데 도서도할겸 갔는데 정말 좋았어요. 바람도 불고 그늘만 있으면 도서하긴 정말 좋아요~ 담에 또 가려고요.
강바람 시원~ 풍력발전도 해요. 난지야구장, 난지캠핑장 야외 수영장, 하늘공원까지 세트로 경험 가능

Easy to get to. Very clean. Comfortable seats. You can go with friends or family. Awesome atmosphere during the games. Restrooms are clean. You can bring your food and eat while watching the game. Great

column7: As you may know the dream concert 2018 was held at this stadium on 12th May. Unfortunately, the weather was terrible and it was pouring down with rain. This led to the stage being wet, however no roof was put up to prevent this and caused many NCT members to have some very bad falls which may have caused some injuries. It is your responsibility to ensure that all members remain out of harms way. We are very concerned and hope that in the future you will at least provide a decent rain cover on the stadium to prevent anything as such from occurring again.We hope you take our concern into consideration. Thank you for taking your time to read this.

Great stadium. Lots of amenities. Plus the Sky Box. Cost of entry for matches incredibly  low compared to Europe. Season ticket is about  $200. Great value. Matches can be so so; but great atmosphere.

Lovely area. Plenty of parking and amenities i.e. Water fountains, toilets and bins everywhere. A central cafe/restaurant area. Lovely well kept gardens, good views and easy access by stairs or bus to the Skypark. Areas for dogs, sports etc.
Easy to reach by subway. Shopping mall inside a stadium.

여길 왜가서 먹나요? 이미 초입부터 냄새가 엄청나고 맛도 너무 느끼합니다. 너무 먹기 힘들어 개운하게 먹으려고 막국수 시켰는데 말라 비틀어진 막국수가 나왔음.  어쩔수없이 시키는 야식보다 못한 족발. 몇년동안 다닌 음식점중 최하위. 다신 안감.
보족세트먹었는데 보쌈은 독일산이라 그냥 그렇고요 족발은 맛있어요 양념무가 좀 달아요 ㅎ 그외 기본으로 제공되는 순대국 맛있고요 순대도 기본 순대로 괜찮아요.  참 떡볶이도 주시네요.  일하시는 분들도 바쁘신데 정말 친절합니다. 사람이 세명이하라면 그냥 족발을 추천드리고 싶어요
족발은 그냥 아는 보통맛이고

column1: 비린맛도 안나고 들깨가루가 들어가서 고소하고 맛있다.  무한리필이지만 메인요리보다 맛있다.

column7: Affordable and awesome selection. Might be tricky to navigate without a Korean speaker but certainly a positive experience hard to find elsewhere in seoul. They have a wide assortment of different kinds of jeon (meat, veggies, seafood, or fungi fried in a light batter. Basically you walk through a buffet of already cooked jeon and put what you want in a basket and you are charged by type & /or weight. They also have an assortment of makguli for very cheap prices and other korean alcoholic beverages.
With a selection like an outlet city, its tough to sample all the delicious fried foods!

Nice place to taste different types of Tempura(튀김) and Korean pancakes. You have varying options of fried vegetable & seafood to choose before taking a seat. Quite cheap price and friendly service it has as well.
Very lively place!!! Tourists, Must visit!!!
Secret Korean pancake pub. Great little slice of life in Seoul.

Bridges can be on the last item of your must-visit but I made sure that I'm able to go to Mapo Bridge. As someone who can understand and read Hangul (did I really need to say that?), I wanted to see those words and sentences that they've placed at the bridge. Turns out that this bridge is a place where a lot of people have taken their lives, those sentences were placed there to give hope for those who feel hopeless.

column1: Anyway, it's a good place to look at the Han River or Hangang Park despite the number of suicide/ suicide attempts in this area.

column7: Rainbow Show gave my best friend a Cold. 0/0 would not do it again

Although I've never visited this place in person, I've spent some time researching it and its past. The 'Bridge of Life' has a beautiful view of the stars, if you stay up that late. It's a great monument in South Korea.

column1: But, it has quite a horrid past of many suicides. People jump off the bridge into the water. So ( In order to try and stop the suicides ) they put encouraging words along the railing, trying to distract you. There are also multiple Help Lines that you are able to call and reach out to.

I don't think people should rate it poorly because of the suicides. If suicide concerns you, you should be helping the Hotlines. It's offensive to mark down something because of suicides. Suicide is a real issue and we shouldn't just ignore it or brush it off.

column7: The precious time walking with my Korean bf here

It will be a good place if you would like to see a scenery of Yeouido or Han River. Since it is known for suicides, there are a lot of sentences on the rails of it. but I think it's not helpful for them.

A really nice and tiny market. Most goods are handmade. You can find some original and unique gifts like painted cap and wooden craft. The place to go if you want to buy quality souvenirs for your friends and family.
If you like a busy, happening atmosphere, this is the place to be. If you want a quiet corner, maybe you should find somewhere else.
If you want to feel young spirit, go there at night on weekends. Could be a little noisy depends on your taste.😊
Really nice smallish market selling hand made items such as passport cases, fans and other art. The price wasn't high like you might expect.

column1: Shame it's only on once a week.

column2: The War and Women's Human Rights Museum
column7: Very moving experience highlighting that you can really make a difference when you speak up about your experiences. These women’s experience would never have been acknowledged only that they stood up and said spoke about it. I would hugely recommend a visit.

column2: The War and Women's Human Rights Museum
column7: A must go.

column1: Really difficult to visit because of the feels...
You can give money during the visit to organisations.
Most of the signs are in Korean, so your visit may last 1h.
I would not recommend bringing children because of the difficult topic mentioned in the museum.

column2: The War and Women's Human Rights Museum
column7: An important, tastefully done museum about the suffering of so-called Comfort Women in WWII. Informative but also emotive, not easy subject matter. The English audio guide was very good, visit took about 40 minutes.

column2: The War and Women's Human Rights Museum
column7: Brilliant museum showing the story of the 'comfort women'. Really good English audio description. Very well curated. Friendly and helpful staff. Small tactful shop. Excellent all round.

column2: The War and Women's Human Rights Museum
column7: An incredibly evocative museum discussing the heart-wrenching past and present of 'comfort women' and violence against women during war. I was brought to tears, but left with deep admiration for the strong women who came forward to bring this terrorism to light.

column1: I am a museum fanatic, and during my five visits to Korea visited dozens of museums. This is at the top of that list.

column7: Good

근현대디자인박물관은 우리나라 최초의 본격 디자인박물관으로서 국내 최초의 디자인 사료들이 대거 소장되어 있습니다. 박암종관장이 20여년 동안 심혈을 기울여 모은 수 만점의 한국 디자인 관련 사료 중에서도 특별히 엄선하여 저 하늘에 빛나는 7개의 별-북두칠성 이라는 컨셉으로 전시를 기획하였습니다. 개화기 이후 2000년대 초까지를 7개의섹션으로 구분하여 1,600여점의 사료를 상설 전시하고 있습니다. 국기, 태극기, 신문, 잡지, 그림 엽서, 인형, 화장품, 라디오, 전화기, 텔레비전, 냉장고, 휴대폰, 컴퓨터 등 국내에서 최초로 디자인되고 생산된 진귀한 자료들을 한 곳에서 만날 수 있습니다. 부대시설로는 카페 엘리시온과 갤러리 모디움 그리고 와우디자이너스클럽 등이 갖춰져 있습니다.
간판이 그냥 디자인박물관이라고 써있었던거 같아요 주변사람들도 근현대디자인박물관 물으니 모르더라고요 작은 갤러리느낌이 나더라고요 1층은 카페고 카페통해서 올라가서 2~3층이 전시실, 입장료는 5000원인데 사실 좀 아깝더라고요 지하는 돈을 또 따로 내야함

Pretty pricey for a basic photo studio. But if cost isn't an issue, it's a good place to go to. Quite a range of selection of Korean hanbok, photo packages and services. but they charge pretty much for everything extra (makeup, hair setting, hairpiece, accessories, Queen's dress). The studio just provides backdrop & dress rental. Most of the staff speaks Chinese.
If you wanna take Harbok picture this is nice place to visit♡ you can take picture as much you wanna take. Also they give you print out picture for service♡
I love all the traditional clothes there. The staff treated tourists very wonderfully and the photographers are fantastic! Highly recommended hanbok studio. Would like to come again if I visit Korea

column1: Regular cafeteria charge 4000won but the waiting time is sometimes weirdly long. Also the food is always the same. It's hard to find a seat and just take a rest for a second. Don't recommend going here

column7: 회원가입 후 와이파이 이용가능하고 노트북 열람석 있습니다.  일층에 이디야 커피점 있고 사층에 구내식당 및 일반식당. 구내식당은 사천원인데 점심은 한시까지만 하니까 시간 맞춰 가셔야합니다. 평일엔 저녁식사도 하는데 주말은 점심만 합니다.

column1: 어린이 도서관이 따로 있어서 주말에 애들 데리고 와서 근처 호수공원, 대통령기록관과 함께 보는 것도 좋습니다.
다만 평일에 9시까지 개관인데 관내 유일 커피숍 이디야는 5시까지만 영업합니다. 도서관 주변에는 커피나 음료수 살 만한 곳이 없어서 저녁까지 있을 때는 다소 불편합니다.

column1: 축구관련 역사부터 시작해 유익한 정보들 뿐만 아니라 VR, 홀로그램 등 눈을 황홀하게 만드는 요소들이 중간중간 배치해있어 지루하지 않더라구요.
친구들과도 연인과도 방문해도 좋지만 특히 자녀분들과 함께 방문하면 좋을 것 같습니다.
둘러보는데 궁금한 점은 가이드 분이 따로 설명해주시기도 해서 더 이해가 잘되는 것 같아요.
여러 행사도 진행하던데 방문해 행사도 즐기고 박물관 관람도 하면 유익한 시간 보낼 수 있을 것 같습니다.

Sangsu's very own cafe/pub that has been keeping Sangsu vibes for years. Drop by for a cup of coffee or visit at night for a beer or wine. Indie bands play based on the schedule that's written on the outside of the cafe.
A great atmosphere, vibes like being a cafe during the day, a bar at night. Throw some gigs on the underground floor where you can see through the big hole on the ground floor.

Awesome place to check out indie music of Korea. Love the cosy basement stage area that is perfect for indie performances and those at level one can peer in from the center too. Check out the board right outside of the cafe for the line up of indie artistes. 👍🏼😊

column7: Once been an Airforce Academy campus, presently a great spot to enjoy. You may find a circular walking course, kids playground, dogs playground, football and tennis courts, rock climbing wall, beautiful pond with lotus flowers and music fountain. And on top of that: open air aircraft museum with bunch of training and fighter jets.
Theres a running track local elderly like to use. Many spots to sit down and enjoy nice weather. Also has a dog park, convenience store, climbing rock etc. Many restaurants nearby.
The place is peaceful especially at the mountains. Where you can see lots of birds

This is a lovely city park that was the former site of the Korea Air Force Academy. That's why it's a giant open field. There are basketball courts, extreme sports arenas, a climbing wall, and ll sorts of other wonderful things. The running track has been cut short for the next two years while a new subway line goes in. So they have torn up about 1/5 of the park to take care of that.
Good place to work out and sunbath. You can find several beautiful flowers in the well maintained field. Very huge park inside the city.

column1: 다른 관악산과 같은 삼막사나 연주암과 같은절은 매주일 마다
점심을 등산객들에게 봉사를 하고 있는데 여기 우면산의 대성사는 얼마나 야박한지 저 아래 입구서 부터 차단기를 만들어서 차량진입을 못하게 합니다 예술의전당은 새벽부터 오전 10시까지는 주차장을 새벽 산행객들에게 무료로 개방을 하고 있는데 여기 대성사는 새벽시간에도 공휴일이에도 넓은 주차공간이 있지만 주민들에게 너무 인색하게 합니다

1주일에 한번 취미 배우러 가면 재밌습니다. 직장인반이라 수업시간이 짧아 너무 후다닥 넘어가는 느낌이지만 지역구 문화센터라 회비도 저렴한듯 해요

It's amazing place to spend time if you are interested in new Samsung gadgets VR glass new phones and more. It was interesting, fanny and tricky to find out how everything works. Definitely recommend for those who like technological stuff.

Horrible futuristic museum. Virtually just a series of concept videos and Instagram filters. Most of the actual physical gadget don’t work so well. Even the concepts themselves are not creative. Mostly its screens inside everyday objects.
Exhibit new technologies from Samsung Electronics. You can buy original Samsung Electronics too. You can use and  test some of cool stuff as well. Good for kids.

A nice place to see the technology in the future from Samsung and kids can have some fun in the 2rd floor.  Good to visit if you have an hour or so of your time in the afternoon.  The location is right at the Gangnam station exit 8

One of the amazing experience to visit a Samsung digital market. Happen to see latest stuff that Samsung is launching in market and they are really worth watching here. A band was put by staff and with that you can start multiple experience of Samsung technology..
상당히 멋진 곳인데 관악산 밑자락에 붙어 있고, 등산로와는 동떨어져 있어 아쉽기만 하네요. 이런 문화유적지가 묻혀 있다는 것이 안타까울뿐
수영장별로임...거기 여탕에 청소하시는 아줌마 욕함..그리고 거기 냄새심함..피아노교실도 엉망임 낙서오짐..그리고 거기 위에 상상아카데미 내 친구들 다니는데 너무 힘들다고 함..굳이 밥 다 먹으라 하고(많이 주면서)너무 하는거 많음 그리고 매점은 너무 비쌈 뭔 하드아이스크림이 800원씩이나 함..최 저가를 500원정도로 해야지
시설 개량을 했다고는 하지만 사우나시설만

이용할 수 있도록 되어 있는데 십년이상씩이나

column7: 수영장 개비를 2018 3월에 해서 깨끗함
낙후된 시설...  낙후된 서비스..   이걸 수영장이라고...
수영장을 비롯해 저렴하게 다양한 체육프로그램을 체험할 수 있음 단 수영장 올해 12월부터 내년2월까지 공사때문에 휴관한다 함
Cozy place.
자연 경관이 훌룡하고 차마시고 식사할 곳도 있어서 산책하기 좋습니다

토요일오후방문. 주차공간이 너무 협소해서 주차장입구 150m앞두고 1시간 줄서있다가 들어감. 들어보니 여기 와본사람들 다 주차때문에 애먹었다고 함. 주차하고 홀공연보고 메이린중국집 등 돌아다니다 보니 건축설계자가 누군지 궁금해질만큼 욕나오는 비효율적인 건물... 밖에서 구경하기 좋지만 정말 공간활용 거지같이 한 건물..화장실은 강아지똥꾸멍만하고 여자화장실 가는길목에 남자화장실 볼일보는 모습이 정면에 딱!!! 보여서 진짜 화남..설계자가 돈만 쳐먹엇나..계단이 많고 동선이 너무 길어요. 장애인 배려는 눈꼽만큼도 없는 건물이네요.
북서울 꿈의숲에 있는 아트센터. 아트센터보다는 전망대쪽이 인기있고 볼만하다. 먹거리는 같이 있는 중식요리점이 괜찮은편.
공연장의 소리 울림이 정말 좋습니다

column1: 전혀 마이크를 쓰지 않는 공연도 종말 섬세하게 잘 전달되어서 정말 편안하게 감상할수 있었습니다.
북서울 꿈의숲 안에 있어서 공원 내 거닐곳도 충분해서 좋은 문화공간인것 같습니다.

column7: I wish I could properly review this embroidery museum, but I've tried to visit twice, during times they are supposedly open, and it has been closed. So, beware. Maybe I was just unlucky, but it might run on a less than reliable schedule. But looks promising from the website.
우이동 솔밭공원주위에 위치해 있으며 일반에게
박을복여사님의 숨결과 문화의 혼이 담긴 박물관
자수박물관 관람
좋아요!

It is a unique park. It is very dense like a forest so even in peak summer time you can get away from the harsh sun Rays and enjoy nature and good time with family by being here. It is not very crowded also. There is children play area , toilets and a convenience store inside.
It's a nice park to walk around, especially in the spring when they plant flowers. Also a nice place to see the cherry blossoms when they bloom.
It is really beautiful forest. I love it.

It is not the biggest of parks, but it offers a nice, relaxing area for a family to go to. There are seats and places under trees for a picnic, a play park fir the children and even a fountain for children to get wet in (have some adult supervision in case one of the munchkins falls over and hits their head.) A subway station very close by just adds to the convenience.

I love this place.  It is a great spot to spend the afternoon with family or friends.  It is great for kids as there is a large sandbox, playgroubd, splash pad and forested area.  They have bbqs in a bbq area that you can rent by visiting their website.

One of the nice place to enjoy spring in Seoul. It has beautiful scenery with a stretch of canola flowers cover the mainly park. Really good to take pictures here. You can freely go to here, free entry.

column1: But the bad thing is, it is rather far away from the canola park to get the store to buy some drink or snacks.

column7: Good place for walking. I recommend dinner and night time in summer. No restroom!
Nice place for walking your dogp. Be sure to leash your dog.
Nothing here. More a park for local residence.

If you visit Sevit Islands or Banpo bridge, I recommend here, Seorae Island. This island is very beautiful and near the Sevit. These days there are so many rape flowers and you can take nice pictures with them as backgroud.
Best museum i've ever seen because in this museum i can see human civilization centered on the history of redemption
성경적으로 아주 귀한 유물들을 깨끗하게 보존하고 전시. 관람할 수 있도록 되어있어 아이들과 방문하기에 유익하다.
연면적 420㎡로, 1998년 11월 개관하였다. 국내 유일의 성서유물 박물관으로서 미국의 고고학자 케네스 바인 박사가 평강제일교회의 박 아브라함 목사에게 기증한 고대 이집트와 오리엔트문명의 유물 2,000여 점을 소장하고 있다.

column1: 주요 소장 유물에는 BC 4000년 경의 이스라엘 토기를 비롯하여 고대 서아시아의 토기 중에서 가장 품질이 우수한 미케네 불레셋 토기, BC 8세기 키프로스의 페니키아 양식 토기, 메소포타미아식 원형 인장 및 이집트의 스캘럽 인장, 모세의 어머니로 알려진 하쳅숫트 여왕의 황금 완장, 이집트의 미라 2점, 수메르의 고대 설형문자 토판문서 등이 있다.

column7: 모세시대와 3000년전 고대 이집트 유물들을 관람할수 있읍니다
유일한대한민국성서박물관
수제화만 본다면 재미가 없을 것. 특별한 공간이나 카페 등을 찾아가야 다닐만 하다. 가능하다면 미리 성수동 공부를 하면 좋을듯. 수제화 명장1,2호 분의 구두는 꼭 보길 권함. 확실히 뭔가 다른 것이 있음.
이름에 비해 매장이 많지 않은곳

column1: 여기만 보로가기는 조금 부적하지만 주변 맛집과 카페와 함께라면 그냥 한번은 지나가볼만한 곳

column7: (주)오피엘 코리아에서 수제화를 주문함. 사전예약했음에도 대표가 나타나지 않음. 사과전화 한번 없이 전부 문자로 처리. 환불요청에 대해서는 제작비 요구, 현재 소비자 보호원에 고발조치 중. 왜 대기업에서 서비스를 받으면서 제품을 구입하는지 알것같음

강동구에서 운영하는 공연 및 전시시설로 사전예약제로 무료로 이용할 수 있다. 밴드 등이 콘서트를 열고 무료로 입장해서 공연을 즐길 수 있다. 드럼 등 모든 기본 시설을 갖추고 있어 악기 등 몇가지만 갖고오면 된다. 한강을 조망할 수 있는 좋은 위치로 투명한 유리로 둘러쌓여있다. 다만 위치를 잘 몰라 헤매는 경우가 빈번하다. 일단 광진교 중간 정도에 오면 조그만 푯말과 내려가는 계단이 보인다. 계단밑에 다리 상판에 붙어있는 멋진 공간을 볼 수 있다.
분위기가 좋고 피아노 상태도 아주 좋아. 직원분도 친절해서 기분좋게 이용했어.
광진교 다리밑 교각에 설치되어 있는 문화시설입니다.
한 번 가면 반할껄~~~~ㅎㅎ
공연이나 전시회가 자주 열리니 홈페이지 참고하여 관람하면 좋습니다.
Famous mountain in Seoul. Various routes are available to reach summit.

This was an amazing hike. We did the hike up to Jaunbong peak and the views were amazing. Be prepared to spend 4 to 6 hours here. To the peak and back was over 10 miles and it is not for the faint of heart. The trail at the top is rated expert (their highest) and it was a challenge. Even is you don't want to hike to the top stopping to picnic is very common and a good way to spend the afternoon.
MISS KOREA KIM /VERY GOOD
멋진 암릉 조망이 뛰어난 명산.   도봉산  암릉산행의 진수는  Y계곡으로서,  긴장을 유지하고 직벽에 가까운 코스를 내려갔다 다시 올라오는 로프구간은, 아슬아슬하고 스릴 넘치는 재미도 있지만, 집중이 필요합니다.    Y계곡을 지나 신선대에서 마주 보이는 자운봉과 주변을 둘러싸고 있는 암릉경관은 가히 절경입니다.

column1: 또한 서쪽 방향으로 오봉, 여성봉까지는 연결되는 코스는 큰 어려움 없는 구간인데, 이 코스에서 보이는 능선 또한 어디에도 뒤지지 않는 훌륭한 조망이라 하겠습니다.   다녀간 분들만이 왜 그렇게 부르는지 안다는 Y계곡과 함께, 뛰어난 암릉미를 자랑하는 도봉산은 산을 사랑하시는 분들께 꼭 한번 산행하시기를 권하고 싶습니다.

column7: I'd like to visit here again and again whenever I'm in Seoul.

column1: Bukhansan National Park is the best hiking place in Seoul with so many trails, so everyone can easily pick the most suitable trail to hike.
The mountains inside are not high but the topography is amazing beautiful especially near the mountain top.
以後來首爾一定會再來的地方。
北漢山國家公園，是首爾市郊區的熱門登山健行地點，有許多不同的入口及山頭可以選擇，所有的人都適合去走走。
而且搭捷運再走一小段路就能到達圓圈。
韓國喜歡登山健行的人真的不少，從搭捷運往北漢山國家公園的路上，就看到滿滿的登山客，完全不怕迷路。
爬完山後在山下的小販區吃個魚板和熱湯，或是辣炒年糕、鯛魚燒，真是美好的一天。

column7: Incrivel, cidade hiatorica e bem.planehada
암사동의 유래가 된 바위절터, 즉 암사터이며, 구암서원이 아니라 구암정이란 정자가 있다
5 hours climbs and down. It’s a worthy experience though the climb was tough. The view is breathtaking and it’s windy. Hikers often have snacks when taking a break up there! MUST GO
Great place for easy hiking. Multiple peaks, amazing view over Seoul. Really green nature. Doseonsa is close by.

Quite a challenging hike to reach the peak, especially for beginner. Nice view along the way and also at the peak of the mountain. Make sure you prepare water and food as likely will spent 5-6hrs at least for the whole journey to reach the peak. Also, make sure you go there earlier so that you can return to ground before the day turn dark.

We went on winter, so the landmark wasnt as good. Still, great experience. We went right to the top and went down the other side and took us around 5 hours, cause we went without the appropiate outfit.

column1: When going up was easy, but going down we needed to be a little more careful because of the snow. But they have ropes, so you can go down grabing those

column7: Amazing hike! Had a great time at the very top! Beautiful view! A must for any one in Seoul!
옆에서 뮤지컬보고 짧게 돌고 가기엔 좋았어요

column1: 무료입장이고 처음 가본 7세 아들이 전시물품 몇개는 잘보더라구요.

column7: 한전의역사로부터시작해 현재 한전이  사업하고있는 내용까지 알차게 전시되어있었습니다!  관람비도 무료이고 시간 나실때 들르시면 좋을거 같네요.

100년이 넘는 한국의 전기역사를 체계적으로 정리하여 보존하고 전기의 소중함을 일반인과 어린이들에게 널리 알리기 위해 2001년 8월 10일 건립되었다. 전기역사관과 현대전기관 등의 전시실·수장고·사무실·제어실의 시설이 있다. 관람객이 전시물 앞에 서면 자동으로 설명이 나오고 작동되는 첨단 설비를 갖추었다. 주요 전시품으로는 전기관련 유물 247점과 디오라마 모형 9점, 일반모형 5점, 복제물 16점, 그래픽 패널 84점, 영상물 9점, 정보검색 10점 등이 있다.

column1: 전기역사관에는 1887년 3월 우리나라 최초로 전깃불을 밝힌 경복궁 점등식 모형, 1910년대 전차승차권과 전기다리미·유성기, 조선전업 10년사 원본, 피뢰기·발전기, 국내 최초의 발전소인 동대문발전소 모형, 전차가 달리는 옛 종로거리 풍경 등이 축소로 재현되어 있다. 또한 전기에 관한 정보를 검색할 수 있는 터치스크린과 플레밍의 진공관, 패러데이의 전자석 원리 등을 직접 체험할 수 있는 실험코너도 마련되어 있다.

현대전기관에는 한국표준형 원자력발전, 태양발전, 우주광발전 등 현대적인 전기생산 원리와 과정이 모형과 영상자료로 전시되어 있다. 또 반사광을 이용하여 실제 전구처럼 보이나 손으로 만져지지 않는 3차원 입체허상 체험코너, 몸에서 나오는 미세한 전류를 직접 측정해 볼 수 있는 인간전지 실험 등 전기놀이 시설이 있으며, 박물관 배경을 컴퓨터로 합성하여 기념사진을 찍을 수 있는 코너도 마련되어 있다. 이 밖에도 전기상식을 퀴즈로 풀어보는 터치스크린과 전기에 관한 영상뉴스·광고 등을 다시 볼 수 있는 그때를 아십니까 코너도 준비되어 있다.

column7: 한전에서 운영하여 재미있는 전기에 관한 역시적인사료 및 자료가 많음
안가봄
인사를 해도 받지 않는 동대문 도서관 사서들의 불친절. 도서관 앞에 있는 중고 노점상들의 담배연기와 욕설 그리고 울통벗고 술먹는 노정상 주인들의 불건전한 행동. 이런걸 개선하거나 단속할 의지도 없는 도서관 책임자들과 단속반들.

column1: 리모델링만 잘하지 속은 여전히 불친절과 무관심의 동대문 도서관.

column7: 풍물시장 바로 옆에 있는 도서관으로 시립도서관이다. 건물은 낡고 노후되었지만 내부는 나름 인테리어 공사를 해서 이용하기에 불편은 없다.  나름 많은 프로그램을 하며 지역과 유기적 관계를 가지려고 노력하는 모습이 보인다. 바로 곁에 우산각공원이 있고 조금 떨어져 있지만 10분 이내거리에 청계천이 있다.
도서량 많다. 구내식당 싸다. 대체로 조용한 편이다. 보유 도서량 많다. 시설은 낙후되었다. 근방에 청계천 산책로가 있다.

I went to buy some hiking clothes and wasn't disappointed. The flea market mainly sells outdoor clothes and junk though, so unfortunately it's nothing like an American flea market.

이성계가 조선을 건국하고 아들 이방원이 '왕자의 난'으로 왕위에 오르자 분개한 태조 이성계는 함흥으로 간후 한양으로 돌아오지 않았다. 이는 왕위가 정상적으로 계승되지 않은 것으로 여겨질 수 있기에 신하들의 노력으로 함흥에서 태조를 함흥에서 돌아오게 하였다. 태종이 태조를 맞이하기 위해 중랑천 부근에서 기다리고 있었는데, 이를 본 태조가 태종이 있는 방향으로 활을 쏘아 올렸고 이 화살이 태종에게 채 도달하지 않고 떨어진 곳을 '살꽃이'-'살곶이'로 불리운다고 한다.
자전거 타고 건너다 다칠 수 있으니 유의하세요! 그것말고는 유적지로써 한양대와 뚝섬을 연결하는 가치 등 충분한 가치를 가지고 있습니다.

An art museum for kids, often featuring art by kids. It is kind of hit and miss: we've seen some fun shows, but much of the time it isn't open, or it is something that costs money and might be better for older kids. So, kind of a gamble each time we go by. Fun when it works out, but not something to plan a visit around, unless you know in advance what you are getting into.

The iris gardens are obviously best when the irises are blooming, but this is a relaxing and nice looking park at any time. There is a little book cafe on the second floor of the information center, and on the first floor, from the little office on the left, is where you get free maps and stamp books for the Seoul Trail, which runs all the way around Seoul. You turn around and can start your long journey around the city right there at the first red stamp box.

column7: I really didn't get why the place is so popular. There's nothing really special. Besides, exit from the park on some downhill paths are closed, so you have to climb back up to get out of there. The rabbits and birds are very nice though

The Seoul Museum of Art (free entry) is modern art museum located behind the Deoksugung Palace grounds. Here you can explore several floors which six exhibition halls which feature the works of Korean and international artists works at various times throughout the year.

column1: There is one permanent exhibition "Chun Kyung Ja - Eternal Narcissist, where you can see a handful of works painted by this important Korean artist. During our last visit we found some of the works included in the third floor temporary exhibition - DigiFun Art: Urban Space (22 Sept- 13 Dec 13 2015) quite interesting to see. We also enjoyed the sculpture garden in front of the museum. These are quite photogenic, particularly during autumn foliage time of year.

In the end, the Seoul Museum of Art might be a hit or miss for art fans. There are few exhibition halls and depending on the current exhibitions, there might or might not be much that meets your tastes for art. As such it is best to visit the museum website beforehand prior to deciding to include a visit here or not during your trip to Seoul.

column7: This museum is not as bad as my rating suggest. I'm merely giving it that rating in comparison with the other great museums that Seoul has to offer. This is, however, a great little outpost for Seoullites who live further away from the hustle of the city centre.

column1: A big plus is that is it well maintained and is part of the SEMA, (Seoul Museum of Art), an organisation what is made of of 8 separate museums.

column7: Although it's got some distance from central Seoul, its proximity to two subway stations (Hagye, Junggye) renders it quite accessible. Entrance is free, and the exhibitions highlight the works of contemporary Korean artists providing valuable, personal and at times poignant insights into the various social and historical aspects of modern Korea.
Neighborhood friendly museum. They serve decent museum education programs

column1: I used to join this Sunday Meditation Program. And it is good for us to do a zen meditations practice here release from stressful busy city life. And find a balance, clear mind with all situations in our life. Such as studying, working, relationship, family, friends ... etc.

나름 관악산 주변에 있는 사찰 가운데 전경과 배경이 멋지고 훌륭한 곳입니다. 아래쪽으로는 사당역을 향하는 길이 있어 도보와 차로 드나들 수 있고, 위와 옆으로는 등산길이 있어 관악산을 바라보며 천천히 오를 수 있습니다. 주말에 차량이 꽤 있어 불편함을 주기도 하지만, 화려한 산새를 끼고 있어 보는 내내 감탄사가 저절로 나옵니다. 특히 사찰 옆이나 관음사 국기봉에서 내려다볼 때에는 한폭의 그림처럼 아름답게 보입니다. 마치 드론을 띄워 위에서 아래를 내려다보는 느낌과 아주 비슷하다고 할까요? 바로 앞에서 보는 사찰의 느낌에 3차원 공간적 시각이 덧붙여져 입체를 보는 것 같습니다. 꼭 산 위에 올라서 보시는 것을 추천합니다. 관음사의 화려한 외관을 마음껏 즐길 수 있거든요. ^^
저의 개인경험으로 말씀드리자면, 관세음보살님의 영험과 부처님의 기운이 느껴지는 곳입니다.

The bridge that every body talks about. It is an usual bridge, at night the fauntains and lights bring it to life. Except the uniqueness of that, the bridge is a pedestrian bridge too and from it goes a wide, long and interesting recreation path. Cycling, roller blades, running, open air gyms, etc. If you like to be active, go here make a circle on bouth shores of the river you will be very happy :)

It's spacious, clean and cool when we're here in early June! There's bicycle rental, lots of people in tents and a ministop(shop) to buy drinks and snacks nearby! The water show in the evening starts at 8, 8.30 and 9pm (So it says). We saw the 8 and 8.30 show.. go when it's darker for a better experience :)

한의약에 관한 각종 역사적 사실과 지식을 넓힐 수 있는 좋은 기회가 될 것으로 보이며, 건강에 그리고 한의약지식에 큰 도움이 될 것으로 생각되어진다.

column1: Its easy accessible going up and down. Location of this mountain is far from the city centre. Easiest way is to take the subway to Danggogae then transfer to another bus.

column7: 5 hours climbs and down. It’s a worthy experience though the climb was tough. The view is breathtaking and it’s windy. Hikers often have snacks when taking a break up there! MUST GO
