IS a trick! for your eyes! A lot of stuff to see there.. best for the families or couples. You can spend couple of hours there to have fun. VR section is for me the most recommended.

I really love spending my time here to see and capture some funny moments with the props and application that was given by the staff. The 3D effects are so cool though! Would like to visit again if I have a chance :D

I had a good time with my friend when we visited! I could finally fulfil my dream as a ballerina on stage so yeah, that’s my favourite display. The others were cool too and we had lots of fun posing at different angles.

It is a great. I was have fun with my friends.Using the apps can take the 3D video which the picture is look like alive. It was very funny to take the photo and video. There are ice museum which is very beautiful. I played on the ice slice many times. It was fast and  exciting .
독특한 수저 판매점. 만드는 공방 수업도 있고 구매도 가능한 곳
젓가락 하나하나의 디자인과 만들어낸 솜씨 그리고 이를 전시하기위한 저집.의 공간이 하나로 이어지는 감이 무척 훌륭함.
남녀노소 국내국외 상관없이 선물용으로 좋음
멋진 저!
철판에 구워먹는 호주산 와규인데

column1: 자리가 넓어서 많은 인원이 회식하기에 좋아요
겨울보다는 봄, 가을에 더 좋을 듯 합니다.
야외 좌석 위주로 되어 있고 전체가 움직이는
천막으로 덮힙니다. 봄 가을에는 천막을 접고
시원한 바람 쐬며 고기를 먹을 수 있습니다.

column7: 두번 갔는데.. 고기 질은 그저그래서.. 맛있는 소고기는 아니고요.  누린내라고 해야하나.. 비린내있어요.그냥 싼 소고기 단체회식장소에요. 질보다 양으로 승부하는 사람들한테 맞는..
구조상 정신없음. 고기의 맛은 보통 혹은 보통 이하. 단체손님이 많음
가격적인 부분은 큰 메리트 그러나 고기집에서 갖춰야할 가장 기본적인 환기가 없다

column1: For price wise, it has big merit. However threre is no air ventilation system which should be mandatory equipment for restaurant which use fire & grill

column7: 날씨 맑은날은 좋아유. 가격은 좀 비싸유

This is a big tower in the middle of the city on top of a hill. It's kind of a nice place. I would walk up the hill if I were you. There's some nice yellow buses that will take you to the top. There's also a cable car that you can pay money to wait in line for a long time before you ride. Some days the line is not so long. But mostly it's long. You can also pay money to go to the top of this Tower. Like I said it's a nice Tower.

N Seoul Tower is the signature observatory tower of Seoul, sitting on top of Namsan Park. It also houses thematic museums, cafes, restaurants and souvenir shops, so you have plenty of options on what to do.

column1: At 10,000 won per entry, N Seoul Tower is one of the cheapest observatories that I have been to. You can mix and match your ticket to have museum entries, food or dining experience to go with it. For a really romantic night, you can make advanced booking (they don't accept walk-ins) for n.Grill, a high class French restaurant.

Really enjoyed my experience here. We had a lovely coffee at the cafe on the observatory tower with an equally lovely view. Highly recommend in for an evening outing paired with dinner so you get to see both the day and night view.

column7: Call it cheesy.... but it's just so romantic here. The ride up was beautiful. Unfortunately when we went we had no view as it was raining and very foggy. Regardless, walking around and seeing the thousands of rainbow heart shaped locks, signed in every language and sealed with words of love, it was so beautiful. We of course bought a lock and signed it. Bring your own lock to save some money!
It's pretty cool.

column1: You can go at night and take some pretty good pics of the skyline. It also might be nice to see the sunset there.
Lots of couples and families, lots of tourists. Prepare thyself.
(Also, I don't think that paying to go up in the elevator is 100% worth it. You can check out the love lock terrace for free)

column7: A great place to get a view of the city. Do take the cable car to get here especially if you have kids you need to carry or elderly as no car or tour bus can go up to the base of the tower. A challenging short hike a steep hill from where the car/bus stop. To avoid the crowd, go during weekdays. We went in the morning as soon as the cable car started to operate so there was hardly any queue to get on the cable car.
Nice hangout place. Good for individuals and groups. Nice for picnics. Rent bikes from the information center. These is a great getaway even for a short period as well.

column1: So many green to please the eye.

column7: A forested park area that combines elements of a zoo. There are animal and plant exhibits here. There's even a section of deers. This is a very multi-faceted parks. Families come here to camp as well. It's a pity that the path to the Han River was blocked off due to construction works.

More of a park than a forest, though the area is more than big enough. There are many small areas dedicated to group activities,  children's play, and much more. Art is littered throughout the space, so there is something new to appreciate every corner you turn. Bike rentals are available as well. Watch out for bugs during the summer!
Here is so great for family. It is also great for picnic. There are so many trees. There are few pretty cats there where you can play with them.
Lots of things to see, maps are conveniently placed and easy to follow. You could easily spend a whole day there with your family or on a date. Make sure you see the butterfly garden and insectarium.
It was great place to rest and have a coffee with a view of the city on the terrace after the long walk in the hanok village.
도심에서.. 이런 아름다운.. 옥상카페도 없을듯.. 석양이 질때.. 거기를 거쳐간  자들이 문제들이지.. 멋진곳이 없을듯..
비오는날 고즈넉한 북촌의 향취를 느낄 수 있는 좋은 공간이였습니다.  음료도 맛있고 주인분도 너무 친절하셨어요~
루프탑이 있는 삼청동 카페. 삼청동 일대와 북악산을 볼 수 있다.

column1: 작은 창들을 통해 들어오는 빛의 움직임이 좋다. 실내는 넓진 않지만 아늑한 편. 1층에서는 주문만 가능하고 2층과 3층, 루프탑에 좌석이 마련되어 있다.
음료와 디저트의 맛은 무난했지만 주인분들의 친절한 응대가 기분좋은 곳.

column7: 삼청로에서 한계단만 올라오면 만날 수 있는 아늑한 카페!

column1: 날씨가 좋을땐 옥상에서 경치를 즐기며 커피 한잔 하기 좋고 실내 자리는 아늑한 분위기
직접 구운 디저트류외 커피가 맛있는 곳 :)

column7: **** THE GOOD:

column1: This is supposed to be a traditional village in the middle of Seoul.
We went when the weather was extremely hot, and traveling with young kids.  The information center was under construction and we didn’t know where to go to appreciate this site.
We walked around aimlessly for a half hour (with whining and whimpering kids) before we gave up and walked down to the palace area.
We saw some old style homes and streets, but I’m not sure what the big deal is.  With the steep streets to traverse (with kids) it wasn’t a great experience for us.
I guess if we had found the one street where you look down through multiple old style homes / roofs, it would have been a cool photo spot.
I did find a postcard painting of that famous photo spot so at least I got that!

column7: This is the most beautiful place I've ever been. It was breath taking. People complain I see about not having it layed out for tourists - it isn't for tourists. It's a village kept original and it's beautiful with amazing views, gorgeous buildings, and the most gorgeous girls in hanbok dresses. It was like being whisked away to another world for a little while. Explore, stay quite to respect the area, and enjoy every minute of this beautiful area.
Pros:

column1: - It's a great site to take pictures in and has some craft stores along the route.
- It's a route and not a proper tourist site so we had to walk around for 20 mins trying to find some sites (1 street and many alley ways.
- It has become a residental area, it's not preserved. So the residents aren't really happy with tourist and has lots of warning signs. (Ex: GO AWAY, NOT TOURIST SITE)
Overall: If u want to take pictures here, it's a real effort to come here especially in this heatwave.

column7: The most beautiful hanok village in Seoul and, I think, in South Korea. Very nice houses and very nice view above Seoul. It's a must on your travel list, but if you go there please be quiet when you visit. People still live there and I met a lot of turists who made noise. All of the walls were full of posters "please, be quiet!" or "just visit and pass away".
Historical part of Seoul with a modern twist. Many shop's restaurants, boutique's, shop's that have some nicknack's. Bukchon Hanok Village is worth checking out.

Nice place to learn about Kimchi. I loved they provided some samples of Kimchi for me to find out which one I liked best. I liked the interactive tables with guides on how to make Kimchi. I wish I lived in Seoul in order to attend their Kimchi making workshops.

A little hard to find since it's not directly off of the main street of Insadong. It's in a multi-story building off of Insadong. I was using google maps to find it, but it kept showing we were there when we clearly were not. We had to walk a little and then noticed a marking on the ground. I wanted to take a kimchi making class, but the website is a little hard to understand. When I got there I was told they were booked for the next month. The museum itself is pretty small, but there was some kind of discount for the entrance (2 for 1) plus you could have a free coffee or tea at their cafe which I think made up for it. The fact that they have kimchi samples is also a plus!

Cool museum. We had a good time here. Also a great way to duck out of the heat or rain. Be sure to look into the kimchi cooking claaa ig you like kimchi. We didn't know until it was too late (3 day advance booking) but hopefully others get to go. :)
Nice place to experience the making of kimchi, with a compact museum introducing the kimchi history
Very little to see as a museum. Might be worth going if you can arrange to take kimchee making class.

Great history here. It cost 3,000₩ to enter but it's totally worth paying a few bucks extra for a guided tour. It tells you more of the history and the fun facts about the palace. If you'd like to dress up in a traditional Hanoi, you should visit stores outside the palace. If it wasn't a hot day in June, I probably would have since the dresses look so pretty. They also have costumes for men too.

column1: Also make sure to bring plenty of water since they only place that solid water I could find was the National Folk Museum and I spent hours under the hot sun wandering around the place. Its massive so do bring comfortable shoes. And overall have fun!

column7: Very beautiful palace, the biggest.. too shame that it was mostly destroyed but its remaining beauty is yet enjoyable.. and even after 1st visit .. one will feel the need to revisit again as it is really huge and one can't get to see it all in one day.. but it's open for free on national holidays.. we were lucky that we had a very knowledgeable guide that showed us through its beauty and directed us to the important features in each corner.. but yet if there was no guide you'd still enjoy the atmosphere of the beautiful korean history.

The palace is so amazing constructed back then. The oldest the five. It is worthwhile going there earlier to avoid the peak crowd timing and you can enjoyed the traditional Korean culture. A very well maintained place to view. Great for many photo taking of the all place, especially when there lesser crowd. You should proceed to view the palace from the rear entrance, which has a very nice cultural museum building. When you moving along the buildings and headed toward the main,you will get more and more amazed.

Gyeongbokgung is a great place to visit for cultural learning and photo opportunities. If you come on certain days, there is even a free English tour provided by some Korean middle school students. The students speak English very well and are very knowledgeable about the palace! It's a great way to experience this part of Korea.

Beautiful palace. Most of the buildings are recreations due to destruction during the Japanese occupation prior to and during WWII. There are nearby options to rent period clothing. While I did not avail myself of the option, those who did seemed to be far more uncomfortable in the heat, so I would advise taking into account the time of year before making that decision. While the buildings themselves were beautiful, there was very little in the way of decoration in about 80% of the buildings, with no view inside even, though the building with interior decoration were well done.

One of the main reasons I came to Korea was for Tongin. The coins for food was an amazing experience! I walked up and down the isle a few times trying to pick things to get. I ended up finding some amazing food that I've never had before. I highly recommend this to people visiting Korea!
It is very near to Gyeongbokgung palace. So if u have time just come here. May be better around lunch time. if too early morning some shop havent open yet.
Variety of Korean food and snacks here. I love this market! You got to explore this market if you're street food hunter.
Interesting experience. Make sure to purchase the coins and tray. There's a table selling them for 5000 won near the center of the market
Cheap and good! For 5,000won it is not that bad. You can fill up your plate easily. Quite a lot of selection of Korean food! The spicy Tteok-bokki is so nice and dry haha.
동대문 보다는 이태원 시장... 넓은곳 돌아다니는거 싫어하는 사람들에게 잘맞음... 동대문보다는 살짝 비싼가격
Im scene viertel Itawon. Hier ist alles recht westlich geprägt aber trotzdem auch typisch koreanisch. Die preise sind hier generell höher egal was man sucht.
가격만족♡맛있는 식음료와 다양한 구매아이템 함께있어 지인 만남장소로 추천~
정말 세계적인 관광지네요. 한국의 뉴욕이라고 할만하죠. 다양한 인종과 문화가 뒤섞인 곳 ~
외국인들도 많이 보이고 니색음식들도 있고 데이트하기 좋음

column2: Jungbu Market (Local Wholesale Dried Seafood Center)
column7: Cheap and quality dried seafood.. Must visit if you like dried seafood!

column2: Jungbu Market (Local Wholesale Dried Seafood Center)
column7: Never seen so much dried fishes in my life. Thot Msia was a lot but this place has all. Anchovies, all shapes n sizes, fishes too....Nice place to walk around like a wet market.

column2: Jungbu Market (Local Wholesale Dried Seafood Center)
column7: Good qualities with reasonable price dried seafood n vegetables here

column2: Jungbu Market (Local Wholesale Dried Seafood Center)
column7: Alot of Koean Style dried seafood stalls. There are some occasional dried food stalls that sell other typ of dried food too.

column2: Jungbu Market (Local Wholesale Dried Seafood Center)
column7: A street full of dried seafood and snack shops. Price not expensive.
Amazing variety of fresh produce, exactly what I was after in Seoul. Not really a tourist destination, unless you're after ginseng for which they have multiple stores.

column1: Loads of seasonal fruit and veg, interesting range of preserves and dried ingredients are scattered throughout the market too.

column7: Vast market covering a few block selling all kind of produces from herbal to fruits to meat to things u havent seen before . Mainly locals but worth a trip if ones is into local market.
Excellent deals on fruit and vegetables. Be ready to haggle. Busy old style market that's got a little of everything.
Great farmer's market. Fruits are affordable, especially.
This is a fine place to find real ginseng with  reasonably good price

Having traveled through many Asian countries, I'd say this was a lesser impressive market. Not only were the food stalls shelling out mostly the same things, but the prices were as if I was at a regular food hall or restaurant. When coming to any market, I expect low prices with minimal service. Definitely still worth a gander and if you're in town for a but, stock up on the fresh Kimchi selection for your fridge.

Nice market to eat street food. There aren't too many options, the stalls are kind of repetitive but it's nice to have everything in one place. From fish cake and pork feet, kimbap and live octopus. There's plenty of food to enjoy and it's nice the market has a covering so you aren't in direct sunlight during the day.
Busy market with many interesting sights and kind vendors. Mung bean pancakes are delicious. Street food is yummy in general! Had some tough tteokbokki though :(

Lots of colours and interesting to see. Whilst it looks like a lot of food most of the vendors sell the same things and of the same quality. Very few sweet things to eat. Got very warm and stuffy during summer. Borderline unpleasant due to the heat so best prepare yourself for that.

It's become increasingly touristed but it is a true market experience. Honestly even though I live in the city I feel like a tourist here as I rarely have need to buy the things out on sale there. However, the street food is still great and authentic, and the used clothing market is aleays a great place for wandering and rummaging.
Fresh sea food! I stopped by the 일월수산 that sells crabs. They were very very fresh and most importantly the crabs were delicious. :D yummy 일월수산's phone number is 02-403-6454.
Clean and tidy but it may not be worth taking such a long traffic to visit there

시장의 관리는 서울특별시 농수산물도매시장관리공사가 맡고 있으며, 시장의 운영은 1997년 현재 10개의 농수축산물 도매시장 법인과 협동조합의 공판장이 담당하고 있다. 부류별 도매시장 법인과 공판장을 보면 청과물은 5개의 도매시장 법인과 1개의 농협공판장, 수산물은 2개의 도매시장 법인과 1개의 수협공판장, 축산물은 1개의 축협공판장이 각각 시장의 운영을 담당하고 있다.

column1: 시장의 거래에 참여하고 있는 유통 참여자로는 1997년 7월 현재 경매사 314명, 중도매인 2,111명, 매참인 145명이 있다. 부류별로는 경매사의 경우 청과물 267명, 수산물 42명, 축산물 5명이며, 중도매인의 경우 청과물 1,655명, 수산물 406명, 축산물 50명이 있다. 도매시장에서의 거래제도는 도매시장 법인의 수탁 판매원칙과 상장경매제를 원칙으로 하고 있다.

시장의 거래 물량은 개설 초기에는 개장 후 5년 이내 완전 가동을 목표로 1일 평균 거래량을 청과물 3,030톤, 수산물 540톤으로 설정하였으나 개장 후 2년째부터 목표 물량을 상회하여 1996년 말 현재 거래 물량은 청과물 223만 9,484톤, 수산물 18만 4,954톤, 축산물 10만 7,843톤으로 1일 거래량은 각각 6,745톤, 557톤, 356톤에 달하고 있다. 개장 초기에는 도·소매가 분리되어 있지 않아 시장 질서가 혼란스럽기도 했으나, 점차 경매 물량이 증가하고 거래 질서가 잡혀 우리나라의 중심적인 농수산물 공영도매시장로서의 기능을 수행하고 있다.

column7: 대한민국에서 농수산물집결 하는 아주 큰 시장이라고 할수있어요.단 일반인 소비자분들은 구매를 할땐 잘 살피고 사야지요 도매시장이라고 까딱하면 바가지 쓸수 있습니다.
자연산광어  활어  3만5천
Thanks for still being there. I really like to visit and read a book that curated from the owner have similar interests. Inspirational and comfortable place, bookstore!
I love this place : ) photo books, zines, post-cards, stationary... and cute cats ! The most adorable place in Seoul.
Good
韓国の面白い本、雑貨を買うならココです。独立出版系の本もあります。デザイン、アートに興味がある人は特に面白いと思います。飼い猫が店内で自由に過ごしているので、猫アレルギーの方は注意です。
책을 세권 샀다. 갑자기 쓰기엔 부담스런 54000원.
很喜歡這間位於安靜社區內的小書店。架上的書按主題整理分類陳列著，多為藝文類選書。常舉辦作者見面會。買書可免費享用一杯美式咖啡。
좋은 공간이야. 수업들으러 갔었는데 만족스러웠어. 직원들도 친절해.
마음을 채울 책들과 간단 맥주 커피 주스가 기다리고 있고...책속 스승과 오프라인으로 만나는 즐거움이 있는곳!
아메리카노가 맛있습니다. 좋은책과 그리고 편안한 자리. 작가님들의 번개가 자주 열려 좋아하는 작가님이 오신다면 꼭.
지인 소개로 갔어요. 맛있는 커피와 함께 한 책이 있는 공간에서 휴식할 수 있어 좋았습니다.
Local experience.  A traditional market in a working class neighborhood. The vendors are friendly and helpful.
Great area for authentic Chinese food in the heart of Seoul
If you want have some north-eastern Chinese experience!!
중국 식재료를 많이 파는 시장. 짜사이, 고수, 해바라기씨, 껍질콩....  시장구경 재밌음. 중간 중간 파는 꽈배기하고 진빵 종류도 먹어 볼만함.
큰 시장은 아님니다만 주변에 중국계 상인들이 많아 중국식품을 싸게 구입할수 있었던 점, 그리고 중국식 밀가루 요리들을 살수있었던점은 아주 큰 장점이었던것 같습니다. 다른 시장에서는 볼 수 없는 음식들이거든요.
small but great variety and changes regularly. awesome wood photo shop there i purchase gifts from often
very small, mostly jewelry and cosmetics
used to be traditional market, not nay more. temporary handmade market is held weekend.
집앞이라서 일끝나고 항상 돌아가는 길에 들르는 시장인데, 겨울에는 엄청 춥고 여름에는 엄청 덥고 안에 파는 물건이라곤 하나도 신기하지 않는 액세서리 위주! 아이디어 좀 내야 하지 않을런지. 위치도 좋다고 말하지 못하겠고, 환경이 좋은것도 물건이 좋은것도 아님. 그것도 아니면 뭔가 이벤트라도 해야하는데 그런것도 없고, 그냥 이름만 프리마켓!
악세서리나 수공예품 판매가 이루어지는 마켓으로 변해 아쉽습니다. 운영주체가 바뀌었다는 소식을 들었는데 사실인지는 모르겠지만 특색이 없어져 아쉽습니다

Not a bad trip for the cost, but it is starting to show wear and clearly isn't getting much of a budget for updating or renewing exhibits or facilities. Has a lot of potential to be much nicer and more interesting, but the will to get it there seems to be lacking.
Great for kids.lots of things/activities to do
Good place for children
일회 입장료에 비하면 컨텐츠가 그리 많은건 아님. 연간회원권으로 날춥고 더울때 가면 참 좋음. 바로옆에 어린이 도서관도 있어서 책보는데 너무 편함!(더서관은 무료임!)

column1: 건물 지하 주차는 전날까지 웹페이지에서 사전등록해두어야 가능함. 지하말고 외부(좀걸어야함) 주차장도 있음

column7: 쌍문동 관광지이며 둘리 고향이기도 한 쌍문동 둘리박물관입니다.

column1: 입장료가 있지만 연간회원권도 그닥 비싸지 않고 3층에는 키즈카페같이 아이들 놀수있는곳도 있어서 매우좋아요.
지하부터 3층, 옥상도 있고 매우 신경을 많이 쓴 흔적이 곳곳에 있어요.
그림그리며 체험 할수도 있고 게임도 할수 있는 공간도 있고, 아이들 노래방까지 있습니다.
주차는 예약한 사람들만 주차할수 있고 4시이후에는 빈자리에 주차하게 해주기도 합니다.
가벼운 마음으로 들르기 좋은 곳이지만 데이트 장소로는 적합하지 않고 가족단위 니들이 장소로 적당합니다.

column7: 깊고 넓진 않지만 아이들이 놀 수 있는 계곡이 있어 좋구요. 화장실 샤워실이 깔끔하게 운영되어 좋네요. 부족한 물건이나 간식은 안에 있는 가게에서 바로 살 수 있어 편리합니다
처음에는 접근성 우수, 시설우수, 관리우수 모두 만족한 편이었다.

column1: 개장한지 몇개월 안되서 시설에 문제가 생기고 관리에 허점이 보이기 시작한다.
화장실, 샤워실, 개수대가 있는 건물에서 정화조 악취가 몇주간 계속 풍기는데 조치가 없고 하다 못해 설명도 없다.
청소 하시는 분들은 청결유지를 위해 열심히  하시고 문도 열어 놓고 환풍기도 계속 틀어놓기는 하는데 건물의 무엇인가가 고장인지
냄새 나서 화장실과 샤워실에 가는게 고역일 정도이다.
초안산아래 아늑한 풍경을 즐기며  조용하게 힐링하러 온 캠퍼에게 짜증나는 분위기가 자주 연출되고 있다.
초반에는 상당히 조용한 캠핑장으로 이따금 애들이나 조금 떠드는 평화로운 분위기 였으나, 진상캠퍼들이 늦은 밤까지 술마시며 큰소리로 떠들어 그들이 잠들때까지 잠을 자기 힘들다.
심지어 커다란 캐빈형 텐트를 쳐놓고 무더기로 몰려와 새벽까지 마시며 웃고 떠들고 새벽3시까지 난장판이지만 이를 제지하거나 관리하는 사람은 구경 조차 못한다.
진상들과 직접 부딪히다가 싸움이라도 날까봐 관리실에 조치를 부탁 하려 전화해보지만 전화 조차 받지 않는다.
옆텐트 캠퍼가 제발 그만 좀 자자는 애원 섞인 짜증을 부려도 소용없다.
오전 11시까지 퇴실 준비하라는 방송외에는 이런 부분을 신경쓰는 관리가 매우 미흡하다.
아마도 개인이 운영하는 시설이면 이렇지는 않을 것이다.

column7: 집 근처 캠핑장으로 30개 정도 사이트가 있으면 예약은 전쟁이고 사람들도 많아서 자연과 하루는 기대하지 않아야 합니다. 그런데 아파트가 보이는 곳에서 캠핑하면서 야외에서 바베큐할 수 있는 곳이 서울 안에 있다는 것으로도 최고라고 생각이 드네요. 캠핑장이 접근성이 좋아서 혹시 안 가져온 것이 있으면 잠깐 나가서 가져오는 것도 가능하고 잠깐 방문해서 쉬다 오는 것도 가능 합니다.
최악의 캠핑장. 사람들은 밤 12시가 넘어도 소리지르면서 술먹고 노는 곳.

column1: 남에 대한 배려가 1도 없는 사람들만 모여잌ㅅ는 곳

column7: 10분거리에 이렇게 좋은 시설이 있다는게 너무 좋았습니다.부담없이 가서 반나절 아이들과 신나게 놀고오니 좋네요. 좀더 따뜻해지면 1박해도 좋을듯 하네요.

column2: OME Korean Cooking Class in Seoul : 오미요리연구소 OME Cooking Lab's Korean Home Cuisine
column7: Tldr: This is awesome and enjoyable. Do it

column1: This cooking class was very enjoyable. I have lived in Korea for 8 years and i learned a lot whilst on the market tour. The staff, especially Dave, are really friendly and very knowledgeable. The cooking was lots of fun and out was Korean style. Everyone worked together to a common goal. The customer service and after care with the recipes being sent was above and beyond what i was expecting. Already planning a second trip to learn some new dishes. Loved it.

column2: OME Korean Cooking Class in Seoul : 오미요리연구소 OME Cooking Lab's Korean Home Cuisine
column7: Had an excellent morning touring the markets with Dave, learning nearly as much about Korean food in 2 hours as I have learnt in almost three years here. The lesson itself was relaxed, friendly, and most importantly, delicious.

column1: I will be attending again, and recommend it to anybody who wants a great bite of Korean culinary culture.

column2: OME Korean Cooking Class in Seoul : 오미요리연구소 OME Cooking Lab's Korean Home Cuisine
column7: The class was full of fun and it is a “must try” event when you visit Seoul. The class content is easy but essential. Wonderful experience!

column2: OME Korean Cooking Class in Seoul : 오미요리연구소 OME Cooking Lab's Korean Home Cuisine
column7: This cooking class was quite fun and a really great experience. I loved the stroll with Dae over the market an all the explanations we got during this time. Arriving at the new opened cooking studio we got slippers and a warm welcome from Yunji. The cooking itself in a small group was really relaxing and you are not in a rush. Having the meal together in the group after cooking was the perfect end of a great cooking class.

column2: OME Korean Cooking Class in Seoul : 오미요리연구소 OME Cooking Lab's Korean Home Cuisine
column7: Dave gave a great tour of the herb market nearby with lots of fun facts about popular Korean dishes and traditions. Minseong led a great cooking class where we made kimchi and seafood pancakes, kimchi stew, bulgogi, and a summer kimchi. Dave also showed us how to make soju bombs and we finished with some melon! Yum!!!!

There are a lot of people will be taking photos with the exterior of the building, the extraordinary design for the building is totally worth visit even you only take few photos. If you are not a fan keen to shopping, It was nice for take photos to see the containers. Worth a quick visit there are many restaurants on the top floor, easy to find tasty cuisine. Recommend to check it out! It is a popular photo spot for local teenagers, afternoon maybe the best moment to take photos and there are not so many instagramers. Take your time here, must visit.

It is a hot place for youths. Festivals are mostly held at there. Clothes shops are cozy and modernize. Korean fashion is influenced. Restaurants are on upstairs and you could choose western and eastern foods.
Great fun! Nice shops, nice places to eat. Great little book cafe called Index. It's like another London Boxpark but bigger
Yeah if u like blue container stacking up highly this is the place for u. I would imagine most girl ranging from 20s to 30s would like it here. Dunno why..
Very casual place to go around and eat while shopping. There's a few restaurants and many small shops that sells clothes and jewelry. The selection was very interesting, especially the cube bread.
Good place to spend some time in summer holidays. The artists are ok, and there are some games inside too.. pretty fun, over all.
The tickets for this place was part of the Discover Seoul pass.

column1: I thought that this place was just a wax museum and was pleasantly surprised when it was a bit more than that. Keep your entrance ticket handy since that's what you use to play the mini games inside. Like other wax museums, you can pose with the actors for photo ops. Some of the displays or areas had games like roulette and landing (or in my case crashing) a plane. I thought that made it more interesting.

Some of the wax statues were a bit hard to tell or unfamiliar but there were placards around so that you can figure out who you're looking at. Nice place to spend some time especially if you can recognise them all.

column7: Good quality wax models with interactive game features available. However, the highlight is the allowed interaction with the model, with the only exception of touching the face and hair features. I got nice and close photos with the wax models, as compared to other wax museums. The models are also placed in enviroments styled accordingly, such as a studio set-up for actors and actresses.
Looks real. And got a chance to see my fave celebrities 😊

This place is like Madame Tussaud with so many famous people's figures. Unfortunately, it is lack of Kpop figures, which I want to see more since I was in Korea. If you use Discover Seoul Pass, you can get free ticket to this museum.

It's amazing place to spend time if you are interested in new Samsung gadgets VR glass new phones and more. It was interesting, fanny and tricky to find out how everything works. Definitely recommend for those who like technological stuff.

Horrible futuristic museum. Virtually just a series of concept videos and Instagram filters. Most of the actual physical gadget don’t work so well. Even the concepts themselves are not creative. Mostly its screens inside everyday objects.
Exhibit new technologies from Samsung Electronics. You can buy original Samsung Electronics too. You can use and  test some of cool stuff as well. Good for kids.

A nice place to see the technology in the future from Samsung and kids can have some fun in the 2rd floor.  Good to visit if you have an hour or so of your time in the afternoon.  The location is right at the Gangnam station exit 8

One of the amazing experience to visit a Samsung digital market. Happen to see latest stuff that Samsung is launching in market and they are really worth watching here. A band was put by staff and with that you can start multiple experience of Samsung technology..
本を選んだり読んだりすることができる楽しめる場所でした。佇まいもすごく美しくまた行ってみたいところです。空間の仕切感を活かした造り方だと思います。本当にありがとうございます。
서점에서 시간을 보내는건 즐거움인것 같아요

column1: 하지만 아쉬운건 서점에서 자유롭게 책을 볼 수 있도록 배려 해주는 거잖아요
그럼 책을 대하는 마음도 매너있게 행동해야 한다고 생각하는데 거친 손길들에 맘이 아파요...
책을 조금만 소중하고 정중하게 대하면 하는 아쉬움이 들어요

column7: 독서할 수 있는 공간이 내부에도 있지만

column1: 구매한 이후 주변 별마당 도서관에서 책 보기에도 괜춘
주변 음식점도 많아 주말에 책 읽으며 시간 보내기 괜찮은 장소

column7: 원래 있던 자리에 '삐에로쑈핑'이 생기면서 이전했습니다. 전보다 더 깔끔하고 예뻐졌지만 규모는 많이 축소돼서 아쉽습니다.
규모는 크지 않지만 신간이나 잘 알려진 책들은 찾기 쉬웠습니다.
Nice view of Deoksugung
덕수궁 뿐만 아니라 정동길을 포함한 주변 경관을 함께 즐길 수 있는 곳으로 무엇보다 무료로 방문할 수 있다. 서울시청 서소문청사에 위치하여 주말에 옆으로 나있는 입구로 안내대로 들어가면 엘리베이터를 통해 올라갈 수 있다.

column1: 전망대 안에는 카페도 함께 있는데 주말에 영업을 하는지는 잘 모르겠다. 좌석은 20여석 남짓 있기 때문에 붐비면 그 고즈넉한 경관을 조용한 곳에서 볼 수 있는 분위기를 놓칠 수 있기 때문에 잘 안방문할 수 있는 타이밍을 잡아서 가면 어떨까 싶다.

column7: 덕수궁을 호젓하게 내려다보는 멋진 풍광을 자랑하는 카페에요, 정동 전망대. 북악산, 북한산, 인왕산, 안산까지 훤히 다 조망할 수 있는 최고의 위치죠. 입장료는 무료! 이곳보다 더 적나라하게 우리나라 근대사를 눈으로 보여주는 역사의 현장은 없을 듯 합니다. 사진 한 컷에 족히 책 수십권 분량의 역사가 담겨있는 느낌입니다.
이 위에 올라가면 정동길과 덕수궁을 한 번에

column1: 볼 수 있고, 위층에 카페도 있어 아주 좋습니다

column7: 덕수궁이 내려다 보이는 전망대.

column1: 서울시청 별관에 있으며 카페로 운영되고 무료입장한다.
전체적인 덕수궁의 모습을 조망할 수 있기에 더욱 멋지고 오랜시간 동안 머물며 주변의 여러곳들을 찬찬히 감상할 수 있는곳이기도 하다.

column7: I love #openmall designs and was glad to find #mecenatpolis by chance. It reminds me of #centurycitymall mall back home. The #umbrella ceiling is a nice touch. Lots of eating options and shops. They even have a #lilliput #cafe
Very nice place to stay since it's nearby Subway and Mall. In addition, there is Home-plus store. I do recommend this place for visit

usually come to this mall just to go to homeplus. it's really good place, near hangang, and hapjeong yok.. good locations, neat and good architecture. and affordable-price shops. surrounding by apartment and near woolim ent. tho
contrived commercial center for those who have no taste or discernment.  beds of plastic flowers?  oppa please.

A mixture of residential apartments, offices, and retail stores/restaurants/cafes/movie theater all in one place, conveniently connected to Subway Lines 2 and 6. Some commonly known shops include Uniqlo, Muji, 8 Seconds, TGIF, Lotte Cinemas, Starbucks, Krispy Kreme, ABC Mart, 7-Eleven, McDonald's, Home Plus, and many other places to eat, drink and shop. The only downside--according to some--is that it is open-air, and visitors can directly feel blistery winds in the winters and the hot-and-humid warmth in the summers.
GOOD
대림시장이 근처라서 먹을것 걱정없이 아침에 와서 저녁에 가도 좋을듯...

column1: 은명초등학교 근처엔 가족단위로 갈 수 있는 도서관이 없어서 찾다가 버스로 한번에 오고 조금 걸어도 되고 가족단위로 와도 좋네요.
폭염 피하고 공부하기 딱 좋은 장소!!!

column7: 접근이 용이하고 근처에 버스 정류장이 가까워서 오고갈때 이용하시 편리할 듯
작지만 좋은 동네  2층짜리도서관
나쁘지 않아요
Honestly, it is one of the best aquarium I have ever been. Not only because it's big (The biggest in Asia) but also because of the variety of species and the overall presentation.

column1: There are many explanations in English but still there is a lot of room to improve on this topic.
Definitely a must go if you have enough time to spend a whole morning there .

column7: Not a huge aquarium but kids can enjoy for 2 hours or less. It's a beautiful place but the entrance fee is a bit expensive. For the family of 5 it cost 90 even after i got a discount. I Shouldn't have gotten out instead i shouldve roamed around more inside. I thought they had more things to see. what a waste!

column1: I wish they sell the souvenirs cheaper. After paying 100 for the entrance, not many people would want to pay more for them. I would like to go see the aquarium again but not with the full price.

column7: Nice place if a like cozy as with most things in Korea. Beluga whales and large ocean tank with walkthrough tunnels are the highlight. Not a ton of variety and doesn't take long.

This aquarium have different marine species and it have many rooms to see and interact with the fishes. It's kind of expensive, therefore, exist special offers for foreigners and groups. I've been in 2 or 3 other places, but this one, was very good.

A modern, medium-sized aquarium which is 2orth visiting, especially if you are with kids and have time. The main attraction is the beluga which is a white whale that resembles a dolphin.  They have two at the aquarium and they are very impressive creatures, definitely worth seeing and interacting with through the glass.
Very big and great mall. There is a Nike factory store inside, also an Adidas outlet store.
It's best place to get trendy and inexpensive sports items! It has Nike and adidas.
You can buy a brand clothes with reasonable price. Other places can not compare to this one.
Big retail store for buying clothes. Huge selection but a little messy. There is food in the basement and top floors.
Very nice place... I like it
아이들과 즐겁게 놀수 있음, 하지만 주차장 없음^^:
저렴하고 독특한 옷들이 많아요 합리적인 가격도 마음에 듭니다
항상 샤랄라하고 친절한 직원언니들♡
귀여운거먀니파
깔끔한 컨셉

Coex is pretty good. The layout is terrible! But the movie theater is nice. We always go there for IMAX. There is a ridiculous number of restaurants to choose from, featuring a wide variety of cuisines. There are also some good shops. I love Christmas shopping at Aland in particular. The convention center is also very nice. I have only gone to Comic Con there, but I thought it clean, well-organized, and spacious. However, a warning: it is uncomfortably crowded on weekends, so try planning a weekday trip.
Huge mall with cine, aquarium and so many restaurant choices. There's a beautiful open library in the middle. You take impressive pictures there. Hub of public transportation.

Great mall with variety of shops and eateries. This is a great place to just hangout and grab some good food. The mall is very clean and the restrooms are well kept. I would love to visit again before leaving Korea to do some shopping.
Great underground mall. Specially library square is awesome. It is alive with food and culture. Recommend
So many stores and so much to do. Plenty of places to grab a drink or food. The aquarium was such a great day out

Been there studying for 2 years. really strategic place. lots of restaurant and shops around, lots of cafe and various entertainments. best art school ever in korea.. one of my best experience, visiting hongdae and strolling around there

This was an extremely enjoyable experience in dawn,  right before sunset.  Aside from the plethora of shops along busy streets,  what really got my attention was the numerous student performances along the street!  There was a boys group singing ,  schoolgirl dancers and even normal students action out a zombie-thriller  play.  All of this was on a Saturday¡ It's so great to see the artistic side of students.
great public area
Friendly customer service 👍🏻
The area is surrounded by tons of small cafes, bars, clubs, and local designer shops. Recommended for day and night walk.
5 hours climbs and down. It’s a worthy experience though the climb was tough. The view is breathtaking and it’s windy. Hikers often have snacks when taking a break up there! MUST GO
Great place for easy hiking. Multiple peaks, amazing view over Seoul. Really green nature. Doseonsa is close by.

Quite a challenging hike to reach the peak, especially for beginner. Nice view along the way and also at the peak of the mountain. Make sure you prepare water and food as likely will spent 5-6hrs at least for the whole journey to reach the peak. Also, make sure you go there earlier so that you can return to ground before the day turn dark.

We went on winter, so the landmark wasnt as good. Still, great experience. We went right to the top and went down the other side and took us around 5 hours, cause we went without the appropiate outfit.

column1: When going up was easy, but going down we needed to be a little more careful because of the snow. But they have ropes, so you can go down grabing those

column7: Amazing hike! Had a great time at the very top! Beautiful view! A must for any one in Seoul!
등산길이 정리 잘됨
등산로 및 서울 둘레길 일부구간
노잼 쭤금 만이 보통 아주아주아주아주아주아주아주아주아주아주좋음
가깝고걷기좋아요
Such a wonderful mountain hiking in Metropolitan area

column1: Hiking on rainy day or day after rain is awesome. Gwanak mountain is rock mountain. It is wet in rainy day, but not muddy.
The Gwachon side stream is full of water.

column7: Great short hiking trail during Autumn..Probably take about 3 hrs up n down. A very popular place for local to hike..A bit challenging while about to reach the peak but not major problem..Just a bit of climbing needed..Rope n foot rest located at strategic places to help u climb..Enjoy my hike.. Peaceful Day with Nature @ Seoul..
This course should be alright for all level climber~~ the view on the submit is gorgeous ~~
Nice place that you can a good view of the city

Had a great hike here in Autumn.  Was told that the trail can be wet in October, but when we went it was great.  The trail is accessible by train stop at gwacheon and offers a stop at a Buddhist mountain temple and a 360 panoramic view of Seoul.  The fall colors were also gorgeous.

column1: Can be tough to find a clear day. The trail was also very well maintained.  I would rate the hike up as moderate, primarily because the hike has a consistent moderate grade. Roughly 500m over the course of 2.5km.

column7: 서울 강남 예술의전당과 시내가 한 눈에 보이는 곳. 야간산행도 아주 안전하므로 추천합니다.
서초구 주민들이 즐겨찾는 산

column1: 때론 예술의 전당이 내려다 보이는 소망탑으로

column7: Beautiful scenic views, very easy. Can be done in ~2hrs if u dont stop much

Achasan is a mountain which can be hiked by people who are starting out. It's of moderate difficulty. From the top whole city view can be seen. For increasing the difficulty and distance it's a good idea to start from achasan and get down towards yongmasan. It will take around 2 and a half hours to 3 hours for this course.
Not too strenuous, great views on a clear day!
I stayed near this mountain and I went there many times. There are easy trails and much harder trails, without much security but more natural.
서울에서 가장 해가 빨리 뜨는 곳입니다.

column1: 가볍게 산보 삼아서 올라갔다 올 수 있는 곳이고
트레일러닝같은 스포츠를 즐긴다면 연습할 수 있는 곳이기도 합니다.
완만하고 어느정도 업힐과 다운힐이 있는 곳..
그리고 아름다운 경치는 보너스 야간 산행도 좋습니다

column7: 수락산과 맞붙어 있어 연계산행이 가능하며 뒷쪽 별내면에 퇴뫼산 또한 산책하기에 좋은 산
낮이나 밤이나 자연의 아름다움이 살아 숨쉬는 곳
서울에서 쉽게 접근할 수 있는 산중하나로 예전과 다르게 정상부까지 계단이 설치되어 있어 정상에 쉽게 오를 수 있다
언제나 아름다움을 선사하는 산
Bonne chaussures recommandées
Crazy mix of buildings and fun vibe.  Like a small scale Vegas.
Only place in USA style arround seoul. People can speek English. Some western foods can be found. Great for night life.
Fresh salmon and other seafood as side-dish.
Good to dinner with friends, nice food.
It's starting to become more westernized. Stay away if you want to experience the real Korea.
서울식당 싸고 맛있어요. ㅎㅎ
볼거리가없음
도봉산 매표소 지나서 도봉서원
Very descriptive, great price. Be warned it comes every 30 mins. So if you missed the bus on one of the stops thee should be another arriving
Great tours with Wi-Fi
it was so good~!! I visited Seoul last year.

column1: Within one day, I was able to see all the famous attractions.
The bus was so comfortable, clean, and the driver was so nice.
Most of all, it was really cheap!!!

column7: 필리핀에서 오신 엄마와 함께 한 서울시티투어~ 20여년만에 변한 서울을 둘러보신 엄마와의 시간 즐거웠어요^^ 좀 비싼 느낌이었던건 안 비밀~ㅋ
Soul city tour หลากหลายสถานที่ท่องเที่ยว ที่เป็นจุดสนใจในโซล ที่คุณอยากไป ภายใน 1 วัน ก็เที่ยวทั่วโซลแล้ว

column1: ค่าบริการ 10,000 won
สถานที่ท่องเที่ยว 27 จุดในseoul
ซื้อตั๋วได้ที่ gwanghwamun station exit 5

column7: I had a great time in this awesome building. I loved going through all the different levels and finding artworks in semi-hidden rooms. Definitely a place to check out ♥️
Unexpectedly interesting, found it by chance, recommended 100%. Also try Fritz Coffee one of my all time best coffee in Seoul.
If you are an art lover, give it a try. I bet you will return.
Fantastic gallery in a beautifully architected building. Great but expensive gift shop.
Very unique building and structures, quality exhibitions as well. Interesting curation but if you have physical difficulties to walk around or little kids with you might be difficult to enjoy
Houses everything you need to know about the wall throughout its history. The #museum is located on #naksanpark hill and overlooks Heunginjimun. #visitseoul #GSM
Free on the weekends, English available for everything, great way to experience the history of the city.
This is the place to study the walls protecting Hanyang now known as Seoul.

column1: Many parts of the wall are still intact while restoration for those parts destroyed by war and neglect by Japan occupation are ongoing.
At level 3, there is a door which allows you to go to the wall.

column7: You can  understand the history of  seoul here..
This gave us an insight into the conflicts that lead to tbe building if the wall, its ruin and its continuing repair.
가격은 조금 비싼편이나 유기농 채소 와 가공식품 매장임.
상품이 좋고 직원들이 친절하며 특히정육코너쪽이친절하며 고기도 품질도 좋고맛도 좋다
비교적 다양한 유기농식품을 구입할수 있는곳이다.소스나 케챱등등은 외국유기농제품으로 판다.  다좋은데 가격이 항상 문제. 몇개만 사도 금액이 후덜덜...
유기농 농 식품을 취급하는 곳.
더운여름 눈꽃빙수가 맛있는집
Special theater in Seoul. You could enjoy music, opera , coffee... ect
Good
Good
편안한 의자와 볼거리(오디오 전시)도 있는 소극장. 발렛 주차 가능. 1층에 레스토랑에도 괜찮은 음식
편안한 좌석. 실내악에 최적화된 공간설계.
Bigest book store in gangdong gu
more than expected
One of the biggest book store chain in South Korea
은근 찾기 어려운 자잘한 제품도 갖추고 있어서 좋아요. 오늘 저는 각종 충전 케이블을 고정하는 케이블 홀더와, 이어폰 끝에 끼우는 고무 팁을 샀습니다. 제품에 대해 물어보면 친절히 응답해주는 직원들도 좋았습니다.
다양한 문구용품을 구매할 수 있음.

It is quite nice free museum in the Olympic Park. If you take a walk in the park, pls visit this museum. From last this month(June 2018), till Aug 19, there is special exhibition on tea cups from Song Dynasty of China. Those were found in the ocean in Korea, from the wrecked ships. I recommend this special exhibition, which is also free.

It's free. If you are around Olympic park, it's worth a walk thru, but nothing to write home about. The restaurant on top floor is fairly pricey. Walk across the street to Vicentes for decent Italian food
Immersion on a very first Korea kingdom. Amazing place, no doubts after exit you will be have a new vision about Korean peoples.
Well managed museum since opening only 6 years!
There are so many peopel.
핸드폰케이스 구매하러갔는데 만족은하지만 가격대가 좀높음..

column1: 핸드폰 악세사리 구매하기 가격빼곤 너무나 좋아요

column7: 미술 화방도구를 구매하러 들렀는데... 종류도 다양하고 온라인 가격대비 택배비를 감안하면 크게 차이나지 않고, 준/전문가용 용품을 직접 비교하며 구매할 수 있음. 외에도 다양한 카테고리 상품이 준비되어 있음.
나의 최애 장소
다양한 기프트 상품들
본점의 핫트랙스. 다른 지점의 핫트랙스보다 규모도 큽니다.
Good

근현대디자인박물관은 우리나라 최초의 본격 디자인박물관으로서 국내 최초의 디자인 사료들이 대거 소장되어 있습니다. 박암종관장이 20여년 동안 심혈을 기울여 모은 수 만점의 한국 디자인 관련 사료 중에서도 특별히 엄선하여 저 하늘에 빛나는 7개의 별-북두칠성 이라는 컨셉으로 전시를 기획하였습니다. 개화기 이후 2000년대 초까지를 7개의섹션으로 구분하여 1,600여점의 사료를 상설 전시하고 있습니다. 국기, 태극기, 신문, 잡지, 그림 엽서, 인형, 화장품, 라디오, 전화기, 텔레비전, 냉장고, 휴대폰, 컴퓨터 등 국내에서 최초로 디자인되고 생산된 진귀한 자료들을 한 곳에서 만날 수 있습니다. 부대시설로는 카페 엘리시온과 갤러리 모디움 그리고 와우디자이너스클럽 등이 갖춰져 있습니다.
간판이 그냥 디자인박물관이라고 써있었던거 같아요 주변사람들도 근현대디자인박물관 물으니 모르더라고요 작은 갤러리느낌이 나더라고요 1층은 카페고 카페통해서 올라가서 2~3층이 전시실, 입장료는 5000원인데 사실 좀 아깝더라고요 지하는 돈을 또 따로 내야함

column7: Very moving experience highlighting that you can really make a difference when you speak up about your experiences. These women’s experience would never have been acknowledged only that they stood up and said spoke about it. I would hugely recommend a visit.

column7: A must go.

I would not recommend bringing children because of the difficult topic mentioned in the museum.

column2: The War and Women's Human Rights Museum
column7: An important, tastefully done museum about the suffering of so-called Comfort Women in WWII. Informative but also emotive, not easy subject matter. The English audio guide was very good, visit took about 40 minutes.

column2: The War and Women's Human Rights Museum
column7: Brilliant museum showing the story of the 'comfort women'. Really good English audio description. Very well curated. Friendly and helpful staff. Small tactful shop. Excellent all round.

column2: The War and Women's Human Rights Museum
column7: An incredibly evocative museum discussing the heart-wrenching past and present of 'comfort women' and violence against women during war. I was brought to tears, but left with deep admiration for the strong women who came forward to bring this terrorism to light.

column1: I am a museum fanatic, and during my five visits to Korea visited dozens of museums. This is at the top of that list.

column7: Accessible via  Seoul metro rail line no.2, 4 and 5 right under the Dongdaemun Design Plaza which is ultra modern building with regular K-Pop shows and different exhibitions. Cultural tour course and Seoul Highlight tour course can be purchase outside of the plaza and of course you can start and end your from this point too.
This place is best to have a nice walk. Variety of markets, parks and constructions can give you unforgettable memories.

column1: P.S Also there are a lot of places for russian speaking tourists to visit. ;)

column7: This place has exceptional magnificent structures and most foreigners in Korea like to come to this place. It is also know for hosting various events from time to time.
Wonderful aesthetic surrounded by great shopping
Really appreciate
Pretty fun place.  Found the maze to be a bit more fun (although brief) than the museum exhibits.

The maze was fun, but really short. Some of the obstacles were more annoying than challenging, but overall it was fun for what it was. It probably only takes 25 minutes to finish it all, and it's 12.000￦ unless you get some online discount to make it 9.000￦

column1: I think it's a fun date experience, but I wouldn't do it again.

Great facility for kids. Kids love it. Just 4000won. Crazy offer for this much fun.
Our little guy loved this place. Lots of different levels with interactive exhibits. The water play area was a highlight for him.

Very good place to spend time with kids. They have a very wide variety of scientific tools and demos which are very informative, and to be honest to lot if adults too. Although almost all of the exhibits are in Korean, it is possible to get English translations in few places as well, so international tourists don't need to lose heart.

column1: It is four floors of exhibits, including a water play area that's the favourite of several kids. Space, television, visual effects are few of the interesting exhibits.
Overall a great experience for kids and adults equally.

column7: Inexpensive, large museum full of hands-on activities for kids. When we went the provided a 1/2 off coupon for Lotte adventure and COEX aquarium.

Great place to bring your kids. The zoo is free and great big park for them to play at. The Childrens Museum is full of fun and activities to your kids busy for hours. Well worth the price of admission.

서울 한복판의 한강 조망 좋은 나즈막한 산 겸 공원, 강변북로를 횡단하다보면 계속 주택, 아파트, 또는 빌딩이 나오다가 딱 한번 산이 나타나는데 그것이 바로 응봉산이다. 응봉산이 가진 지리적인 조건 때문에 주변 아파트 주민들로부터 큰 사랑을 받고있다. 꼭대기에는 생각보다 많이 넓은 공원과 팔각정이 있다. 꼭대기에서는 한강의 상류와 하류가 모두 보이고 남북을 잇늰 다리들도 잘 보인다. 물론 삼표시멘트 공장도 잘보인다. 봄에는 개나리축제로 유명하다. 개나리축제 할때는 개나리가 응봉산 전체를 덮는데 진짜 멋지다. 내려가는 길에 중간쯤에 체육공원이 또 있다
어제 처음으로 응봉역을 지나 개나리축제에 가 보았는데 등산효과도 있고 한강조망권이 아주좋아 개나리꽃들과 함께 좋은구경도 하고 운동도 잘하고 왔습니다.
한강 일대가 보이는 야경이 좋지만 팔각정 운영시간이 09~18시라는 건 아이러니함. 화장실 배수시설도 문제가 있는지 세면대에서 물이 나오지 않음. 풍광은 좋지만 조금만 더 관리가 필요할 듯.
韓劇拍攝夜景的熱門場景之一，但蚊子很多。
4월초에는 개나리 축제가 열려요^^
A unexpwcted find, but modern inside with a great abstract installation when I was there. Fantastoc place to escaoe the summer heat.

The Seoul Museum of Art (free entry) is modern art museum located behind the Deoksugung Palace grounds. Here you can explore several floors which six exhibition halls which feature the works of Korean and international artists works at various times throughout the year.

column1: There is one permanent exhibition "Chun Kyung Ja - Eternal Narcissist, where you can see a handful of works painted by this important Korean artist. During our last visit we found some of the works included in the third floor temporary exhibition - DigiFun Art: Urban Space (22 Sept- 13 Dec 13 2015) quite interesting to see. We also enjoyed the sculpture garden in front of the museum. These are quite photogenic, particularly during autumn foliage time of year.

In the end, the Seoul Museum of Art might be a hit or miss for art fans. There are few exhibition halls and depending on the current exhibitions, there might or might not be much that meets your tastes for art. As such it is best to visit the museum website beforehand prior to deciding to include a visit here or not during your trip to Seoul.

column7: This museum is not as bad as my rating suggest. I'm merely giving it that rating in comparison with the other great museums that Seoul has to offer. This is, however, a great little outpost for Seoullites who live further away from the hustle of the city centre.

column1: A big plus is that is it well maintained and is part of the SEMA, (Seoul Museum of Art), an organisation what is made of of 8 separate museums.

column7: Although it's got some distance from central Seoul, its proximity to two subway stations (Hagye, Junggye) renders it quite accessible. Entrance is free, and the exhibitions highlight the works of contemporary Korean artists providing valuable, personal and at times poignant insights into the various social and historical aspects of modern Korea.
Neighborhood friendly museum. They serve decent museum education programs

column2: National Museum of Korean Contemporary History
column7: You can earn some knowledge about modern Korean hoistory. Its a free entry and well organized place. They provide a device which translates in English.

column2: National Museum of Korean Contemporary History
column7: Great overview of Korean history from mid 19th century onwards. However,  some of the displays had English translations below the Korean, while others did not, so I had to kind of guess from the context what some of the displays were talking about.

column2: National Museum of Korean Contemporary History
column7: This is one of many free entry museums in South Korea. It is very well curated and will provide someone with little or no knowledge about modern Korea with a good understanding of the country's modern origins.

column1: The displays are well described and when I first visited three years ago, it provided tablets with English commentary free of charge.
As a student of history, I look for bias in historical narratives but found little evidence of any here.

Last month, there was a special exhibition about an uprising on Jeju Island in 1948-1949. That was a bloody period on an island known for its beauty. I thought it was very well done and did some reading up on the subject when I got home.

column2: National Museum of Korean Contemporary History
column7: This very good museum in South Korea. Entery is free.You can get very knowledge from here in different languages.

column2: National Museum of Korean Contemporary History
column7: Interesting museum about the history of Korea. Entrance is free and you can read details on the exhibitions in multiple languages, from French to Spanish.

column7: 상암동 평화의 공원내에 자리잡고 있습니다. 평화의 공원과 서울에너지드림터는 평일은 관람객이 많지 않아 한적한 분위기에서 휴식과 관람을 즐길 수 있습니다. 진입로는 호박 덩굴이 주렁주렁 매달려있어 운치가 있습니다.
최첨단의 시설과 깨끗함.

Beautiful commuter station. Dedicated to the new high-speed rail system, SRT, however, is actually more of a central hub for transportation. You'll find a gauntlet of buses, taxis, and a few hundred yards (or shall I say meters) away via direct tunnel is a connection to Seoul's expansive light-rail system. The facilities are very clean and well managed. Customer service so far has been good. The select food options are good, but a tad heavy on the franchise network.

column1: Overall, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better transportation station any where in the world that serves this amount of people in such a relatively small space. If there's one thing I would give an A+ grade to the country of South Korea, it would be their efforts to move people efficiently, at a fair price, and with nearby services.

column7: Can be crowded but pretty nice. Lot of stairs. Not lot of shops. But still a nice station.
호호카츠, 소담반상.  Too busy restaurant.  So so food as expected at busy station restaurant.
In planing Go to Korea 😘💋

대한민국 비즈니스, 대중문화, IT, 레저, 쇼핑,의료의 중심인 강남지역과 전국 주요 도시를 잇는 서울의 새로운 관문으로서 중요한 역할을 합니다. 지하철 3호선과 분당선이 직접 연결되고, 지하철 2·5·8호선과 신분당선은 물론 동부간선도로에 인접해 주요 고속화도로와도 이어진 교통요충지로서 접근성이 우수합니다. 수서역세권을 중심으로 업무·R&D·생산·물류 기능이 융합된 ‘미래형 복합도시’로 개발되어 산업 활력과 환경 가치가 공존하는 서울의

column1: 서울 강남구 수서동에 위치하고 지상3층, 지하2층입니다. SRT 시종착역
강남권에 있는 사람들은 서울역보다 가까우며 저렴한 장점이 있습니다.
수서역 종합안내센터’는 SRT 이용 고객에게 여행 정보, 병원 이용 방법 등을 빠르고 친절한 안내를 담당하게 된다.

column7: It is nice place taking experinces of complex culture between human and city such as exhibition or shows. There is cafe and convention hall. But you need to notice that is not easy fine any convenient facilities around there.

column7: 꽤 높은곳에 있다. 가면서 올라가는 길에 개 키우는 집이 있으니 주의. 1950년에 세워진 원래 전적비는 나무계단을 내려가서 오른쪽에 있다. 구석에 화환쓰레기랑 꺄진 유리병 땨뮨에 눈살이 찌푸려진다.

친절도가 최악이에요. 웨딩 박람회에서 보고 갔는데 주기로 한 사은품도 슬쩍 종류가 바꿔치기 돼 있고, 상담하는 사람은 중고차 매장도 아닌데 엄청 강압적이고, 문제를 제기하니까 뒤에 같이 오신 부모님까지 비꼬면서 아주 더럽게 말을 하네요. 진짜 좋은 날 망치고 싶지 않으면 가지 마세요. 최악입니다.

넓고 고급스럽고 친절함
디자인만 잘 찾는다면 괜찮은 모델이 많네요.
우리의 전통을 고수하여 나아가시는 조수정님의 애정과열정,뚝심에 찬사를 보냅니다!
처음 접해보는 한지그림갤러리 더구나 우리나라 한지협회 회장님이신 조수정회장님 갤러리로 한지 그림등 커피 한잔에 정성과 멋이 있고 회장님의 한지 그림과 같은 온화한 미소와 저를 향한 배웅의 인사에는 우리나라 전통을 연구하시는분다운 기풍은 갖은자 만의 거만함은 전혀 찾아 볼수없는 그래서 더 존경해야하는 그런 느낌을 받았습니다.
갤러리만 있는게 아니라 좋은 차를 즐길 수 있다. 특히 하늘공원에는 야외에 옛정취를 느끼게 해주는 뽕나무, 사과, 살구 등 다양한 과실수를 심어 정취를 더해준다.
손기정 선수의 위대함을 일깨우고 프로그램이다양해서 볼거리가많다 강추강추 모든게무료인 기념관
가격도 싸고 이용할 것도 많아요
Location is quite good, but room is too small. Fair price and clean room.
Modern ! Clean

column1: But one thing to criticise is the window blind, when u want to hv more sleep .

column7: Expensive for the quality I had. Room very clean and comfy but noisy. Breakfast was not really interesting with a few choices of imposed menus

The location was very convenient. Plenty of public transportation is available nearby. Our room was an end room with 3 beds so we faced the street with the river. Very beautiful view! The bedroom seems to be made for 2 so there wasn't a lot of room to walk around but it was fine. There is plenty of room underneath the beds to stow away luggage and such. Plentiful amenities and an English-friendly guide is included in the room. I would like to stay here again if I was in the area!

A newer addition to the hotel scene in Tenjin. I wasn't a guest but I did attend an event and meet some friends here. A modern, kind of hip(ish) hotel, it's stylishly decorated and well appointed. The staff seemed friendly and attentive, too. Prices, from what my friends told me, are mid-high range. This place fills up quick so if considering, book early.
Place for learning about objects. Must visit.

Cool markets to explore to look at old products of yesteryear. A lot of fake antiques if you can't afford the real thing. Cool to see things like old mailboxes of Korea and equipment that are no longer used. I didn't buy anything and nothing has a price so I assume you will expect to negotiate the price.
If you are into knick-knack & all quaint/old things, you must visit Seoul Folk Flea Market.
I went to buy some hiking clothes and wasn't disappointed. The flea market mainly sells outdoor clothes and junk though, so unfortunately it's nothing like an American flea market.
Various things to buy in this market.
I saw the musical Rock of ages in the Woori Art Hall in Korean.

column1: The performance was good although completely in Korean (even the classical rock songs were translated). The building is modern and fresh and the staff is very helpful and friendly.
Had a bit hard time finding there because the hall itself isn't clearly pointed out in English on any map.
They have a cafe but no bar.

column7: 올림픽 공원에 위치한 공연장. 예전 역도 경기장을 재활용한 듯. 그래서인지 좌석 배치가 일반 공연장과 약간 다른 듯 함. 주차하기 편하고 공연장 시설도 만족스러우나 입점한 카페가 좀 비싸고 불친절함. 공원 내에 식당이 없으니 바깥에서 먹고 들어와야하는게 불편함.
공연 봤는데 무대도 넓고 좌석도 많으며, 공연장 좌우 커피숍과 화장실 등 편의시설이 잘 되어 있어요.
공연관람하고공원산책하기에좋음...3시간이하는주차비후불제가유리.3시간이상[공연+여유있게산책]계획이면선불로5천원결제하면주차요금걱정해방됨
자동차를 이용하여 방문할 때에는 남2문을 통해서 들어가면 좀 더 편리합니다.
A decent looking theater. There are bathrooms and a coffee shop on the first floor open during the day. A little park outside has benches, a nice sculpture, and a free bike rental facility.

Interesting historical place to be visited in Seoul. Located in the heart of Seoul, you will find a little serenity in crowd. You can look back and learn from the shades of Korean past life. column1: But there is no prayer room provided here. So it's less visitor friendly, especially for Muslims.

column7: This is truly a beautiful sight to see in Korea. Unlike the other famous palaces, this one is located in the heart of Seoul just down the street from city hall. From within the palace grounds you can look around and see the modern buildings of Seoul surround an ancient historical landmark. Warning a hanbok provides free entrance to the palace and touring it can feel as if you're actually a part of the Joseon Dynasty. If you're ever visiting South Korea, this is definitely a location to check out!

Tagpol Park is a city park in Jongno area not far from the Jongmyo Shrine. Also referred to as Pagoda Park, this is an important historical location in Seoul with several interesting things to see. The park is open from 6am to 8pm daily.

column1: Here you can see the 15th century, Wongaksa Pagoda. This is a 10-storey marble structure and an important national treasure which is encased in a glass building and supported by scaffolding. It is similar to the Gyeongcheonsa Pagoda you can see at the National Museum of Korea.

You will also find pavilion covering the historic Monument of Wongaksa, a tortoise with a pillar on its shell created in 1471. There are a number of bas relief murals lining the inner wall of the park. These are images of Korean patriots and the proclamation of Independence, which was recited here at Tagpol Park during the important March 1st Movement in 1919.

Other figures, sculptures and open park space can be found here at Tagpol Park, making this a nice add-on place to visit if you are planning spend time at the nearby UNESCO World Heritage site - Jongmyo Shrine. You can comfortably see the historical attractions here in 15-20 minutes and be on your way.

column7: Maybe a bit too touristic, with many chinise groups around for shopping, but the food is still great. I recommend the noodle alley.

종로구 신문로에 있으며 흥화문, 숭정전 등 문화재와 시립미술관, 서울 정도 600년 기념관 등이 있어 공원과 더불어 문화공간으로도 활용되고 있다. 경희궁은 원래 조선 시대 광해군 8년(1616)에 '경덕궁'이라는 이름으로 건립되었다가 영조 36년(1760)에 경희궁으로 개명되었다. 처음에는 회상전, 융복전, 집경당, 흥정당, 숭정전, 흥화문, 황학정 등의 건물이 있었으나 융복전과 집경 당은 없어지고 나머지 건물들은 1910년 경성중학교(지금의 서울고등학교)가 설립된 후 여기저기로 옮겨졌다.

A huge-ish historical complex that is rebuilt after the Japanese burned it down. Very similar to other historical Buddhist Asian temples. Highly encourage you to visit this place if you have not experienced Asian temples before. The entire area is calming and serene.

column1: Am particularly amazed by a section in the temple where they stacked rocks on top of each other to resemble pagodas. It's like a mini city itself.

You can take Bus 12 from the main road below the temple to go to Seokguram Grotto. Bus 12 departs every hourly when we were there. There are also numerous eateries at the main road leading up to the temple. You can get here via Bus 10, 11 and 700.

A must visit in Gyeongju due to its UNESCO status. For the religious, you can also pray to the deities here. If you're interested, you can also sign up to spend the night in the temple for a small fee. There's a counter in front of the temple for you to ask or you can Google for more info regarding the temple stay.

column7: Nice temple, you can reach it easily from Gyeongju taking bus number 10, 11 or 700. Not crowded around 12-14h.
A really nice place to visit. Having been restored some years back it's in very good condition. It's seems big but doesn't take long to be fully visited.

No trip to Korea would be complete without a stop at Bulguksa Temple.  It is one of the best preserved temples in Korea. Anytime of the year is a great time to visit. I prefer spring and autumn for the colors. The spring is filled with cherry blossoms and bright spring colors as well. In the autumn you have the orange and red leaves. Just be prepared for the traffic it is a very popular destination. Getting to the temple is simple there is public transportation and private tours.

오늘날 사회로부터 욕먹는기독교인들이 이곳에서 정화되었으면 합니다.

한국 현대사를 알고 싶다면 이곳에 꼭 들러봐야할 장소입니다.

column7: 선교사님들의 헌신과 사랑 그리고 하나님의 일하심.  말씀의 소중함을 깊이 묵상하게되는 너무 좋은 시간이었습니다. 영상과 현장 가이드 분의 설명과 전시장에서 친절하게 잘 설명해주셔서 더 깊은 묵상에 도움이 많이 된것 같습니다. 감사합니다
가슴이 뭉클 했답니다. 고맙습니다선교사님.사랑합니다 하나님
잠깐의 휴식을 취할수 있는 장소 , 언제나 공개 개방 되어 있어 , 마음 편히 들릴 수가 있다 .

column1: 당시 일본군의 눈을 피해 만들었는지, 주변 환경에 꼭꼭 숨어 있어서 골목길을 잘 찾아 가야 한다.

column7: 고즈넉하고 조용한 곳. 힐링받는 기분. 오는 골목길은 좁고 험한게 문제
만해가 만년에 거처하다가 임종한 심우장... ^^

column1: 尋牛莊을 풀이하자면 ‘소 찾는 집’인데, 불교에서는 대개 소가 마음을 상징하는 뜻으로 쓰인다.
집은 응달진 언덕에 북향하고 있는데, 만해가 남쪽에 있는 조선총독부가 꼴 보기 싫다 하여 일부러 북향으로 지었다는 말이 전한다.
님은 갔습니다. 아아 사랑하는 나의 님은 갔습니다.
푸른 산빛을 깨치고 단풍나무 숲을 향하야 난 적은 길을 걸어서 참어 떨치고 갔습니다.
황금의 꽃같이 굳고 빛나든 옛 맹서는 차디찬 띠끌이 되야서, 한숨의 미풍에 날어갔습니다.
날카로운 첫 '키쓰'의 추억은 나의, 운명의 지침(指針)을 돌려 놓고, 뒷걸음쳐서, 사러졌습니다.
나는 향기로운 님의 말소리에 귀먹고, 꽃다운 님의 얼골에 눈멀었습니다.
사랑도 사람의 일이라, 만날 때에 미리 떠날 것을 염려하고 경계하지 아니한 것은 아니지만, 이별은 뜻밖의 일이 되고 놀란 가슴은 새로운 슬픔에 터집니다.
그러나 이별을 쓸데없는 눈물의 원천을 만들고 마는 것은 스스로 사랑을 깨치는 것인 줄 아는 까닭에, 걷잡을 수 없는 슬픔의 힘을 옮겨서 새 희망의 정수박이에 들어부었습니다.
우리는 만날 때에 떠날 것을 염려하는 것과 같이, 떠날 때에 다시 만날 것을 믿습니다.
아아 님은 갔지마는 나는 님을 보내지 아니하얏습니다.
제 곡조를 못 이기는 사랑의 노래는 님의 침묵을 휩싸고 돕니다.

Some of the best performance to be seen in Seoul.
Good place
다양한 연극과 무용공연이 펼쳐지는 유서있는 극장.

column1: 라이브로 생생히 살아있는 공연보면서 피서를 즐기는 것도 좋습니다. 대학로 마로니에 공원과 접해있어서 뜻있는 공원과 버스킹하는 모습이 어우러진 곳입니다.

column7: 한국 공연예술극장의 상징과도 같은 곳이자 대학로의 랜드마크. 내부 및 외부 시설은 매우 청결하며, 외관의 고풍스러움, 상영되는 국내/국제 작품들의 수준 역시 매우 높은 등 특별히 나무랄 곳이 없는 곳. 강남에 예술의 전당이 있다면 강북에는 아르코극장이 있다 할 만하다.

It used to be my favorite place in Seoul but the feeling has changed in time. Nevertheless the place is still a good place to go with friends (though usually you can find a lot of couples there). It's good for picnic. I noticed that many people build a tent there. I think there are tent rentals around the area. It was very windy when we went last Sunday so make sure you protect yourself from the dust. There are also bike rentals and from late afternoon to night time, there are street performers that will make your stay lovely.

Great outdoor place. Always has people but it's very spacious so more than enough room. Nice place to go with friends, always performances around. Rented bikes with my friends and rode along the river.

We had a great time having chimaek (chicken and maekju/beer) with friends by the Han River. Summer is the best time for "camping" and laying mats on the grass and relaxing with friends. There are many restaurants nearby and you can just order food and they'll deliver it to you in the park. You can rent bikes (solo or use a couple bike for two) and ride around the park. It's also a great place for running. Expect more people during Fridays and weekends.

It is a great park. We went for international fire cracker festival in October. It was exceptionally crowded. People start pouring in the park from 10 am in the morning for  show starting 7 pm. It's like a big Mela. It's lot if fun as there were some groups performing also before the fire show.

Large, expansive park. Many locals come here to pitch a tent and picnic for the day and evening. Always has a LOT of people, but there’s a lot of space. You can walk along the Hangang river and watch cruise ships go by as well as live performances.

강동구에서 운영하는 공연 및 전시시설로 사전예약제로 무료로 이용할 수 있다. 밴드 등이 콘서트를 열고 무료로 입장해서 공연을 즐길 수 있다. 드럼 등 모든 기본 시설을 갖추고 있어 악기 등 몇가지만 갖고오면 된다. 한강을 조망할 수 있는 좋은 위치로 투명한 유리로 둘러쌓여있다. 다만 위치를 잘 몰라 헤매는 경우가 빈번하다. 일단 광진교 중간 정도에 오면 조그만 푯말과 내려가는 계단이 보인다. 계단밑에 다리 상판에 붙어있는 멋진 공간을 볼 수 있다.
분위기가 좋고 피아노 상태도 아주 좋아. 직원분도 친절해서 기분좋게 이용했어.
광진교 다리밑 교각에 설치되어 있는 문화시설입니다.
한 번 가면 반할껄~~~~ㅎㅎ
공연이나 전시회가 자주 열리니 홈페이지 참고하여 관람하면 좋습니다.

One of the interesting monuments you will see at Gwanghwamun Square is the gilded bronze of King Sejong, erected at this location in 2009. This monument is of a seated beloved King Sejong, his right hand raised while he hold a manuscript in his left hand. Sejong seems to be smiling down on his people.

column1: Behind the Statue of King Sejong, you can find four pillars with gold reliefs portraying scenes from the King's life. In front of the statue, you will find a sundial, rain gauge and celestrial globe. These make for a nice arrangement and good photographs.

At the back of the statue, you will find entrance into an underground museum area where you will find 'The Story of King Sejong' attraction, which shares space with the equally interesting 'The Story of 'The Story of Admiral Yi Sun-Shin'. This is a good opportunity to learn more about King Sejong if you are interested in this important figure in Korean history.

column7: There are many countries that have their own language in the world, but not many countries have unique characters.

column1: The Republic of Korea is a country have unique characters name of Hangul.
The person who made the unique character of Hangul was King Sejong of Joseon Dynasty.
King Sejong did many good politics for the people as well as the Hangul.
If you go down the stairs to the bottom of King Sejong, located in Gwanghwamun Square, you can find a museum of King Sejong and General Lee Sun-sin.

column7: the history is so deep in regards to this king as he is praised and credited into creating korean along with many other amazing feats. there is a museum right under the statue in regards to his acomplishments so its nice to check that place and learn as the entrance fee was free when I went there. Amazing thing about korea is that all the museum run by government is free for entrance. very fascinating and encouraging to interact with the past.
The most interesting part is the museum underneath. You can access it from the backside of the statue. It's free and very interesting.

This was a great surprise! There's a museum underneath the statue! We ended up spending about 2 hours here. Audio guides are free, which is awesome. The souvenirs were more kid friendly but I got a nice decorated, oversized hairpin and high quality paper and bamboo fan for 20,000w, which is pretty cheap for souvenirs in Seoul.
Calm but high sound music in the big buffet hall at 16:00. Cafe opens all the day until mid night. Some yaghts are anchored outside in a small habor where very close to the national assembly house.

i was there for a walk one year ago ! i didn't get any service from the Marina Club but the area around it is amazing! You can walk for a run, bicycle, admire boats and nature or just relax for a couple of hours ! 2 minutes walk from mrt station !!! that day i spotted a lamborghini ! ;)
GREAT experience on hired yacht with skipper taking us out onto Han river and allowing us to pilot the yacht on the way back
Classy and beautiful. Food is so good
Great views! Especially at night. You can see a canal at back & parliament house at front. But I expected more about the food
Small stadium with European standards, but still enjoyable if you choose the right match to watch. In terms of possibilities, there are many things to get from ttopokki to more conventional snacks.
Awesome stadium for friendly and international matches
Nice ice skating rink, but go early, it gets busy
Very nice ice skating rink.
여러 목적으로 쓰일 수 있는 좋은 곳 다만 화장실 시설이 아쉬움
Great place to visit and walk around but the food there are overpriced. You can get coffee, pastries and bread there. There are two cafes: Tous les jours and Twosome coffee. No Wi-Fi.

column1: Tried breakfast morning set at Twosome, the americano was nice but the Sandwiches were so so.

column7: Great place. One of the best bakery shop i ever tried. They also make high quality cake and offer coffee, tea and juice
It's really  cool place with few diversity in food.
Good for shopping groceries. There’s a cooking studio which is great for lessons!
Fancy food court

Another great place to relax and shop at. You must give yourself at least 2 hours or more to really enjoy the place.  Remember there are stalls outside selling goods too. There is always a bargain but just remember the weight and price of you are travelling home . There is so much to see and the restaurants are great. Remember this is my review and I like all foods so please don't say there were no choices or bad places. The price varies from place to place to what you would like to eat.  It's all good but it's your choice.  The shop staff are helpful and polite.  Always there to help. The make up counters are best in the world according to others.  As I said it's your choice so make your own mind up the make up. Clothes can be expensive or not it's up to you want you want. The sports clothing is great light weight and sti  dry or quick dri.  Trainers are hugely discounted but you must know your size I  cm and UK sizes are not there   290 cm is good for a UK 12. All in all worth while visit again
Really enjoyed being here. Lots of things to do and buy. I really liked the underground shops and the movie theater
I love that they bring all the sales out into the front to make it easier on customers to know what's cheap!
Huge with many different shops. Went to dickies here, but the staff was rude, showing black face.
Love this supermarket....dekat ngan seoul station,hotel,bus station kira semua kat sini semua adalah de besttt

One of the larger locations along the toy street that it is part of. The price was ok. Lego prices are extremely high compared to what you can get them for in the States. Korean toys however were reasonably priced. The choices were fairly vast with inventory large enough to make any kid of any age happy.
Really, really good price for the toys! Toy lover should definitely check this place out.

SeungJin Toys are located in the center of the toy street near Dongdaemun. You can buy things like dolls, toys, Legos, and model cars. It is 30~40 per cent cheaper than large mart. There is no price tag on the toy box, but you can check the price by taking a bar code.  freely. Cash and card prices are the same.
Toy shopping district, this is a good one-stop shop for party organising
Double storey toy store. Many korean cartoon character toys available, probably some have greater variety in this shop as well. Price comparable to shopping malls.
Very nice place to stay... A lot of items to see and nice places for eating or drinking inside.

Clean and tidy big book store. They have not only books but also many other stuff (such as K-pop music albums, cosmetics, stationary, and toys etc.). There are some nice restaurants down stairs at the book store. *Personally, I don't really recommend the restaurants there.
Very nice bookstore. It is just next to the see stream. Lots of interesting Korean books. The stationary section is great. There are also smartphone covers and earphones on sales
The sales staff is very helpful, especially at the magazine section.
quite big bookstore, good location, clean and not too crowded

I really enjoy coming here because they always have some quirky and trendy exhibition going on, drawing a younger crowd. Many of the workers are voluntary students as well which makes it more approachable and charges the area with a youthful energy. They also have a large arts, crafts and design shop, and an arts bookstore on the second floor I believe.

The lower level of this place is a wonderful spot to see independent films.  Probably a good idea to make reservations, though, as they seem to sell out most shows.  Note that shows start exactly at the stated time.

column1: There is a stationary shop on the ground level.  There are art spaces elsewhere in the building, but I haven't visited.

column7: EDIT: They are open again. As good as before.

column1: It used to be a nice shop for gifts. However, they are closed now. Not sure if this is temporary or if they will open again after renovations.

column7: Best place to find unique stationary and home bits. There is a coffee shop on the third floor that served one of the best coffees I had in seoul. Definitely coming back!
Very nice design producta from stationary to little pieces of furniture.

column1: The staff that applied the screen protector in my mac was amazing. Although they take money to perform it, but that worth the money

Disrespectful. Went to buy my IPhoneX on the 2nd day it was released in korea. While paying by card they asked me to show id. I was surprised why I need to show id in order buy anything from Frisbee. They said as it was expensive they need to check id. There was dozens of other customers who was buying the same phone, none had to show their id card. Later I came to know that none of the shopkeeper has the rights to ask you for id. I guess my racial profile was the reason. I feel bad about people for being narrow minded and disrespectful, I can't help it.

column7: Worst service ever. Visit here if you want to be mistreated by salesperson.
very expensive.

column1: They sell faulty products and refuse to refund or exchange. This is not an Apple Store but a fake one run by Koreans. Buy online from Apple or go to the verified Apple Store in Gangnam. There is only one Apple Store in Korea.

매년 7월 첫 주. 세븐데이 행사로 프리미엄 라인까지 20%할인 해줍니다. 이 때 맞춰서 금강 상품권도 가격이 올라가요. 상품권 26%할인 추가해서 약 40% 할인 받았네요
직원분이 친절하십니다. 7월 1일 ~ 7월 7일까지 진행되는 행사에 맞춰서 방문했는데, 교통도 편리하고 직원분도 친절하고 다 마음에 들었습니다.
Interesting exhibits of Shinkai Makoto's anime universe. But everything is in Korean so if you can't speak Korean, learn it before you go or go watch a movie instead...
I just really love this place. They usually have one or two excellent exhibits going on and a lot of open (but concrete) space for the kids

Large museum with multiple exhibition halls. Modern architecture, has  multiple shops and Cafes. Hosts world renowned works from all over the world. About 15min walk from the nearest subway station. Highly recommended.
Too many people in the rooms. Photo zones are blocking the flow.
I dont know
Small lake, water fountain, adequate facilities. Be aware, airplanes flying over constantly

Beautiful place. Made on a site where previously was a water management facility. You can still see some remaining structures kept intentionally. Also old water pipes can be seen everywhere changed to benches etc. The whole park has a rusty metal theme. Being very close to Gimpo airport every one or two minutes a ready-to-land airplane passes over the park.
Ppl are nice and clean facility

Nice place to hang around for an afternoon or evening. A variety of locations makes for some nice walking. The main around-the-lake path can get a bit busy, but there are other places to walk and play as well. In the wrong season, the mosquitoes can be a bummer when near the forested/brush areas.
Great place in free charge.

I've lost a lot of weight since the last time I shipped here, yet sizes that used to fit, I now have no chance of even squeezing into. This used to be THE place to shop as a larger woman in Korea. Now I wouldn't recommend it if you're larger than what we used to know as a size 6.
Recommended fashion chain store. It has great design lines for men. Not so reckmmended for the price.
It's H&M:)

column1: Probably less crowded than the others, even though it is in the middle of Myengdong.

column7: More style & good pr9ce

토요일오후방문. 주차공간이 너무 협소해서 주차장입구 150m앞두고 1시간 줄서있다가 들어감. 들어보니 여기 와본사람들 다 주차때문에 애먹었다고 함. 주차하고 홀공연보고 메이린중국집 등 돌아다니다 보니 건축설계자가 누군지 궁금해질만큼 욕나오는 비효율적인 건물... 밖에서 구경하기 좋지만 정말 공간활용 거지같이 한 건물..화장실은 강아지똥꾸멍만하고 여자화장실 가는길목에 남자화장실 볼일보는 모습이 정면에 딱!!! 보여서 진짜 화남..설계자가 돈만 쳐먹엇나..계단이 많고 동선이 너무 길어요. 장애인 배려는 눈꼽만큼도 없는 건물이네요.
북서울 꿈의숲에 있는 아트센터. 아트센터보다는 전망대쪽이 인기있고 볼만하다. 먹거리는 같이 있는 중식요리점이 괜찮은편.

column7: It's very good place to understand Korean Modern history.

미국 선교사(宣敎師) H.G.아펜젤러(1858∼1902)가 세운 한국 최초의 서양식 학교건물이며 근대식 중등 교육기관이다. 2001년 3월 15일 서울특별시기념물 제16호로 지정되었다. 옛 배재학당의 교실로 사용된 건물로 한국 근대 교육적 의미가 크며 한국 근대 건축으로서 그 형식이 우수하다. 건물의 구조와 창문, 외장 및 벽돌 구조가 뛰어나며 정면의 현관(玄關)과 양쪽 출입구의 돌구조 현관이 잘 보존되어 있다. 배재학당 동관 건물은 1916년에 세워졌는데 처음 지었을 때의 원형(原形)이 대체로 남아 있고 건물의 형태가 우수하여 1910년대 한국 근대 건축의 중요한 유물로 평가 된다. 1984년 배재고등학교가 서울시 강동구 고덕동으로 이전할 때까지 교실로 사용되었으며 배재고등학교 동관으로 불렸다. 2008년 7월 24일 동관 건물을 새롭게 단장하여 배재학당 역사박물관으로 개장하였다. 박물관에는 상설전시관, 기획전시관, 체험교실, 세마나실로 구성되어 있으며 상설전시관에는 1930년대 배재학당의 교실 모습을 재현하였다.
구한말 감리교선교사가 세운 학교. 시작부터 지금까지..
한국에서 가장 오래된 학교 중 하나답게 역사박물관이 잘 꾸며져 있지만 일부러 가서 볼 정도는 아니고 정동 산책하며 볼만함
소소한 재미가 있는 곳
5 hours climbs and down. It’s a worthy experience though the climb was tough. The view is breathtaking and it’s windy. Hikers often have snacks when taking a break up there! MUST GO
Great place for easy hiking. Multiple peaks, amazing view over Seoul. Really green nature. Doseonsa is close by.

Quite a challenging hike to reach the peak, especially for beginner. Nice view along the way and also at the peak of the mountain. Make sure you prepare water and food as likely will spent 5-6hrs at least for the whole journey to reach the peak. Also, make sure you go there earlier so that you can return to ground before the day turn dark.

We went on winter, so the landmark wasnt as good. Still, great experience. We went right to the top and went down the other side and took us around 5 hours, cause we went without the appropiate outfit.

column1: When going up was easy, but going down we needed to be a little more careful because of the snow. But they have ropes, so you can go down grabing those
