column7: 아주 좋은！

Very interesting museum. My friends and I had a lovely time. We were given a free guided tour in English. The museum is very big so you can stay there for a long time. It is also located in a very nice place in Seoul. I would love to visit it again.

If you are a museum lover then this is a must see. It covers the whole of Korean history up to modern times and houses some master works and national treasures of this county. The building is beautiful and the layout of nothing to complain about.

column1: The museum also has two separate halls that hosts international history related exhibits. There change roughly every 3 months. I have recently seen exhibits about iron, French palaces, the Mongolians and  the ancient middle east. Some are better, some are just OK.
The gift main gift shop, near the (expensive) cafeteria has some interesting souvenirs to buy. But more importantly, it has a nice selection of books on Korea and Korean culture.

column7: Greta place to learn about Korean history, Art, Culture at one place.  If you go there by subway, we will see another awesome displays on the way this museum. You can enjoy those displays while you were on moving walk. The Museum is huge and contains lots of items telling the history of Korea. One thing to remember, in order to enter this museum, you need to go through the metal detection security gate like airports....and all your belongings must go through the x-ray machine...thus pack light!

Great exhibition for free. If you are a museum lover this is a place for you. You can skip the War Memorial near here, but this is must see. The exhibition is not biased like there, and provides decent English translations.

Great museum and very well laid out. Bottom floor focuses on history, starting with prehistory on the right side and wrapping around ending with the Japanese occupation prior to WWI. The upper floors focus on art from painting and calligraphy to pottery and sculpture. There are quite a few beautiful private collections as well. There was no Special Exhibit when I went. Attached to a Children's Museum, which is quite popular judging by the crowds, though I did not explore. 80% of exhibits included English-language translation.

This was SO FUN! We had such a blast! Every nook and cranny were filled with pictures and photo opportunities. We couldn't stop laughing and smiling. The price was great for what was available to us. I would DEFINITELY go back.
IS a trick! for your eyes! A lot of stuff to see there.. best for the families or couples. You can spend couple of hours there to have fun. VR section is for me the most recommended.

I really love spending my time here to see and capture some funny moments with the props and application that was given by the staff. The 3D effects are so cool though! Would like to visit again if I have a chance :D

I had a good time with my friend when we visited! I could finally fulfil my dream as a ballerina on stage so yeah, that’s my favourite display. The others were cool too and we had lots of fun posing at different angles.

It is a great. I was have fun with my friends.Using the apps can take the 3D video which the picture is look like alive. It was very funny to take the photo and video. There are ice museum which is very beautiful. I played on the ice slice many times. It was fast and  exciting .
Got here in last minute. Till now remember how it was. The authentic bag with the cheap price and beyond my imaginary.
Lots of antique, clean, indoors. Love it.
Pungmul flea market, I wanna effin go!
평일엔 희귀한 물건이 별로 없지만 주말 (토/일)에 가시면 주변에 보다리 장터가 많이 서서 갈만 합니다

column7: 상인들께서 장사가 안되서인지
Good variety of products, plus the staff was nice and helpful. Everyone tried their best to talk to me both in English and Korean
I saw other people saying the staff was rude but I had a great experience with all of them. They were cordial, did their best to explain products to me in English, and were genuinely friendly!

Had such a terrible experience in the shop, especially the service. The sales assistant rudely introduced the products to us. When we asked questions about the products, she answered us in a very impudent tone. There was promotion on which you get a free eyeliner from buying a mascara (there were two colors available: red and white). We told her specifically we wanted the white eyeliner but she got us a red eyeliner. I didn't even realize it until I left Seoul. Overall, the sales assistant was super rude and mean to the customers.
Salesperson here is extremely rude compared to any store in this area.
first visit. good buys.
Picnic time!! Its so great can be here especially with your partner or friends!! Enjoy some delivery chicken or ramen its so great!
A place where every view is different and wonderful. The scenes never get saturated with beauty and smoothness.
Beautiful place....a place which creates network of energy and enthuse....!!
Great place for photography natural things like the flowers bugs

Very cool place to go hang out with your friends have a picnick or some snacks while you wait for the sun to set, also a cool place to drink and have fun, there are convinience stores there where you can buy everything you will need and there are also enough toilets. Very nice for sunny summer afternoons!
Best flagship store I’ve ever had the pleasure of going into. Luxurious, wide open floor plan. Heavy door, fun innovative Japanese designs from the grand master of haute couture, Rei Kawakubo! :)

I was caught off guard when entering this store because the design is out of this world. Anyone who walks by is immediately drawn in by the bright colors , and fancy decor. The staff members were super friendly and showed interest in the customers . I was able to find exactly what I wanted , and I felt  great after making my purchase.
Excellent helpful and informative staff. The display architecture and design alone is worth the visit. We were there during a 50 percent off sale and picked up some amazing works of art.
Space age architecture slows you to enter a portal of haute couture.
Excellent!! The employees are very nice..

It is a unique park. It is very dense like a forest so even in peak summer time you can get away from the harsh sun Rays and enjoy nature and good time with family by being here. It is not very crowded also. There is children play area , toilets and a convenience store inside.
It's a nice park to walk around, especially in the spring when they plant flowers. Also a nice place to see the cherry blossoms when they bloom.
It is really beautiful forest. I love it.

It is not the biggest of parks, but it offers a nice, relaxing area for a family to go to. There are seats and places under trees for a picnic, a play park fir the children and even a fountain for children to get wet in (have some adult supervision in case one of the munchkins falls over and hits their head.) A subway station very close by just adds to the convenience.

I love this place.  It is a great spot to spend the afternoon with family or friends.  It is great for kids as there is a large sandbox, playgroubd, splash pad and forested area.  They have bbqs in a bbq area that you can rent by visiting their website.

양천구 목2동에 축복받은 생활 근린공원 이다 아카시아 나무가 어우러져 여름에 햇빛을가려 그늘밑에서 새로 조성된 둘레길을 산책할수 있으면서 대운동장 트랙에서는 인조잔디위에서 마음것 여러가지 운동을 할수있다 나는 매일 아침마다 1시간반동안 둘래길을 산책하고 친구들과같이 휴식을 취한다

용왕산은 인조잔디로 만들어졌으면 마라톤ㆍ좈구및배드민턴등 다목적으로 심신을 단련할 수있습니다.
넓은 환경 주변 아파트 많아도 운동을  즐길수있는 장소입니다 공기도 좋습니다 인근 축구교실 아이들 교육도 시키며 주말은 동호인들 족구 축구  야구 그외 달리기하기에 참좋습니다 활용도가 매우높다 판단됩니다   이용해보시면  누구나 즐길수있는 곳입니다 입구벗꽃이 아름답게 반깁니다 많이 이용하셔요

An art museum for kids, often featuring art by kids. It is kind of hit and miss: we've seen some fun shows, but much of the time it isn't open, or it is something that costs money and might be better for older kids. So, kind of a gamble each time we go by. Fun when it works out, but not something to plan a visit around, unless you know in advance what you are getting into.

column1: There is a coffee shop on the roof with nice views of the park. Only open in the warm months.

A good exercise to trek up the hill and then be rewarded with a very nice view of Seoul from the top.  Try going up from one place and coming down from another route.  You will be pleasantly surprised by the things you see along the way.

This place is perfect for a wonderful city panorama. The path is well marked and made easier by ropes and stairs build in rock. The view from the top is amazing. You can also walk along the city wall. Enjoy finding your favourite spots: Gyeongbokgung, Namsan Tower, Blue House and many others  :-).
excellent place!!! it was my first experience about hiking, hiking is good for health, don't try if you are not physically fit for it!
A nice walk/hike along the fortress wall. Splendid views of the city too!

Here is one of the best places for light tracking in Seoul, South Korea. You can see beautiful old castles which surround city following small mountain ridge which has thick forest. In addition, you can also enjoy the panoramic view of seoul downtown on the hill.
**** THE GOOD:

column1: This is supposed to be a traditional village in the middle of Seoul.
We went when the weather was extremely hot, and traveling with young kids.  The information center was under construction and we didn’t know where to go to appreciate this site.
We walked around aimlessly for a half hour (with whining and whimpering kids) before we gave up and walked down to the palace area.
We saw some old style homes and streets, but I’m not sure what the big deal is.  With the steep streets to traverse (with kids) it wasn’t a great experience for us.
I guess if we had found the one street where you look down through multiple old style homes / roofs, it would have been a cool photo spot.
I did find a postcard painting of that famous photo spot so at least I got that!

column7: This is the most beautiful place I've ever been. It was breath taking. People complain I see about not having it layed out for tourists - it isn't for tourists. It's a village kept original and it's beautiful with amazing views, gorgeous buildings, and the most gorgeous girls in hanbok dresses. It was like being whisked away to another world for a little while. Explore, stay quite to respect the area, and enjoy every minute of this beautiful area.
Pros:

column1: - It's a great site to take pictures in and has some craft stores along the route.
- It's a route and not a proper tourist site so we had to walk around for 20 mins trying to find some sites (1 street and many alley ways.
- It has become a residental area, it's not preserved. So the residents aren't really happy with tourist and has lots of warning signs. (Ex: GO AWAY, NOT TOURIST SITE)
Overall: If u want to take pictures here, it's a real effort to come here especially in this heatwave.

column7: The most beautiful hanok village in Seoul and, I think, in South Korea. Very nice houses and very nice view above Seoul. It's a must on your travel list, but if you go there please be quiet when you visit. People still live there and I met a lot of turists who made noise. All of the walls were full of posters "please, be quiet!" or "just visit and pass away".
Historical part of Seoul with a modern twist. Many shop's restaurants, boutique's, shop's that have some nicknack's. Bukchon Hanok Village is worth checking out.
Kendrick Lamar concert. 30 July 2018. Great outdoor venue.

Had a great experience walking around the Seoul Olympic complex. It was like visiting a time capsule back to 1988. The old stadium is beautiful and a great part of Olympic history. Seeing the tiger mascot 'Hodori' brought back many good memories from a memorable Olympics.
Big stadium. I took my a daughter to a concert here and it is formidable for that purpose.
Well i went for umf and it was big and lots of dirty toilets
Nice place to do sprints and experience the place where the 88 Olympics took place.
Interesting

Teens will surely like this place. Families may not enjoy this since there is not much to do for young kids.
There is nothing much here..LMAO
So many beautifull big entertainment building in near distance
Nice area. Plenty of restaurants around.
Very nice, but little to do

Shopping mall l. It has E-mart, starbucks and electronics market samsung and LG
Currently, there is almost nothing there, except Emart

nice and cheap price but it's going to be disappear soon
Good place to have a nap and be lazy and to spend time with kids

선우도공원 일대를둘러보았고 우거진 나무숲에시원한 바람과 맑은공기 참 좋았습니다.사울시민 누구나돈 않 드리고 즐길수 있는 공간을 마련해주신 관계자분께 깊은 감사 드립니다.
해지는 풍경을 즐기기 너무 좋네요.. 주차장 대기 시간도 없었어요. 가족단위로 오기 너무 좋아요~
This is the place for couples!!!

column1: all the couples are in here!!
But the night seeing is so so beautiful
you can have some beers and chicken in here

column7: If the air in Seoul Korea good, are there no better place to having a family picnic.
Only place where you can enter inside a submarine and 2 war ships for just 3000krw(2.75 usd).
When you guys come to seoul, You have visit  here.
Romance and relex

It used to be my favorite place in Seoul but the feeling has changed in time. Nevertheless the place is still a good place to go with friends (though usually you can find a lot of couples there). It's good for picnic. I noticed that many people build a tent there. I think there are tent rentals around the area. It was very windy when we went last Sunday so make sure you protect yourself from the dust. There are also bike rentals and from late afternoon to night time, there are street performers that will make your stay lovely.

Great outdoor place. Always has people but it's very spacious so more than enough room. Nice place to go with friends, always performances around. Rented bikes with my friends and rode along the river.

We had a great time having chimaek (chicken and maekju/beer) with friends by the Han River. Summer is the best time for "camping" and laying mats on the grass and relaxing with friends. There are many restaurants nearby and you can just order food and they'll deliver it to you in the park. You can rent bikes (solo or use a couple bike for two) and ride around the park. It's also a great place for running. Expect more people during Fridays and weekends.

It is a great park. We went for international fire cracker festival in October. It was exceptionally crowded. People start pouring in the park from 10 am in the morning for  show starting 7 pm. It's like a big Mela. It's lot if fun as there were some groups performing also before the fire show.

Large, expansive park. Many locals come here to pitch a tent and picnic for the day and evening. Always has a LOT of people, but there’s a lot of space. You can walk along the Hangang river and watch cruise ships go by as well as live performances.

My kids and I absolutely adore this pool. It's cheap, we always have a ton of fun. Umbrellas are abundant, even on busy days it's bearable. There is one small shallow pool for babies, larger wading pool for toddlers and a huge semi shallow pool in addition to a "lazy river"

column1: There are showers, and changing facilities along with some food options.

The biggest draw for me is it's cheap and easily accessible. Entry for adults is 5,000₩ kids 6 and up are 3,000 and 5 and under is free with proof. It's also an easy walk from the subway or parking is very affordable with validation (3,200 and we were there from 11-4)
This could be a phenomenal facility.

There is a splash playground and lots of cool spraying features, but they are never on. I saw the playground on once last year and this year the only time I went I saw grass growing out of the cracks all over the playground so I doubt it's been on this summer.
The "bathrooms" are glorified port-a-potties and look like they're maybe washed once the entire season.
And to top it all off swim caps are mandatory. It used to be that they were only mandatory for the lazy river but now all the pools require it.
Despite all that it only equates to one star lost because we still have a great time and at a great price.

column7: Reasonable price
This summer from 23.6.2017 to 27.8.2017 9am-7pm 👙

column1: Very well maintained roads and pleasant bicycle ride to enjoy stunning view of Seoul.

column7: Once again, like many places in Korea, its very crowded. I really enjoyed renting and riding bikes on the paved trail. You have to be cautious of the fast riders and pedestrians that J Walk and pop out in front of you. There is a water type area in the park where you can wade. The water is pretty dirty but there are tons of people that setup tents and wade and play in the water.
Awesome place to spend leisure time and hang out with family and friends. Lots of water to have fun, Street hawkers selling good food and a setup for stage performances. Loved it
Too much people at the weekend but its quite good as well. There are several food truck which you can buy all kinds of food including steak(!).

My kids and I absolutely adore this pool. It's cheap, we always have a ton of fun. Umbrellas are abundant, even on busy days it's bearable. There is one small shallow pool for babies, larger wading pool for toddlers and a huge semi shallow pool in addition to a "lazy river"

column1: There are showers, and changing facilities along with some food options.

The biggest draw for me is it's cheap and easily accessible. Entry for adults is 5,000₩ kids 6 and up are 3,000 and 5 and under is free with proof. It's also an easy walk from the subway or parking is very affordable with validation (3,200 and we were there from 11-4)
This could be a phenomenal facility.

There is a splash playground and lots of cool spraying features, but they are never on. I saw the playground on once last year and this year the only time I went I saw grass growing out of the cracks all over the playground so I doubt it's been on this summer.
The "bathrooms" are glorified port-a-potties and look like they're maybe washed once the entire season.
And to top it all off swim caps are mandatory. It used to be that they were only mandatory for the lazy river but now all the pools require it.
Despite all that it only equates to one star lost because we still have a great time and at a great price.

column7: Reasonable price

column7: Absolutely love the Atrium Grill and Frank! The food is always hot and delicious. I love their breakfast menu and haven't been disappointed yet! My new favorite is the breakfast burrito w/ chorizo and potatoes!
This place is pretty legit! I have only gone to this place for breakfast with the new owner and never disappointed! Stay Golden!
Great food and a very helpful staff.

My lunch break is only a half hour and you guys always manage to get my food to me in time to get back to work regardless of how busy it is. Also, friendliest staff around. See you guys at lunch time ;)

I've enjoyed every dish I've had here, but my absolute favorite is the chicken quesadilla...it's perfectly seasoned and the salsa is amazing! The Atrium Grilll has a great environment with wonderful and enthusiastic employees. I highly recommend this place if you want quick, friendly service and great food!! #supportlocalbusiness
One of the oldest music venues in korea.
Love this venue! Was surprised there was no bar. I was definitely expecting to order drinks.

Small theatre with basic facilities. Went there to watch The Foreman Show.
Well designed, intimate theatre. We took VIP seats but any of the seating would be fine. Do see the Jump show - high energy and entertaining for all ages. Avail of discounts for foreigners.
The firemanshow is great
We attended the jump show here. It was hilarious. We were joking a out it for the remainder of our trip.
Difficult place to find.. I think the Domino's pizza next door is easier to find than the theatre
Every time when i visit Seoul, must come here.

classic fancy glazed tile on floor, beautiful decorations and furniture.

column7: Nice open space, zany, unique furniture, and great coffee. Last but not least, it probably has the best tiramisu in the city. Don't eat it alone though since it is a pretty big piece of cake.

클래식에 관심이 조금이라도 있다면. 없더라도 이곳에 간다면 클래식에 다가갈수밖에 없는 곳
이제는 좀 한산해진 압구정동 로데오거리 근처를 지날 때면 항상 들리게 되는 곳이다. 명징한 소리를 내는 음질 좋은 스피커에서 들려오는 엄선된 클래식 명곡들을 듣는 것 하나만으로도 좋다. 음반에 정성스럽게 써 붙힌 소개글로 뽐뿌질 당하는 것만 조심한다면 ㅎㅎ 음반을 사면 옆에 붙어 있는 고급진 카페에서 음악과 커피를 즐길 수 있는 호사를 누릴 수 있다.
클래식을 좀 더 가까운 곳에서 느낄수 있는 곳

서울살이 몇 십년만에 이런 아름다운 곳이 있다는 사실을 처음 알았다. 조용하고 참한 풍경과 더 조용하고 차분한 사람들이 잘 어우러져 잠시 걷기만해도 책 한 권 읽은 것 처럼 기분 좋고 마음이 깊어지는 듯 했다. 바쁜 삶을 멀리하고 매일 이곳에 푹 파묻히고 싶은 마음이었다.

column1: One of the most popular library with over a half million books. It is also famous for its historic place and buildings. It is still worthy hanging around the library without reading books.

column7: 我是春天去賞櫻的(所以未進入圖書館內)，整排的櫻花真的很美，而且可以跟三清洞和北村排在同一天，交通很方便，拍照起來真的很漂亮，草皮上有禁止踩踏的標誌，但很多人還是踩進去(包含韓國本地人)，不過為了避免糾紛，還請大家去旅遊的時候不要進入草皮區喔!
고즈넉한 곳으로 봄의 이 즈음 가면 만발하는 벚꽃으로도 유명한 곳. 조금 오래된 곳이지만 그 나름대로의 멋과 넓은 정원이 산책하기 좋습니다. 도서관이지만 삼청동, 인사동과 인접해 있어 나들이겸 들리기에도 좋은 곳입니다.
Lots of little shops with very interesting antique trinkets and furniture. Definitely a good place to take a leisurely walk and window shop.
If antique furniture interests you then a visit to this area is recommended. A lot of small stores here for shopping. From small items like mantlepieces to big ones such as cupboards.
There are some very unique things you can find in so many of the stores and I love the vibe but actually being able to buy things is another story. Very expensive.
Quaint and amazingly plentiful
Just a 5-10 minutes walk from the subway exit, you will see these vintage shops in line.
Very nice place to relax. Amazing scenery
In this place is good for the picnics. We can see the seoul city wall and nice view.

This place good for easy hiking in Seoul. You can enjoy the view of Seoul day and night. Especially at night, beautiful view of city wall with light also enjoy the view of Seoul. if the weather is clear you can see Seoul tower.
A good place to visit for an uphill walk and decent views. The base is surrounded by lot of traditional homes and shops.
Hidden awesome night scape
Good staaying but meed to improve

그 예약하기 힘들다는 강동그린웨이 가족 캠핑장을 예약 잡아 다녀왔네요~~2만원에 잡은거라 얼마나 좋겠어라며 기대를 하지 않고 갔답니다. 와우 그런데 정말 기대 이상으로 시설도 깔끔하고 편리하게 잘 해 놨더군요. 주차장도 잘 되있고 아이들 뛰어놀수 있는 공간도 엄청 넓게 잘 되어 있습니다. 접근성도 너무 좋고 하루 정말 재밌게 잘 놀다온 듯 해요~~적극 추천이에요~~홈페이지 들어가봤더니 예약이 꽉 차서 가고 싶어도 갈 수가 없네요 ㅡㅡ
도심과 멀지 않으면서 시원함을 느낄수 있어서 좋았습니다. 전체적인 비용도 난지천캠핑장에 비해 훨씬 싼 편이고 1인 입장료같은 개념도 없고 주차도 편리하고.. 옆에 있던 허브공원도 야경구경하고 시원한 바람쐬기에 좋았네요.
문정동에서 조금만 더 가도 이런 곳이 있었네요.

column1: 숲 냄새 많이 나고, 물놀이, 산책도 가능하고, 농구 골대도 있네요.

우리에겐 뼈아픈 장소입니다. 덕수궁을 뺀질나게 들락거려도 여기 한번 안가본 사람 많을 겁니다. 꼭 찾아가셔서 아픈 역사를 기억합시다.
역사의 한페이지를 장식한 곳. 잘 알려져있지 않은 만큼 더 소중한 곳. 무료개방이지만 안내 및 내외부 관리가 매우 잘되어있어서 연인, 어린학생이 있는 가족에게는 꼭 가길 강추한다. 모두에게 만족한 장소가 될것이라고 자신합니다.

column1: Majority are fashion related. Too much wholesale centre around. Just keep your wallet full....

column7: If yoy buy good quality fabic, i recommend this place. Most shop kind and small talk in english.
Really good shopping mall for buying raw materials like clothing, accessories and beddings, korean traditional dress(clothes), dishes et cetera.

Visited here for the yarn, which is located on the first basement level.  Those vendors are happy to deal with individual shoppers, but a lot of the stuff is still in "bulk" packages.  Probably best to come before lunch, though the yarn vendors do seem to stay open longer than everyone else.
Good for clothes, accessories, and plant purchases. Has multiple choices in stores and the best street shopping place in Seoul. Rates are reasonable.

Visited here for the yarn, which is located on the first basement level.  Those vendors are happy to deal with individual shoppers, but a lot of the stuff is still in "bulk" packages.  Probably best to come before lunch, though the yarn vendors do seem to stay open longer than everyone else.
Good for clothes, accessories, and plant purchases. Has multiple choices in stores and the best street shopping place in Seoul. Rates are reasonable.

Having traveled through many Asian countries, I'd say this was a lesser impressive market. Not only were the food stalls shelling out mostly the same things, but the prices were as if I was at a regular food hall or restaurant. When coming to any market, I expect low prices with minimal service. Definitely still worth a gander and if you're in town for a but, stock up on the fresh Kimchi selection for your fridge.

Nice market to eat street food. There aren't too many options, the stalls are kind of repetitive but it's nice to have everything in one place. From fish cake and pork feet, kimbap and live octopus. There's plenty of food to enjoy and it's nice the market has a covering so you aren't in direct sunlight during the day.
Busy market with many interesting sights and kind vendors. Mung bean pancakes are delicious. Street food is yummy in general! Had some tough tteokbokki though :(

Lots of colours and interesting to see. Whilst it looks like a lot of food most of the vendors sell the same things and of the same quality. Very few sweet things to eat. Got very warm and stuffy during summer. Borderline unpleasant due to the heat so best prepare yourself for that.

It's become increasingly touristed but it is a true market experience. Honestly even though I live in the city I feel like a tourist here as I rarely have need to buy the things out on sale there. However, the street food is still great and authentic, and the used clothing market is aleays a great place for wandering and rummaging.
sara nail
시장바닥 인간들이 다 그렇지.. 세월이 지나도 질 낮은 인간들은 그대로. 가격도 좀 예쁘다 싶으면 비쌈

column1: またその裏で本物偽物まで何でも揃っています。ショッピングは最高の場所とも言えます。
道を歩けば社長さん社長さんと声をかけられるのがちょっと鬱陶しいですが、楽しい場所でもありますので韓国に来た際は是非足を運びたい場所の一つです。

column7: 인터넷에서도 구하기 어려웠던 유니크한 템을 구할 수 있는 곳. 1~2시간 천천히 걸으며 구경하기 좋다. 가격은? 납득 가능한 수준

천천히 구경하세요!
Interesting Museum. I visited it in 2014.

There's museum under the King Sejong Statue. It's free entrance. The museum displays about the story of King Sejong, Joseon Dinasty, and hangul history. The entrance is behind the statue. Just make sure you visit it.

May 2015 - I love the big open space where you can just run, cycle or walk along the boulevard! It seems like there is usually some themed event happening in this area and it's great for locals and tourists alike. When we were here, we were introduced to the Korean culture of stick walking and traditional costumes.
Very good
이순신 장군을 좋아하는 아들 덕분에 대여섯번은 간듯. 거북선 축소 모형도 좋고 4D영화 상영도 좋습니다. 다만 시설이 낡아져 노젓기나 포쏘기 등은 예전만 못하네요.

We have been living in Korea for almost 7 years and my kids are pretty proficient in Korean. Decided to take them for the first time. Big mistake! So expensive (138,000₩) for the four of us for the morning shift and they were able to fit in TWO activities in 5h time frame! Even if you try and get to the activities according to the timings in front of the stations.... you end up waiting 45min to an hour between activities!!! It is a great concept but with how busy it is, it needs to be reorganized.

Superb idea but poor execution. The idea to give kids hands on work like experience packaged in a fun manner seems great in theory. However when they don't do crowd control or have limit on how many patrons they allow into the center the experience sours immediately. The activities take 15 to 20minutes a piece however the wait time can be up to an hour or more. At least they could have provided some other activities while waiting. This seems like a complete missed opportunity.
Great place for kids. It opens from 10 am. Reservation is recommended. Military training and wall climbing are favorites. Running shoes are needed.
Hmmmm.......kids loved this place but it definitely reorganizes the admission system that too many kids and waiting lines were too long for each section.
Nice place for kids to learn and play.

column1: The real life of kids! They do police activities, firefighters, doctors, and more.

column7: Drinking water facility not well placed. Rest everything is good.
I went here to see Monsta X concert ! This place has an easy access for subway ! Just in front of the entrance
Very nice arena. I was there for a boxing event.
great Arena for sport events! had a lot of fun one day here)
Great experience watching volleyball
Best to go in the morning when it's almost empty.  The workers are friendly and will help you if you need to fax or scan and copy something.

Very spacious with a wonderful array of paper keepings sure to assist any curious mind adventurous to attend. The staff is very friendly. As well, there is a lot of events monthly that you may attend. Show up and feel free to explore the fascinating wonders that is the Dorothy Bramlage Library!
No effort was made for people to lower their conversations. It’s a public library for crying out loud.  This library should enforce having the Courtesy of lowering their personal conversations.
They have good selection of books but need some new ones staff ain't rude at all 😆😆😆😆😆😆😆😛😛😛😛😛😛😏😏😏😏😏👻👻👻👻👻👻🤖🤖🤖🤖💩💩💩💩💩
I love this library!!! I volunteer here all the time.. I wish they had more books but otherwise I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

A really nice and tiny market. Most goods are handmade. You can find some original and unique gifts like painted cap and wooden craft. The place to go if you want to buy quality souvenirs for your friends and family.
If you like a busy, happening atmosphere, this is the place to be. If you want a quiet corner, maybe you should find somewhere else.
If you want to feel young spirit, go there at night on weekends. Could be a little noisy depends on your taste.😊
Really nice smallish market selling hand made items such as passport cases, fans and other art. The price wasn't high like you might expect.

column1: Shame it's only on once a week.

column7: Nice little place with local artists displaying their ware. Popped by for a short visit. Only open on sat!
Walruses were cute. But both were sad and depressed. Too many kids too noisy place.
Nice place for the kids. Avoid weekends.
Pretty expensive and I felt pity for animals that have pretty narrow places for surviving.
if you have kids i really recommand this place. but parking place is small. also its smaller than other aquarium i think.
Children are happy.

column1: Special place for animal contact zone at open air where you can contact with pony sheeps rabbis and others

column7: Love it. You can try traditional cakes there. Place is tiny bit outdated.
ウィークデー木曜日の10時位に訪問。

column1: 開店時刻が8時とあるので餅菓子＝朝ごはん感覚で伺いました。
この時刻なので余裕で品物が並んでいるかとワクワクと店内へ。しかし半分も並んでおらず少し残念。。。中で食べると伝えメニューを出されそして注文。その際餅菓子を選んで渡すとカットしてお皿に盛られ出てきました。
今回選んだのは私と夫で各二種＝計四種類。
ヨモギ系と南瓜系、あと固めのお菓子と芥子餅みたいなお菓子。どれもほんのり甘く美味しい。で、食べていたら店内のお菓子コーナーが少し追加されまして、食べ終えて見に行くと『あぁ、こういったお菓子が食べたかった。。。』となる品物。笑
因みにドリンクは夫は冷たい五味子茶。私はホットのカボチャラテ。特にカボチャラテは南瓜の味そのもの＋優しく滑らかな口当たりでとても美味しく頂きました。時間的な問題の品揃えには残念でしたが、味はとても美味しかったので是非とも。多分品揃えを考えるとお昼過ぎが狙い目？うーん、でも、それは平日だけか？謎

Other than the Gentle Monster stores, not much to write home about unless you like to watch rich tourists or locals shop. Many overseas designer stores that are the same everywhere in the world. Did have a good time in VR Game place near by. The famous cafes were not that great as the quality of the bakery goods were average along with the coffee. Interesting architecture and decorations in these fancy cafes.
It is becoming much more commercial than it used to be. But we can find so cute cafe and restaurants. It's still crowded day and night.

Fabulous. Perfect for Street shopping. The nearest subway station is "Shinsa". It is also easy to access from Gangnam station by bus. If you want to catch the recent fashion trend in Korea, you have to come and look around. People, clothes, accessories. You will love it :)

column1: I've been having my shirts made for the past 3 decades so I know how custom-made shirts should fit.  Not that I am picky - but there is a reason why people get shirts custom-made as opposed to buying it ready-made ... we all want the shirts to fit well ... to our liking ... even if we don't spend much money.  This place (I visited the one in Itaewon part of Seoul - although they have different locations around Seoul) has been around for many years. After having my shirts made at other stores (like at "Houston" - located a few stores away from Hamilton), I decided to try it out. It wasn't because I had problems with Houston (in fact, I really like Houston and have been a regular customer there for years), but rather I wanted to see if I could expand my list of shirt makers.

At this Itaewon location, I was met by a very condescending woman manager (I just want the readers know that it was a middle-aged woman manager so the readers can recognize this person) who told me what I wanted instead of listening to what I wanted - although I tried several times to tell her how I like my shirts or want my shirts to look - each time, she cut me off.  My wife thought that we should just leave but, in the end, I ordered 3 shirts ... against her better judgment.

The result:  I had to go back 3 times because each time, they messed up.  The shirts are still messed up!  My shirts were at least 2 sizes larger (although the manager measured me), and then the  fabric on the collar was wrong (all crumpled up that could not be ironed out - which the manager acknowledged was a "facing" problem - I think "facing" is a professional term of sort), and then my cuffs were made wrong so that cuff-opening faced down instead of out to the side (so when I put on my cuff links and stretch out my arms slightly, both the cufflinks and the cuff openings face directly down to the ground).  They said they would fix these problems, but each time, they failed ... even though I took time out of my busy schedule to go back to the store 3 times. You would think a shirtmaker would know how to make shirts.  As I said before, the shirts are still not right!!! Urgh!!!

The worst of all this was the attitude of the manager at the Itaewon Hamilton store - she kept on asking me if my shirts were uncomfortable as if this was my problem. - although the defects are  quite visible to everyone.  It has nothing to do with my comfort or discomfort - simply, the shirts were made wrong, which is Hamilton's fault! These are custom-made shirts and Hamilton is supposed to a specialist in making shirts.  I expect custom-made shirts to fit me, I expect the collar to not have crumples that cannot be ironed out (not just wrinkle) and I expect my cuffs to be facing the right way.  These 3 shirts were the worst I've had in my life (and I've had many in my 60 years).  This manager then blamed the shirt making factory they use (by the way, all locations of Hamilton use the same factory.)

The attitude of this manager was absolutely horrible - she should be fired!  I will never go there again and I urge others to not go there.  If at all possible, I would go elsewhere - having custom-made shirts in Korea is a fun and easy experience, but this experience at Hamilton was nothing short of a nightmare!.

column7: 10년전 사회초년생 시절 잠원동에 있던 washington에서 맞췄던 셔츠가 괜찮았어서 지난 6월 잠시 귀국 한 김에 이태원에 셔츠 맞추러 감. 시간에 쫒기다 워싱턴은 못찾고 비슷비슷하다 들은 해밀턴으로 감. 싼 가격에도 정성껏 싸이즈 재주던 기억과 달리 삐딱한 자세로 대충대충. 부산으로 배송 받았는데 어깨싸이즈 팔싸이즈 다 잘못 나옴. 넉넉하지 않았던 출국일 탓에 택배로 다시 교환받아서 외국나와서 확인 해 보니 셔츠 카라도 엉뚱한걸 달고 나옴. 주문할때 몇번이나 확인했는데... 매장에선 공장에서 잘못나왔다 그러던데 치수 쟨 영수증 보니 껄렁이며 쓴 주문서에 싸이즈 카라모양 다 잘못 써 있음.. 최악중에 최악.. 중국에서 여행하다 맞췄던 3만원짜리 셔츠보다 질 안좋고 못만듬...

column1: 시력이 좋지 않은데 안경이나 스포츠선글라스를 고려하고 계시다고요? 그럼 명동 아이닥으로 가보세요. 강추입니다.

column7: Gana glasses are great and their attitude is great for any customers who would like to visit. I had my foreign friends visiting myeongdong and they all were pleased with their glasses. the quality of glasses and their hospitality were really great. I wish you all good day.

column7: Nice place to hang out. Visit during the evening for the scheduled rainbow waterfall show. Go with your group of friends or alone its a nice place to chill. Really convenient store, and staff was very helpful.  They were able to give me a new eye exam instantly (I hadn’t done one in probably close to a decade).  Making the lenses and affixing them to the glasses frame took under 2 hours, so I was able to eat lunch in the area and return to pick up.  They also offered the option to let you come back another day and pick up.  They offer a selection of both domestic Korean frames and imports (which are unfortunately a more expensive).  If you’re interested in the Korean frames, they’re very cheap; some are only 20-30K won, which is really low.

Honestly the best optician I've ever had, too bad they're only in Korea. Fluent English skills and excellent customer service. The staff was so kind while doing the eye tests and helping me choose a frame, I never thought going to an optician was this pleasant. And really inexpensive price too!! Would really recommend!!

100% recommend. Super easy and fast and the staff was super helpful. Staff speaks multiple languages including mandarin and English. Daewon helped me and he was super funny and sweet. I got 2 pairs for $280, frames and lenses are separate. There are affordable options ranging from 10,000 won to 90,000 for lenses (10$-90$), they will explain in quality and lense thickness. Anyways would go again.
Wonderfully supportive staff! Helped me find exactly what I was looking for! Very fast service too! Thank you

Great selection of products here. You can always find something new to try.

One can even rent a floating picnic boat for up to 6 people and enjoy an afternoon on the water, or head in front of the islands and sit in the park, watching people picnic and flying kites

Such a beautiful temple close to the city surrounded by Bukhan Mountain. Quiet and clean.

Jingwansa is a large Korean Buddhist temple.  They offer a "TempleStay" program where foreigners can stay for a while.  Once arranged you can spend quality time with the monks and see what life is like on the inside.  According to the sign, "Templestay is a cultural program that gives you the chance to experience the 1700 year old history of Korean Buddhists and the life of Buddhist practitioners at temples that literally live and breathe the traditions and natural beauty of Korea".  Check the air quality forecast before venturing on a long trek through Bukhansan.  Depending on the winds, China's vast smog cloud often makes breathing the natural beauty of Korea a bit difficult.  As for the Templestay, an alternative is to simply walk in  and have a look around.  Lots of art, some depicting graphic violence which seems odd, and a nice little cafe.
I spent the night in 진관사 for temple stay. The whole period was very enlightening
The temple is famous for its temple stay programs for foreigners and temple foods
Good to have a cup of Korean style tea with fruits

It's me again, the only Foreigner who writes decent reviews in Seoul. This is a really long river that runs through the middle of the city. They used to be a freeway. The former president of the country decided that he in a past life would take a bunch of money to pay the giant freeway through the middle of the city. He got a lot of money for it for his Construction Company. Then he became mayor of Seoul. Then he decided that he would pay another construction company gobs of money to tear the whole thing up. Now it's a beautiful River in the middle of the city that you can run next to. If you like that sort of thing. Would you should if you were in Korea. Running next to rivers is like Korea's national pastime. Isn't Korea a wonderful place? Maybe they'll give me citizenship one day.

I loved taking walks along this stream. It hides you from the crazy traffic on the surface. There are also painted graffiti on the walls which make the place look more funky. Here, people sit by the stream and dip their feet in the cool waters, even as the summer sun blazes above. It's also faster to move around here, since you can avoid pedestrian crossings.

This place in Seoul is really awesome! A green oasis in the middle of seoul city centre. It is really beautiful, I absolutely recommend to go take a walk or do some jogging there in the evening around 6 PM

This stream is honestly so peaceful and relaxing, that i would go back every time I had the opportunity to. The water is full of fishes, the side with chirping birds (and pigeons). We even saw an egret hunting for fish.
The atmosphere and the water are clean and pure, temperature near the stream is lower than the street 2-3 degrees. Fish and bird can live here, in center of a big city, it is a good environment.

column1: Carefull in a rainy day, the bank is quite slippery.

column7: This establishment is amazing. The food was great and the bulgoki was on point. The side dishes were so good but I wish they would pay more attention to when they run out so they can bring new ones but other then that this restaurant was amazing definitely most high scale Korean restaurant in the area

Han Gang is the best Korean restaurant in Northern Virginia.  There used to be others that were as good or better in quality and authenticity, but they have all closed.  Quality and cleanliness is why we go to this restaurant.  They used to use MSG, but now they have almost completely removed MSG from their dishes.  The hostess/manager tries her best to accommodate and make sure that your experience is a good one.

column1: Update: the lettuce used for wrapping Korean BBQ last night must not have been washed very well - gave me a bad case of Montezuma's revenge - albeit in a Korean restaurant.  I guess the cleanliness part is spotty.

It has a fish pond and beautiful picturesque landscape. You will enjoy taking a selfie anywhere. The coffee are expensive better buy outside or bring your own 😢. Its a good place for letting your child play as well. I am not sure if using a kite or drone is allowed or you need a license for it. There are designated places to play ball as well. There's museum under the King Sejong Statue. It's free entrance. The museum displays about the story of King Sejong, Joseon Dinasty, and hangul history. The entrance is behind the statue. Just make sure you visit it.

May 2015 - I love the big open space where you can just run, cycle or walk along the boulevard! It seems like there is usually some themed event happening in this area and it's great for locals and tourists alike. When we were here, we were introduced to the Korean culture of stick walking and traditional costumes.

강서습지생태공원은 서울 방화대교 남쪽 끝에서 행주대교 남쪽 끝 사이의 한강 둔치에 있는 생태공원이다. 담수지와 저습지 등을 인공적으로 조성하고 습생, 수생식물을 심었다. 갈대밭과 버드나무숲이 어우러져 있으며 탐방로 두 곳과 철새 조망대가 있다.
강서구 쪽의 방화대교 옆에서 부터 행주대교 근처까지 쭉 길게 이어진 강서습지생태공원. 여러종류의 숲풀과 수양버들이 멋지게 늘어져 있고, 여러종류의 새소리가 아름답게 들리는 곳으로 한강변으로 쭉 늘어진 생태공원길을 한번쯤 걸어보는 것도 아주 유익한 도움이 될 것입니다.

We visited this mall for H&M store and also for one of the indian restaurant, Masala. H&M in this mall is quite big and many options. Masala restaurant is also good.
It a Must if you visiting seoul , a lot of shopping store in a wide open streets most of them for walking only, you will find cheap stuff or high brands, all in one place..

Convenient shopping plaza with Zara, H&M, The Body Shop, Nike, as well as some of local indi brands. Fun to look around. Has various diners in the 6th floor and a seafood buffet in the 7th. One of the places I visit often for lunch.

I would recommend going here first for all your cosmetic, clothing, shoes and accessories as you are bound to find everything here. Cosmetic samples are given out for free when you pass any cosmetic store so be ready to recieve products before you even buy anything, their are heaps of cosmetic stores so keep in mind if you intend to shop be early because time flies.

Great location to meet up with friends. Close to Euljiro 1 Station and Myeongdong Station. Lots of fun global shops including Zara and H&M.  Variety of choices for dining on the 6th floor. International food selections in one place (reasonably priced). Would go again and recommend the softshell crab curry or chicken lunch special at the Thai restaurant. If you like Southern food, the dirty rice and seafood jambalaya at Shybana was so tasty and comforting. Also coffee and snack shops if you need to sit and rest.

It's amazing place to spend time if you are interested in new Samsung gadgets VR glass new phones and more. It was interesting, fanny and tricky to find out how everything works. Definitely recommend for those who like technological stuff.

Horrible futuristic museum. Virtually just a series of concept videos and Instagram filters. Most of the actual physical gadget don’t work so well. Even the concepts themselves are not creative. Mostly its screens inside everyday objects.
Exhibit new technologies from Samsung Electronics. You can buy original Samsung Electronics too. You can use and  test some of cool stuff as well. Good for kids.

A nice place to see the technology in the future from Samsung and kids can have some fun in the 2rd floor.  Good to visit if you have an hour or so of your time in the afternoon.  The location is right at the Gangnam station exit 8

One of the amazing experience to visit a Samsung digital market. Happen to see latest stuff that Samsung is launching in market and they are really worth watching here. A band was put by staff and with that you can start multiple experience of Samsung technology..

column2: Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
column7: This museum is a lot quieter when compared to the air/space, and natural history museum. The art is amazing and beautiful, and there are a lot of informational signs/plaques that explain some pieces of the art, that really helped me to understand not only the individual pieces of art, but also the history that had occurred in Africa.

column2: Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
column7: Great museum, just wish there was more care put into the descriptions on each piece and that some of the pieces weren't taken down. Otherwise a good representation of art and not slavery-centric.

column2: Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
column7: The National Museum of African Art promotes cross-cultural understanding in the social sciences and arts. The museum houses a variety of art, paintings, sculptures, and art history. Although there was hardly anyone there during my visit, it is definitely worth a visit, especially for those interested in looking a cultural work that has had a broad influence on African American, and American society in general.

column2: Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
column7: This museum is an underated gem of the Smithsonian Institute. Hidden behind the castle and connected to the Sackler Drug-Money Legitimization Project and Freer Gallery, this three level, subterranean museum showcases beautiful pieces of art from Africa in a scale I haven't seen even in Africa itself. Most of the objects I sorry my time viewing were from West Africa, mainly from the Niger Delta area up through Mali and other parts of the Sahel. The many different cultures of Africa have unique and interesting works too be seen here and it's definitely worth your time to stop in and spend an afternoon.

column2: Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
column7: The National Museum of African Art is a small part of the Smithsonian museum collection and at first glance it doesn't seem like much, but on second glance, it's a gem. I recommend going to the very bottom of the museum first and work your way from bottom up. The exhibits are small and interesting, but what is most impressive is the circular staircase. Greenery is hanging from it and it's beautiful with a fountain at the bottom and a dome at the top. It's the perfect photo op. If you're nearby, stop by for sure!

Been there studying for 2 years. really strategic place. lots of restaurant and shops around, lots of cafe and various entertainments. best art school ever in korea.. one of my best experience, visiting hongdae and strolling around there

This was an extremely enjoyable experience in dawn,  right before sunset.  Aside from the plethora of shops along busy streets,  what really got my attention was the numerous student performances along the street!  There was a boys group singing ,  schoolgirl dancers and even normal students action out a zombie-thriller  play.  All of this was on a Saturday¡ It's so great to see the artistic side of students.
great public area

The area is surrounded by tons of small cafes, bars, clubs, and local designer shops. Recommended for day and night walk.

서울시 서초구 우면동 소재의 우면산 관문사는 수도권 천태법음의 요람이자 포교의 중심 도량으로써 1993년 기공식의 갖고 5년간 공사를 거쳐 1998년 10월에 낙성하였다.

column1: 서울시 서초구 우면동 소재의 우면산 관문사는 수도권 천태법음의 요람이자 포교의 중심 도량으로써 1993년 기공식의 갖고 5년간 공사를 거쳐 1998년 10월에 낙성하였다. 관문사는 첨단의 설비를 갖춰 다양한 국내뿐만 아니라 국제적인 문화, 학술, 종교의식을 치를 수 있도록 지상 7층에 걸쳐 전통적인 불교건축양식을 계승하고 현대적인 건축양식을 조화롭게 설계하여 시공되었다.

관문사는 우면산을 비롯한 청계산, 양재천 등 천혜의 자연환경과 함께 위치하고 있다. 관문사가 자리한 우면산(해달293m)는 소가 누워 있는 형세라 하여 우면산이란 이름을 붙었으며, 관문사가 위치한 곳은 길지로 손꼽히고 있다. 서울시 도시자연 공원으로 지정, 관린되고 있는 우면산은 여러 계곡에서 맑은 옹달샘이 끊임없이 흘러나오고 있으며, 울창한 산림으로 다양한 동,식물군이 자연서식하고 있어 산과 사찰이 조화롭게 어우러져 있다.

column7: 부처님오신날  손님을 모시고 갔다 떡을 받았는데 봉사하시는 분들의 따스한 온기가 느껴져 너무 행복했습니다 덕분에 맛있게 잘 먹었습니다 ~~♡

My kids and I absolutely adore this pool. It's cheap, we always have a ton of fun. Umbrellas are abundant, even on busy days it's bearable. There is one small shallow pool for babies, larger wading pool for toddlers and a huge semi shallow pool in addition to a "lazy river"

column1: There are showers, and changing facilities along with some food options.

The biggest draw for me is it's cheap and easily accessible. Entry for adults is 5,000₩ kids 6 and up are 3,000 and 5 and under is free with proof. It's also an easy walk from the subway or parking is very affordable with validation (3,200 and we were there from 11-4)
This could be a phenomenal facility.

There is a splash playground and lots of cool spraying features, but they are never on. I saw the playground on once last year and this year the only time I went I saw grass growing out of the cracks all over the playground so I doubt it's been on this summer.
The "bathrooms" are glorified port-a-potties and look like they're maybe washed once the entire season.
And to top it all off swim caps are mandatory. It used to be that they were only mandatory for the lazy river but now all the pools require it.
Despite all that it only equates to one star lost because we still have a great time and at a great price.

column7: Reasonable price
This summer from 23.6.2017 to 27.8.2017 9am-7pm 👙

column1: 물도 1 시간에 1 번씩 갈아서 위생적 이다

column7: Whole area is great! I went to a musical, but lots to do in the area- historical stuff, food stuff, and cultural stuff, as well as the fact that you're in modern, downtown Seoul. Parking is easy to get in but a pain getting out. Also, not cheap if you're not getting a discount from a restaurant or event. Subway stop is super convenient and feeds right into the musical hall and other nearby things to see! Oh- hotels in the area are pricey, and the restaurants too, but they are also delicious!

When you take the subway and get of at Gwanghwamun station and go to Exit 9, the view of Gwanghwamun Square will greet you with it's beautiful mountainous background. At this time (June 2018), there is also an event wherein some artist will do a calligraphy of famous quotes in Korean you can choose from their book. It will be given to you for free. It was a good starting point if you plan to go to Gyeongbukgong palace which is just few feet away.

it is an open and a very beautiful place in Korea,, the scenery was beautiful for photograph,, I dont know this place is new or old,, but somehow I can feel the ambience of Korea maybe in the 80's (maybe because the statue was an artifact? is it artifact? we dont know,,)

column1: other than that, we took some pictures here, and found a local korean man, finishing their duty in the military (i believe that it is mandatory for any men in Korea to join military for at least two years, do correct me if I'm wrong), they ask us to take their picture, which we gladly agreed to.

column7: Big square in northern part of town. Amazing views at night. Went to see a world cup match on the big screen here. The view was fantastic!
Re-enacting "City Hunter" can never go wrong. It's a nice place during sun and sub-par during rain. Was absolutely mental during South-Korea vs Germany during the group stage of 2018 World Cup.
Excelente experiencia sobre el arte coreano, lo realizan de una manera interactiva

우리나라 한의학의 과거와 현재 그리고 미래를 모두  경험할 수 있는 병원입니다.
최고의 한의원 입니다.
Cool

쉼박물관은 우리 전통 상여 문화를 보여주는 상여가마, 혼백을 모셔 운반했던 요여, 옛 사진자료 등을 중심으로 조상들의 죽음에 대한 해석을 재조명하는 편안한 쉼터가 되고자 설립하였다. 특히, 하늘, 땅, 불 등의 자연 삼라만상의 모습을 상상해가는 의인화시킨 목각 조형물들과 영혼을 보호하고자 제작된 용수판과 도깨비 형상들로 장식했던 우리 조상들의 삶과 죽음에 대한 철학과 해학 그리고 순수성과 예술성 등을 엿볼 수 있다. 한편, 삶과 죽음이라는 결코 가볍지만은 않은 주제를 일상에서 편히 다뤄볼 수 있도록 하고자, 설립자의 집을 전시실과 휴식처로 개조하였으며 소장품들과 현대작가들의 주제전도 다양하게 기획하여 관람객들과 편안한 의사소통을 해 나가고자 한다.
어머님같으신 관장님께서 직접 설명도 해주시고 여름에는 수박도 썰어주시는등 정겨운곳이기도 합니다 .

column7: I visited The Shoe Department & was very pleased with employees, the variety of shoes & the value of all shoes. My favorite thing about The Shoe Department is that they offer a low down layaway plan. Exceptional!

column1: 성 라우렌시오 앵베르 범 주교와 성 베드로 모방 나 신부,성 야고보 샤스탕 정 신부의 유해가 안장된 곳입니다 모방 신부는 당시 소년이었던 김대건 안드레아, 최양업 토마스, 최방제 프란치스코 등을 선발하여 마카오로 유학을 보내 최초의 조선인 신부를 양성하였습니다
한 배교자의 책략으로 앵베르 주교의 거처가 알려지자 교우들에게 화가 미칠 것을 염려하여 스스로 관헌에 나가 신앙을 고백한 후 순교 하기를 권하였습니다 1839년 세 명의 외국인 사제는 새남터에서 군 문효수형으로 순교 하셨습니다

아기자기한 걷기 코스. 야생화 군락. 운동장과 각종  구기 코트. 놀이터 게다가 최고의 시설을 갖춘 깔끔한 화장실을 갖춘 지역 명소이다.

Commonly known as a citizen park. It has two lakes with boulevard running around and in between, with a jogging course and walking trails along the lakes. There are few restaurants and coffee shops directly on the surrounding grounds as well as number of hotels with good view. Very picturesque during cherry blossom season - beginning of of April.

A must-visit park during cherry blossom, because the lake will be surrounded by pretty pinkish cherry flowers. It's recommended to stroll in the evening as it'll be illuminated... perfect for couple to have a romantic date.
Visit in the morning and checkout the cherry blossoms which was very nice. The presence of the lake is so calming and relaxing. Several people jogs in here during the morning. Seats are available.
Great place to relax or see a small performance.  Even better when there isnt too much screaming coming from Lotte World.

Honestly, this place wipes all the stress away, like a sponge. No wonder koreans make their evening eacapes here or somewhere along the Han river. April is the cherry blossom season, so it is very beautiful. Otherwise, you can just enjoy the amazing view or just go for a walk or sit on a bench. Perfect place for couples to whisper away all their thoughts. ;)

Bring a mat to sit on.  Plenty of umbrellas to sit under and get out of the sun.  Clean bathrooms and changing areas.  No food vendors so bring your own food and drinks.  Air compressors on-site to inflate water toys.  Free to Seongdong-gu residents but they've never asked me to prove residency.  Very good water park, clean and fun for kids under 10 years old as water is very shallow.  Showers on-site to clean off before departing.  The bus stop is a bit dangerous as you need to utilize a crosswalk on a blind turn with no light to stop cars travelling at 60km/hr.
You can take your children here to play with water. In addition, you and your children also can play several outdoor games here.
My best place for playing baseball!
Best place for night time baseball
A pretty Park to chill out.
Beautiful, though dangerous for kids.
역사적인 장소지만 지금은 그냥 볼품이 없는 돌다리일 뿐입니다.한양대쪽으로 조그마한 쉼터와 화장실이 있습니다.지금은 공사중이고요.조선을 세운 태조와 태종의 역사적인 만남의 흔적은 그냥 옛 얘기일 뿐이네요.
조선시대 돌다리로 지금까지 원형이 잘 보존되어 있음

이성계가 조선을 건국하고 아들 이방원이 '왕자의 난'으로 왕위에 오르자 분개한 태조 이성계는 함흥으로 간후 한양으로 돌아오지 않았다. 이는 왕위가 정상적으로 계승되지 않은 것으로 여겨질 수 있기에 신하들의 노력으로 함흥에서 태조를 함흥에서 돌아오게 하였다. 태종이 태조를 맞이하기 위해 중랑천 부근에서 기다리고 있었는데, 이를 본 태조가 태종이 있는 방향으로 활을 쏘아 올렸고 이 화살이 태종에게 채 도달하지 않고 떨어진 곳을 '살꽃이'-'살곶이'로 불리운다고 한다.
자전거 타고 건너다 다칠 수 있으니 유의하세요! 그것말고는 유적지로써 한양대와 뚝섬을 연결하는 가치 등 충분한 가치를 가지고 있습니다.

One of the nice place to enjoy spring in Seoul. It has beautiful scenery with a stretch of canola flowers cover the mainly park. Really good to take pictures here. You can freely go to here, free entry.

column1: But the bad thing is, it is rather far away from the canola park to get the store to buy some drink or snacks.

column7: Good place for walking. I recommend dinner and night time in summer. No restroom!
Nice place for walking your dogp. Be sure to leash your dog.
Nothing here. More a park for local residence.

If you visit Sevit Islands or Banpo bridge, I recommend here, Seorae Island. This island is very beautiful and near the Sevit. These days there are so many rape flowers and you can take nice pictures with them as backgroud.

I really didn't get why the place is so popular. There's nothing really special. Besides, exit from the park on some downhill paths are closed, so you have to climb back up to get out of there. The rabbits and birds are very nice though
Very peaceful and french design park with some exercices area or the big place in the middle for picnic and playing ball. Dogs are welcome. But there is a lot of rabbits so be aware in the evening !

column1: Nice spot for the sun set with a lot of nature.

column7: Great place to jog or to have a walk. Adorable rabbits are running around and workout equipments are available
Great park for kids, dogs and picnics..some rabbits run free which is a nice distraction too
Cool park in a small tree lined area, interesting trail to climb to get there.
Wonderful!
서울 서초구 양재시민의숲에 있는 윤봉길열사를 기념하는 공간. 시민들의 재충전을 위한 공간에 지배국에게 자주민족임을 지켜내기 위해 한 개인의 희생정신을 기린 공간..숲이 깊고 습기도 적당한지 청정지역에서만 자라는 이끼도 푸르게 바닥을 덮고 있었다. 청서가 사람에게 친근하게 다가오는 곳..가히 자연친화적이다.  숲에서 편히 쉬고 싶다면..그곳으로 가라.^^

Small but excellent museum with a comfortable cafe near small upscale shops & eating area.

Bridges can be on the last item of your must-visit but I made sure that I'm able to go to Mapo Bridge. As someone who can understand and read Hangul (did I really need to say that?), I wanted to see those words and sentences that they've placed at the bridge. Turns out that this bridge is a place where a lot of people have taken their lives, those sentences were placed there to give hope for those who feel hopeless.

column1: Anyway, it's a good place to look at the Han River or Hangang Park despite the number of suicide/ suicide attempts in this area.

column7: Rainbow Show gave my best friend a Cold. 0/0 would not do it again

Although I've never visited this place in person, I've spent some time researching it and its past. The 'Bridge of Life' has a beautiful view of the stars, if you stay up that late. It's a great monument in South Korea.

column1: But, it has quite a horrid past of many suicides. People jump off the bridge into the water. So ( In order to try and stop the suicides ) they put encouraging words along the railing, trying to distract you. There are also multiple Help Lines that you are able to call and reach out to.

I don't think people should rate it poorly because of the suicides. If suicide concerns you, you should be helping the Hotlines. It's offensive to mark down something because of suicides. Suicide is a real issue and we shouldn't just ignore it or brush it off.

column7: The precious time walking with my Korean bf here

It will be a good place if you would like to see a scenery of Yeouido or Han River. Since it is known for suicides, there are a lot of sentences on the rails of it. but I think it's not helpful for them.

Affordable and awesome selection. Might be tricky to navigate without a Korean speaker but certainly a positive experience hard to find elsewhere in seoul. They have a wide assortment of different kinds of jeon (meat, veggies, seafood, or fungi fried in a light batter. Basically you walk through a buffet of already cooked jeon and put what you want in a basket and you are charged by type & /or weight. They also have an assortment of makguli for very cheap prices and other korean alcoholic beverages.
With a selection like an outlet city, its tough to sample all the delicious fried foods!

Nice place to taste different types of Tempura(튀김) and Korean pancakes. You have varying options of fried vegetable & seafood to choose before taking a seat. Quite cheap price and friendly service it has as well.
Very lively place!!! Tourists, Must visit!!!
Secret Korean pancake pub. Great little slice of life in Seoul.
Naturally it's beautiful..... Nice family place

The iris gardens are obviously best when the irises are blooming, but this is a relaxing and nice looking park at any time. There is a little book cafe on the second floor of the information center, and on the first floor, from the little office on the left, is where you get free maps and stamp books for the Seoul Trail, which runs all the way around Seoul. You turn around and can start your long journey around the city right there at the first red stamp box.
Not good season in summer
Park
Unabashedly traditional, this place is untidy and a little dirty but the food is great as you're packed closely with other diners the place gets super noisy on Friday and Saturday nights.
Nice place to have Pork Feet Meat(족발) with Pork Intestines Soup(순대국). Taste is bit moderate but price is cheaper than other places. Good to visit with a group of mates.
여길 왜가서 먹나요? 이미 초입부터 냄새가 엄청나고 맛도 너무 느끼합니다. 너무 먹기 힘들어 개운하게 먹으려고 막국수 시켰는데 말라 비틀어진 막국수가 나왔음.  어쩔수없이 시키는 야식보다 못한 족발. 몇년동안 다닌 음식점중 최하위. 다신 안감.
보족세트먹었는데 보쌈은 독일산이라 그냥 그렇고요 족발은 맛있어요 양념무가 좀 달아요 ㅎ 그외 기본으로 제공되는 순대국 맛있고요 순대도 기본 순대로 괜찮아요.  참 떡볶이도 주시네요.  일하시는 분들도 바쁘신데 정말 친절합니다. 사람이 세명이하라면 그냥 족발을 추천드리고 싶어요

Achasan is a mountain which can be hiked by people who are starting out. It's of moderate difficulty. From the top whole city view can be seen. For increasing the difficulty and distance it's a good idea to start from achasan and get down towards yongmasan. It will take around 2 and a half hours to 3 hours for this course.

This is an overlooked area - I never hear of other expats coming up this way. The park is nice, with great views of the surrounding hills. The park itself has a playground, badminton courts, a fountain, climbing wall, and trails up the hill that connect to the Seoul Trail extension that circles the valley. And plenty of benches for sitting and watching the rock climbers and the trains coming and going from the station across the street.

2018.3.14.16:00 미국에서 1 년만에 귀국하자마자 일부러 이집을 찾아갔는데. 마침 여자종업원이  식사중이었음. 의자에 앉은채로 입에는 음식 한가득 집어넣고 우물우물 먹으면서 고개만 살짝돌려서 뒤에앉은 우리에게 음식주문하세요 한다.

column1: 이런제기랄. 이게손님맞는 태도인가?   열받아서 그냥나오려다  낙지볶음2 인분과조개탕을 맛도없이 반쯤먹고나옴. 마침 여자사장님이 출근해서 자초지종을  말하고 사과받았지만  너무너무실망했음.음식맛도 중요하지만 손님맞는 태도와 정성이  더중요함.
사장님. 제발 종업원들 교육철저히 하세요. 쥔없다고 손님맞는태도 정말 완전 개판입니다. 손님한테 인사도 제대로안하고  그직원 계속두면 이집 영업 망칩니다. 미국에 돌아가서 절대로  이집에 가지말라고할겁니다

Don’t be misled by pictures of multi-floored indoor gardens—that’s not part of the “spa”. The actual jjimjil spaces are very small and gets overcrowded really quickly. You could barely sit in the hottest room because it was so crowded. While there are amenities such as movie room, individual caves, book cafe, video game rentals, etc., it’s either ridiculously overpriced or so crowded that you can’t use it. The shower facilities are pretty big and nice to use—I guess people just come to the spa and camp out. It’ll sort of get the job done but not recommended.

If you expect good service, dont go here. After 40 minutes after payment, they told us that they were out of ingredients. Dont sell food in the first place if there are any shortages. Crowded place with no staffs.

It was a great experience because it had caves where you can sleep in and it had ice rooms and hot rooms but the only bad thing was that when I was sleeping it was to hot so I woke you at 6 o'clock and I constantly had to go to the ice room every minute.

column1: So next time turn the A.C. to around 21 degrees.

column7: This site offers High quality service. I recommend it instead of another hotels. It opens 24 hour. So you are in Seoul and looking for a place to sleep,  must visit here
