We really enjoyed this park! The fountains and water features are really unique and relaxing. The kids all love the splash ground (it does get really crowded mid-day when it's hot out, so be mindful if you're bringing a younger child). Our favorite though was the Olympic fountain music and light show in the evening. Such a fun free activity for the whole family. Plus, the park is really pretty all lit up, especially the torches.
This park adds some beautiful greenspace to downtown Atlanta.

column1: One end of it has a nice playground for kids. Between the center of the park and the other end, there is a fountain with the shapes of Olympic rings that kids enjoy playing in. But the fountain seemed little different from other fountains I've seen elsewhere. Only by looking at the base of the fountain did I recognize the Olympic ring shapes. Still, it's a nice touch.
Educational plaques at various places around the park provide information about the Olympics and other things. I enjoyed reading those, but persons less interested in history might not.
An amphitheater is located near one end of the park (the end farthest from the playground).
A concession stand in the park offers snacks and drinks, and it even has a small amount of indoor seating. But it was closed when I walked by it late Tuesday afternoon, May 15, 2018.

The park offers a nice place to enjoy nature in a sense in the downtown area. And it is conveniently located near several downtown attractions such as the Center for Civil and Human Rights, the Aquarium, the World of Coca-Cola, the College Football Hall of Fame, and CNN studios.
The Atlanta streetcar has a stop across the street from the park. MARTA also has stops nearby.
I urge persons in the downtown area to take a few minutes, or perhaps an hour, to walk through the park and enjoy it.

column7: Great place to sit in the sun, have a snack at the food stand, and run through the water fountain. We have visited thisnplaceany time with our grand kids, they love it. There's always new friends for them to meet and play with. You can also bring a blanket and have a picnic in the grass. There's a huge area for chilling. It's located in walking distance from the Ga. Aquarium and Coke museum

Nice place, especially the Olympic fountain, great for kids on a hot day. But lots of homeless and really, not much of anything else. Nice to look at and walk around but I won't go out of my way next time I'm in town.

This is beyond the best public park to visit in Atlanta. A must see having so many beautiful trees, seating areas, and water sites. There's always people from different walks of life enjoying the park .

Foreigners maybe think to be just one of the squares, but it is a special place for Koreans.   First of all it is a capital city of the Republic of Korea, it means the center of the Republic of Korea.

column1: Many democratization protests have been held in the process of democratization of the Republic of Korea, and sometimes cultural festivals and concerts are held for citizens.
Since 2002 Korea World Cup, millions of citizens enjoyed the festival, cheering for soccer in the square.
In the winter season, ice rinks are built and citizens are enjoy skating.

column7: The ice skating only open for a month in every year which is winter time only. You can skate for a cheap price which is only 1,000￦ for 1 hour. It's okay even if you don't really know how to skate since most of the people that went here are the same.
it's an okay place to go but the ice rink is smaller than a hockey rink. Which I think is then a bit disappointing? Nonetheless I had a good time
Lots of fun. Need to be careful with the ice though, some rough spots
Great activity. Inexpensive and invaluable.

Definitely one of my favorite shows all over the world! They showcased funny jokes coupled with acrobatics, dances, and music using cooking utensils and kitchen wares (plus real cooking action) The show has no real dialogue (except for some punch lines) so anyone from across the globe can understand (the humor, is also easily understandable and very funny!). 5 stars!

Very good show and very funny. Good for the whole family. The theatre is only 5 minutes walk from metro Hotel.  The theatre is not too big and sit closer to the aisle for a chance to be invited to the stage
So much fun to watch. Definitely worth the see. If you can soring for it, sit next to stage. Might get pulled up to participate

This place is amazing... It's a combination of my kitchen rules, Jackie Chans latest and so you think you can dance 😂 best show I've seen in a long time... Great audience participation... Get ready to clap... Afterwards there is great street food outside and several fantastic shopping streets right outside the theatre door... Your not allowed to use cameras inside so my pictures aren't great... You'll love the show 😁

Fun and entertaining. Still got a good laugh after the second visit in 5 years. This is not Paris or New York theater shows, so don't come here if you expect to see that kind of shows. But if all you want is to have a good laugh with friends and your kids without much thinking and having to be art literate, just come and enjoy the shows, it's worthed.

Made a reservation at Korea House after reading reviews about it. You can enjoy traditional Korean cuisine here. However, the price point is significantly higher. I had a meal for 47000 won. There was seafood, including crab stew. Even though the portions of the food was small, by the time I was done with the courses, I was full. I would say that the food isn't super amazing as you would get at the food carts. But it has a more elegant taste, that makes it taste good.
Amazing traditional korean food. Great place as the building itself is very traditional. Heard that they have some performance but I didn't watch. A bit on the pricey side though.
Great tasting menu for vegetarian. Of course, i would add a little more variety - as most dishes were mushroom based

column1: Ambience wise quite old world. Look up and admire the wood work and paintings.

column7: nice welcoming. beautiful historical place where many traditional weddings are celebrated
Very good and decent food, but the eating time is limited to 1.5 hours only. Seems to rush to enjoy this fine dining set.
1893년 샤무엘 무어 선교사님이 설립한 교회 ^&*
좋은교회

Fantastic experience. Really great facility with tons of options. Really easy to navigate as a foreigner who doesn't speak Korean as well! Prices are also very reasonable. Metro accessible from Seoul Station.

Great place!!! I wish to visit this place everyday if I could. Very friendly and awesome service. Friendly to foreigners, friendly for people with tattoos. The workers there were very nice and welcoming. Quite cheap too especially for all the services they provide. Definitely will go back if I visit Seoul again.

Confusing but after you get the hang of it, it's very simple and nice. Not crowded on the weekdays. I recommend not to be afraid of being naked in front of everyone. Tbh no one cares about you. The hot tub is so warm and nice to stay in the shower. There are many type too.

column1: If you are not here for shower, you still can go for Karaoke, table tennis, gym, or just sleeping in some rooms above. Great place, highly recommended.

column7: The location is fine. There is a foot bridge to arrive. The Spa itself is foreigner friendly. Everything got English instructions. Although the place seems very local and popular, it is much cleaner and tidier than I thought. The hot spring and spa is super comfortable for night travelers to relax. There are lots of facilities in the building like canteen, gym, karaoke, reading zones etc, even charging lockers for foreigners! Great variety of food to choose in the canteen but please but reminded that, you have to pay in cash for food and drinks. Other expenses are calculated with your locker number when you leave. The local people are so quiet in the sleeping zone even if they are not sleeping. They are much polite than I thought. The best and most impressive thing is the paid body rubbing service in the bathing zone. It gives you a refreshing feeling afterward which made my day.
Good place to hangout. As a foreigner i will come bk to visit again next time for sure. Good experience. Went during summer when its ard 40 degree.

Nice place to spend a few hours. The entrance fee is 12,000 won. You can add additional services like massage and body scrub if you like. After 12 hours or certain time, they charge you additional fees. There are a few different saunas at different temperatures in the unisex area as well as an ice room. There's also a common room where people lay on the ground and have some snacks or drinks. The women's only area has lockers to keep your stuff and a shower area with different baths that contain herbs and other medicinal stuff at different temperatures. You can also swim in their outdoor pool if you bring your swimsuit and there's also a restaurant and game room. You can definitely spend a day here.

As someone who remembers the first time this opened nearly a decade ago, it was a shock to see how utterly miserable the place has become. I understand things can get old, but the owners seemed to have given up. Broken ceilings, leaky walls, broken faucets and broken doors - none fixed in time. VERY dirty floors full of sticky residue from god knows what - my feet were soot black after walking around for 2-3 hours. Dust and yuck everywhere in the corners - clearly this place relies on foreign tourists who will visit here once and never come back. Because of the good location and the presence of swimming pools, they know they can get away with it. STAY AWAY if you care about personal hygiene, seriously!

***Worst of the worst. Very dirty and very rude. Please please do not come here. I'm regretting so much for coming in. Double the price and very bad service. If you want to experience Korean sauna culture, please go somewhere else where there are many Koreans use. They will be nice to you. This place has lots of foreigners and is very rude to foreigners. Again, very expensive and very rude and very dirty. Never recommend. Come if you are willing to waste your money and time.***

Went there and had an okay time. The clothes they give you smell musty and the bathrooms smelled atrocious, but the saunas and food were okay. Then as I went to check out, I didn’t know that you couldn’t wear your shoes in the shoe cubby area. Lady at the front desk proceeded to scream at me in Chinese (I am not Chinese) then she screamed at me in Korean but I couldn’t hear her very well and walked over to hear her, which by then it was too late. She then continued to call me annoying and stupid to my face, unknowing that I spoke Korean. The other people at the front desk did not admonish her or care that she was cursing to my face, meaning they allow this to happen frequently. Rudest service I was ever given and I am extremely dissatisfied with how the staff treat their patrons. Extremely unprofessional and unfriendly towards foreigners. I highly dissuade foreigners from coming here, they will treat you like dirt.

Interesting place to visit. Initial payment for entry. Firstly shoes in the first locker. Then move to the Floor for Women 3F or Men 5F and changed into their provided top & shorts. There are just one sauna, different rooms are set at different temperature for you to select which suites you. Many other types of room to try our are ready fun. My like to Finland cold room.
Nice place, good location, quiet place, easy going, tasty breaking, not expensive...
Traditionelle koreanische Pension, sehr zu empfehlen! So gestaltet, dass man wie im Korea von 1800 lebt. Keine Betten, das gehört dazu ;)

column1: Frühstück wird einem aufs Zimmer gebracht. Netter ruhiger Innenhof zum Relaxen. Mit kleinem Cafe zu super Preisen (zB Espresso 1€). Supermarkt und italienisches Restaurant direkt nebenan. Ubahn ca. 5-10 Minuten entfernt.
Preis in Ordnung, 60€/Nacht für ein Doppelzimmer mit Frühstück!
Insgesamt sehr zu empfehlen (für ein paar Tage)

column7: 친절
수영, 헬스, 골프 및 각종 레크리에이션 교육이 이뤄지고 있음
좋아요
강남에서 살아남은 최대규모 스포츠센터. 좀 부족해도 제일 낫다.
가장 쾌적한 운동시설. 특히 수영장이 좋음.
가격빼고 훌륭한 곳. 스쿼시 코트도 2개 있어요^^
주차와 수영장 헬스장 골프연습장을 겸비한 스포츠 콤플렉스 입니다.

A bit expensive but has almost everything you need. From squat racks to treadmills, there is a variety of machines. The treadmills are all connected to their own individual TV for use if you bring your OWN earphones. Massage machine is great for postworkout.

column1: The fitness center offers free a spinning class which is a great exercise and introduction for everyone interested in spinning.
The swimming pool is 25 meters long with 4 lanes. There are variety of classes for different skillsets of swimmers for all ages. There is always at least 1 lane for free swimming.
The fitness center also has zumba, yoga, and racket sports.
Also has a small restaurant for quick meal if you're short on time.
The entire venue is underground and there is an elevator that takes you directly to the center next to the coffee shop.

column7: Good
수영장에 갔는데 사람도 좋았던거 같아요. 수영복도 빌려주고 진짜 감사드립니다

column1: 가격 수영 3시간 15000원. 맨 마지막 시간에 가면 놀수있음

column7: 시설이 괜찮고 지하철이랑 가까워 접근성이 좋습니다 일하시는 분들도 대부분 친절하세요~
전문강사들이 친절하고 오랫동안 운동하신 분들이 많아 가족같음
수영장이 매우 낡음.

column1: 관망대 에어컨이 고장인데 수리 안하고 방치함.

column7: Outstanding location adjacent to Itaewon station! Good rooms, with a bidet toilet and good, helpful amenities for travelers. Decent gym w/free access. Close to all the nightlife of Itaewon. Cheap too - we paid $60/night.

The hotel was nice and clean. Good location to eatery, shopping and tiub. However it can be pretty noisy from the nearby clubs. I would give it a 5 star but decided only 4 because it charges hotel guests for using the swimming pool.

The hotel was fantastic, every staff member was extremely helpful and happy while they helped. The hotel is in a great area, close to entertainment, transportation, lots of options for dining and shopping locations. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Itaewon

Good value for the price. No issues with cleanliness or location (subway entrance is steps from the front door). One star off because there was a nightclub right outside our window and even with it shut, it was incredibly loud all night. The hotel staff are aware of this and will provide ear plugs at request.
Overall comfortable accommodation.

column1: Spacious but cozy room and bathroom, affordable rates, friendly staff and clean facilities all around. Standard amenities included, plus the heated bathroom mirror was a nice touch!

Free luggage check to our convenience (really helpful) and staff was there to make suggestions and give help on how to get around and what to visit. Service was great, although we didn't ask for a lot.

The district the hotel is located in is great for tourists and visitors, with great nightlife (till morning) and a variety of shops, restaurants and bars. Very lively (and lovely) neighborhood for all kinds of groups or taste.
The hotel is really hard to miss, a prominent building in a busy area, and there's a subway station right out the hotel's door, so it's really easy to get around.
All in all, a great experience and would definitely consider staying there again! I would also recommend it to anyone interested in visiting Itae-won (or even Seoul in general)!

column7: For budget travellers and want to have a good scrub down and if you're female, this is the place to be. 14K won for the first 12 hours no matter the time. Body immediately feels relaxed. Staff doesn't speak much English but are helpful, especially the front desk. Best to read up about what to do first before entering if you're a first timer. Probably not a good place to sleep if you're not used to sleeping in a crowd on the floor.
Food is good, condition of the interior is okay, service is quite rude and not very welcoming. If you come here for massage I recommend not because it’s very hurting!

Staffs speak a little bit of English so that's good. The spa is women-only, pretty clean. I went there on a Sunday, admission was 14,000 won per person and massage was 30,000 won for 30 mintues. You can stay up to 12 hours, each additional hour is 1000 won. Sauna and spa close at midnight and reopen at 2pm, of course you can spend a night there, they have floor mattresses and blankets. Perfect backpackers! Not necessary but I recommend bringing a toothbrush, clean underwear, and shampoo!
Perfect place to relax and give your body a rest. Food on 3F is great. Just go out from Exit 5 Sinsa station and go straight. 14k won is a good deal for such relaxation
Amazing experience! Relaxing and rejuvenating.
It's ok, if you like malls you can come here, they have some cool clothes. But don't expect it to be extraordinary
Thousands of small clothes shops in build. cheap and various designed clothes. clean and nice food courts. a lot of shop and restaurants  offer 2hours free parking.
Unique building, has many local fashion outlet, recommended for gift / snack seeker from Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, cause there's famous shop named Arirang Shop
Majority of shopping is geared to feminine products and features high end luxury products.

If you are from Malay country (Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei), you can visit the Arirang Shop, they sell Korean Souvenir, and the most important is, the Seller can speak Bahasa so you’ll not lost in translation 😁
주차장이 완전 좁고 주차안내해주시는분 넘 불친절 합니다~~차없이 가기엔 등산이구~~
올라가다 숨넘어가는줄..  ㅠㅅㅠ
가 봤는데 큰 재미와 흥미가 별루 없어서 다시는 안 가고 싶어요.

Worth a visit! A peaceful and resting place in vivid Seoul. The park is a great place to enjoy a walk either with the family or more lonely. You can also jog, but I would recommend to attend earlier in the day. Nice path through trees, view on the Olympic stadium... I had a great time.
Huge park to go for a quick sightseeing. Drop by the alone tree for a photoesque site. You will see free roaming rabbits here!

Lovely park in any season. I recently went here to run the 89th Seoul Marathon 10K. It has numerous things to do and enjoy within and around the park. Take your time to visit this huge park on a sunny day in spring. You will love it and make good memories here!
This huge park is so incredibly breathtaking, I felt at peace just by being present and appreciating nature. There are also gym stops with equipment, where you can do a small workout.

I dream about this park, if ever there was a successful post Olympics venue this is it, massive rolling lawns, fantastic events, and art thrown around the place like it's no one's business. One could easily spend days here at what I would consider the earliest of parks. Oh did I mention the entrance? It's spectacular, an engineering achievement.

As all galleries go, some artists work is better or not than others. I've seen some fantastic work at this gallery from time to time. I respect Doosan Gallery very much because not only do they seek out and display many talented artists, they also provide a scholarship to promote new and promising artists.
Ghourri Smart Art
전시가 미래다 두산
Nice temple, easy hike. If you go just a bit further up, you get a beautiful view of seoul from the peak above.
It takes only about 20 min to go up from Samsung holy place.

If you get all the way to the temple, take a short walk south to reach a lifted wooden walkway. There are free-to-use toilets (with perhaps less people than the temple), plenty of benches to rest, a small library with books to read, and you can get into the tree level.

column1: It takes about 10 minutes to go and you can either go more from there or you can come back to climb up 호엄산.

column7: Close to go
금천구에서 유명한 사찰.

column1: 걸어서 올라가려면 노약자 분들은 힘들 수도 있을 정도로 조금 높은곳에 위치.
산 아래 금천구가 한눈에 보이며, 비행기가 지나가는 위치로 큰 비행기 배밑이 한눈에 훤히 보일정도로 가깝게 날아간다.
규모는 작지만, 있을것은 다 있는 절이다.

column7: 도심의 화려한 곳은 아니지만 결코 뒤지지 않습니다  아담한 대웅전 산신각등이 있고 약사여래불 지장보살님을 모신곳이 있어요 개인이 집중해서 기도할수 있으니 마음을 가다듬고 싶을때 찾으면 좋아요 다만 현충원정문에서 걸어서는 다소 힘이드는 거리이니 참고하시도록...가을에는 정말 좋은 분위기입니다
현충원 약수터 에서 물도좋고
동작동 국립현충원 벛꽃 목련 진달래가 흐드러지  피었읍니다
가을 단풍이 물들어 있어 경치가 더 이쁨
전철을이용하면 당고개역에서 도보로30분정도 차량을 이용하시면 절입구까지 가실수 있고 500년된 소나무있어  소나무 기운을 받으시고 절입구에 귀막고 입막고 눈막고3년 이면 해탈~  사람들이  분비지않아 상당히 조용한절입니다~

걸어갈 생각으로 차를 초입부분에 세웠는데,  올라가는 내내 모기와 썩은 더러운 냄새로  고생했습니다. 다 올라가서는 더 실망~!! 찾아온 이가 아무도 없었고,(주말이었으나 그 흔한 등산객도 이 절은 피하는 듯한 느낌을 받았습니다.) 코끼리며 학이 장식품처럼 놓여져 있는데 저는 무섭기까지 했습니다. 왠지 서늘한 기운이 들어 대웅전은 가보지도 않고 발길을 돌렸습니다. 조계종 소속 사찰이 맞는가 싶었습니다. 다시는 찾고 싶지 않습니다.
소박하고 예쁜 절
비구니 고찰입니다
힐링
유서 깊은 고찰이 가까운 곳에 있었음.
Cool temple that is worth going to if you are hiking up the mountain. It's nothing much different than other Korean temples but it has a nice view and the usual nice architecture and artwork.
Beautiful temple on the way up to the Dobong Mountain.
Fantastic place to hike, crowded on weekends, but lovelly viewas and very relaxing
Beautiful temple on the way to Dobongsan.
늦은 오후 적막감에 휩싸인 산사는 모든것을 내려놓고 잠시 쉴수 있는 최적의장소....
It' my hometown of Philosophy.
This temple is good place to rest for everyone.
조용하고 깨끗한 사찰! 절에서 내려다 보는 서울 시내 모습이 최고!
북한산.숲속에.조용한(산사)

Great inspiration for me visiting Namsangol Hanok Village, portraying simple and peaceful traditional house living in Seoul, Korea. You could experience photo taking in this place in "hanbok" (Korea traditional costume).
Best picture time is around sunset
서울에 이런 곳이! 너무 예쁘고 멋지네요~

column1: 행사때문에 저녁에 살짝 들렀는데, 낮에도 가봐야겠어요. :)

column7: 10월 마지막주 토요일까지매주 열리는 남산국악당 야시장. 매주 색다른 테마로 열리는 야시장에 한번 다녀가세요
Agréable visite, petit donc rapidement visité mais tout de même beau a voir.

I really enjoy coming here because they always have some quirky and trendy exhibition going on, drawing a younger crowd. Many of the workers are voluntary students as well which makes it more approachable and charges the area with a youthful energy. They also have a large arts, crafts and design shop, and an arts bookstore on the second floor I believe.

The lower level of this place is a wonderful spot to see independent films.  Probably a good idea to make reservations, though, as they seem to sell out most shows.  Note that shows start exactly at the stated time.

column1: There is a stationary shop on the ground level.  There are art spaces elsewhere in the building, but I haven't visited.

column7: EDIT: They are open again. As good as before.

column1: It used to be a nice shop for gifts. However, they are closed now. Not sure if this is temporary or if they will open again after renovations.

column7: Best place to find unique stationary and home bits. There is a coffee shop on the third floor that served one of the best coffees I had in seoul. Definitely coming back!
Very nice design producta from stationary to little pieces of furniture.
예전에는 비구니 승려들이 계셨는데 비구승이 계시네요.
강아지 누렁이가 귀여워요
마음을 내려놓는 곳
Tried night hike with a meetup group. My photos are not good as the ones taken by S company's newest model. The view from the top let you forget about the sweat you shed along the way.

This mountain close to the palaces is a great place for a pleasant and not very difficult hike. The view from the top is great. You have a panoramic view of Seoul which together with the walk along the city hall is worth the efort.

These are from the trails on the East side of the mountain.  Very easy walk up.  Blue trail is stroller friendly and Red trail gives a nice hike and views.  Both trails lead to a great observation point overlooking Seoul.
Nice spot to hike if you don’t wanna drive long.

We took Inwangsan hillside by accident, We went to see Gyeongbokgung but it was close every tuesday we look around and saw a little trail up the hill in the background didn't knew is was Inwangsan hill, decided to see if there was a trail up the hill, on our way there was lot's of café shops, restaurants and we found this small burger place just before the trail starts that made some delious brugers and fries. Found out there's three peak on Inwangsan hil, you can take all three peak's if you are in good shape we took the first peak, along the trail you can look down to some amazing view's it only gets better the higher you go, getting to the top can be a bit dangerous so always go with some friends there are medical staff going up and down the trail should you injure yourself. Pick a sunny day to go and don't forget water and snacks and enjoy the journey, highly recommeded.
원통사에서 내려다보는 풍경이 예술입니다. 해발 약 400고지로 노원구, 도봉구, 강북구, 중랑구는 가깝게 내려다보이고 미세먼지 없는 날은 관악산 연주대, 롯데월드타워, 남산 멀리 팔당까지 보입니다~ 서울 동북, 동남, 남양주, 구리까지 보이는 명소입니다~
신라시대 창건한 천년고찰.
아무나 가지마라. 소원이 통한다
적당한 높이에 있는 조용한 장소.
가는 산책로가 아름다움.절 뒤편으로는 암벽이 절경을 이루고 있음.
절  치고는 괜찮음 주지스님도 좋고 절다니시는분들에게 적극추천함
절이 보존이 잘 되어있다.
북한산 멋져요!!
자주 오고 싶은 곳
힘들어유
불교사찰
전철당고개역에서 도보로 1시간정도 소요되고

column1: 차량이용시 학림사까지 올라오셔서 주차하시고30분정도 도보로 올라가시면되고요  용굴암은 명성황우 께서 잠시 피신했던곳입니다 사람들이 분비지않고 조용한 절입니다

column7: 신라태부터 전래된 고찰임 .

column1: 옛부터 영험하신  전설들이 많은 가피와 자비 보살님으로 유명하다.

column7: 마애불이 유명하다. 작지만 정감가는 사찰
작은사찰이지만 서울시내에 조용한편이고 예쁜편.

column1: 석가탄신일직전에 갔던지라 메인등이 안켜져있어서 아쉬웠던 기억.

column7: 천년고찰 옥천암. 작지만 산과 물 이야기가 있는 정감있는 사찰 입니다.^^
옥천암 마애좌상 (백의관음상) 이며 약 5미터 이며 고려 12-13세기 양식이라네요.보관을 쓰셨으며 전실안에 모셔져 있습니다.

column7: 만월암은 신라 문무왕 때 창건했다고 전해지는 도봉산 만장봉 중턱에 있는 전통사찰입니다.  큰 바위 밑에 자그맣게 자리잡고 있고 근처에 석굴암, 천축사가 있음. 도봉구, 노원구, 중랑구, 남양주까지 보이는 전망이 좋습니다.

이름도 모르고 지남
Small Sized Buddhist Temple immersed between Mountains
Has traditional Korean architecture, fairly nice but seeing the palaces and larger temples would be more worthwhile.

매년 초파일 방문장소. 주차장을 재구성하여 좋아졌다.

column1: 다른 관악산과 같은 삼막사나 연주암과 같은절은 매주일 마다
점심을 등산객들에게 봉사를 하고 있는데 여기 우면산의 대성사는 얼마나 야박한지 저 아래 입구서 부터 차단기를 만들어서 차량진입을 못하게 합니다 예술의전당은 새벽부터 오전 10시까지는 주차장을 새벽 산행객들에게 무료로 개방을 하고 있는데 여기 대성사는 새벽시간에도 공휴일이에도 넓은 주차공간이 있지만 주민들에게 너무 인색하게 합니다
해서 자주 인근 주민들과 그리고 방문객들과 마찰과 충돌을 빗습니다

column7: Absolutely beautiful art on the buildings.   Recommend at least a quick visit.

대각사는 서울시 종로구 창덕궁 후원 앞 방향에 위치하고 있는 재단법인 대각회의 사찰로서, 1911년 용성진종대종사가 창건하였다. 대각회는 불교포교단체의 하나로 석가모니불의 대각불교사상을 선포하여 민족번영의 원리로 발전시킨 용성 스님의 대각사상을 선도하며 이에 필요한 시설을 유지 경영함을 목적으로 1968년 자운 스님 등에 의하여 기존의 대각사를 중심으로 설립되었다.대한민국 구석구석, 한국관광공사
독립운동 역사가 고스란히 남아있는 곳! 종로3가에 나오신다면 그냥 지나치지 마시고 잠시 역사를 되돌아보는 시간을 만들어 보시면 좋을 것 같네요.
돈화문로에서 종묘 옆, 서순라길의 중간 지점
마음이 절로 고요함을 느끼는 독립운동의 성지
좋은 절이지만 올라가는 길들이 모두 경사가 심하고 제대로된 안전장치가 없어 노약자분들이나 장애인분들이 접근하시기 어렵습니다. 또한 차가 다닐 수 있는 길이 있고 절 앞에 주차장이 작게 있으나 경사 등 안전상 문제에 유의하셔야합니다. 어느 날 어느 시간에 제공되는지는 정확히 모르겠으나 밴으로 셔틀을 운영하는 것도 같습니다.
산...물...모두 우수합니다
절집 분들이 친절하시고 관리가 잘 되어있어 늘 깔끔하며 서울 시내를 조망할 수 있는 산책로가 잘 되어있음
경사가 심해서 차량 없이 접근하기 어렵지만 .. ㅠ 산책로에서 달마사로 들어가는 길은 있네요 예상보다 규모가 큽니다
숨은 한강 불꽃놀이 명당! 불꽃놀이 아니더라도 풍경 좋고 절도 작고 이쁩니다. 석양이 정말 멋진 곳!

북한산 입구에서 약 이삼십분 걸어 올라가면 조용하고 한적한 내원사에 다다릅니다. 주지스님을 자주 뵈었는데 오늘은 사찰경내에 아무도 안계시네요.목어 법고 범종 운판이 함께 있습니다.여느절도 마찬가지지만 평일에 가시면 정말 좋습니다. 내려오실때는 경사가 급해서 무릎안좋으신분들은 서서히 발을 내딛으며 보폭을 짧게해서 내려오면 좀 낫습니다. 멧돼지 출몰하기도 합니다

Great temple stay experience. There's an English program and a Korean program so you don't have to worry about not understanding what's going on. Everyone st the temple is very warm and welcoming and does their best to help you or answer your questions. Also the view of Seoul is amazing.
The very fotress of natural beauty surrounded by mountains in Seoul, Bibong(Bukhansan)

column1: From Cave to garden, offering diverse prayer-experience
High up on the mountain with the overview of Seoul with only 10 min hiking
Very humble, but cozy and relaxing
Accommodating & well-trained staff ready to serve you during the temple stay program
I highly recommend Geumseonsa for you overnight stay in Seoul with truely unique experience of Korean Buddhist Culture :)

column7: The temple stay was great. Our host was excellent with good English, and the experience of staying in a Buddhist temple with outstanding views was incredible. If you're not super keen on temple food bring a snack.
몇년전에는 서울의 아름다운 절로 선정된 장소

column1: 여기 알게된 계기는 故 정원스님 돌아가시고 장례식 참석하여 마지막 가는길까지 화장을 보내드리고 마지막 안치장에는 금선사에 찾아와서 알고보니 서울의 조용한 절이고 아름다운 절입니다.
그 이외에 가보면 좋습니다. 목정굴은 여름에 꽤 시원한 편이고요. 그 이외에 풍경과 사찰 환경은 모두 평균적으로 좋습니다.
그리고 제가 등산가기전이나 등산후에 들리는 절이죠.
아무튼 저에겐 일요일날에는 수원에서 금선사까지 일상의 장소이죠.

column7: 북한산자락 구기동방면에 자리잡은 절집으로 그 자태가 꽤나 아름답다.  절 내부에 작은 굴이 있고 굴 내부에 불상을 안치해 기도처로 쓰고 있으며 굴을 통해 절집 안팎으로 드나들 수도 있다. 김선분선생님을 비롯한 여러 선생님들이 봉안되어 계신절이라 찾게된다.
유서깊은 고찰입니다
정릉천과 숲이 어울어져 풍광이 좋고 교통편도 좋아 방문하기 편리함
조용한. 정릉에 산책할 만한 조용한 절.
慶国寺の住職友人です。今回初めてお寺に寄せてもらい、いいお寺でした。
보물로 지정된  목각탱 (목각아미타여래설법상)이 있습니다.정릉에 오시면 자장율사가 창건했다고 하는 경국사에 들러서 꼭보세요.
This is the place for couples!!!

column1: all the couples are in here!!
But the night seeing is so so beautiful
you can have some beers and chicken in here

column7: If the air in Seoul Korea good, are there no better place to having a family picnic.
Only place where you can enter inside a submarine and 2 war ships for just 3000krw(2.75 usd).
When you guys come to seoul, You have visit  here.
Romance and relex
효창공원에 처음 가봤다.. 몰랐던 역사에 대해서 조금이나마 제대로 알고싶다.. 대한민국 사람이라면 누구나 가봐야 하는곳이라 생각한다..
훌륭한 우리 민족의 지도자에 대하여 다시 한번 상기 할 수 있는 좋은 기회를 가졌습니다 아울러 추가로 더 많은 분들의 업적이 계속해서 추천되고 교육 되었으면 더 좋을 것 같습니다 예를 들면 이동녕 같은 분은 비교해 보면 적은 기념사업이 좀 아쉽습니다
한국의 독립운동사, 김구선생님의 일생, 그중에서도 중국에서의 임시정부역사를 볼 수 있어 좋았습니다.
주차장 있음. 산책할 수 있는 공원이 있음. 건물이 깨끗~
처음 가봤어요. 컨텐츠가 풍부한 기념관은 아니지만 효창공원에 있는 다른 기념 장소 삼의사 등과 함께 역사의 숨결을 느끼면 새삼 숙연해져요. 20세기 초 그 흉험한 시절에도 어찌 그리도 굳게 살아갔는지 새삼 지금의 삶을 투덜대는 것이 부끄럽네요
Очень интересно. Хозяин познакомит с выставкой, угостит чаем и сфотографирует на прощание.

들어가는 순간 고대 유물에 압도당한다. 전시용 부엉이가 아니라 생활용품으로 만들어진 부엉이들을 전시한 곳이다. 과거의 인간이 부엉이에 대해 어떻게 생각하고 부엉이모양의 생필품, 혹은 물건을 만들었는지 들을 수 있다. 역사공부를 하고 가면 좋다. 사진은 반드시, 반드시 지정된 곳만 찍어야 한다. 값을 매길 수 없는 물건이니까 최대한 사진이 아닌 실물로 봤으면 좋겠다.
C 조그마한 가정집을 개조한 조그마한 박물관이지만, 관장님의 엄청난 수집에 놀람. 부엉이와 관련된 많은 것들이 있으며, 입장시 음료수 제공
매우 특이한 곳 하지만 아직 들어가보진 못했네요
직원들이 너무친절 합니다
동국대학교 앞 종이나라박물관... 오늘은 스쳐가고 다음번엔 확실히 방문해 볼께요...^^
특별함이 없네요
박물관은 특별히 볼만한게 없음
종이접기에 대한 체험이 가능해요

Have been here a few times for several exhibitions. There are three floors, all packed with stuff to see. Right now, it is showing Coco Capitan. There is a cafe to take a rest before and after the viewings, and a souvenirs shop to buy stuff for the exhibition and for Daelim museum. The docent seemed very enthusiastic about the explanation of the works. There is a guide every hour.
Favourite museum in Seoul! Interesting displays. However might need to have a Korean guide sometimes to fully appreciate them

Potent little collection of great paper art stuffs and installation.  The neatly detailed architecture is worth the visit alone.  Bought a bag full of cool paper toys in the gift shop.  And the cafe, in an old mansion, shouldn't be missed.
Great museum. Interesing exhibitions. We were just lucky there wasn't a crowd when we went.
Usually nice modern exhibitions. Small, so maybe try going during the week.
Especially good place for elementary schoolers. Well organized and you can explore the many variety of natural things from rocks to space. Very educational place. I highly recommend it.
I took my two year old on a weekday and we had a blast. Not a lot of parking, so get there early.
Great place for kids!They have coffee shop but no restaurant. Better bringing your own food.

So much history & excellent exhibits

column1: This war museum in Seoul South Korea was such a great experience!

I went there in December 2015 on a business trip & I was amazed at how well put together the exhibits are. A few of them are audio-visual & interactive. They do a great job at educating foreigners like myself & locals alike of this trying time in South Korean history.
Definitely recommended to go there at least once

column7: A must-see if you’re in Seoul. It’s a great memorial/museum. Lots of military hardware displayed outside. It’s very cool if you’re into that sort of thing. You can pretty much sit in/on most of the military gear. Great for photos. And the museum part of it is also very cool. Lots of history and historical significance of the most recent wars that have shaped this peninsula. I think the admission is free if I remember it correctly.

This museum is free of charge and is huge as well. It also offers a good explanation on Korean history for a newcomer like me, which was nice. I wouldn't necessarily call it a "children friendly museum", but then again I don't have kids. I also assume that the target audience is adults and not children so it really doesn't matter.

column1: All in all this is a great museum for people interested in Korea. We visited this museum before we did a day trip to the DMZ. This was very helpful as we understood a lot more of the tour guides explanation.

column7: **** THE GOOD:

column1: We went during a super hot summer day, on a Monday when the museum was CLOSED for the day (every Monday, plus maybe Sunday).
We were able to walk through the outside of the large granite buildings, and also walked through the outdoor exhibit of military equipment, like tanks, artillery, jets, etc.
I can only imagine what the inside was like, but the scale of the entire museum grounds was super impressive.
I walked around the “ring of honor” style placates, commemorating the different countries that sent soldiers to Korea to fight (and die) during the “conflict”, aka “war”.

I was surprised (or not really) that France sent a pitifully small number of soldiers (like 700 soldiers) while other much smaller and less developed countries sent so many more.  Haha.  Just a joking jab again the French!

Based on the super impressive scale of the grounds, and because I’m personally interested in old-fogey things like war museums, I would definitely go back on a non-Monday and also when the weather is cooler.

column7: The War Memorial of Korea (free entry) is an important attraction dedicated to the Korean War which raged over the Korean Peninsula during the early 1950s. There are six themed halls and a large outdoor exhibition area where you can spend several hours learning about the Korean conflict. Note the museum is closed on Mondays.

column1: As you approach the War Memorial, you will see several large outdoor monuments which set the stage for a educational it not sombre experience of visiting an attraction like this. There are also numerous military vehicles, planes, vessels, equipment in the outdoor exhibition area that are worth spending time to view before or after you enter the monument to explore the halls within.

Exhibition rooms do a good job of presenting the war in a mixed variety of ways and medium; traditional text and figurative displays, cased displays, wall maps, sounds of the war and even 4D experience of MacArthur's landing at Inchon. In this manner, there is a nice effort to make the memorial as accessible as possible to a younger audience, who might not enjoy traditional war and military museums.

At the War Memorial you will find expected lockers, a cafe and gift shop at the War Memorial of Korea but no wifi, unlike the various national museums you can visit around Seoul. Photography is allowed throughout as well. You can easily spend 2-3 hours here leisurely going through the exhibition halls learning about the Korean War.

We very much appreciated our latest visit to the War Memorial of Korea. This is one of those attractions that can have a real impact on visitors, a place you want to return to during future trips to Seoul.

column7: Fun exhibition when we visited

2000년 12월 15일 문을 열었다. 프레시움(Presseum)이라고도 불리며, 이는 신문 또는 언론을 뜻하는 프레스(press)와 박물관을 뜻하는 뮤지엄(museum)의 합성어이다. 전시품 600여 점을 비롯해 5,000여 점의 언론 자료를 소장하고 있으며 신문역사관·미디어영상관·기획전시관 등으로 구성되어 있다. 그 중 신문역사관은 신문의 어제와 오늘을 다룬 테마관으로, 다시 신문의 역사관, 신문과 사회관, 신문과 문화관의 3개 소주제관으로 나뉘어 각종 관련자료가 전시되어 있다.

column1: 미디어영상관에는 글래스비전, 신문제작 체험 등의 코너가 있어 관람객이 능동적으로 참여할 수 있다. 특히 미래 신문 글래스비전은 2050년의 가상신문을 보여주는 첨단기기로, 동영상과 쌍방향 장치를 통해 독자가 직접 글래스비전에 뉴스를 담을 수도 있다.
한편 기획전시관은 신문과 관련된 각종 전시회를 개최하는 전시공간으로 활용된다.

This is a modern museum with different kinds of exhibits that illustrate the history and development of Seoul.

column1: On the third floor, there is a medium sized model of ancient Seoul. In a separate gallery on the same floor, there is a grand model of modern Seoul that spans quite a large area. Around this model, there are different interactive consoles that allow you to understand the development of different districts in this metropolitan.
For those who would love to know more, they can borrow a mini headset which allows them to listen to more detailed explanation by entering the number of the relevant exhibits.

When one feels tired, there is a little outdoor garden enclosed by the different blocks of the museum for people to take a rest in. Coffee and snacks are served in the indoor cafeterias, and there is also a souvenir store for visitors to buy gifts for others.

column7: A really good place to start to roam the city as we got to see how the city evolve through hundred years of time. Great and very interesting exhibits, especially their meticulously crafted miniatures/maquette.

서울 반포동에 위치하고 있는 대한민국 대표도서관이다. 개가식으로 직접책을 보면서 열람이 가능하다. 복사시설도 가까이 있어 편리하다.  디지털도서관등 오후 6시까지 서비스를 하는데 본관 1층에서도 밤 10시까지 이용이 가능하다. 월요일에 주로 휴관한다. 이때는 미리 도서를 신청하여 대출을 받아 이용할수 있다. 1층에는 노트북을 직접가져와서 활용도 가능하다. 와이파이 좋다. 디지털도서관에 수백대의 컴퓨터가 있어 이용하기 편리하다. 동시에 노트북 사용도 가능하다. 또한 동영상 편집등 을 위한 최고급사양의 컴퓨터가 이용가능하다.  디지털도서관에서 주기저으로 SNS 교육도 실시한다. 국립장애인 도서관도 같이 있다. 식당도 쾌적하고 맛있는 편이다. 편의점도 있다. 커피셥에서 책도 보면서 커피도 마실수 있다. 구내에 서점도 있다. 근처 조각물등 조경도 좋으며 시서연수원, 국제회의장도 있다.

column1: 도서관 자체보단 시민의식이 문제가 되는 것 같다. 공부 용도로 사용을 금함에도 버젓이 필기구를 갖고 들어가고, 문제집을 풀고 있는 사람들을 많이 봤다. 문학관에서 낙서한 책을 봤을땐 마음이 아팠다. 우리나라의 시민의식은 언제 함양될지 모르겠다.

column7: best Korean library ever!!

This building had long been the City Hall of Seoul since Japanese occupation, but a few years ago was changed to a public library by Mr. Park, Wonsun, Mayor of Seoul. Although the book collection is not big enough to be called a library representing Seoul, I found books were selected well. The location allows citizens and tourists easy access. You are free to enter the library and browse books without any ID check. There is a room for foreign language books at the top floor. Worth visits.
Good place to understand the Seoul.

내곡동에 위치한 분재박물관에서는 다양한 종류의 분재들을 감상하실 수 있습니다. 김재인관장님께서 근 50년동안  정성껏 가꾸고 보살핀 분재들을 통해서 분재란 자연의 작은 축소판이구나! 라는 감동과 함께 어느새 자연과 동화됨을 느낍니다. 또한 분재박물관에는 매주 토요일마다 수목디자인 수업을 진행하고 있습니다. 나무가꾸기에 관심이 있거나 정원수 가지치기, 정원가꾸기등 나무에 관한 수업을 진행하거든요~ 많은 분들이 분재박물관에 오셔서 작은 쉼을 얻고 가시면 좋겠어요~~!!!
한국분재연구소에서 분재 문화를 널리 보급하기 위해 1988년 9월에 개관한 분재 전문박물관이다. 연면적 3,960㎡의 비닐하우스에 한국분재연구소에서 20년 이상 가꾸고 수집한 분재 5,000여 점이 전시되어 있고, 고문헌과 사진 등 분재관련 자료 1,000여 점을 소장하고 있다.

column1: 소장 분재 중에는 수령 300년의 단풍나무와 500년 이상 된 노간주나무 분재를 비롯하여 곰솔, 각종 과수, 매화나무, 배롱나무 등의 예술적 가치가 높은 분재 작품이 200여 점 이상 있다.
처음에는 분재역사자료실·분재생활관·분재특설전시장·분재감상실 등으로 나뉘어 운영되다가 2000년 12월부터 하나의 공간에서 전시와 감상·강습·판매가 동시에 이루어지는 형태로 대폭 축소되었다.

column2: National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Deoksugung
column7: During the hot and humid summer in Seoul, this lovely air conditioned building was a great place to find refuge. The cost for the palace and museum was only 3,000 KRW which equates roughly to about $3 USD. You cannot get that kind of cultural experience at such an affordable cost in the US. The museum has artwork dating back centuries with detailed descriptions in both English and Korean. The facility is clean, quiet, well organized and well staffed with polite employees who direct you along the exhibits. If you love art, history and culture this museum is a must!

If you visit Seoul, I recommend you to visit Deoksugung Palace, Gyeongbokgung Palace, and Changgyeong Palace.

Definitely worthwhile stop to see the struggles the Korean nation has overcome.  It’s a 5 Star museum but 4 stars for the international visitor.  Not very much effort was put into maximizing impact for the non Koreans.  There was so much more I wanted to see and understand.

This was one of the most interesting museums I've been to in Seoul. It provides a comprehensive history of the Japanese occupation and the Korean freedom fighters. I won't lie, it's grim (there's a model room showing where bodies were collected after they were hanged AND an interactive video where you can superimpose your face onto  someone being tortured (?)), but it's laid out well and there is a lot of space to walk around the various buildings at your own pace. The people working there are friendly and helpful.  Unlike a few museums in Seoul, this one also has English-friendly descriptions and signage.

My ancestors have been brutally tortured and eventually killed. People of all ages have been killed. But I’m happy that Korea got their peace and freedom. However Japan has one of our land and lies that it’s their land.

An amazing museum about the Japanese occupation of Korea. The descriptions in English are very well-done. The museum reminded me a lot of Kilmanhaim Gaol in Dublin--many parallels between the British occupation of Ireland and Japan's occupation of Korea. Definitely worth a visit!

It's a nice place to see the horror Koreans suffered from the Japanese, and the pathway toward democracy. It has a good amount of English, but could use a little more in some sections. It's about three dollars to get in and takes about a hour and some change to get through.
이름에대한 설명은 별로없지만 주차,입장무료로 아이들과 즐거운시간 보내기 좋음
연건축면적 3,348㎡의 4층 건물로, 1995년 2월 23일 개관하였다. 우리나라 최초의 국악 전문박물관으로서 역사적·문화적으로 가치있는 각종 국악관련 자료와 유물 6,000여 점을 소장하고 있다.

column1: 일곱 가지 주제로 꾸며진 여섯 개의 상설전시실에는 각종 국악기와 국악관련 음향·영상 자료 250여점을 전시하고 있으며, 박물관에 마련된 입체영상실에서는 3D애니메이션을 언제나 감상할 수 있다. 흥미로운 테마의 특별·기획 전시도 다채롭게 마련하고 있다.
중앙홀인 궁중음악실은 궁중의 음악과 무용을 소개해 놓은 공간이다. 나라의 잔치를 그린 조선시대의 병풍과 병풍 속 그림에서 찾아볼 수 있는 악기를 전시했다. 또 궁중에서 연행된 정재를 모사한 인형과 공연영상을 통해 조선시대 궁중 문화의 진수를 만나볼 수 있다.
중앙홀인 궁중음악실은 궁중의 음악과 무용을 소개해 놓은 공간이다. 나라의 잔치를 그린 조선시대의 병풍과 병풍 속 그림에서 찾아볼 수 있는 악기를 전시했다. 또 궁중에서 연행된 정재를 모사한 인형과 공연영상을 통해 조선시대 궁중 문화의 진수를 만나볼 수 있다.

초등학생 현장 학습에 적당한 소박한 규모의 박물관.

Wonderful facility with staff who speak English. They are truly dedicated to preserving the historical art and traditions of Korea. They have traditional  music classes for foreigners for an affordable price, and it really is a rare opportunity to find this. The building itself is modern and bewutiful, so come and visit!
The staff can't speak English. Also, the information for shuttle bus is quite poor.
Very good and nice place.
If you want to learn about Korean traditional music, this place is dedicated
If you like to experience Korean traditional music and/or learn Korean traditional instruments, National Gugak Center is the place.

Hard to find. When I arrived on a Monday at 1130, the door was locked. I had to call to have someone come open it. It was one small room with ABSOLUTELY NO EMBROIDERY! Just posters of embroidery and glass display cases with empty boxes of books?  I couldn't help but laugh at how ridiculous this was. Complete waste of a trip. The only upside was the kind gentleman that worked there. Luckily, I live in Korea so it wasn't a huge loss but if you're visiting here, just avoid this completely and go to Insadong area.
Really not worth your time. They have no actual embroideries on display, just posters and books.

Very difficult to find and the hours were odd so after a long trip we weren't able to visit the museum. There are not a lot of other interesting things to see in that area, so if you have limited time in Seoul, I would skip this stop.
1976년 11월 허원실과 박영숙(朴永淑)이 전통자수, 보자기, 침장, 종이공예품 등을 수집·보관·전시하기 위하여 설립했으며 전통자수 500여 점과 보자기 500여 점 등 1000여 점이 소장되어 있다.

column1: 주요 행사로는 1978년 6월부터 100일간 국립중앙박물관에서 전통자수특별전를 시작으로 1979년 5~6월 일본 도쿄의 한국문화원 개원기념 한국고자수전, 1983년 9~10월 국립민속박물관에서 전통보자기특별전, 그해 10~11월 독일 쾰른의 캐라미온박물관에서 한독수교 100주년기념 고자수전, 1984년 2월 영국 런던의 빅토리아앨버트미술관에서 한영수교 100주년기념 고자수전, 1986년 5~11월 도쿄 일본민예관과 오사카민예관에서 전통보자기전, 1987년 5월 쾰른의 동양박물관에서 고자수100선전, 1988년 서울올림픽 기념으로 국립중앙박물관에서 전통보자기특별전, 그해 5~6월에는 남부 독일 슈투트가르트주립 린덴박물관에서 고자수100선전, 1989년 7~10월에는 일본 나고야 세계디자인박람회에서 조각보전, 1990년 3~6월에는 영국 케임브리지대학교 박물관과 옥스퍼드대학교 박물관에서 전통보자기미술전, 그해 도쿄 소게쓰[草月]현대미술관에서 조각보명품전을 개최하였다.

column7: 그럭저럭

Amongst the many museums and galleries of Seoul, this one is sure to satisfy, and also stay open with exhibits on its many floors and halls. I've visited a few times but whilst some others may be closed for various reasons, this one is open with the most exhibits and easily the most comprehensive in the vicinity. Recommended to all, even the less inclined.

Located downtown Seoul right next to Duksoo Palace. Walking to get this museum from the subway station exits along side the historic stone wall is a special and lovely experience in the core of downtown Seoul. Next to this, there are plenty of cozy cafes and shops as well as other historic places to visit.

column1: In particular, Korean renown painting artist, Kyung-ja Chun (1924~2015) collection is its permanent exhibit. Her beautiful art is another reason why I like this museum.

One of the very famous art museum in Seoul. The regular exhibition is well organized and mostly free of charge, and special exhibitions are always super popular. Recommend to visit on weekdays.

Easy to find, and if you go on weekends there might be an open market as well. Highly recommend going!
Free admission with Lotte world ticket. A lot to see but at the exit area, never eat at their restaurants. Overpriced with bad quality food.

Exhibition: "Flower Paintings from the Joseon Dynasty"

column1: Paintings that were often called 'minhwa' because they were created by unknown artists, not by paintings for the royal family or the nobility, are for various purposes, education, decorations, etc.

Back then, paintings sold on the market were called "painting" or "munbaehwa" because they were attached to doors. Ironically, the term Minhwa was created by the Japanese Yanagi Muneyoshi, who founded the Japanese Leadership Academy in 1936. During the Joseon Dynasty, he held a folk art movement centered on pottery and crafts, and through various writings in the 1950s, he also became known about the shock and mysterious beauty of Joseon folk paintings

However, similar themes were used from the royal court to the aristocracy at the time, there is no fundamental difference between royal decorations and folk tales. Today, we are tying together a huge flow of painting culture that traversed the Korean Peninsula in modern times.
It was very good exhibition to feel the beauty of folk arts.

column7: World-class gallery right next to the largest ancient palace in the city, great juxtaposition. Great space with interesting exhibitions.

평소에는 좋은전시가 많이 없는데, 이번에는 좋은작가의 작품을 전시하는것 같음. 앞으로도 무료전시로 좋은 세계적인 작가들의 전시를 쭉 봤으면 좋겠고 젊은 한국작가들도 많이 발굴했으면 좋겠다.

Good hotel in a good area. Free breakfast included with your stay. Lots of shopping in within the area. But most of the shops seem to close at 11:00 pm and reopen at 9:00 am. All rooms are non smoking but they do have a smoking lounge on the 6th floor. Most of the front desk people do speak english. Check this hotel out.
SEJONG is Name of King (13C,Chosun Kingdom), He is very famous, benevolent & respected. He created Hangul(Korean Alphabet).

column1: Sejong Hotel is located in Center of Seoul. The rooms are clean and breakfast food is also high.

column7: YR Score: Site - 4. Experience - 1, Return - 1

column1: This hotel is located at a prime spot. Walkable distance to Myeongdong shopping street.
The size of the room is reasonable, but the toilet is tiny.
The service in this hotel makes me wonder "why four stars".

There were four guests in my room, but the amenities provided was constantly insufficient (1 tiny bottle of shampoo and shower gel a day for four people). We had to ring for more, and the reply was consistently condescending, implying that what they have provided should be sufficient. We stayed there for a good seven days, and this happened a few times. The lack of proactiveness by Sejong Hotel puts the 4-star rating to shame.
Most of the staffs at the front desk doesn't seem approachable and helpful. Not much smile on their face (besides one who was genuinely helpful).
There was also a protest going on in front of the hotel about Sejong Hotel abusing staff to achieve the 5-star rating.
It is unlikely that I will be returning to this hotel considering various options around the area.

짚과 풀로 만든 민속자료를 수집, 연구하여 전시하는 세계 유일의 짚·풀 전문박물관으로 1993년 3월 25일 개관하였다. 짚신·망태기·멍석·달걀꾸러미·새끼줄 등 보릿짚이나 밀짚으로 만든 생활용품과 공예품에서 죄수의 머리에 씌우던 짚주저리까지 짚·풀 관련 민속자료 3,500여 점을 비롯하여 제기(祭器) 1,000점, 한옥문 200세트, 세계 각국의 팽이 500여 점, 슬라이드 25,000여 점을 소장하고 있다.

column1: 또 1894년 동학농민운동과 관련되어 당시 농민군이 쓰던 몽둥이·죽창·농기구·활·화살 등의 무기와 나주와 함평 지방의 동학군 참가자 명단인 〈동학군명록〉〈동학군축문〉, 동학의 2대 교주 최시형이 새끼를 꼬던 자리 모형 등이 있다

column2: Patriot Ahn Jung Geun Memorial Hall
column7: So, this was the most controversial museum I've ever visited. Ahn Jung Geun is treated here as a revolutionary, dedicated to the freedom of his country. He is celebrated, he has a giant statue, his calligraphy is all over the place. His quotes are memorialised, his actions re-enacted in wax statues speaking with the voices of actors. Here's the  problem, though. His most famous action is the assassination of a Japanese prince in a train station.

column1: So, the story is very interesting. The whole museum is in Korean, with no English anywhere, so I experienced this museum through the lens of Google translate, which was surprisingly doable. The only English in the museum is in the foreign newspapers in the exhibit that report on the murder/assassination. The foreign language newspapers are hilarious, because they're captioned in Korean like, "the foreign newspapers report on the farcical show trial", but then when you read it in English, they call Ahn a thug, who was given a fair chance to speak, but just rambled incomprehensibly about his ideas, so the jury decided that his crime couldn't have been politically motivated, because he was so ignorant. We see the prince called an oppressor in Korean, while the newspapers called him basically an unimportant old man, who had no reason for being targeted.

I don't want to say the museum was bad, but it is very biased, so bear that in mind when you visit. It is a fascinating look into how every country in the world is rewriting their history, not just the big players. I'd recommend it for the pure novelty value, and for curiosity, but if you're just looking for a history museum to bring your kids to to learn about Korea, maybe choose somewhere else. There's a graphic exhibit about the assassin's cutting part of their finger off, and it's a lot of reading, and a couple of audio recordings.

column1: Located inside the palace area, the walk up to the museum was fun and interesting for all ages.
I forget if the museum has a ticket to purchase, but if it did, the price was not high enough to remember.
The museum was impressive and a nice mix of historical (boring) items and interesting exhibits for the kids.  It kept their attention for the most part.
There was also an interesting special exhibit on salt, its mining / manufacturing, and importance - all around the world.
Since salt is such an important ingredient for Koreans, it was nice to see this special exhibit.
The weather was HOT!  95-degrees (F) the whole 3 weeks we were in Korea.  It made the outdoor tourist places like this palace hard to handle.
Definitely a good place to see.  We will have to come back to appreciate the outdoor grounds and palace when the weather is more manageable.

column7: Visited June 17th 2018. I loved the red bean smoothie - it was...smooth! The exhibitions were extremely detailed and comprehensive - it was fascinating to learn about Korean culture from life to death. The facilities were accommodating for all ages and the fact that it was free is brilliant! Definitely worth a visit.

column7: The National Folk Museum is located in a modern building within the premises of the Gyeongbokgung Palace the largest palace of the five grand palaces built in the Joseon dynasty .. the museum shows the royal life, clothes, architecture, science, rites, and many more all with detailed description and awesome display..

Made a reservation at Korea House after reading reviews about it. You can enjoy traditional Korean cuisine here. However, the price point is significantly higher. I had a meal for 47000 won. There was seafood, including crab stew. Even though the portions of the food was small, by the time I was done with the courses, I was full. I would say that the food isn't super amazing as you would get at the food carts. But it has a more elegant taste, that makes it taste good.
Amazing traditional korean food. Great place as the building itself is very traditional. Heard that they have some performance but I didn't watch. A bit on the pricey side though.
Great tasting menu for vegetarian. Of course, i would add a little more variety - as most dishes were mushroom based

column7: nice welcoming. beautiful historical place where many traditional weddings are celebrated

Seoul Arts Center is a vibrant performance space. For Seoul residents, it is considered a sort of hallowed ground, which is full of various cultural performances, exhibitions and conventions. It also accommodates a number of dining facilities and coffee shops in its premises.
Its a nice place for performing arts. Haven't been to other places in Korea to compare. It feels very high classy and artistic.

column1: The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because there are better places in North America and Europe. Relative to other places in Korea, it definitely is a 5 star.

I watched the rehersal for Anna Karenina (the ballet). Hate to admit... Kinda fell asleep a couple times... Its probably because I don't have a knowledge or experience in ballet and it was just the rehersal before opening.

column7: Beautiful theater, came to see the Giacometti exhibition. Was wonderful. Check out their site they sometimes have great things on

A beautiful art center with restaurants, cafes, and shops to enjoy in between exhibits. I came here years ago for a Modigliani exhibit and was amazed by the design and organization of the center. Everyone is very welcoming here as well

Nice and fun, but could be better. Things appear cheaply done, obvious cameras and ride triggers for example. Others are poorly laid grass turf and stuffed animals in rides.

column1: Nice prices for food and souvenirs etc (much better than Disneyland). Cheap stroller rentals with an easy process. No real stroller parking that way marked though so busy 'wherever' worked.
Great time for the children with lots for them to do (ages 5, 3, 10 months.) Great rides they loved and a fun parade etc.

Some staff not very enthusiastic and seemed to be just putting in their time while others were great. One concern was one of the ride workers checking her hair in her phone while securing the kids to the moon/Sun ride. Way to many staff had their phones out and weren't paying attention.
Overall a good experience and definitely worth a visit if you like theme parks. Awesome for kids and great baby facilities.

column7: Fun amusement park with a good amount of rides to last about half a day. Definitely don't recommend you come from first thing in the morning, as you'd pay for the full day. We went on a summer weekend day and still managed to ride everything we wanted despite getting there at 4.

Great indoor theme park as well as the island! I suggest going after 4 pm because there is a discount on the price. Also, if you are a tourist wanting to visit Lotte World, make sure to bring you T Money tour card for a discount. The rides were nice and safe and there is something for the whole family to enjoy. Food is expensive though.

Lotte World was pretty enjoyable. However, when I visited, some of the rides were under renovation. Most of the queues moved quickly. Indoors, the hot air balloon ride has one of the longest queues, so be prepared to wait up to 1 hour for your turn. The hot air balloon ride was nice to see the entire indoor Lotte World. If the monorail is working, I would take that instead.

Great place to bring kids. Plenty of food and the rides are very enjoyable. Unlike other theme parks and such they have places where you can reserve a spot at a ride for a certain time and so you don't have to wait in line at all. There is also an app for free fast passes. The shows are fantastic with a lot of energy. Especially the center stage and the parades.
Nice, elegant chamber hall in which to perform and listen to music. Intimate space with audience capacity of 400. Centrally located near city hall and other tourist attractions.
Sejong Center for the Performing Arts

column1: Sejong Center for the Performing Arts is the largest arts and cultural complex in Seoul, South Korea. It has an interior area of 53,202m². It is situated in the center of the capital, on Sejongno, a main road that cuts through the capital city of the Joseon Dynasty. The center took 4 years to complete, opening in 1978. It was "built as a cultural center for Seoulites." It currently contains the biggest pipe organ in Asia.

column7: Place itself is not so special, but they have some of the best performances line ups in Korea
Awesome place! Would love to come back.

We have been here numerous times for exhibits. The content is usually not bad, but more often than not the setup, or is it called curation, is just bad. There never seems to be a theme, or any consistence with how pieces are displayed in their exhibition halls. You can look at animals not, just to suddenly have a the theme change to buildings on the same wall, for no apparent reason. The descriptions and titles of works often have wrong or confusing English and I've been told the Korean can be just as bad. We once went to an exhibit where, on one wall, withing the same apparent theme, they suddenly decided to stop using Korean on titles and switch to English, and a few pieces later, back to Korean. Definitely not high on my list of places to go regularly.

Very interesting museum. My friends and I had a lovely time. We were given a free guided tour in English. The museum is very big so you can stay there for a long time. It is also located in a very nice place in Seoul. I would love to visit it again.

If you are a museum lover then this is a must see. It covers the whole of Korean history up to modern times and houses some master works and national treasures of this county. The building is beautiful and the layout of nothing to complain about.

column1: The museum also has two separate halls that hosts international history related exhibits. There change roughly every 3 months. I have recently seen exhibits about iron, French palaces, the Mongolians and  the ancient middle east. Some are better, some are just OK.
The gift main gift shop, near the (expensive) cafeteria has some interesting souvenirs to buy. But more importantly, it has a nice selection of books on Korea and Korean culture.

column7: Greta place to learn about Korean history, Art, Culture at one place.  If you go there by subway, we will see another awesome displays on the way this museum. You can enjoy those displays while you were on moving walk. The Museum is huge and contains lots of items telling the history of Korea. One thing to remember, in order to enter this museum, you need to go through the metal detection security gate like airports....and all your belongings must go through the x-ray machine...thus pack light!

Great exhibition for free. If you are a museum lover this is a place for you. You can skip the War Memorial near here, but this is must see. The exhibition is not biased like there, and provides decent English translations.

Great museum and very well laid out. Bottom floor focuses on history, starting with prehistory on the right side and wrapping around ending with the Japanese occupation prior to WWI. The upper floors focus on art from painting and calligraphy to pottery and sculpture. There are quite a few beautiful private collections as well. There was no Special Exhibit when I went. Attached to a Children's Museum, which is quite popular judging by the crowds, though I did not explore. 80% of exhibits included English-language translation.
It's a calm and empty place during winter. If you are a foriner, you need a passport to enter to walk along the wall. If it snows, the path is closed.
Best place to ride bicycle in Seoul
Good!
개인적으로 제일좋아하는 한양성문. 어서 경복궁방향도 사진촬영이 허용됐으면좋겠다. 창의문 숙정문 와룡공원 코스는 경사가 아주급하므로 참고. 입구에서.신분증을 맡겨야한다. 참고로 안내소에서 일하는 사람들은 뭘믿고 그렇게 불친절한건지?
이 곳에서 북악산이나 인왕산으로 접근할 수 있으며 이근에 유명 음식점이 많고 산책이나 가족나들이에 좋은 곳임
This place has very nice spa and the service is pretty good and the food is very nice

Dirty pool without proper amenities like shampoo, conditioner & body foam. Gotta buy all of these at between 500-700 yen each apart from the entrance fee of 12,000 won for entry btw 9pm to 6am. There's a single type of liquid soap provided though. Staff does not converse in English. No chairs provided at the make up / hair drying area. All combs are shared, not disinfected, no cotton pads, cotton buds. Only hair dryer, shared combs, facial toner and facial emulsion provided.
Ideal place to take a nap after bath since it got a lot of available sleeping area with pillow and blanket.

Second Jimjilbang I've been to. Itaewon land is the other (Itaweon land has a separate floor for sleeping). The showers, lockers and facilities are really nice just don't expect a good rest. The lockers are very close to the rooms where you sleep. So people talk and laugh at 2am with no real consideration for others. There were quiet times but it wasn't a great overall experience.

column1: Expect hardish pillows and sleeping mats like you usually find.

column7: The best spa I've visited in Seoul (so far).

column1: They have many different baths, some hot, some cold and some with bubbles. They also have saunas with degrees ranging from 40C to 85C.

Since you are provided clothes upon payment and you are naked in the spa area you don't need to bring anything at all if you want to sleep there, except for maybe a toothbrush (which you can buy at the entrance).

As usual in Korean spas women and men each have their own spa facilities but there is a common area where you can sleep together, watch TV or get a massage. They have sleeping facilities with hard cushions, thin blankets and Korean style mattresses.

column7: Been here 3 years ago and this is my second time visit them. Many Jacuzzi blower head spoiled and lacking in maintenance. Staff unable to communicate in any of the foreign langguages. Other than this i was having a good and relaxing time here.
The facility is a bit old and feel not very clean.  But the people are very nice.  Good place to stay if arrive by early flight and rest for a few hours to wait for hotel check in.
Friendly and welcoming staff for foreigners. Location is a major plus. Place is quite a bit dated, but overall cleanliness was acceptable.
Local jjimjilbang(public bath house) and not many ppl on weekdays. Nice Korean ajumma taught us how to use the facilities.
Nice visit right up until my wallet was stolen out of my locker

From Ewha Highschool gate, turn to a slope upwards, enter into a park on the right and you will soon find the tower on the hilltop ahead.

column1: Better to go after visit to Jungmyeongjeon (重明殿) on the way from Deoksugung Palace (徳寿宮).
The other approach is to climb a cliff by stairway from Seoul City History Museum side.

column7: 한국전쟁으로 본관이 몽땅 날라가고 탑 하나만 남아 있습니다. 아관파천에서 [아관]은 아라사 공사관, 즉 러시아 공사관이라고 합니다. 영어 around thirty를 일본식 표현으로 アラサー(아라사)라고 줄여 부르기도 합니다.

A beutiful 100 years aged high school in Bukchon. It's not far from main road. My friend and I visited the place on Saturday, so there were no actual students. It was quite peaceful. Even though it's not catholic school or something like that, still the school's main building boasts delicate decorations and picturesque yard. Take a visit if you go to Bukchon.
beautiful school with buildings feel like in Europe
Love this school

column1: 정문앞에는 겨울연가를 비롯한 한류스타의 사진을 파는 곳도 있네요.

column7: This is the old Seoul Station. Now beside of this building there is a new one. And it is used as a gallery... containing the history of the station. It's quite good chance to know about it. And it's free...
Great place to visit for architecture and history.  Fabulous if you can catch an exhibit here.

逛逛首爾新地標由MVRDV設計的天空步道"首爾路7017"，順遊免費的美術館。好羨慕首爾這麼多免費景點!
Always on the look out for another METHODIST church overseas!
Good Place
Awesome 97

배재학당의 설립자이자 감리교 선교사인 아펜셀러가 지은 최초의서양식교회다. 배재고등학교시절 채플시간이면 예배당으로가서 예배를 보던 기억이 난다.  그때는 그것도 수업이라고 가기 싫어했었는데  지금 생각해보면 다 추억이고 이야기거리다. 오랜만에 이 길을 지나며 잠시 들여다본 정동제일교회. 박정희시절 경호실장이던 차지철이 이 교회 장로였다 들었는데  고교시절의 그 당시가 생각난다.  함께 예배를 보았던 당시의 친구들은 지금은 어디서 무얼하며 지내고 있을까? 건물하나를 보며 참으로 많은 기억과 얼굴들이 스친다.
이 건물은 감리교 선교사인 아펜젤러가 자신의 집으로 사용했다가 감리교를 우리나라에 전파하면서 벧엘예배당이 되었답니다. 새문안교회와 서울대성당(성공회) 등 우리나라에서 역사가 깊은 건물이고 제가 일갈하는 1887년도에 만들어 진것으로 추정됩니다. 고딕양식 건물이기 때문에 창살패턴이 고딕입니다.

An older venue, that is showing its age. It had three large halls open when I was there, and we were able to cover them in under 2hrs. It was a nice change from attending conventions in Coex, where you've no chance of seeing everything in a single day. You can park at the riverside baseball stadium overflow parking to save money if you drive, and they had free shuttle buses running constantly for this convention.

SETEC was a nice venue with three fairly large rooms and the ability to put concessions in them if necesdary. The location is not in the best spot (difficult to get to - not dangerous), so I knocked a star off.
Good place for exhibition event. There's AC, restroom, free water, etc
The convention halls are small, making it easy to navigate the booths. The parking was easy until it was time to pay. Our foreign credit card wouldn't work and it was a hassle gretting out.
Crowded when open for events. There is an ATM and a convenience store inside. Poorly ventilated.
우리나라의 슬픔과 지혜를 한 번에 알려주는 그야말로 뜻 깊은 종교🙏

Korea's first Catholic Church, built in 1893 and still beautiful

column1: 조선호텔 식당 주방에서 나오는 음식 조리 연기와 냄새가 심합니다.
또 입구쪽에는 흡연실이 설치되어 있어 주변 환경이 열악하지만 가볼만한 사적지입니다.

column7: 1897년 고종 황제가 하늘에 제를 올린 뒤 대한제국을 선포한 역사적인 장소. 한민족의 수천년 하늘에 제를 올리던 문화의 중심지 였고, 고종황제가 세웠으나, 일제가 조선 영혼 말살을 위해 식민지시절 환구단을 대폭 철거하고 조선호텔을 지었습니다. 한민족의 제를 올리던 중요한 기관이었습니다. 팔방을 이롭게하는 홍익인간 정신이 서려 있는 팔각의 건축물.

단순히 지나쳐야할, 웨스틴 조선호텔 바에서 볼만한 곳이 아닌. 우리민족의 독립성을 상징하는 곳. 하늘에 제사를 지내는 환구단은 황제만이 지을 수  있는 건물이었음. 고종이 이곳에 제사를 지내고 대한제국을 선포하였으나 일제는 의도적으로 이곳을 훼손하고 조선호텔의 전신인 철도호텔을 지음. 이후로 복원을 했어야할 곳인데....아쉽게도 황궁우 건물과 돌북, 문 등 몇몇 유물들만 살아있음. 외국인들에게 추천할만한 곳. 가볍게 보기 좋음.
Crazy mix of buildings and fun vibe.  Like a small scale Vegas.
Only place in USA style arround seoul. People can speek English. Some western foods can be found. Great for night life.
Fresh salmon and other seafood as side-dish.
Good to dinner with friends, nice food.
It's starting to become more westernized. Stay away if you want to experience the real Korea.

Though small the musuem presents a good introduction into traditional korean medicines which are still apart of the current culture. I highly recommend signing up for a 30 min tea foot bath or facial and hot back massage.while you are there.  It's well worth the small 5000 won fee.
Awesome herb museum!!!
우리나라 한약재의 최대시장인 서울약령시에 적합한 한의학박물관.

column1: 볼수있는 박물관,어성초등 한약재를 우려낸 42°의 따뜻한 물에 족욕을 할수있는 족탕, 힐링한방, 생활한방, 문화가 있는 한방등 다양한 한방 문화체험 프로그램이  있음.

column7: 東洋医学の素。漢方薬を扱っている通りにあります。
薬市場に在るので、漢方を身近に感じるには良い施設だと思います。

column1: ワンフロアなので博物館と言う程では、有りませんが、
ドラマの大長今やホジュンの世界が良く解ります。
漢方を解りやすく説明して有ります。
入口は建物一階の裏で地下二階に在るので解りにくいです。

column7: 병자호란때 청의 임금에게 인조가 '삼전도'의 굴욕을 받은 곳으로,박정희 전 대통령 시절에 매립하여 지금의 모습처럼 육지가 되었다.
안감
전 잘몰라요
보나장신구박물관은 우리 옛 여인들의 장신구를 보존하고 널리 알리고자 설립한 국내 최대 규모의 전문 장신구박물관입니다.

column1: 김명희 관장님께서 지난 40여 년간 소중하게 모아온 1만여점 넘는 유물을 기반으로 설립된 보나장신구박물관은 서울시 종로구 관훈동에서 운영되고 있습니다. 2006년 서울시 등록 제35호 사립박물관으로 인정받았으며, 보나는 보석처럼 빛나는 아름다움을 가진 우리 고유의 미를 의미하는 박물관으로 많은 언론의 주목을 받고 있습니다.

남녀 장신구를 비롯하여 고려시대 옷장식, 단추에서 근세의 노리개에 이르는 시대별 장신구 및 생활문화에 관련된 유물 200여 점을 전시하여 한국 장신구의 역사와 문화를 한자리에서 감상할 수 있도록 하였을 뿐 아니라, 매년 1, 2차례 소장품 특별전을 열어서 관람객들에게 새로운 문화재를 감상할 수 있도록 진행하는 등 여성장신구 문화를 폭 넓게 이해할 수 있는 다양한 전시와 연구 활동을 펴 나가고 있습니다.
이는 보다 더 많은 사람들과 함께 옛 여인들의 미와 그 맛을 느끼고 나누기 위함이며 또 앞으로 우리 문화를 지키고 이끌어갈 젊은이들에게 우리 고유의 아름다움과 그 정신을 이어 받아 우리 미의 소중함을 발견하며 그것을 밑거름으로 온전하게 보전하고 더 발전적으로 새로운 아름다움을 창작하는데 도움이 되고자 합니다.
또한 조상들의 숨결이 닿아있는 우리 문화재를 여러 사람과 함께 체험하며 나누는 문화공간으로 자리매김하고자 혼신의 힘을 다할 것입니다.

column7: 등이 좀 배기긴 하지만, 배우들의 생동감 있는 모습을 그대로 볼 수 있다.
연우소극장으로 놀러오세요~~ 커피와 책과 건축과 연극 그리고 사람이 존재하는 공간입니다.
살아 숨 쉬는 곳
120여석 규모의 소극장
노란봉투, c가 왔다 를 검색해보세요

옛날 여인들의 생활문화, 화장문화의 역사를 담고 있는 국내 최대 규모의 전문 화장미술관이다. 코리아나화장품(주) 회장 유상옥(兪相玉)이 30년간 수집한 화장도구와 규방에서 쓰는 물건들을 모아 2003년 11월 20일 개관하였다. 코리아나화장품(주)의 복합 문화공간인 스페이스 시(space*c) 건물 5~6층에 자리잡고 있으며, 같은 건물에는 현대미술 갤러리와 스킨케어 시스템, 휴식공간이 갖추어져 있다.

column1: 박물관에는 옛 여인들이 맵시를 내는 데 사용하던 화장용구나 장신구 등 각종 여성 생활용품 600여 점과 도자기, 조각품 등 총 5,000점이 전시되어 있다. 5층 전시실에는 분합·분항아리·동경(銅鏡) 등의 화장구, 비녀·노리개 등의 장신구 외에 여성생활문화와 관련된 민속품이 전시되어 있는데, 특히 고려시대의 팔능형소문경(八菱形素文鏡)과 청자상감모자합(靑磁象嵌母子盒), 조선시대의 화접뒤꽂이인 화접잠(花蝶簪)과 영락비녀(瓔珞簪) 등이 있다.

6층 전시실에는 도기·청동기·청자·분청자·백자 등의 도자기가 있는데, 중요한 전시품으로는 고려시대의 청자음각연화문매병(靑磁陰刻蓮花文梅甁), 조선시대 도자기인 백자대호(白磁大壺), 백자청화불수감문호(白磁靑畵佛手柑文壺) 등이 있다. 그밖에 국보 제284호인 초조본대반야바라밀다경(권162,170,463)(初雕本大般若波羅蜜多經), 보물 제977호인 묘법연화경(권7)과 같은 불교사경을 상설·전시하고 있다.

column7: 국보
집 주변이라 산책할 때 스치게 되는데 항상 친절하셔서 좋아요. 절 내부도 너무너무 좋습니다.
커피와 차를 파는 공간도 있고
조용하고 주차장 있고
守國寺黃金寺廟
요즘 수국사 여기저기에 꽃이 만발하여 사진을 많이 찍었습니다
Not many people here today, since it's quite cold. Park is well maintained, but the drone launch pad area was a little muddy.
Good
Nice place

한강수영장 중 가장 사람 적은곳

column1: 한강 남측 맞은편 워커힐호텔이 보이는 광나루한강공원내 한강수영장 입니다. 주차장은 수영장 좌우에 위치하며 수영장과는 꽤 먼편이나 좌측 주차장이 조금 더 가깝습니다. (공원 차단기 바로 앞 주차장)
시운영으로 입장료 또한 저렴한 한강수영장입니다. 성인기준 5천원, 네이버예약시 인당 500원 할인(단, 당일구매사용불가), 5세미만 무료(증빙서류원본필히지참)
성인풀과 가족풀 모두 넓은 면적이며 유아풀에는 2개의 작은 슬라이드가 있습니다. 단, 초등생 이상은 사용불가. 성인풀은 스킨슈즈 포함 아쿠아슈즈는 신을 수 없고, 유일하게 일반모자가 아닌 수영모가 필수입니다.
팀당 파라솔 자리 하나씩 제공되며 텐트를 가져올 경우 별도 구역(유아풀을 둘러싸는)에만 설치가능합니다. 선베드는 별도비용발생.
내부상점물가는 미쳤으니 수영모 등 물놀이물품은 반드시 챙겨가길 바라며, 매점 또한 비싼편입니다. 외부음식은 허용하나 주류반입은 엄격히 체크하는 편입니다.
타 한강수영장 대비 외곽인 편에 사람이 적은 편이라는것이 가장 큰 장점일듯 합니다.

column7: Excellent spot. Be here or be square!
우리나라 7~80년대 생활상은 엿볼 수 있는 곳입니다.

column1: 불과 40년전의 우리들 모습, 그렇지만 왠만한 아이들은 전혀 상상하지도 못하는, 우리들의 과거생활....
아이들과 한번쯤 다녀 올 만한 곳

column7: 가깝고 각 종 청단 이벤트가 열린다.
하루 교육체험할만합니다

The bldg. was where my 7th grade classroom was, exactly 70 years ago. Brought lots of fond memories, but interior has been torn down to make one giant hall to house the museum displays that to me the charm is altogether lost, sadly to say.

This little museum in Bukchon is easy to miss since it's at the top of a little hill right by the busiest area in the historical district. It showcases what schools and the education system were like pre~1980. Exhibits include a typical classroom, various uniform and appearance standards, textbooks, etc. It seems like it also hosts special exhibits on occasion.

column1: -food and drink: not allowed and not available
-language support: mostly korean, very little English is offered on placards or signs
This is interesting if you want to see what korea was like before it's huge industrial boom or if you have family members who lived through this time period. This may also be interesting to children.

column7: 아이와 국립현대미술관을 갔다가 실망해서 바로 옆 여기에 다녀 왔다. 조금 부실하고 70년대 감성이지만 뭐...

column1: 볼 것 없는 미술관보다는 아이와 이야기 할 것이 많았으니 불만 없다.  하지만 여기보다는 주변에 아이와 돌아다닐 곳이 더 있었다면 좋았을 뻔.

column7: 추억을 더듬을 수 있는 조그마한 공간으로 기볍게 다녀오긴 참 좋아요~
예전 교실 모습과 학교생활을 짐작할 수 있게 잘 꾸며놓었다. 옛 교과서들도 스캔본으로 볼 수 있어서 추억하기 좋았다.
Small but excellent museum with a comfortable cafe near small upscale shops & eating area.

건축물 자체가 훌륭하게 지어져있어서 미술관을 관람을 포함해서 꼭 한번 방문할 가치가 있는 장소입니다.

This is free which is a reason why you should go if your on a budget like us (or ran out of things to do). It's not particularly huge but lasted roughly an hour. The weirdest thing about it is the placentas in the jars (which I won't say anything more about). However if your overly interested about the history of royalist family's like myself, then try find something else to do. However my sister enjoyed it.

Nice place to see Korean history. With 3000 Korean Won ticket I can access royal palace and this place, too. Take a round through palace garden, enter it I see many items very close with Korean people. From traditional clothes, Kimchi, Korean of food, funeral, wedding, shoes maker, a little a little I understand about Korean and Korean people. Great place.
What a great museum! There were young kids that loved speaking English to me here. So many great exhibits to see.

One of the most lovely mesuems I've ever been to. Very informative, extremely clean and well cared for, and the displays are beautiful. The information plaques are well written with all the information you could need on each particular display or item.

Great museum showing the history of the numerous palaces across South Korea, particularly around Seoul, during the Joseon Dynasty and through the Korean Empire. Many beautiful artifacts. Proximity to Metro and Gyeongbukgong Palace make it a must see during your visit. Decent gift shop and affordable cafe.
Great park. This place was originally a purification facility. It has evolved into a wonderful park. You can see very various plants.
Little Island in the middle of Han River. Its nice for a stroll or just to enjoy the nice weather.
The island in Han river that has old rain reservoir which renovated to park for people to visit. Very nice view, you can walk around the park. Can access by foot, bus and car.
Wonderful oasis for busy Koreans in Seoul even though it's just a park. Very few tourists.
Nice combination of nature and an old industrial property. Loots of links between the history of this place and water , plants combination.
Quite expensive but good experience. Quite a range of guns for you choose and very convenient location

column7: 한전의역사로부터시작해 현재 한전이  사업하고있는 내용까지 알차게 전시되어있었습니다!  관람비도 무료이고 시간 나실때 들르시면 좋을거 같네요.

100년이 넘는 한국의 전기역사를 체계적으로 정리하여 보존하고 전기의 소중함을 일반인과 어린이들에게 널리 알리기 위해 2001년 8월 10일 건립되었다. 전기역사관과 현대전기관 등의 전시실·수장고·사무실·제어실의 시설이 있다. 관람객이 전시물 앞에 서면 자동으로 설명이 나오고 작동되는 첨단 설비를 갖추었다. 주요 전시품으로는 전기관련 유물 247점과 디오라마 모형 9점, 일반모형 5점, 복제물 16점, 그래픽 패널 84점, 영상물 9점, 정보검색 10점 등이 있다.

column1: 전기역사관에는 1887년 3월 우리나라 최초로 전깃불을 밝힌 경복궁 점등식 모형, 1910년대 전차승차권과 전기다리미·유성기, 조선전업 10년사 원본, 피뢰기·발전기, 국내 최초의 발전소인 동대문발전소 모형, 전차가 달리는 옛 종로거리 풍경 등이 축소로 재현되어 있다. 또한 전기에 관한 정보를 검색할 수 있는 터치스크린과 플레밍의 진공관, 패러데이의 전자석 원리 등을 직접 체험할 수 있는 실험코너도 마련되어 있다.

현대전기관에는 한국표준형 원자력발전, 태양발전, 우주광발전 등 현대적인 전기생산 원리와 과정이 모형과 영상자료로 전시되어 있다. 또 반사광을 이용하여 실제 전구처럼 보이나 손으로 만져지지 않는 3차원 입체허상 체험코너, 몸에서 나오는 미세한 전류를 직접 측정해 볼 수 있는 인간전지 실험 등 전기놀이 시설이 있으며, 박물관 배경을 컴퓨터로 합성하여 기념사진을 찍을 수 있는 코너도 마련되어 있다. 이 밖에도 전기상식을 퀴즈로 풀어보는 터치스크린과 전기에 관한 영상뉴스·광고 등을 다시 볼 수 있는 그때를 아십니까 코너도 준비되어 있다.
