관세청 개청 30주년을 기념하여 2000년 8월 27일 서울세관 본부에 설치된 관세관련 특수박물관이다. 관세는 수출입 물품에 대하여 부과되는 세금으로 우리 나라에서는 1878년 부산에 두모진 해관이 생기면서 근대적 관세업무가 시작되어, 오늘날에는 관세청 본청 외에 전국의 28개 세관과 14개 출장소 등에서 통관·심사 및 조사와 감시업무를 수행하고 있다.

column1: 박물관에는 수집된 1만1천여 점의 관세관련 유물 및 사료 중 1,500여 점을 상설 전시하고 있으며 관세청 및 세관의 활동 등을 영상물에 담아 상영하는 홍보실도 운영하고 있다. 전시장은 환영의 장, 역사의 장, 이해의 장, 정보의 장, 국제의 장으로 구성되어 있다.

column7: Good for the family or large groups! 6 floors! NO elevator...  which was a bit of a bummer because I am in a cast and doing the stairs was not something I was ready for.  Kids had fun though
생각보다 많은 전시품이 층층히 준비 되어 있어 어지간한 사설 박물관은 비교가 되지 않습니다. 입장료는 받지 않습니다. 아이들 방학동안 체험하기 좋은 교육 장소 입니다.

경희대학교에 있는 여러 표본들을 편한이 들러볼 수 있음. 회기역 근처에서 학교를 구경한다면, 박물관이 궁금하다면 한번정도 들러볼만한 가치가 있음. 다만 학교 후문에 위치하면 잘보이지 않고 오는길이 경사가 있는 언덕길 위에 있기에 잡근성이 좋지 않음. 추가로 너무 큰 기대하지 말고 편안히 구경할것을 추천함. 자연사 박물관 앞 법대 건물 1층에 조그마한 카페가 있으니 구경한 후에 카페에서 시간을 보내도 좋을것같음.또한 회기역을 통해 오는것 보다 외대역에서 내려 경희대 후문으로 와서 들러보는게 더 빠르고 가까움.

국내 몇 없는 자연사박물관 중에서도 박제 및 표본 관람에 있어서는 매우 가치가 높은 곳이라고 할 수 있겠다. 식물표본은 다소 빈약한 아쉬움이 있고, 포유류 및 어류 등의 보존상태에 좀 아쉬움이 있긴해도 일단 그 방대한 수로 관람객들을 압도해버리기 때문에 생물종 분류에 대해 공부하고 있는 사람들은 즐겁게 방문이 가능할 곳이다. 특히 조류박제전시의 경우는 다양한 종의 모습을 한 눈에 비교해보며 볼 수 있는 점에 있어 막 공부를 시작한 사람들에게는 도움이 꽤 될 수 있을 것으로 보인다. 단점이라 한다면 고층으로 갈 수록 환기가 잘 되지 않는 듯하여 조금 냄새가 날 수 있는 점은 감안해야한다. 기타사항으로는 교내에 자리잡고 있는 곳인만큼 건물앞의 주차장소는 여의치않은 편이며- 어줍잖게 정문으로 입장할 경우에는 한참을 가야 목적지에 도달할 수 있다는 점(후문에서 바로임)이나 서울에서 무료관람할 수 있는 곳으로서는 꽤 가치있는 곳이라 할 수 있다.
무료이용. 풍부한 전시물. 경희대 산책도 좋음
Beautiful scenic views, very easy. Can be done in ~2hrs if u dont stop much

Achasan is a mountain which can be hiked by people who are starting out. It's of moderate difficulty. From the top whole city view can be seen. For increasing the difficulty and distance it's a good idea to start from achasan and get down towards yongmasan. It will take around 2 and a half hours to 3 hours for this course.
Not too strenuous, great views on a clear day!
I stayed near this mountain and I went there many times. There are easy trails and much harder trails, without much security but more natural.
서울에서 가장 해가 빨리 뜨는 곳입니다.

column1: 가볍게 산보 삼아서 올라갔다 올 수 있는 곳이고
트레일러닝같은 스포츠를 즐긴다면 연습할 수 있는 곳이기도 합니다.
완만하고 어느정도 업힐과 다운힐이 있는 곳..
그리고 아름다운 경치는 보너스 야간 산행도 좋습니다

column7: 수영장별로임...거기 여탕에 청소하시는 아줌마 욕함..그리고 거기 냄새심함..피아노교실도 엉망임 낙서오짐..그리고 거기 위에 상상아카데미 내 친구들 다니는데 너무 힘들다고 함..굳이 밥 다 먹으라 하고(많이 주면서)너무 하는거 많음 그리고 매점은 너무 비쌈 뭔 하드아이스크림이 800원씩이나 함..최 저가를 500원정도로 해야지
시설 개량을 했다고는 하지만 사우나시설만

column1: 조금개량을 했을 뿐 건조발판 및 발수건등의
이용할 수 있도록 되어 있는데 십년이상씩이나
이용자 편의 시설이 많이 보강되어야 할것

column7: 수영장 개비를 2018 3월에 해서 깨끗함
낙후된 시설...  낙후된 서비스..   이걸 수영장이라고...
수영장을 비롯해 저렴하게 다양한 체육프로그램을 체험할 수 있음 단 수영장 올해 12월부터 내년2월까지 공사때문에 휴관한다 함
노원역 유서깊은 수영장! 시설은 그만큼 낙후되었지만 강사님도 좋고 회원들도 텃세가 없음. 물도 깨끗한건 잘 모르겠지만 피부가 좋아짐
자유수영하기 좋은 곳!!! 8천원에 무한대.. 노원역 바로옆이라 가기도 편함.
여러 종류의 운동을 한곳에서 효과적으로 할 수 있고, 한가지 운동 수강 등록하면 다른 시설을 함께 사용할수 있음(예를 들어 수영 수강비 내면, 헬쓰, 에어로빅, 사우나 기타 시설을 무료로 사용할 수 있음)
창동수영장 공사휴관 중에 3개월간 이용해봤는데요 민간시설이라 그런지 강사 관리를 잘하는지 강사들이 모두 열정적으로 가르치더라구요 특히 제 옆라인에서 가르치던 강사님은 정말 열정적으로 가르쳐서 저렇게 가르치면 지치지도 않나 하는 생각이 들 정도였어요ㅎㅎ 너무 신기해서 이름 물어보니 김남현이라네요 나는 직접 배우지는 않았지만 이 강사님 추천함ㅎ
시설 청결하고  직원및  강사진 모두 정열적입니다

Tagpol Park is a city park in Jongno area not far from the Jongmyo Shrine. Also referred to as Pagoda Park, this is an important historical location in Seoul with several interesting things to see. The park is open from 6am to 8pm daily.

column1: Here you can see the 15th century, Wongaksa Pagoda. This is a 10-storey marble structure and an important national treasure which is encased in a glass building and supported by scaffolding. It is similar to the Gyeongcheonsa Pagoda you can see at the National Museum of Korea.

You will also find pavilion covering the historic Monument of Wongaksa, a tortoise with a pillar on its shell created in 1471. There are a number of bas relief murals lining the inner wall of the park. These are images of Korean patriots and the proclamation of Independence, which was recited here at Tagpol Park during the important March 1st Movement in 1919.

Other figures, sculptures and open park space can be found here at Tagpol Park, making this a nice add-on place to visit if you are planning spend time at the nearby UNESCO World Heritage site - Jongmyo Shrine. You can comfortably see the historical attractions here in 15-20 minutes and be on your way.

column7: Maybe a bit too touristic, with many chinise groups around for shopping, but the food is still great. I recommend the noodle alley.
Most beautiful korean Restaurant best menus BBQ and steamboat
Great place to discover historic pagoda and learn about Korea's independence movements in the recent past.
Pagoda and the gazebo were cute but I was too shy to go up because of all the old men scattered around, smoking cigarettes.
**** THE GOOD:

column1: This is supposed to be a traditional village in the middle of Seoul.
We went when the weather was extremely hot, and traveling with young kids.  The information center was under construction and we didn’t know where to go to appreciate this site.
We walked around aimlessly for a half hour (with whining and whimpering kids) before we gave up and walked down to the palace area.
We saw some old style homes and streets, but I’m not sure what the big deal is.  With the steep streets to traverse (with kids) it wasn’t a great experience for us.
I guess if we had found the one street where you look down through multiple old style homes / roofs, it would have been a cool photo spot.
I did find a postcard painting of that famous photo spot so at least I got that!

column7: This is the most beautiful place I've ever been. It was breath taking. People complain I see about not having it layed out for tourists - it isn't for tourists. It's a village kept original and it's beautiful with amazing views, gorgeous buildings, and the most gorgeous girls in hanbok dresses. It was like being whisked away to another world for a little while. Explore, stay quite to respect the area, and enjoy every minute of this beautiful area.
Pros:

column1: - It's a great site to take pictures in and has some craft stores along the route.
- It's a route and not a proper tourist site so we had to walk around for 20 mins trying to find some sites (1 street and many alley ways.
- It has become a residental area, it's not preserved. So the residents aren't really happy with tourist and has lots of warning signs. (Ex: GO AWAY, NOT TOURIST SITE)
Overall: If u want to take pictures here, it's a real effort to come here especially in this heatwave.

column7: The most beautiful hanok village in Seoul and, I think, in South Korea. Very nice houses and very nice view above Seoul. It's a must on your travel list, but if you go there please be quiet when you visit. People still live there and I met a lot of turists who made noise. All of the walls were full of posters "please, be quiet!" or "just visit and pass away".
Historical part of Seoul with a modern twist. Many shop's restaurants, boutique's, shop's that have some nicknack's. Bukchon Hanok Village is worth checking out.

It's me again, the only Foreigner who writes decent reviews in Seoul. This is a really long river that runs through the middle of the city. They used to be a freeway. The former president of the country decided that he in a past life would take a bunch of money to pay the giant freeway through the middle of the city. He got a lot of money for it for his Construction Company. Then he became mayor of Seoul. Then he decided that he would pay another construction company gobs of money to tear the whole thing up. Now it's a beautiful River in the middle of the city that you can run next to. If you like that sort of thing. Would you should if you were in Korea. Running next to rivers is like Korea's national pastime. Isn't Korea a wonderful place? Maybe they'll give me citizenship one day.

I loved taking walks along this stream. It hides you from the crazy traffic on the surface. There are also painted graffiti on the walls which make the place look more funky. Here, people sit by the stream and dip their feet in the cool waters, even as the summer sun blazes above. It's also faster to move around here, since you can avoid pedestrian crossings.

This place in Seoul is really awesome! A green oasis in the middle of seoul city centre. It is really beautiful, I absolutely recommend to go take a walk or do some jogging there in the evening around 6 PM

This stream is honestly so peaceful and relaxing, that i would go back every time I had the opportunity to. The water is full of fishes, the side with chirping birds (and pigeons). We even saw an egret hunting for fish.
The atmosphere and the water are clean and pure, temperature near the stream is lower than the street 2-3 degrees. Fish and bird can live here, in center of a big city, it is a good environment.

column1: Carefull in a rainy day, the bank is quite slippery.

column7: Great meal place with foreign friends.

column1: Also has a decent vegie course.

column7: Great korean food eaten in the traditional style of the past kings. You get a little of various dishes. It is pretty expensive but you can experience how the kings ate. Reservations are a must here.
An excellent Korean restaurant for tourist but exlensive
It is one of the best place to visit to enjoy Korean food. But the unti price of dishes is very expenssive. If not, I will give 5 stars...
Beautiful place for an event. Building is wonderful and gardens well maintained. Staff very helpful and service great.

The views were beautiful. It was a nice hike going up. i wish we had more time so we could have relaxed while enjoying the view. Unfortunately, we went there on our last night so we climbed and went down in a hurry. We were still able to take beautiful pictures. Cafes at the foot of the mountain, near Haehwa Station, so you could eat before or after going up, up to you.

My boyfriend and I walked along the Seoul Fortress wall, and the small hike was great, even in the middle of winter. The view of the city was magnificent, showing patches of green and brown where untouched, and a variety of colours from rooftops and buildings. The park was easy to navigate with the help of the signs (written in Korean and English) pitched throughout. There are also maps in a handful of languages (Korean, English, Mandarin, and others I cannot remember) available at the central plaza (middle of the park).

column1: There is a lot of uphill and downhill, with and without stairs (sometimes uneven steps), so be prepared for a walk. There are some fun little stops, like the Mural Village, where you can appreciate some local art. The park is a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life, and presents some atmospheric views at all times of the day.

column7: Nice place to have a walk and take pictures! The view of the city and the night lights are very beautiful.

I went through several alleys near my air bnb and found this park and Historic site by accident and I'm really happy I found this! The park was really peaceful during the Golden hour, the fortress, and the sunset views were amazing! I was lucky I had my camera with me and this is the best spot to take shots for FREE! Although, there are some observation decks around Seoul, this one has to be the best local secret in Dong-Sung area.
Very tranquil place to watch and take city lights. The walls look awesome in the night 👍

One of the 8 gates of fortress wall that surrounds the ancient Seoul. Small in size compared to other major gates. When people die within the city wall, the bodies used to be carried out through this gate. Such tradition had the gate earn a nickname 'the corpse gate'.
Night view from  connecting wall in  Gwanghuimun.
서울 중구 광희동(光熙洞)에 있는 조선의 사소문(四小門).

column1: 시구문(屍軀門) ·수구문(水口門)이라고도 하였으며 서소문(西小門)과 함께 시신(屍身)을 내보내던 문이다.1396년(태조 5) 도성을 축조할 때 창건되었으며, 1422년(세종 4) 개축된 것으로 추측된다. 《숙종실록(肅宗實錄)》에 1711년(숙종 37) 민진후(閔鎭厚)의 건의로 금위영(禁衛營)으로 하여금 개축하게 하고, 문루(門樓)는 목재를 구하기가 어려우므로 후에 개축하기로 하였다는 기사가 있으며, 1719년 문루를 세워서 광희문이라는 현판을 걸었다. 그 후 1975년 도성복원공사의 일환으로 석문을 수리하고 문루를 재건하였다.

column7: It is the only gate to move the body of the dead person in Hanyang city during the Joseon Dynasty(15c~19c). So the official name is 「Gwanghui Moon」, but it is called 「Shigu(→the corpse) Moon(→gate)」.

column1: It is a historical place that Koreans do not know well.
Also, About 200 years ago when Catholicism was oppressed. At that time, the dead bodies of many Catholics moved out of this gate. So this gate is called  Roman Catholic sacred place.
朝鮮時代（15c〜19c）に漢陽市で死者の体を動かす唯一の門です。だから公式の名前は「光文の月」だが、それは「しぐ」（→遺体）の月（→ゲート）と呼ばれている。
韓国人がよく知らない歴史的な場所です。
カトリックが圧迫された約200年前、また。その時、多くのカトリック教徒の死体がこの門の外に出た。だからこの門はローマカトリック神聖な場所と呼ばれています。

column7: 수백년 문화유산이 원래 있던 큰길에서 밀려나 길가에 서 있는 모습이 안타깝습니다.
가성비 최고
3년째 일본어 공부중입니다.
보통입니다.

column2: Seven Luck Casino Gangnam COEX Branch
column7: As of July 2018 this definitely deserves a 5 star. Don't know why others give it a low star. Winner winner chicken dinner. Mahyo earned triple the minimum full time wage here. Plus, had enough to pay for a luxury taxi to go back to hotel instead of MR to the T.

column2: Seven Luck Casino Gangnam COEX Branch
column7: This is a foreigner only casino. There are a bunch of VIP areas that I didn't check out, but the actual gambling space was a bit small, with a couple tables just for blackjack and baccarat. They also had roulette and other table games. Noticeably missing was craps. One nice thing is that they have a self serve counter with non alcoholic drinks (water, tea, coffee, and juice) as well as a cart with other drinks that they roll around the venue. I also noticed as we are entering that they didn't let an extremely drunk person in (forced him to take a breath test), which i appreciated. They also offer free for vouchers with a couple dishes if you gamble a lot, but I didn't get to that point.

column2: Seven Luck Casino Gangnam COEX Branch
column7: This casino is really small. It seems pretty old and honestly the whole place is a little run down.

column1: There aren't many tables and so you'll be fighting for space with a lot of tourists.
If you're looking to throw away some money, there are much better ways in Seoul.

column2: Seven Luck Casino Gangnam COEX Branch
column7: Very quiet compared to American casinos but it is very clean and very well staffed. The only drawback i was able to find about the casino is that there are no crapps tables here. But they have just about whatever else you want to play.

column2: Seven Luck Casino Gangnam COEX Branch
column7: If you are European this might not be as you expect. No bar or table service etc. If you just want to gamble this place is great, but don't expect the glamour or entertainment side of things to be as in Europe or the US.
Good
백제예술대학이 개관한 420석 규모의 중극장으로 콘서트, 연극, 뮤지컬, 무용 등 다양한 장르의 공연을 열 수 있는 시설로 된 다목적 공연장이다.

column1: 백암아트홀의 무대는 일반적인 액자형 무대와 같은 정형화된 틀에서 벗어나 다양하고 색다른 공간을 연출할 수 있는 가변무대[Adaptable Stage]형식을 채택하였다. 무대, 음향, 조명시설 역시 다목적 공연장에 맞게 설비·시공되었다. 무대의 크기는 최대일 경우 객석이 약 360석 정도 되며 무대가 최소일 경우에는 객석이 424석 규모로 전환된다. 무대 중앙에 속도와 각도 조절이 용이한 턴테이블(Turn Table)을 설치하여 효과적인 무대전환이 가능하다.

column7: 시간의 흔적에 고풍스러움을 더함.. 뚝딱맨 보기 좋은 곳 ^^

위치는 찾아가기 쉬움 삼성역에서 도보 5분~10분정도. 연초부터 여러번 방문하였으나 시설은 타 극장에 비해 좋다고 할 수 없음. 화장실은 계단 참에 위치해 입구가 좁아 사람이 몰리면 계단 위까지 줄이 올라가는데 극장 특성상 사람몰리는 시간이 정해져있어서 더욱 협소하게 느껴짐. 극장내부는 1 2층 나누어져있지만 2층은 1층의 연장이나 마찬가지. a~e열까지 무단차 이기때문에 시야방해가 심함.
아무리 애들 공연이라지만..쩝
They have a vegetarian and clean eating restaurant. Enjoy a snack or meal after you explore the museum.
Nice
1999년 한빛문화재단의 설립자이자 사업가인 화정(和庭) 한광호(韓光鎬)가 약 40년 동안 국내외에서 수집한 미술품을 기반으로 설립하였다. 한국·중국·티베트의 일반회화, 불교회화, 불교조각, 공예품 등 동양미술품들을 소장하고 있다. 평창동에 있다.

column1: 전시실은 소장품의 특별전을 개최하는 공간과 중국도자실과 티베트 불화(佛畵)전시실인 탕카실 등의 상설전시실이 있다. 소장품은 한국미술품이 회화·서예·불화·도자기 등 약 3,000점, 중국미술품이 회화·서예·도자기, 금속·칠기공예품, 복식, 자수 등 약 4,000점 있다. 특히 티베트 미술품은 축 형태로 된 불화인 탕카와 불상, 불구(佛具), 경전 등 약 2,500여 점에 이르는데, 양과 질적 가치면에서 한국 및 세계에서 독보적이라는 평가를 받고 있다.
그밖에 인도의 세밀화(細密畵), 베트남의 도자기·동종(銅鐘) 등 동남아시아 여러 국가들의 미술품, 유럽의 다양한 부채들과 약항아리·약연 같은 제약 관련 도자기 등 이색적인 미술품도 소장하고 있다. 작품 수집과 전시 외에 국내외에서 소장품 특별전과 티베트미술전 등 다양한 전시활동을 활발하게 펼치고 있다.

column7: 얼마전 리모델링을 해서 메가박스 신촌점 내부가 예전보다 더 깔끔하고 멋있게 바뀌었습니다. 신촌 메가박스는 의자도 푹신하고 영화에 집중하기 좋도록 영화관을 잘 꾸며놓아서 자주 이용하고있습니다. 직원분들도 친절하셔서 좋습니다.

I had the pleasure of seeing the American cast of "Dreamgirls" here and it was absolutely fantastic! The cast was beyond talented, and the production values between the lights and the beautiful costumes, were out of this world. The theater was gorgeous and clean, but that staff got a bit pushy when my friend moved over one seat after intermission so her view wouldn't be blocked by the man in front of us anymore. Would have been a 5-star review if it weren't for that rude exchange. All-in-all, a great experience though.
I think world class theater for musical or other performance. Parking is terrible so strongly recommend to use public transportation.
The place is nice. The staff is nice and helpfull. If u cannot buy ticket online. They sell ticket on the venue 2 hour before show.
Beautiful theatre, great performances!
Dream Girls Show and actors. Individual performances is fantastic.

My experience of staying at Seoul National University has been great! The Seoul National University is top leading universities of South Korea, ranked in the World’s Top 100 Universities by the Times Higher Education World University Ranking. Beautiful campus with high quality teaching, faculties, world-leading research, and  friendly campus with an unrivalled position in the heart of the Seoul.

For those who visit SNU with public transportation, I recommend you to expect to take at least 30 minutes from Seoul National University subway station to anywhere in campus. Unlike other universities having great accessibilities, I would say SNU is the hardest place to get to in Seoul. Don’t be tempted to the misleading subway station name - it is not close to the subway station!

I came here last year as an exchange student. The very first impression of SNU was so good indeed the campus was so beautiful (specially gardens were most memorable). Also the students here are so friendly and kind even though I haven't studied other countries except for here but anyhow everything is just perfect so far. As for living cost near the university is so cheap. I think this area is the cheappest in Seoul but there are so many places to hang out, not to mention about 24 hours convenient stores, bars and cafes.
I love korea i want to study there how can i study korean to go there ???
I went to go to this school so bad I just love the idea of living in South Korea . But do you need to know how to speak Korea before coming to this school or do they have a class for that?

Don't even think to try the steak from Gourmet Steak aka 고메스테이그

column1: Been in Korea more than two years, never experienced such bad service. The food were served cold. Yes, a cold steak. We ordered medium and were served RAW MEAT! When we asked them about it, they just fried it and return.
The attached photo shows the "steak" after fry.

column7: You dont have to pay for parking after 11pm. It has everything that department store should have.
행복란 백화점에 예쁜옷과 멋진 옷들이 많았지만 다 산후 B1층에도 먹을것도 있지만 5층에 맜있는 것도 있었지만8시 지나면 문을 닫기 때문에 좀 아쉬었다 (5층에 있는 횃집이 정말 정말 좋음 과자, 음료수, 아이스크림도 있고. 그러고 5층에 있는 횃집은 많은사람이 오는걸 추천합니다.
가끔씩 옷을 저렴하게 팔아서 인근 목동 현대에 비해 가격 메리트가 있는 곳 입니다.  지하에 하나로마트에서  새로 킴스클럽이 개장해서 성업중이죠. 푸드코트는 애슐리 정도가 유명하죠
Huge.  Good variety.  Great food stalls. Large enough to get lost in....
Became labylinth after renovation few years ago. Too expensive. One simple Japanese ramen cost about 11 dollars. Even more expensive than in downtown Sunnyvale.
I was blown away. The best brands. The best tax rebates. Everything I dreamed of under one roof and I grabbed a dinner snack in the food pavilion. Was a delight. Wish we had a Hyundai in Dallas.
very lit and decent place. should visit b1f and 10f food court. u will experience traditional, fusioned and extraordinary cuisine at one place
It is a very luxurious place for those seeking international brands. Prices are a bit in the higher side compared to other malls but it worths being visited.
well equiped with so many stuffs. but coex area hyundai has more things than apgujeong hyundai
a great place for shopping and grabbing a bite to eat. has definitely changed over the years but still one of the premier shopping malls in Seoul

Connected to Apgujeong station (line#3,orange). I especially enjoyed their gourmet street (food court) in the basement floor which has all kinds of dishes to choose from. Their desert is also of good quality, yet you might be a little surprised to find their prices pretty high.
My favorite Hyundai department store in Seoul. I always receive impeccable service here. I usually stop by CGD store here
Most certainly worth a detour. A must visit when in Seoul. Food Hall alone is superb. A great way to try a variety of local favorites.
Amazing place for shopping. The energy us great, and you have to check out the tower.

It is one of the best shopping mall or departmental store not only in Seoul, Korea but also around the world. This is one of the biggest departmental store I have ever been in any other country. It is nicely managed and well designed store to visit.

For learning about ancient civilisation s it is not bad. Very cheap and quiet. Yes, it moves through Korean history but to see how people have progressed and how culture is introduced it is very well done. A little dated, but really well maintained.
It's a huge mall with mart and indoor amusement park.^^ It's great for families and friends to hang out.^^
Gigantic mall has everything. Various high end shops. Has cafes and restaurants of different kinds. Has a cinema and a viewing tower.

Lovely cafes, restaurants, shops and art galleries along this road. It's close to Bukcheon Hanok Villiage, Gyeongbukgong Palace and the Blue House (presidential building). There is a park at the top of the road.

This is one of my favorite places to go for a walk in. There are tons of shops and cute little nooks and crannies to explore. Cafes abound as well so you can stop in one and grab a seasonal drink or the Korean fave Americano. There's a few novelty stores and shops that you can find cute trinkets and souvenirs. There's a shop that sold artworks and prints made by blind students and knickknacks that helped endangered species. This place is also a favorite of young people and couples.

column7: Very reasonable entrance fee. Palace is small 's ale and quite empty. Mostly in Korean. Not very interesting I'm afraid. The changing of guards at 2pm was nice. Be careful of the protests outside the main gate. Riot police too.

Interesting historical place to be visited in Seoul. Located in the heart of Seoul, you will find a little serenity in crowd. You can look back and learn from the shades of Korean past life. What makes this place unique is you can find the contrary view between Korean-style building opposite to European one.

column1: But there is no prayer room provided here. So it's less visitor friendly, especially for Muslims.

column7: This is truly a beautiful sight to see in Korea. Unlike the other famous palaces, this one is located in the heart of Seoul just down the street from city hall. From within the palace grounds you can look around and see the modern buildings of Seoul surround an ancient historical landmark. Warning a hanbok provides free entrance to the palace and touring it can feel as if you're actually a part of the Joseon Dynasty. If you're ever visiting South Korea, this is definitely a location to check out!
One of Seoul"s grand palaces. Quite interesting to observe the changing of the guards ceremony.

column1: Walked the stone-wall road  and enjoyed a very unique atmosphere

column7: If you want to visit Deoksugung or the other palace I highly recommend you to visit it with a free guide. It's a really nice experience and you learn a lot about the life of kings and queens who lived there.

13.05.2018: really appreciated this traditional Korean knots workshop and Master Sung is really nice, she actively introduced her products and passionately showed everyone the steps, all products in workshop were made by her, it’s awesome :)

column1: 첫 째로, 다른 필요한 기기는 상당히 자주 고장나는데 정작 잘 쓰지않는 기기를 새로들이는데에 있습니다. 특히 좌석발급기는 1주일에 1번 이상 고장나는게 아닌가싶을정도로 잦습니다.
둘 째로, 귀찮아서 인지 아니면 공공기관이라 적게나오는 전기세 마저 아낄려는건지 시설 제공에 상당 인색한 모습이였습니다. 3층 좌석의 70%가 사용 중이면 4층을 개방하는것으로 알고있습니다만 제대로 지켜지지 않는듯합니다.
마지막은 제 개인적인 바람입니다만 열람실의 냉난방 및 환풍구를 이용한 환기를 제대로 해주셨음 합니다. 제 자취방만도 못한 환경에 마치 아우슈비츠 수용소를 보는듯 하였습니다.

column7: 한국 공연예술극장의 상징과도 같은 곳이자 대학로의 랜드마크. 내부 및 외부 시설은 매우 청결하며, 외관의 고풍스러움, 상영되는 국내/국제 작품들의 수준 역시 매우 높은 등 특별히 나무랄 곳이 없는 곳. 강남에 예술의 전당이 있다면 강북에는 아르코극장이 있다 할 만하다.

An awesome place...

Seoul Plaza is a square shaped plaza with a an open-ground space in its centre. Situated next to City Hall in the hear of downtown Seoul, this is where free shows, concerts and other events are held throughout the year. There is even a ice-rink during winter holiday season.

column1: During our last visit (October 2017), we found Seoul Plaza ground to be in a bit poor shape. The grounds were well-trodden upon with much more dirt/mud surface than grass. It was much preferable walking on the pavement around the plaza than directly upon the centre ground space.

A stage had been setup on the pavement area next to the City Hall, where a dance performance of sorts was taking place. Plenty of seats were set up but the event seemed to have only attracted a small audience. We took watch for a few minutes before being on our way.

In the end, it really depends on what is on schedule when it comes to Seoul Plaza. Best to check the Seoul Plaza website to find out what is on during the time of your visit. Or when passing through the area, just have a quick look to see if anything interesting is taking place.

column7: Great hotel!

column1: If you want to get even better experience, invest more and get one of their sweets, because the std rooms are small and bit weired.

The location if tge hotel is great too, you can find many shopping options including very big lotte world shopping center, subway market, and their is a great shopping street nearby. I really enjoyed my stay in the plaza 2 times

column7: I went there for the Seoul drumming festival.  It's a great place to have a concert or festival.  Great access to other areas of Seoul too.

Visited the area because of the 20th anniversary of the Seoul Drum Festival. Atmosphere was great with so many seoul-lites coming down for an evening of fun. Expect the plaza to be much more quiet on your typical weekdays. Seoul metropolitan library provides a good place for a toilet if needed.

Foreigners maybe think to be just one of the squares, but it is a special place for Koreans.   First of all it is a capital city of the Republic of Korea, it means the center of the Republic of Korea.

column1: Many democratization protests have been held in the process of democratization of the Republic of Korea, and sometimes cultural festivals and concerts are held for citizens.
Since 2002 Korea World Cup, millions of citizens enjoyed the festival, cheering for soccer in the square.
In the winter season, ice rinks are built and citizens are enjoy skating.

column7: It s huge. And cheap cost. If you want to buy lowest ticket. Connect internet. Like timon korea site. It s just 6000 won. This ticket can sleep here when you arrive 8 pm ago. On one floor there is small store gs25. You can use all day.

This is one of the taping locations of Jun Ji Hyun in The Legend of the Blue Sea. The place is neat. Different kinds of saunas to choose from. But some people talk too loud inside the enclosed room. No respect for others. Food is expensive.
Okay level of sanitary and service considering the location is in middle of Seoul.
Lovely place,,,nice clean sauna,steam bath,resting room very organised
Good
The museum located inside Olympic Park, Bang-i Dong, Songpa-Gu.

column1: Subway Line 9 is under construction on beneath of this meseum. It ssems that the transportation to reach here will be more comfortable.

column7: Nice park with good view. Cafe Eat is a bit weird though. Ordered espresso and wanted a cup for water and they said no. Just a mug hello?
Nice museum
Intimate museum in the heart of Seoul, near the subway station.
Set in a gorgeous park which allows the many modern sculptures to continue outside the museum, SOMA in Seoul is amongst my favourite modern art museums in the world.
5 hours climbs and down. It’s a worthy experience though the climb was tough. The view is breathtaking and it’s windy. Hikers often have snacks when taking a break up there! MUST GO
Great place for easy hiking. Multiple peaks, amazing view over Seoul. Really green nature. Doseonsa is close by.

Quite a challenging hike to reach the peak, especially for beginner. Nice view along the way and also at the peak of the mountain. Make sure you prepare water and food as likely will spent 5-6hrs at least for the whole journey to reach the peak. Also, make sure you go there earlier so that you can return to ground before the day turn dark.

We went on winter, so the landmark wasnt as good. Still, great experience. We went right to the top and went down the other side and took us around 5 hours, cause we went without the appropiate outfit.

column1: When going up was easy, but going down we needed to be a little more careful because of the snow. But they have ropes, so you can go down grabing those

서울중심 지역에 위치한 묘각사

column1: 서울의 중심지역에 위치한 낙산 묘각사는 서울시민의 안심입명 귀의처로서 열려있는 수행사찰이다. 청정법신 비로자나부처님을 봉안하고, 십일면 관음보살상을 모시고 있다.

서울시민을 위한 수행과 대중 불교 운동을 지향한 법화신앙의 중심사찰이다. 현 위치에 절을 세우면 서울이 편안하고, 시민생활에 안정을 가져온다는 풍수지리설에 의해 터를 잡았다고 한다. 현재 낙산 묘각사는 대불보전, 원통보전, 낙가선원, 석굴암, 산신각, 그리고 마애관음상으로 구성되어 있으며, 석굴암에 모셔진 부처님은 9세기에서 10세기 초에 조성된 것으로 추정되는 귀중한 성보문화재이다. 또한 만력 2년 10월(1574년 조선조 선조)에 조성된 청동부처님을 소장하고 있다. 서울의 중심지역에 위치한 낙산 묘각사는 서울시민의 안심입명 귀의처로서 열려있는 수행사찰이다. 청정법신 비로자나부처님을 봉안하고, 십일면 관음보살상을 모시고 있다. 경내에 모셔진 마애 관세음보살상은 천연 바위산인 낙산의 절벽에 조성되어 서울특별시 문화재로 등록되었다.
2002년 세계 월드컵 대회 때부터 전통불교 문화체험인 템플스테이 사찰로 지정되어 올 하반기만 12차 템플스테이 참가자들이 사찰의 문화체험의 인연을 맺었다. 낙산 묘각사 도량에는 태허 대종사의 사리탑과 법성보살의 공덕비가 조성되어 있다.
낙산 묘각사 건축 및 자랑새로 중창한 대불보전과 원통보전의 건축양식은 내5포, 외3포의 금단청의 동기와(銅器瓦)로 조성한 최고의 건축양식을 갖추고 있다.
법당내의 수미단은 홍송(紅松)에 5번 옻칠을 한 것으로 석가모니 부처님의 팔상성도를 양각으로 조각하였고, 부처님을 봉안한 닷집은 전통양식의 9포로 장엄하였다.
대불보전에는 만봉스님의 천불탱화가 모셔져 있고, 석굴암에는 양각으로 조성된 팔부신장과 칠성여래부처님을 모시고 있다. 산신각에는 서울시내에서 유일하게 15세기부터 내려오는 산신제의 전통으로 기도하고 있으며, 산신님, 산신 동자, 호랑이 상(像)을 조성하여 그 기도의 영험함이 널리 알려져 있다.

Nice 5-star hotel. Staff can speak English. Great buffet breakfast.
I felt housekeeping is not so good because I found a sock and a towel with stain at fresh room. But this hotel has nice trail to walk and breakfast was delicious.

It's located near a subway station and big shopping malls at Yangjae, which takes about 10 minutes by walk. There’s also a park nearby. Overall appearance is good. A doorman and front desk staffs are good but its halls and rooms are not soundproofed well. In some halls, noise was heard during the last meeting. Rooms are comfortable but talks from other rooms or hallway were slightly heard as mumbles. FourSeasons, a restaurant, provides neat and nice Korean dishes.
Excellent... housekeeping volunteered top iron my dress.

column1: Buffet offered great tasting international variety breakfast.
Great locations,   close to lots of shopping areas.

column7: Not bad hotel. Staff is quite responsive (yes, some of them do speak English) and always ready to help you. Wi-fi sometimes has quite poor signal. Breakfast is just always the same. Very nice and beautiful park next to the hotel facilities (really enjoyed it). Due to the place is almost anytime crowded by either visitors or guests (because of some performances, conferences, wine fairs, etc.) might be a bit loud. Recommended if you are not seeking for a completely silent place to stay.
Great location in a mall. Daughter was thrilled to go. Mermaid show was nice. They did pack us in like sardines though which was uncomfortable.

Nice aquarium with a few cool fish. Very nice for families, as it is heavily aimed at kids. Get 10% off by taking a picture of the sign further in the COEX mall (or maybe steal the one I posted I suppose).
Coex shopping mall is a very nice place with a various shops and restaurants there's also a small arcade games shop. Easy to reach by Subway. Highly recommended for families.

Simply an amazing experience of underwater life. The best part was ocean kingdom. Watching some exclusive creatures in front of your eyes is mesmerizing. According to me Ticket price is bit expensive. It takes not more than 2 hours to complete the tour inside.
So beautiful and maximum kind of fishes and sea animals...  beautifully located and so calm.. also the bird sounds in the speakers keeps mind so calm...

column1: Love this place...  fit for all age groups...

column7: Namsan Cable Car is the easiest and fastest way for you to visit N Seoul Tower. It is located 10 to 20 minutes walk away from Myeongdong area and the ticket is quite affordable at 8,500 won for adult return trip.

column1: The cable car journey however is short, at around 10 minutes journey if I am not mistaken and takes you straight to the foot of N Seoul Tower. Quite a seamless experience but do take note that the cable car is not operational during bad weather.
Nothing really special except as a convenient way to visit Seoul Tower and Namsan Park.

column7: Definitely a must experience of riding the cable car to reach the TOP. Its a short ride but the view is spectacular and the experience is surely enjoyable. Large spacious cart to houses the visitors per trip up. Surely there is wait in queue to move, and gladly it is moving along all the time. Nice, nice, can clean environment. Very organised in crowded controls. Ticketing service is efficient and easy to understand with many signings explaining the different tiers.
■ Good

column1: - If it is too cold or hot, it's a good way of reaching to the top. Also, if any of your family feel uncomfortable, it is recommended.
- However, I prefer walking up on a mountain road since its scenary is so good to see and there are many places where you overlook city view. These landscapes are different from the one from the top.
In a nutshell, I strongly recommend you to take the mountain trails.(There are several trails.) ★★★

column7: Beautiful scenery. Place is very clean. History is great. And if you are looking for a physical challenge, try walking/biking to the top instead of taking public transport.
Not really worth it for the view as I liked hiking up and taking my time at the viewpoints. Convenient way of getting up and down from the tower.
모처럼의 연극 즐거운 시간 였습니다
보잉보임 보고왔는데요 엄청 재밌네요^^
댕로홀을 찾으면 두레홀이라고 되어있어서 처늠가는 사람들은 정말 찾기 힘들듯 합니다 주소 수정바래요
엉덩이가 아파요
깔끔함

Helpful and friendly staff, although we could not find them at first. They did speak good English. The museum is more of an exhibition since there is no information about the locks at all. Some of the locks have a plate with the name of the lock, but nothing detailing where the lock came from, how it worked or when it was fabricated. The museum is not expensive, but it still feels like something that should be a free gallery.

It was a nice exhibition but there is too little information and context written down about the locks. You would like to now from which time period the locks are and possibly how they work. In the current state a guide would be necessary to provide the information and context about the locks.
Calm and mellow place, good virility of warded locks from different places
2003년 11월 5일, 20여 년 동안 철물점을 운영해온 최홍규(崔弘奎)가 개관하였다. 사라져가는 한국의 옛 자물쇠를 수집·보존·연구하며 전시활동을 통해 자물쇠의 아름다움과 과학적 우수성을 알리기 위하여 설립하였다. 최홍규가 소유한 한국과 세계 각국의 자물쇠 3,000여 점 중 300여 점이 전시되어 있다. 쇳대는 열쇠를 말하는 방언이다.

column1: 4층짜리 건물의 4층에 230㎡ 넓이의 박물관이 자리잡고 있으며, 3개 전시실과 이벤트홀로 구성된다. 제1전시실에서는 각종 자물쇠를 시대별·형태별로 전시하고 있는데, 조선시대에 사용되었던 자물쇠로는 ㄷ자형 자물쇠, 둥근원통형 자물쇠, 함박형 자물쇠, 물고기형 자물쇠, 용형 자물쇠, 거북형 자물쇠 등 약 40여 점이 있고, 고려시대 자물쇠 3점, 통일신라시대 자물쇠 1점, 빗장 11점, 열쇠패 8점, 대형자물쇠 7점이 있다.
제2전시실에서는 함(函), 궤(櫃), 인장함(印章函), 영정함(影幀函), 빗접 등 조선시대 목가구에 쓰인 각종 자물쇠 15점을 전시하고 있다. 제3전시실에서는 아프리카·유럽·티베트·중동·인도·중국 등 세계 각국의 자물쇠를 전시하고 있다. 2004년 가을에는 특별기획전시 대장간을 개최하였다.
사면이 녹슨 철판으로 뒤덮인 독특한 외관의 철제건물은 건축가 승효상의 작품이며, 건물 설계도와 모형이 국립현대미술관에 소장되어 있다. 3층에는 미술전시, 문화공연, 이벤트 등 다양한 문화행사가 열리는 갤러리 쇳대가 있다.

column7: 옛사람들이 쇳대에 부여한 의미는 그렇게 간단치 않았다고 합니다.

성경적으로 아주 귀한 유물들을 깨끗하게 보존하고 전시. 관람할 수 있도록 되어있어 아이들과 방문하기에 유익하다.
연면적 420㎡로, 1998년 11월 개관하였다. 국내 유일의 성서유물 박물관으로서 미국의 고고학자 케네스 바인 박사가 평강제일교회의 박 아브라함 목사에게 기증한 고대 이집트와 오리엔트문명의 유물 2,000여 점을 소장하고 있다.

column1: 주요 소장 유물에는 BC 4000년 경의 이스라엘 토기를 비롯하여 고대 서아시아의 토기 중에서 가장 품질이 우수한 미케네 불레셋 토기, BC 8세기 키프로스의 페니키아 양식 토기, 메소포타미아식 원형 인장 및 이집트의 스캘럽 인장, 모세의 어머니로 알려진 하쳅숫트 여왕의 황금 완장, 이집트의 미라 2점, 수메르의 고대 설형문자 토판문서 등이 있다.

column7: 한국의 역사에 관심이 많은 여행객이라면, 이곳을 놓치지 않는 것을 추천합니다. 이곳은 한국의 역사에 있어 굉장히 유서깊은 장소이기 때문입니다. 공원의 이름에서도 알 수 있듯이, 서대문 독립공원은 과거 일제강점기 시절 수많은 한국인들이 착취당하고 고문당하였으며, 사형당하였던 슬픈 장소입니다. 대표적인 독립운동가인 유관순또한 이곳에서 형장의 이슬이 되었습니다. 잠시 그녀에 대해 묵념하는 시간을 갖도록하겠습니다.

column1: 개인적으로 이곳은 제가 나온 고등학교 바로 옆에 있는 장소여서 추억이 많은 곳입니다. 고등학교 때 만난 첫사랑과 행복한 시간을 보냈던 곳이며, 지금은 비록 떨어져있지만 그 시간은 항상 제 기억속에 행복한 모습으로 자리잡아 있을 것입니다.

column1: So many green to please the eye.

column7: A forested park area that combines elements of a zoo. There are animal and plant exhibits here. There's even a section of deers. This is a very multi-faceted parks. Families come here to camp as well. It's a pity that the path to the Han River was blocked off due to construction works.

More of a park than a forest, though the area is more than big enough. There are many small areas dedicated to group activities,  children's play, and much more. Art is littered throughout the space, so there is something new to appreciate every corner you turn. Bike rentals are available as well. Watch out for bugs during the summer!
Here is so great for family. It is also great for picnic. There are so many trees. There are few pretty cats there where you can play with them.
Lots of things to see, maps are conveniently placed and easy to follow. You could easily spend a whole day there with your family or on a date. Make sure you see the butterfly garden and insectarium.

A very informative museum about the Stream (Cheonggyecheon).

column1: This museum tells the story about the Stream history starting from ancient times, then how it had been covered by the road in ‎‎1958-1977, and the Cheonggyecheon Restoration Project that lasted for two years and three months from July 2003 until October 2005.
Start from the 4th floor (going up by outdoor escalator) and smoothly stroll down viewing each stand.
In front of the museum entrance you can see and visit old houses located around Stream.

There is awesome food hall downstairs with tons of different kinds of delicious food all around. If you are hungry go there. Whole place is basically three buildings with many floors connected together. Department store, Avenuel and Young Plaza. All filled up with shops. There is nice skygarden on top of the Young Plaza to get some rest.

Nice setup for shopping enthusiasts, but if you are to visit the food section get ready for paying double or even triple of the actual market price, especially ginseng! Offered at 150$ for a set but if you go just outside to the underground passage you can find the same item for 65$ and that's the price without negotiating. Only pro is that it has a lot of variety in one place.

I easily spent about twi hours at the food court. There are just too many delicious choices you would not be able to resist. You can have your linch, desserts, drinks , etc at one place. There is good variety of food and I especially love dessert choices. The grocery market is not that good though.

This is like a mega mall building.  It connects to the lotte department store next door via a bridge. It has a movie theater and there is a food court up near the top. They also have a duty free area. Pretty much everything you can want in a department store is here plus more.

I drive by The Art Park routinely and am disappointed with their curb appeal.  I know art is in the mind of the beholder but dilapidated deteriorating brightly colored pianos is not art.  Sorry.  It is an eyesore for the neighborhood and is causing the property values to stagger.  As a homeowner and neighbor I wish you would clean up your property.  I appreciate art.  My brother was a famous artist and I support several museums here in Wichita and I have been around art all of my life.  Please do something to make a better impression for Wichita and your neighbors.

This place is AMAZING. So many options for classes. We have been taking our kids here for many years. The best part is two kids and two activities in ONE place! The 13yr old takes an art class while the 11yr old is getting a cello lesson. No more driving all over town every night of the week. Charles Baughman and Kate Pepper have built a truly wonderful place that is a godsend to busy families.

The classes at the Art Park have been wonderful for both of my children. My 8 year old son has some learning differences and was struggling significantly with academics & behavior in school when I enrolled him in his first after school Art Park class in Kindergarten.  It was one of the best decisions I have made for him.  Art was the first "win" he had -- something he was made to feel successful at and enjoyed doing. I credit his work in art classes as the starting point for a huge jump in academic confidence over the past two years.  I never expected this when I signed him up!  My other son started weekly classes when he was 3 and I am so happy with the things he gets to try and experience during his time there.  I honestly did not think he was "old enough", but the teachers and the preschool curriculum have both captivated him and he loves going!  Art at the Art Park truly is for everyone!

My kids were scheduled for a day camp and with only 3 days notice, the camp was canceled. Very poor customer service to schedule this (with parents relying on it for childcare) and then cancel with very little notice.

Incredible staff & wonderful camps! Always amazes me to see what my kids bring home, super creative! They always ask to go whenever school's out, highly recommend-especially for elementary school ages.
There are music art hall, gallery, bakery, cafes and the main purpose of this place is for disabled students.

ㅋ제가다니는,남서울은혜교회이자,주중에는밀알학교로사용되고있습니다.목사님과성도분들이좋앙사시고,또볼때마다정서적으로도,풍성하고리렉스가되어서,남는시간이있으면짬짬이들러서감상합니다.다양한아이템으로,도자기,유화,동호회그림,유명화가,이북화가들의그림,신앙적인그림,늘쉬지않고,끊임없이다양한부분의대가들,그림이나도자기를보고있자면,참으로행복할때가있습니다.몇년저에어떤작가분이,가족을소재로그린수채화가,어느지인집에걸렸을때,더욱감동이배가되었던기억이있습니다.지하에는도자궁전으로,동아콩쿨까지개최하는,유명한도기로장식된,음악당도잉ㅎ답니다.
저에게 마음의 평화를 가져다주는 장소였습니다.
무료전시지만 수준이 낮은 건 아니구요~

column7: I'm not much for art, but the place is nice. They had a super cool looking VR setup, but I didn't get a chance to use it.
As an interactive and dynamic place to experience art and creativity, this place accomplishes exactly what it sets out to do.
Love their support of the arts community and community projects. I once spilled a glass of wine there and they didn't kick me out.
Artlink is a great contemporary art center in the heart of downtown Fort Wayne.  At nearly four decades old, Artlink has supported visual artists of myriad styles and media.
Went to an art show silent/ vocal auction was pretty sweet. They actually feed people there too!
가격이 싸거나 무료공연이라든가 해서 엄청난 퀄리티를 기대하지만 않으면 만족함. 다만.. 앞사람 머리가 큰건지 좌석이 낮은건지 아님 내가 키가 작은건지...
공연장 훌륭했습니다.
울림은 좋음. 하지만 친절하지는 않음.
공연장이 많고 캐주얼하게 방문할 수있는 곳.
독주회도 여기서 했고 좋습니다

Not quite sure why this place is popular enough to have people queuing up outside its gates before the opening time of 10am. The craft shops here have very interesting merchandise at decent price points. It's more modern/modernist  than the other craft shops in Insadong. Go up to the rooftop - there is a love corner here where couples write their wishes here.

This place is great for shopping again and eating . The street food is fantastic for me. Again what I like may not be to your taste.  The number of eating places is massive remember that some buildings have 4 floors of restaurants all of which are different.  The side streets have many too. The main street is shops of all description there is a small antiques side road. Very Korean items and massive old style radio players and relics from the war. All good and plenty of choices.  The majority of shops will say made in Korea.  Lots of gift shops.  The hand stamp die is popular. A few shops sell a die which you can print on to paper.  I suppose you can say like a seal in older times. Very colourful and artistic.  As I said the street food is good.  Eat as you browse as not miss anything . A place to visit but allow plenty of time again

This place is one of the most popular tourist spot in Korea. IF you are a girl and you go to this place, I highly recommend you to buy handbook (the modern version) or just rent and have a picture of it. But if you are  a guy then buy some traditional soldier materials which are fascinating. I just bought one expensive handbook like a modern style and I am very glad i bought it. DO NOT BUY ACCESSORIES HERE!!! It is all fake and expensive. If you want to buy fake accessories then the express terminal is a better place.

Full of authentic Korean art of all sorts including handwritten hangings in both Korean and Chinese, this Art Market is full of charming stops including places where you can buy lucky poop cakes. The last thing I would expect to be lucky would be poop but there you go. Expect to be changed by moving around in other places.

A nicely place for streets shopping area the area and a a corner that is mores activities happening with events and more shopping. Take a simply stroll alone the street and appreciate how the is maintained and dressed up to spices up the usual shopping. Worth take a look and tourist to have some pictures taken while you are there.
Usually has an exhibition for an emerging local artiat.
很好
very good for pictures exhibitions.
한미약품 본사 건물에 위치. 빌딩 최고층에 겔러리가 있습니다. 주로 사진전을 많이 개최하며,  관람은 무료입니다. 1층 로비에서 한미사진미술관에 간다고 하면 올라가실 수 있습니다.
교통편리하고 한미약품에서 하는 전시와교육 사업도 맘에 들어요
좋은 문화공관
사진 공부 하는 곳
ㅎㅎ
인접성이 좋고 인사동 갤러리에서는 큰 편에 속합니다. 1층에 2개의 전시장과 2층 3층에 전시장이 있습니다. 한국화와 서양화를 가리지 않고 다 전시합니다. 아쉬운것은 주차가 어렵고 맞은편 유료주차장을 이용해야 합니다.
종각역에서 인사동 가는길 초입에 위치해 접근성이 매우 좋습니다.

column1: 요즘 신인작가 발굴 기획전을 하는등 일반인을 위해 개방된 아주 좋은 문화 예술 공간입니다.

column7: 친구  작품 전시회에서.
2층3전시실에서 전시했는덕 전시공간최고
쾌적하고 가까움
Good place
西大門公園から601番のバスに乗り(14:15)延世大学の前を通り漢江を越え1002番バスに乗り換え到着。(45分程度)

column1: 余生を執筆に専念した『東医宝鑑』は、日本にも江戸時代に入って来ている。
屋上の薬草園は、楽しい。子供向けの薬草の本を買ってみた。また小学生以上の子供とも楽しめる体験がいっぱいでした。
100円のオミジャ茶は、本格的で美味しかった。

column7: 韓国漢方医学を総編集して民衆に広めたホジュンの博物館。ユネスコ世界記録遺産「東医宝鑑」本物が貯蔵されています。場所がちと分かりにくいところにあるので、星4つです。
여기는 허준에 대해 아주 자세히 있습니다.
평일에 방문했는데 한적해서 좋았다. 그럭저럭 볼만한 박물관이다
지역사회의 소규모 박물관으로선 시설, 운용, 전시다양성 등이 우수한 편임.
Easily reached by mass transit, and good price. The ice could have been cleaned more often, but not a bad afternoon.

About a 15 minute walk from the subway, good price, well maintained. As a foreigner, I was unaware that gloves and a helmet was required. They provide helmets free of charge and simple gloves for approximately 75 cents a pair.
Perfect place to enjoy ice hickey!!!!
오래되어서 그런지 시설이 많이 낡아보입니다.
가성비로 강북에서 스케이트타기 젤 좋은 곳.고대학생은 일반 스케이트화 대여 합해도 5000원입니다. 학부때 누릴 수 있는 드문 혜택이니 있을때 열심히 이용하세요.(졸업생은 웁니다) 올라가는 길이 좀 고되므로 고대정문에서 학교셔틀버스 타고 가시면 됩니다.
Very nice pagoda

Национальный этнографический музей Кореи/National Folk Muzeum of Korea. За стеной дворца. Типа нашего краеведческого музея. Достаточно неплохой, но с экскурсоводом интереснее - особенно подробности про этапы жизни корейцев. Интересное дополнение к скучному однообразному дворцу. Рядом несколько домиков - образцы корейской деревни. Сбоку - маленький детский музей, но в него не заходили.
어린이들에게 우리의 전통 생활문화를 직접 만져보거나 느껴볼 수 있도록 조성한 체험 위주의 박물관으로서 2003년 2월 17일 개관하였다. 경복궁 내 국립민속박물관 본관의 제2전시실 옆에 2층으로 마련되어 있으며, 면적은 1층이 648㎡, 2층이 345㎡이다.

column1: 다양한 체험 위주의 공간으로 운영해오다가 개관 5주년째인 2008년 12월 24일 옛부터 전해 내려오는 심청 이야기를 주제로 내부를 새롭게 꾸며 재개관하였다. 심청이의 생활, 인당수로 향하다, 내가 심봉사라면, 바닷속 용궁 체험, 왕비가 된 심청 등 5개 공간 속에 효녀 심청에 관한 옛이야기를 현대적으로 재가공하여 어린이들에게 교육적 기능과 함께 전통문화에 친숙하게 다가설 수 있도록 하였다.
관람시간은 오전 9시부터 오후 6시(11~2월은 오후 5시까지, 5~8월 토요일과 공휴일은 오후 7시까지)이며, 하루에 30분 간격으로 1회당 30명씩 총 16회 입장하는 것을 원칙으로 한다

column7: 국립중앙 박물관이나 전쟁기념관의 어린이 박물관과 비교하자면 이제 막 프로그램을 본격적으로 돌리고 있는 느낌입니다. 특별전시에 예약을 받아 과밀화를 막는 등 노하우 활용이 좋네요. 전차나 다방거리 등 야외 전시도 아이들이 좋아합니다..
Bagus
Traditional oriental market for herbs spices and medicine. One of the oldest markets in Korea. Lots of elderly people
beitiful little market
Old market in Seoul for herbal / Eastern medicine remedies.  Check out the nearby museum for an intro to the history of the area which has been where people have gone seeking healing for centuries.
Authentic, lot's of local products (if you can only know which is which.. `-))
서울 약령시장으로 재 발족된 제기동 경동시장으로 동대문구청에서 서울한방진흥센터를 발족하고 한약박물관을 옮긴 약령중앙로 26 은

column1: 찾아가기도  쉽고( 1호선 제기동역 2번출구로 나가 ㄱ 자를 연상하고 찾아가면 200여 m 거리 밖에 되지않는다.) 각종 한의약 관련 자료들이 풍부하게 전시되어 있고 한의약 상식 10문제 중 8문제 이상 맞추면 한의학상식에 대한 수료증을 수여하며, 이멜 주소 입력하면 즉시 수료증을 보내주기도 한다.
한의약에 관한 각종 역사적 사실과 지식을 넓힐 수 있는 좋은 기회가 될 것으로 보이며, 건강에 그리고 한의약지식에 큰 도움이 될 것으로 생각되어진다.

column7: 무슨 작품이 전시중인지 홈피에서 확인하고 갈 수 있어요. 연간회원권도 괜찮을만한 컬렉션이 만원이니 갈만한 것 같아요. 고전시관도 좋고 근대전중에 박수근씨와 제프쿤스도 좋아요.

column1: You can check the on showing collections in homepages. Great collections, especially korean traditional collections and you may see lots of modern times collection. I love sugean-park and jeff koons.

column7: Giving it a 3 stars because I got shouted at for taking a picture of a window looking outward. It's extremely strict and someone is always watching over your every move. It was overall very quiet.

column1: I did like how the place was organized. Second floor is for ancient art with things like vases. The first floor is all modern art. I personally enjoyed the modern art the most. Guess it depends on what you are into.

column7: Really incredible building and very modern.

column1: Museum 1 consisted mainly of vases and pots, which is not my cup of tea. Museum 2 is much more modern and diverse. You are not allowed to take pictures of the exhibition and carry on a bag larger than a purse, but they offer free lockers. Free guided tour on the weekends in English at 3:00 pm (duration 1:30)

column7: I really liked this museum. It has two different exhibits. One is Korean traditional art and ceramics and the other one is modern/contemporary art. The building it self is also worth to visit since the architecture is amazing.

This is a great museum all around--the architecture of the building itself, the organization and maintenance, and the choice of artworks placed side by side, especially in the international arts wing.

column1: I was allowed to take pictures in the Korean wing of the museum, but was chided for attempting to take a photo in the international wing. I guess if they don't want photos for whatever reason, they should put some signs or enlarge the fine print on the back of the ticket.
Finally, if a docent tour is coming through the gallery you're in, they tend to dominate the area. It's disruptive but also makes walking around or enjoying the peace and quiet hard.

column7: Cool place
covered amusement
피겨나 스피드스케이팅 연습하는 모습을 구경할 수 있다. 사람이 많아서 그런지 얼음이 많이 녹아있고 정빙 후에도 물이 많은 느낌. 저녁에 가면 롯데월드에서 하는 퍼레이드 분위기를 지하에서 느낄 수 있다.

column1: 성인 입장료 ₩11000(다양한 할인이 있으니 알아보는것 추천 : 생일자 및 동반 50%할인받았음)
대화료 ₩3000 정도 (피겨화) / 장갑 필수! (현장에서 구매 가능 ₩800)

column7: 진짜 실망했슴. 입장료+스케이트세트 16,000×2 32,000원 냈는데 안전상 목장갑을 따로 구입하라고 함 700×2 구입안하면 입장불가. 신발 넣기위해 락카500원 써야하고 빌리는스케이트는 휘겨스케이트만있고 그러면서 가운데쪽은 레슨한다고 못들어가게하고 빙판은 엉망이라 넘어지기 쉽상이고 위험하다고 사진도 못찍게하고 그럴려면 뭐하러 오픈했나? 도대체 뭘 하라는거야? 휘겨스케이트신고 갈갈이파인 트랙만돌라는건가? 절대 비추....별 -100개 하나도안하면 등록이 안돼서 했슴.
아이스링크는 환경도 좋으며 청결하고 빠르게 청소하며 강추드립니다
국내 최고의 어린이 영어 전문극장
Soso
Combining this with the historical Society wall and the other gates can give you an opportunity to experience a large portion of the city.  This will require a lot of walking and climbing.

column1: This beautiful site is a wonderful stop in the middle of the bustling city.  Consider climbing up to Seoul tower before or after visiting.

column7: You must know the history of this gate so u can feel the meaning of this gate. Very nice place to visit while shopping near namdaemun market.
A must photo opportunity. Historic monument but shame its not 100% original.

column1: Choose visit period carefully, July 27th was +37°

column7: Nice reconstruction of one of the door to the ancient city. Walking distance from Namdaemun Market. Worth a visit of in the area.
A nice place that gives you a good look into the korean history and culture.  All you need is close, there are toilets and it's  a very clean area.
I like and love museum korean !!!
Good Place
훌륭한 컬렉션. 일년에 두 번 여는 곳이라 아쉬움이 남는다.
언능 재개관하여 전시장 보물들과 마주하고 싶네요

대한민국의 보물창고! 국보65호 청자 기린형뚜껑 향로, 국보66호 청자상감연지원앙문정병, 국보68호 청자운학문매병, 국보70호 훈민정음, 국보71호 동국정훈 권1,6, 국보72호 금동계미명삼존불입상, 국보73호 금동삼존불감, 국보74호 청자오리모양연적, 국보135호 신윤복필풍속도화첩 국보149-1호 , 국보270호 청자 모자원숭이모양 연적, 국보294호 백자 청화철채동채초충문 병 소장
Beautiful temple in the center of Seoul, I liked the peaceful environment, the colors, I believe it is a must visit site when you go to Korea to learn about their culture.

column1: And of course it is free of charges.

column7: Beauriful temple in center of city.
This temple has a worth as its own and also good place to travel with Insa-dong, Cheonggye creek and Myeong-dong.
Best Temple. Located in the city near Insadong. Flower festival on early November.

Very great temple located in the city and next to Insadong market. Even though it's not a big temple, but it's decoratedwith flowers beautifully especially in the period I visited (early November 2017).
Picnic time!! Its so great can be here especially with your partner or friends!! Enjoy some delivery chicken or ramen its so great!
A place where every view is different and wonderful. The scenes never get saturated with beauty and smoothness.
Beautiful place....a place which creates network of energy and enthuse....!!
Great place for photography natural things like the flowers bugs

Very cool place to go hang out with your friends have a picnick or some snacks while you wait for the sun to set, also a cool place to drink and have fun, there are convinience stores there where you can buy everything you will need and there are also enough toilets. Very nice for sunny summer afternoons!
Very excited  collection
동대문에 위치한 아동복 도매매장! 대한민국의 유아복은 여기서 출발합니다.

Very expensive. For example i saw the same tops that they were selling for 15,000 in other places for 10,000 won or 5,000. You should bargain even if there were price tags. Ask for a discount. A hat was originally 26,000 i got it for 15,000 after bargaining. There are many floors ( children, shoes, women clothing, men clothing, jewelry etc)

one of the worst shopping area whole entire world.   They will try to rip you off every stores you visit.  we were feel like we have to buy something and not comfortable at all due to guys acting like gangsters.
Many shopping
Good place to get clothing, bags, souveniers etc
Don't go there. They will rip you off with a very high price for poor quality clothes. Not every store is like that, but most of them are so. I will never go back there again.
Hood
개인적으로 주말마다 가서 책을 읽는다.

column1: 옆에 바로 언주중학교가 있어서 축구할땐 좀 시끄러운 편이다.
독서실 (열람실) 이외에 책을 읽으려고 오는 목적으로 오는 사람이 적어서 좋다

column7: 무료 책 대여 가능. 볼만한 책도 아주 많음
도서량 적다. 열람 불편하다. 전반적으로 좁고 낙후되었다.
공공재 처묵처묵 할 수 있는, 세금 으로 운영되는 공공 도서관

The view of the mountain was amazing at top, you will encounter some big rocks while you hike, sit down and take some rest or have snacks what I love most was the relaxing view when I was sitting under a big rock in a quite place.

Nice hike, which is easy to access via metro. There is very limited amount of signs in English to the start of the trail/ throughout the trail but people will help you. Probably less crowded that Bukhansan. Beautiful autumn colors in October when I visited. The peak has a Korean flag on the top so don’t be fooled and think some of the lower peaks are the end (you can’t see the real peak from these), just continue the trail :)
Beautiful mountain for hiking.

column1: Its easy accessible going up and down. Location of this mountain is far from the city centre. Easiest way is to take the subway to Danggogae then transfer to another bus.

column7: Beautiful and accessible mountain. Lots of trails. Most signs and maps only in Korean.
Good for hiking
수락산과 맞붙어 있어 연계산행이 가능하며 뒷쪽 별내면에 퇴뫼산 또한 산책하기에 좋은 산
낮이나 밤이나 자연의 아름다움이 살아 숨쉬는 곳
서울에서 쉽게 접근할 수 있는 산중하나로 예전과 다르게 정상부까지 계단이 설치되어 있어 정상에 쉽게 오를 수 있다
언제나 아름다움을 선사하는 산
Bonne chaussures recommandées
지하1층에 수영장 4층에서는 문화교실로운영
오랜 전통이 있는 곳이에요 :)
안좋아요.괴롭히는얘들이많아요.
중요무형문화재를 지키는 곳이 많지 않다. 이러한 공간을 만날 수 있다는 것이 좋다.
가볼만한곳
무대와 객석의 사이가 넓지 않아 서로의 호흡을 느낄 수 있다.
선정릉역 3번출구

Made a reservation at Korea House after reading reviews about it. You can enjoy traditional Korean cuisine here. However, the price point is significantly higher. I had a meal for 47000 won. There was seafood, including crab stew. Even though the portions of the food was small, by the time I was done with the courses, I was full. I would say that the food isn't super amazing as you would get at the food carts. But it has a more elegant taste, that makes it taste good.
Amazing traditional korean food. Great place as the building itself is very traditional. Heard that they have some performance but I didn't watch. A bit on the pricey side though.

Very reasonable entrance fee. Palace is small 's ale and quite empty. Mostly in Korean. Not very interesting I'm afraid. The changing of guards at 2pm was nice. Be careful of the protests outside the main gate. Riot police too.

Interesting historical place to be visited in Seoul. Located in the heart of Seoul, you will find a little serenity in crowd. You can look back and learn from the shades of Korean past life. What makes this place unique is you can find the contrary view between Korean-style building opposite to European one.

column1: But there is no prayer room provided here. So it's less visitor friendly, especially for Muslims.

column7: This is truly a beautiful sight to see in Korea. Unlike the other famous palaces, this one is located in the heart of Seoul just down the street from city hall. From within the palace grounds you can look around and see the modern buildings of Seoul surround an ancient historical landmark. Warning a hanbok provides free entrance to the palace and touring it can feel as if you're actually a part of the Joseon Dynasty. If you're ever visiting South Korea, this is definitely a location to check out!
One of Seoul"s grand palaces. Quite interesting to observe the changing of the guards ceremony.

5 hours climbs and down. It’s a worthy experience though the climb was tough. The view is breathtaking and it’s windy. Hikers often have snacks when taking a break up there! MUST GO
Great place for easy hiking. Multiple peaks, amazing view over Seoul. Really green nature. Doseonsa is close by.

Quite a challenging hike to reach the peak, especially for beginner. Nice view along the way and also at the peak of the mountain. Make sure you prepare water and food as likely will spent 5-6hrs at least for the whole journey to reach the peak. Also, make sure you go there earlier so that you can return to ground before the day turn dark.

We went on winter, so the landmark wasnt as good. Still, great experience. We went right to the top and went down the other side and took us around 5 hours, cause we went without the appropiate outfit.

column1: When going up was easy, but going down we needed to be a little more careful because of the snow. But they have ropes, so you can go down grabing those

column7: Amazing hike! Had a great time at the very top! Beautiful view! A must for any one in Seoul!
Very scenic place for trekking. With lots of trekking tracks in the mountains. Well maintained tracks. Lots of temples to visit.

A national park with stunning peaks right in the middle of a city. Hundreds of miles of trails, dozens of Buddhist temples - I could live up here on weekends. The entrance at Dobong is worth checking out for picnics and family outings as there is a nice park area by the stream as you enter where you can play in the water, and further upstream there are nice picnic areas overlooking the stream.

column1: The only downside is that on weekends half the city is in the park. Also, climbing up to the peaks can be treacherous. Koreans tend to be pretty cavalier in their hiking, scrambling up rocks and steep paths where a slip could be dangerous, and don't tend to slow down when trails are packed. There seems to be a lack of healthy caution that I'm used to from hiking back in the Cascades and Rockies in the States.

column7: Dozens of trails, beautiful view of the city, tons of places to buy hiking gear at discounted prices, tons of pochas.  Had an absolute blast!

날씨가 맑아 저멀리 시내가 또렷이 보입니다. 월 2회 이상 다니는데 이렇게 맑고 멋진 날은 처음인 듯 싶네요. 원터골, 옛골을 거쳐 가는 것이 일반적이라 저도 이쪽을 많이 다닙니다. 매바위, 옥녀봉, 망경대, 이수봉, 석장대 등 볼 곳이 아주 많습니다. 저는 망경대를 강추하고 깊은데 비가 오는 날이나 눈이 오는 날은 조금 위험하기에 피하셨으면 합니다. 망경대의 경치가 최고로 아름답기에 이곳을 10회 갈 때 1번 겨우 갑니다. 갈 때마다 조금 떨리기도 하고요. ㅋㅋㅋ 하기야 산을 잘 타시는 분들에게는 더할 나위가 없지만요. 이곳에서 사람을 마주친 적은 거의 없네요.

column1: All: Genuflect with the Sign of the Cross.
Guardian: You are the Way, the Truth, and Life of Salvation for us.

People: In the Love of God, the Father, You have glorified His Name through Your Holy Cross and Resurrection, You have redeemed us, the Repentance Children, back to the Father with Your Blood and Water of Life.

Guardian: Jesus, You know our hearts and our sins. We are too weak and a nothingness without You by our side. Obstacles are laid heavily upon us; as we overcome one, there come seven of seven times seven over shadowed and weighted down on us. In the misery, we remembered Your Agony in the Garden that You said "Pray that you may not undergo the test."(Luke 22:40) May our prayer be heard by our Merciful Father.

People: “Our Father in heaven, hallowed be Your Name, Your kingdom come, Your will be done, on earth as in heaven. Give us today our daily bread; and forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors; and do not subject us to the final test, but deliver us from the evil one.” (Matthew 6:9-13)

column7: The Myeongdong Cathedral is an active Roman Catholic church and seat of the Archbisop of Seoul. The cathedral as between 1892-1898 and is dedicated to Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception.

column1: Interestingly, Myeongdong Cathedral is the first church built of bricks in Korea. It is a rare example of Gothic style architecture in Asia. Here you'll find expected narrow nave with high vaulted ceiling and window seals. The interior features attractive stained glass windows, paintings on both sides of the nave near the front of the church as well as images of the disciplines behind the altar.

The exterior of the building is a subtle design of various brick material, providing a simple and humble appearance, different to more ornate cathedrals you may have visited in Europe. There are religious sculpture figures in front of the church that you might want to see as well.

In the end, Myeongdong Cathedral is a good attraction to see in Seoul. It is out of place in the busy, lively Myeongdong district but makes for a good break from the lights, shops and dining of this area neighbourhood.
Note: Myeongdong Cathedral is open daily for visitations, you can also find the mass schedule available online.

column7: I love the building structure and how quiet this place is.

column1: Very nice place to take photo and walk around the area. :)
It is just beside the Myeong Dong food streets.

column7: Came by 6yrs ago and loved how beautiful & peaceful it was. Was happy that I managed to attend mass on a recent visit back, loved the bookstore!
Beautiful cathedral. Several masses as well, in several languages. Truly a sanctuary.
Such a wonderful mountain hiking in Metropolitan area

column1: Hiking on rainy day or day after rain is awesome. Gwanak mountain is rock mountain. It is wet in rainy day, but not muddy.
The Gwachon side stream is full of water.

column7: Great short hiking trail during Autumn..Probably take about 3 hrs up n down. A very popular place for local to hike..A bit challenging while about to reach the peak but not major problem..Just a bit of climbing needed..Rope n foot rest located at strategic places to help u climb..Enjoy my hike.. Peaceful Day with Nature @ Seoul..
This course should be alright for all level climber~~ the view on the submit is gorgeous ~~
Nice place that you can a good view of the city

Had a great hike here in Autumn.  Was told that the trail can be wet in October, but when we went it was great.  The trail is accessible by train stop at gwacheon and offers a stop at a Buddhist mountain temple and a 360 panoramic view of Seoul.  The fall colors were also gorgeous.

column1: Can be tough to find a clear day. The trail was also very well maintained.  I would rate the hike up as moderate, primarily because the hike has a consistent moderate grade. Roughly 500m over the course of 2.5km.

column7: Amazing palace with beautiful architecture. Entry was free with the discover Seoul Pass. We had just come from Gyeongbokgung so this place seemed smaller compared to there. The palaces looked similar on the outside but the decorations here were a bit more colourful. This place also has tours to the secret garden, the tickets are extra to the entrance ticket and located near the entrance of the garden. We had just missed the last English one for the day so decided to go to the next place instead.

Beautiful place to stroll and learn about Korean history. Guided tours of the Secret Garden are offered in English and definitely worth your time. Bonus: free admission if you are wearing traditional Korean garb! But a steal either way since admission to the general grounds and gardens won’t set you back more than $10. Final tip is to bring water since there isn’t a huge presence of concessions on the grounds.

A must see  .. beautiful place. Crowded if the tour is on a weekend but it's worth it .. you just see it once , take amazing pictures and have a nice coffee . Don't forget to got to small shop to buy a souvenir  ( we bought a magnet and some great postal cards that you don't find else where ) .... oh and an important thing ( for girls ) there are toilets hahaha.. very very clean ... ;).
Very beautiful palace. The color and architecture are so intricate. Didn't get to see the full palace as it was way too hot but will visit again.
A nice palace in Seoul. There is a bid garden in the back calls 'Secret Garden' very peaceful.

조용하고 아담한 절
Lovely area, right in the center of the financial district of Yeoido. There are little gardens, ponds and activity areas. It's common to find seasonal events hosted here as well.
Very nice park to take a stroll, jog, or even ride a bicycle or Roller-Blade around. There is a rental shop for bicycles and rollerblades.

column1: The open compound has a market going on now (15 April 2018) celebrating the blossoming of the cherry blossoms it seems. Lots of food stalls, game stalls and stalls selling accessories or clothings.
There is an aircraft C-47 on display in the open area and visitors can climb up to take a look at the aircraft interior.
A nice place to spend a leisurely morning, afternoon or evening.

column7: Great park with beautiful scenery and one of the largest parks in Seoul. So big that you cannot finish walking all areas of it in 1 day. There are many seatings here and ample toilet stops. You can also rent a bicycle here. One thing to note: you cannot smoke in this park.

There are so many little gardens!  There are places to sit and eat lunch with friends, plenty of flat grass for picnic, about 6 outdoor gyms, a bike trail and walking trail that run around the entire park, ponds here and there, and so many rentals! There is ice skating in winter, and now that it's spring you can rent bikes, roller blades, basketballs, and scooters. I love walking around this park!
Amazing gem in the middle of a busy city. Large Plaza and nice pathways came here during cherry blossom season and I do not regret visiting this gem.

The area is really big. Spent one whole afternoon in the children's museum. Entrance fee is considerably cheap as compared to the size of the museum's play area and the activities available. Do not have sufficient time to visit other areas. Definitely need to come again. A lot of free activities provided at the park.

Great place for children. Adults can enjoy the  park as well. Playground, zoo is free. Amusement Park is not crowded with tourist. So queue is not long. Ticket applies for amusement park. The stay should last half a day....
Oh so budget but oh so great. I love that this place exists. It's an unintentional throwback to what top notch family amusement in the late 70's and into most of the 80's

It's one place pocket friendly, where we can enjoy with complete family....Zoo, Animal show,Amusement park,water fountain, kids museum n more importantly nice garden to hangout in summer....Oh! Stroller facility for kids make it more helpful.

This is a good place to bring kids. There is a science center, a playground, a greenhouse, and a small zoo. There is no entrance charge. The kids have a lot of fun on the playground. I am giving it 4 stars for two reasons. The animals in the zoo don't seem to be that well cared for, and the enclosures are pretty small and uninteresting. Also, the science museum is a little disappointing. There aren't as many opportunities to really roll up your sleeves and play or make things as at other science museums around the world, such as Telus World in Vancouver.
Very nice are for a good afternoon with the family. Great place for pics and picnics

It is really nice and calm. We went there feom the national museum and tried to get out feom the north side of the park. However there was a wall around the whole park so getting out resulted in a lot of walking.
Great place for families with kids. Have camping area, kids playground, lakes with fountains...
Great place to get away from the busy city life. It's really big and spacious. Has monuments, a pond and even a small waterfall called Dragon Falls.
Quiet in a large area. Not easy to access without driving.
사육신공원 여의도불꽃축제때는 미어터지니 요주의. 마스코트는 고양이인듯하다
Good photo opportunities. Lovely and clean. Free.
Interested museum like village in seul, might be worth to see it, even if the complex is not that big it gives a glimpse at old official buildings.
Free entrance. Small area. You can rent hanbok here for a small fee; KRW 3,300 for a duration of 20 minutes for your photo taking session around the area.
Small, but free palace to wander through. A nice contrast to Changdeukgong Palace.
Good tour guide.  Great history

Great history here. It cost 3,000₩ to enter but it's totally worth paying a few bucks extra for a guided tour. It tells you more of the history and the fun facts about the palace. If you'd like to dress up in a traditional Hanoi, you should visit stores outside the palace. If it wasn't a hot day in June, I probably would have since the dresses look so pretty. They also have costumes for men too.

column1: Also make sure to bring plenty of water since they only place that solid water I could find was the National Folk Museum and I spent hours under the hot sun wandering around the place. Its massive so do bring comfortable shoes. And overall have fun!

column7: Very beautiful palace, the biggest.. too shame that it was mostly destroyed but its remaining beauty is yet enjoyable.. and even after 1st visit .. one will feel the need to revisit again as it is really huge and one can't get to see it all in one day.. but it's open for free on national holidays.. we were lucky that we had a very knowledgeable guide that showed us through its beauty and directed us to the important features in each corner.. but yet if there was no guide you'd still enjoy the atmosphere of the beautiful korean history.

The palace is so amazing constructed back then. The oldest the five. It is worthwhile going there earlier to avoid the peak crowd timing and you can enjoyed the traditional Korean culture. A very well maintained place to view. Great for many photo taking of the all place, especially when there lesser crowd. You should proceed to view the palace from the rear entrance, which has a very nice cultural museum building. When you moving along the buildings and headed toward the main,you will get more and more amazed.

Gyeongbokgung is a great place to visit for cultural learning and photo opportunities. If you come on certain days, there is even a free English tour provided by some Korean middle school students. The students speak English very well and are very knowledgeable about the palace! It's a great way to experience this part of Korea.

Beautiful palace. Most of the buildings are recreations due to destruction during the Japanese occupation prior to and during WWII. There are nearby options to rent period clothing. While I did not avail myself of the option, those who did seemed to be far more uncomfortable in the heat, so I would advise taking into account the time of year before making that decision. While the buildings themselves were beautiful, there was very little in the way of decoration in about 80% of the buildings, with no view inside even, though the building with interior decoration were well done.
It is Korean version of NY time square.

column1: they celerbrate and greet new year in front of this big bell at year end!

column7: It is a historical place that is definitely worth a visit.
Nice place to just sightseeing or meet up spot.. Better at night because of the lamp. But the bell will be rang once a year, every New Year. Be ware of the crowded.
Awesome night on the new year’s eve there, fully packed with enthusiastic people and I am glad to be part of this experience.

column1: Must recommend for anyone visiting Seoul on the new year’s eve.

column7: Went there to witness New Year Celebrations on New Year Night, on recommendation from Korean official tourism website. To my utter disappointment, there were no fireworks. There was a lot of rush and suffocation. Not worth a visit on New Yeat Night at least. Instead consider going Lotte World Tower in Jamsil.
Super nice place for all ages to walk, exercise, and play in! Also, a great walking date spot on summer evenings~♡
역사적으로 대한민국을 위기에서 구한 위대한 영웅의 사당이 있는 걷기 좋은 공원. 주변에 애견들을 위한 공간이 있음.
Small family park enough for a short walk on weekdays. On weekends you may see traditional Korean marriages. It has a small place to walk your dog as well.

A very nice wide park where one can enjoy skating and hiking. Also, there is a beautiful Buddhist temple where you can feel traditional Korea. Additionally you can make some workout in outdoor gym facility in here.
Good place to bring you family to stroll
Nice market

During the Joseun Dynasty, after the Imjin War(Japanese army invasion. AD16c), Chinese army helps Joseun to defend. But the real reason is to protect theirs country. After the War, Chinese king ordered the shrine to be built( Memorial of Guanoo General who is chinese war god). It was built by Chinese oppression. Therefore, this place is like a shame of the Joseun peoples. And nowadays korean peples do not know this place well. So that is why Shrine maintenance is not good. Also there is a used market at the entrance of the shrine.

column1: 임진난 이후 중국의 강요로 만든 의미있는 사당. 관우사당.. 역사의 아이러니가 아닐까 한다. 중국 장군사당을 우리나라에 세운다는게.. 그래서 그런지.. 관리가 꽝이다.. 그나마 과거에 비해 꾀 깔끔해진 것이다.

column7: 벼륙시장 수입과자 고기튀김...볼거리 다양
東廟蚤の市。東廟前駅３番出口～清渓川（永渡橋）は平日も土日も開かれ、その他の路上では主に土日に開かれる。
A good big clean subway station. Also the public toilets are great here! !!
There's good shopping at this station if that's your thing.
Clean neat subway station, not sure why Google asks me to review subway stations...
