갤러리아백화점과 연결되어 있으며 압구정 한양아파트, sm본사, 청담동 명품거리와 가까움. 그말인즉슨 이러한 시설을 이용하는 사람들은 지하철 잘 안 탈 거라는 거;;; 역은 지어진 지 오래되지 않아 깨끗함
If you want to visit traditional Korean temple but don't have time to go out of Seoul, Bongwonsa Temple would be a great choice.

column1: Recommend this place for those who think like that.
1) Jogyesa is good, but traditional buildings are few. Something is not enough.
2) Bongeunsa is cool, but it's so urban and modern. I want to see a temple in the mountain.
3) I wonder how is more typical version of Korean temple.
4) But I don't have time to go out of this city!
To visit, take a bus at Anguk station, Gyeongbokgung station or Dongnimmun station.

column7: 아늑하고 산속에서 힐링하는느낌 다운타운카페도좋은데 가끔이곳에서 거니는것또한 매력입니다.그리고 밑에 불가마한증막이있는데 땀빼는곳으로 유명명소이니 같이체험하는것도 좋아요
처음 갔는데  서대문구 안산 바로아래 있던데요.한오백년이나 된 느티나무 보호수도 있고 대웅전 앞에는 커다란 연잎들이 꽉차있고 군데군데 연꽃들이 하나둘 피어나고 있습니다.
도심 사찰에서 연꽃축제와 다양한 문화행사에 즐겁게 힐링하고 왔습니다
서울시내에서 가까운 서대문에있는 봉원사
>주변이 '신계역사공원'으로 꽃단장하여 누구나 부담없이 방문하기 좋습니다

column1: 2017년 10월 17일 확인된 정보입니다. 이후 변동사항이 있을 수 있으며 위 내용에 반영되어 있지 않을 수 있습니다

column7: 도심공간에 안식과 평안과 아름다움과 신앙심 고취가 가능한 아늑하고 아름다운 성지입니다
순교자들의 삶을 엿볼수있는 성지
당고개순교성지, 노원구가 아니고 용산구 당고개임
성체안에계신예수님

새남터 순교성지 이곳에 순교의 피가 뿌려지기 시작한 것은 1801년 신유 박해 때 치명한 중국인 복자 주문모 야고보 신부님께서 자진해서 의금부로 가셨고 새남 터에서 순교 하시면서부터입니다 1839년 기해 박해 때는 세 분의 사제께서, 7년 뒤인 1846년에는 병오 박해 때 한국 최초의 방인 사제인 김대건 안드레아 신부와 현석문 가롤로가 참수되셨습니다 1866년 병인 박해 때는 여섯 분의 사제들이 순교 하셨습니다

column1: 새남터가 다른 성지와 다른 점은 사제들의 순교 지라는 것입니다.
목숨을 다하여 하느님을 첫 번째 자리에 모시고 신앙을 증거 하신 순교자의 얼을 잊지 않겠습니다

column7: 너무 좋았다!! 사무장님께서 안에 성당내 구조와 보면 좋을곳을 위치를 설명해주셨고, 성물방에서 이쁜 묵주팔찌들이 많이 판다.
성당사무실 사무장님이 까칠하십니다. 순례자들이 많으니 까칠. 모두가 이해해 주셨으면 좋겠습니다.
网上查到的圣堂，很有特色！里面很漂亮啊
거룩하신주님

Pleasant mid-size park.Wifi,store,exercise equipment,badminton and baseball courts but no facilities for young children.The museum,a former prison,is interesting but again some of the exhibits are unsuitable for youngsters.

The independence gate is located in Dongnimmun and it's close to other hot-spots just as Ewah University and Gwanghamun. Seoul Station is rather close as well. The Independence Park as toilets, a convenient store, is clean and well maintained. The Seodaemun Prison Museum is also located in the park. A traditional market is just across the street.

This is a great historic park in Seoul. It is the place of the independence movement march. The best time to visit is March 1st, Independence movement day. Transportation is well connected to subway and buses. Its a good place to roller blade or walk around. It is also close to the path to a mountain trail and a historic Japanese prison museum that held independence leaders during Japanese occupation.
If you visited Seoul you should come to Doknim mun park. ( Independence gate from Japan)
We visited here when we went to Seodaemun  Prison History Museum. This is related to the Independent movement in Korea against the Japanese rule.
불교상담개발원과 어산작법학교가 경내에 있습니다.
서울 시내에 있는 고찰로 흴링하기 좋은 곳입니다.
전통사찰
당신은 무슨 종교길래. 비난을 합니까? 기독교, 천주교면 이런곳 욕할 자격이 없습니다. 어떻게 그노래을 부르고 하는게 무슨 소음이에요? 당신이 불교라면 당신은 불교 정신이 부족한것같습니다.
부처님 오신날 에 즈음하여  여러색상의 연등이 맞이하는가운데 잠깐 들렀는데 도심속에 이런 절이 있는줄 몰랐네요.

Bongeunsa temple for the first time but I love the place so much! Many things to see, walk around and pray. The day I went was cool as there was  a lantern festival - very colourful and the weather is great. Bongeunsa is also well connected with the subway too so it's really reachable and easy to find. The place is photogenic so it's great to take lots of photos! Will of course return every time I visited Seoul.

Love it here. It's pretty much tranquil eventhough it is located in the city centre. It's close to any other attractions in Seoul as well. You can explore here half a day and it's recommended to come early in the afternoon. Restroom and small shop are available. Be careful not to disturb people who pray here while you visit.

One of the more beautiful Buddhist temples I’ve been to.  When I visited it was vibrant with Buddhist practice and chanting.  It was so peaceful and a nice rest from the hustle and bustle of Seoul.  I wish I had known how nice it was and planned for a temple stay.

A beautiful temple full of beautiful people, and a very welcome place of peace in the heart of the hustle and bustle of Seoul. The guide at the gate rushed out to give us an English map and his recommendations with a lot of humor and soul. Once you've looked around the temple complex, don't miss out on a relaxing and delicious tea ceremony with Korean rice sweets 🍵🍡
I am local. Sometimes I take a walk here. Although I am not Buddhism, but I feel comfortable in this temple. If you are a foreign traveler, I recommend you to visit Bongeunsa after visiting coex.
국가문화재임에도 국민들이 들어가볼수 없는 곳.. 하루 빨리 개방되길
10년만의 개방으로 가본 곳. 평상시는 입장 불가. 한국 3대 정원이라는 설명답게 아름다운 곳입니다..
1992년 12월 28일 사적 제378호로 지정되었다가 2008년 1월 8일 명승 제35호로 변경되었다. 지정면적 1만 4,407㎡이다. 조선시대 민가의 조원(造苑)으로는 서울에 남은 유일한 것이다. 조선 철종 때 이조판서를 지낸 심상응(沈相應)의 별장을 의친왕이 별궁으로 사용하던 곳이다.

column1: 공간구성은 쌍류동천(雙流洞天)과 용두가산(龍頭假山)이 있는 전원(前苑), 영벽지(影碧池)와 폭포가 있는 내원(內苑), 송석(松石)과 못이 있는 후원공간 등 자연지형에 따라 조원된 세 개의 공간구역으로 나눌 수 있다.

column7: 조선 최고의 정원은 보길도로 가세요
보수목적인지 앞을 못보게 가려놓아 볼수없었다
처음 가봤는데  아이들이랑 넘 잼 있게 다녀왔어요~ 취사는 안되고 도시락 싸가지고 갔는데 잘 올 다 왔습니다.

有兩個不同高度的雪撬道，地點近首爾市區，適合想玩雪但未想學滑雪的小朋友。
아기와 놀기 매우 좋음!

column1: 각 체험은 추가 비용이 들고 빙어튀김은 현금을 안내면 째려봄

column7: Lovely area. Plenty of parking and amenities i.e. Water fountains, toilets and bins everywhere. A central cafe/restaurant area. Lovely well kept gardens, good views and easy access by stairs or bus to the Skypark. Areas for dogs, sports etc.
Easy to reach by subway. Shopping mall inside a stadium.
Huge and nice park you can walk there for hours and I love to go see the spiders there this are so cool
Very big stadium with direct access to MRT
Great place for couples to walk and relax and of course for photoshoots
This is quite a big Dept. Store, right at the exit of Myeongdong Subway Station.

column1: There are countless booths/stalls inside selling fashion. Most of them cater to a younger crowd I'd say. But it's not really anything special or stylish. Also quality-wise.

The worst part are the (partly) insane prices. Well, maybe some of them are (at least in S. Korea) well-known brands. But nothing just did it for me here. Or my wife. Maybe we're just too old for this....

Besides that it's not a well-maintained store. It looks old, it looks tired. There's no fun - no atmosphere. And only few customers. It was ok for a quick look at the latest "fashion". But not more....skip it.

column7: Maybe in the past was a better place where to find nice clothes and accessories. Now there are less shops and more offices.
The hotel is good location
Lower end
생각보다 싸진 않은 가격.

Easy to get to. Very clean. Comfortable seats. You can go with friends or family. Awesome atmosphere during the games. Restrooms are clean. You can bring your food and eat while watching the game. Great
The atmosphere is second to none. Great seats great game. Just what you need to relax on a Saturday afternoon. Watch a great game with friends and family.
Good facilities and good transportation systems are here

column1: In the stadium, seats are clean and placed very well to watch the game.
The problem is quality of their performance.. I hope they improve their skills and the way of performing

column7: As you may know the dream concert 2018 was held at this stadium on 12th May. Unfortunately, the weather was terrible and it was pouring down with rain. This led to the stage being wet, however no roof was put up to prevent this and caused many NCT members to have some very bad falls which may have caused some injuries. It is your responsibility to ensure that all members remain out of harms way. We are very concerned and hope that in the future you will at least provide a decent rain cover on the stadium to prevent anything as such from occurring again.We hope you take our concern into consideration. Thank you for taking your time to read this.

Great stadium. Lots of amenities. Plus the Sky Box. Cost of entry for matches incredibly  low compared to Europe. Season ticket is about  $200. Great value. Matches can be so so; but great atmosphere.

The buildings and scenery are very calming and serene. Walk through the park and imagine the spirits walking next to you. There's a short 13 min movie that plays on a loop in the park to educate you on the history. The cost for my wife, son and I was about $3 us. Sat and Mon you don't need a guide. All other days you do. Glad we did it.

A beautiful place to visit. There are guided tours allowed here only, which is fine because it gives a wonderful overview of the history and what each building is used for. The spirit tables are housed here and the shrine is used for ceremonial purposes. The gardens are very well kept and stunning and the building are in good repair and have been well looked after.

Visited 11th June 2018. The English tour guide was excellent in explaining the site. It was very quiet and peaceful and the size of the shrine is awe inspiring. It's well worth the price of admission.
Jongmyo Shrine is one of the UNESCO World Heritage areas in Seoul that makes for a nice place to visit if you are interested in seeing historical buildings from the Joseon Dynasty.

column1: Note: Visitation are subject to guided tours only during the week. However, you can visit independently on Saturdays.

Here you will find Confucian style shrine complexes which were used for memorial services for deceased kings and queens of the Joseon Dynasty who ruled Korean from the late 14th century until the end of the 19th century.

The Jongmyo Shrine grounds include four main clusters of buildings which you can browse around. Most are not open to view inside but you can appreciate the symmetry of their design and layout as well as the significance of their presence here.

As you walk around there are a few opportunities to glimpse into open halls, allowing you to view panelled paintings and shrine altars. Throughout, you will find signage at important walking path junctures, providing details regarding the shrine buildings in front of you.
Note: Visits during autumn means that you can see the shrine buildings during the fall foliage, providing lovely colour to time spent at Jongmyo Shrine.

column7: I enjoy the video explaining the tradition of the shrine. It would not be on the top of my list.
so many store for gold. price is depend on the day price of gold.  gold price × weight × their profit = total price. for example . if you buy 18k 7.5g braslet it will be around 400000 won
커플링 맞췄으나 하자로 AS 받는중... 서비스는 친절하나, 받기까지 시간이 너무 걸려서 별하나 뺍니다.(1달 기다림)

column1: 그래도 결정할 때는 여기저기 비교 필수

column7: 잘 찾으면 좋은 사장님을 만날 수 있으나 아니면 바가지 쓰니 추천 또는 알아보고 가시길. 대한민국 금 악세서리의 80%는 여기서 생산한다하니 참고하세요
피카딜리 극장 주변, 단성사는 보석타운으로 변신

The Grand Hyatt hotel sits high up on a hill with great views from all sides.  The lobby is quite swanky, with the feel of a five star hotel.  The front desk and concierge service is excellent. The rooms are moderately sized and nothing special.  Elevators are fast and efficient, and secured by your room key (just swipe your key and they take you right to your floor).  The BEST part for me is the gym, which is one of the most extensive hotel gyms I have encountered.  PLUS, there are two pools, one outdoors and one indoors...the outdoor pool is huge (looks to be about 25 meters)!  There are a few different restaurants in the hotel, all expensive, but convenient.  There is a tasty Baker as well (that carries wine and cheese and baked goods).  OK, one more thing...the service is REALLY excellent.  When I checked out I accidentally left my passport in my room.  I called from the Airport and they promptly recovered it, and drove it to the Airport so I could catch my flight!  What a huge relief.

if you can book a club room it will give you access to one of the best grand club lounge in the world. Delicious food wine and spirit in the evening. Delicious and high quality breakfast. This time I got an older room but the new ones are really good. Bed is far too hard for me but it is very personal taste (for me Westin is rated 10 and I would rate bed here 6) People are really friendly and always try to make your stay as comfortable as possible

One of the best Grand Hyatt locations I've been to. The room is spacious with an amazing view. The location is fantastic, can walk to Itaewon and all the shops nearby, a very convenient bus picks up right outside the property. The hotel has a great gym with multiple classes offered, a hot tub, cold pool, and 3 different saunas. The lounge has a great breakfast and dinner snacks. Did not eat at the main hotel restaurants but the overall vibe of the place is great. It also smells amazing when you walk in!

This is a first class hotel with first class service.  The "Club Lounge" is a converted Italian restaurant in the lower lobby with great breakfast and supper buffets at no additional cost to Club Floor clients.  The gym, which is well equipped with weights and machines, is open 24 hours a day (good for jet lag workouts.

column1: The main foreigner shopping and entertainment district is a 20 minute walk down the hill. A taxi to downtown is less than $10.
Highly recommended for personal and business travel.

column7: Went for the lunch buffet with a coupon. Some food is great and others are so so. They always overcook the sea food. Coffee is pretty bad too. The blinds are down for lunch so we couldn't see the cityscape even though we booked a window seat. The bought view was better but the food was better this time than at night in winter.
Great big place for kitchen and backing tools. You also will find places for home decoration and making soap.
Good place to buy materials of fragrant candle, diffuser, and essential oils. Cheap and many choices.
You can literally find everything you would ever need in the way of packaging
If you wanna make diffuser by yourself..then you must visit this place. Can but stuff at cheap price.

저렴이 시장 옷을 찾는 사람들에게는 비추. 품질이 괜찮고 유명 디자이너 브랜드 카피 제품을 싸고 빠르게 이용하고 싶은 사람들에게 강추. 미로 같은 점포 구성과 너무 많은 점포 때문에 애를 먹을 수 있지만 내 스타일에 맞는 단골 점포 몇개만 찍어두면 편하게 쇼핑 가능함. 옷 이외에 스카프나 악세사리, 가방도 있으니 두눈 크게 뜨고 살펴 볼 것
예쁜 디자인의 질좋은 옷들이 상가마다 아름답게 진열 되어있다.

거기다 영화관도 있어서 살거 다사고 영화보면서 재밋게

Walk towards Jongno Police Station and enter the Insa-dong main street (between Crown Bakery and GS25 convenience store).

와인이 싱대적으로 다양하며 가끔 가격도 괜찮다. 공부가 조금은 필요한 곳. 그럼에도 와인은 코스트코가 진리

대표적인 꽃상가. 12시 반이면 문을 닫기 때문에 그 전에 가야한다
고속버스터미널 경부선3층에 위치하고 있고, 생화를 도매가로 살 수 있다. 양재꽃시장보다 수입꽃이 다양하다.단, 꽃포장은 안해주는데 해주는 곳이 한 곳있긴하다.

column1: 생화는 무조건 현금으로 사야하고, 한 단씩만 판매한다. 조화나 부자재의 경우, 카드도 가능하지만, 부가세10%를 더 내야한다. 월수금 새로운 꽃이 들어오는데, 그래서 그날은 꽃이 정리된 새벽3시 이후에 가는 것이 좋다.
절반은 생화 시장이고, 절반은 조화와 화병, 소품들을 판다. 크리스마스 용품도 많고, 화분을 파는 집도 한 곳 있다.

column7: 어후1시 영업마감  ,1시간 있음 .온몸에 향기가 가득 , 힐링

column1: 꽃향기에 중독 되어 열심히 사는 분들

column7: 경부선 고속버스 터미널 상가에 위치해서 꽃과 기타 장식물을 저렴하게 구매가능한 곳.

column1: 지하철 이용하면 시간에 구애받지않고 쇼핑가능하지만 주차할 경우 한시간 이내로 나오는 것이 경제적일듯~~

column7: 추억의장소 싼 곳이 아님

I've been living in the area just for 45 days and it's crazy beautiful. Some people may find it messy and noisy but it was amazing to me as it helped me not to feel lonely in the huge Seoul. It's opened until late and from early morning you can go and find fresh fruit. The basement is full of nuts, dresses, spices and music shops, people are welcoming and easy to talk to even if you're not fluent in Korean. Plus, there is a lady selling veggies and fruit right after exit4 of the tube who has some of the best Asian Pears in town.

Definitely the place to shop and eat all the local snacks. We came early at 10 am and were able to go the shops with ease, not to mention eating. Getting a map of the place from the information booth is very important as it helps you to navigate the entire Namdaemun. The information booth is located in the middle of the Main Street. Goggle doesn’t have the names of the shop in detail.

Expect to squeeze your way through people. It is very easy to get lost here so if you are not coming alone, always know where your partner(s) is. Also, don't wander too far without knowing the place because lots of shops look similar and you will get lost. Occasionally you might find a wall with a map printed on it, but I wouldn't rely on those. Be careful. Other than too many people and getting lost, there is a lot of good street food. This can be a good place to shop because they have almost everything.

Are you hungry? There's a variety of things to eat! Do you prefer to shop? Don't worry, Namdaemun's got you covered. Do you just want to see new and exciting things? Well, what are you waiting for - go to Namdaemun! Even if you don't want to spend any money, I highly recommend still going to experience the atmosphere of a traditional market. There are people everywhere, shop owners are shouting about the items they are selling to those who might be interested, and deliverymen are swerving in and out of the crowd.
Really enjoyed the food. We first went on a Sunday late morning and there was not much open. I would recommend during the week or a Saturday.
놀라울 정도로 다양한 악세사리 부속품들을 판매함. 대부분 도매 장사를 하지만 갖추어 놓은 다양함에 놀람.
Big ... large ... huge!! Lots of shops for cloths!!
쇼핑품목이. 다양하고. 저럼하다. 맛집도 근처에 많다
층마다다른종류의물건을팔고너무다양하다구경가는게아니고특정목적이있다면그곳먼저가야좋다패션에관계된모든부속과원단이불한복카텐카펫까지다양하다
전문적인 자재파는곳
다양한 종류의 옷을 저렴하게 구매가능.

Vast... seems like I walked 2 miles and didn't even see all the stores.  It reminds me of a US flea market... except cleaner and items are new not used.  Mostly women's clothes and shoes.  Cool experience even though I didn't buy anything.

The underground shopping area is absolutely huge you can’t see the end of it. It has clothes of different styles, skin care, make up, shoes, plants and flowers for gardens, home decor and literally everything you can think of. There is a food court in the end and there are coffee shops in the area. Prices are cheap from 5,000 to 30,000.

I think this place is one of the most cheapest place for shopping in Seoul. There is a long and unlimited line of shops underground here. You can buy good quality of clothes with 10,000 won. (Many items are even cheaper than 10,000 won) Most of cases, it is not refundable so think twice before you buy.

People should not set me loose when it comes to major shopping areas. If I see a bargain that I can't pass up, I'm going to stop. I was born to shop. I came back from Korea with so much stuff especially earrings that now I won't wear American earrings anymore. Anywhere to shop in Korea will be enjoyable and you will end up with a lot. Make sure to take an empty suitcase if you are planning to go, bc you will need it.
It is a wonderful place for tourists especially women. Shopping place with lots of women clothes, accessories,  and decorative items.

column1: Came here on Saturday.  It's packed.

column7: Buy all but not cheap
모든 공구와 전기제품들이 모여 있습니다. 주차장도 넓어서좋아요
중앙유통단지는, 세운상가에 있던 전자부품업체가 이전을 했고,  주변에 전기자재판매도같이해서 one stop으로 자재구매가능
전국 최대. 컴퓨터 부품상가에요. 지하에 가면 식당가가 있는데 별천지입니다.
지하에 음식점 짱 많음 공간이생각보다 넓어서 첨가면 길잃어버리기 쉬움
Almost everything a musician would need to buy in one big music mall. Also fun to just walk around and just browse

Please visit Kyung Eun Acoustic if you are looking for the acoustic guitars and anything you need for your guitars. There are Martin, Taylor, Gibson, Larrivee and A lot more Korean guitar brands. Please check it out this cool guitar shop! The best!

Amazing selection of instruments and music electronics. The prices for imports are a bit high but keep in mind the first price they quote might not be the price you pay. I got a 120,000 "discount" on a 700,000 won guitar when it seemed like I wasn't interested. Knowing 지금 Korean will help.

Nakwon Sangga is a massive mess of musical insanity. Two floors about a football field long of musical gear store after musical gear store. You'll find lots of strange rarities, but have problems finding something you'd expect to be common if you're not from around here.

column1: Some things are overpriced and some are a steal. Anything made in the USA or UK will cost you your first born. Better to aim for made in Japan or Korea, though those items tend to be more randomly priced.

I find it improves my shopping experience greatly if I go in with the intent of coming out with whatever neat thing I happen to find rather than plowing through store after store looking for something very specific. In the case of the latter intent, the Internet will serve you better.

column7: Verry good place. Bad air, noting more
한블럭안에서 길양쪽으로 상점들이있어 다양하게 둘러보기좋아요.돌아다니다보면각자의취향에 맞는집을 찿을수있어요.요즘트랜드 도 물론 체크가능
다양한물건과 여러가지소품이 많이  있던곳

Having traveled through many Asian countries, I'd say this was a lesser impressive market. Not only were the food stalls shelling out mostly the same things, but the prices were as if I was at a regular food hall or restaurant. When coming to any market, I expect low prices with minimal service. Definitely still worth a gander and if you're in town for a but, stock up on the fresh Kimchi selection for your fridge.

Nice market to eat street food. There aren't too many options, the stalls are kind of repetitive but it's nice to have everything in one place. From fish cake and pork feet, kimbap and live octopus. There's plenty of food to enjoy and it's nice the market has a covering so you aren't in direct sunlight during the day.
Busy market with many interesting sights and kind vendors. Mung bean pancakes are delicious. Street food is yummy in general! Had some tough tteokbokki though :(

Lots of colours and interesting to see. Whilst it looks like a lot of food most of the vendors sell the same things and of the same quality. Very few sweet things to eat. Got very warm and stuffy during summer. Borderline unpleasant due to the heat so best prepare yourself for that.

It's become increasingly touristed but it is a true market experience. Honestly even though I live in the city I feel like a tourist here as I rarely have need to buy the things out on sale there. However, the street food is still great and authentic, and the used clothing market is aleays a great place for wandering and rummaging.

Decent indoor rink. Entry fee is quite cheap. Ice conditions are very good. Future gold medalist train at this rink. Downside is only one hot dog and coffee joint for food. Don't forget to bring your jacket....there are 2 rinks and one of them is super cold.
Can rent the skate at this place. Very local Korean place. Quite decent place to skate especially teaching the young child.

Very nice place to ice skating. Provide us helmet, gloves, and ice skating shoe. There are trainer in the court to. Looks like its a hockey court originally. Recommended for who want to ice skate in soul
It is too crowded. So many kids..

column1: Entrance fee and rental service is about $10.

column7: Good time but very crowded. They speak very little English, but it's fairly easy to get on the ice

I have always wanted to try the live octopus and this place did not disappoint! There are two or more floors where vendors are selling there catches, but go to the second floor to find the octopus vendors. You can select an octopus yourself and then take it to a restaurant on the same floor and they will chop it up for you, or you can ask one of the restaurant workers to help you choose one. A small (very small, like baby) octopus is not expensive at all, and neither is taking it to a restaurant to have it prepared. They will also give you a small banchan (side dish) with your octopus.
This is a must-see place to visit if you're in Seoul. Unfortunately, I missed seeing the catches being brought in, but I hear that's really neat.

column1: They have all sorts of seafood, and the warehouse area is huge. You should definitely wander a bit amongst the stalls and see what they have to offer. (You'll also find better prices if you don't just buy from the first few stalls.) You can buy various things to cook or choose a plate that is already prepared. The vendor will guide you to a small restaurant above the warehouse, where you can cook your food/or eat it raw (if it's sashimi), and they'll supply the sides, drinks, and cooking equipment.

column7: despite the fact that there is still a divide between the older building and the new building the products there are second to none. the older building has a rustic original feel and the new building is just that, new. don't be afraid to wander around in either space as the merchants in both buildings are there to sell great seafood at a negotiable price. they speak enough English to haggle prices and each have their own selling points so shop around!

Fish market. The older section is outdoors and the newer is indoors. Lots of vendors selling mostly the same fresh seafood items. You can even have your purchased items cooked at one of many restaurants located on-site. A recommended place to visit.

We went on a Thursday evening. There wasn't much of a crowd. Throughout the market we were bugged by stall holders to buy stuff. They were mostly ladies who could speak both Korean and Chinese. Price was almost the same from stall to stall. Sanakji (small live octopus) was priced at 5K. After purchasing your live seafood proceed to level 2 of the indoor market to get your seafood prepared at the restaurants. We paid 5K per head and an additional 3K for the sashimi slicing service. The salmon belly (20K) was really good and filling.
Fresh sea food! I stopped by the 일월수산 that sells crabs. They were very very fresh and most importantly the crabs were delicious. :D yummy 일월수산's phone number is 02-403-6454.
Clean and tidy but it may not be worth taking such a long traffic to visit there

시장의 관리는 서울특별시 농수산물도매시장관리공사가 맡고 있으며, 시장의 운영은 1997년 현재 10개의 농수축산물 도매시장 법인과 협동조합의 공판장이 담당하고 있다. 부류별 도매시장 법인과 공판장을 보면 청과물은 5개의 도매시장 법인과 1개의 농협공판장, 수산물은 2개의 도매시장 법인과 1개의 수협공판장, 축산물은 1개의 축협공판장이 각각 시장의 운영을 담당하고 있다.

column1: 시장의 거래에 참여하고 있는 유통 참여자로는 1997년 7월 현재 경매사 314명, 중도매인 2,111명, 매참인 145명이 있다. 부류별로는 경매사의 경우 청과물 267명, 수산물 42명, 축산물 5명이며, 중도매인의 경우 청과물 1,655명, 수산물 406명, 축산물 50명이 있다. 도매시장에서의 거래제도는 도매시장 법인의 수탁 판매원칙과 상장경매제를 원칙으로 하고 있다.

시장의 거래 물량은 개설 초기에는 개장 후 5년 이내 완전 가동을 목표로 1일 평균 거래량을 청과물 3,030톤, 수산물 540톤으로 설정하였으나 개장 후 2년째부터 목표 물량을 상회하여 1996년 말 현재 거래 물량은 청과물 223만 9,484톤, 수산물 18만 4,954톤, 축산물 10만 7,843톤으로 1일 거래량은 각각 6,745톤, 557톤, 356톤에 달하고 있다. 개장 초기에는 도·소매가 분리되어 있지 않아 시장 질서가 혼란스럽기도 했으나, 점차 경매 물량이 증가하고 거래 질서가 잡혀 우리나라의 중심적인 농수산물 공영도매시장로서의 기능을 수행하고 있다.

column7: 대한민국에서 농수산물집결 하는 아주 큰 시장이라고 할수있어요.단 일반인 소비자분들은 구매를 할땐 잘 살피고 사야지요 도매시장이라고 까딱하면 바가지 쓸수 있습니다.

column2: Korea National Training Center International Rink
column7: I really enjoyed the skating experience I had with my workmates. After a busy day of labwork we headed to this place which is just a walk away from our school. You just need 7600 korean won (if my memory serves me well) which you can just pay using cash or debit/credit cards. This will be for the entrance fee, a pair of ice skates , and helmets. Just don't forget to bring your own gloves. Remember, safety is your first priority. However, to those who owns a pair of ice skates and a helmet I guess you will just have to pay for the entrance fee (just ask the receptionists) and your good to go.

column2: Korea National Training Center International Rink
column7: Great Olympic training facility that is open to the public for skating. Sometimes the Korean Olympic team is training on the outside ring while the public is on the insideb rink, which is pretty cool!

column1: Skates can be rented on site, both speedskates and hockey skates (not sure about figure skates).

보훈병원 뒤에 위치하여 길동과 둔촌동 등에서 쉽게 접근할 수 있는 곳이다. 하늘공원에서 출발하여 해맞이공원까지 걸으면 충분히 운동이된다. 하늘공원에는 많은 꽃들이 피어있어 꽃구경을 할수있고 휴식공간이 많아 차한잔 마시면서 쉬어가기에도 좋다. 그늘이 많고 힘들지 않은 코스이기 때문에 남녀노소 누구나 산책하기에 적합하다. 시간이 있으면 사전예약하고 생태공원도 함께 방문하면 좋을 듯 하다.
깨끗하고 예뻐요. 시간 보내기 좋아요. 주변 산책로 따라 하늘공원까지 가는 것도, 등산로 걷기도, 트랙만 걷기도 좋구요. 배드민턴, 공놀이, 인라인이나 스케이트보드 탈 엑스게임장도 있습니다. 주차공간도 있구요.
가족 캠핑장도 있고 가까운데 이렇게 좋은데 있는지 몰랐다.

column7: Near my home. Very nice place. If you across the park near the baseball place, you can find a huge stairs structure. Go up and around 30 minutes walking you can reach Seoul Tower (Namsan Tower).

Once been an Airforce Academy campus, presently a great spot to enjoy. You may find a circular walking course, kids playground, dogs playground, football and tennis courts, rock climbing wall, beautiful pond with lotus flowers and music fountain. And on top of that: open air aircraft museum with bunch of training and fighter jets.
Theres a running track local elderly like to use. Many spots to sit down and enjoy nice weather. Also has a dog park, convenience store, climbing rock etc. Many restaurants nearby.
The place is peaceful especially at the mountains. Where you can see lots of birds

This is a lovely city park that was the former site of the Korea Air Force Academy. That's why it's a giant open field. There are basketball courts, extreme sports arenas, a climbing wall, and ll sorts of other wonderful things. The running track has been cut short for the next two years while a new subway line goes in. So they have torn up about 1/5 of the park to take care of that.
Good place to work out and sunbath. You can find several beautiful flowers in the well maintained field. Very huge park inside the city.
Take a walk and enjoy the spring breezes.. I love this place
Perfect to listen to live music with friends, or hang out at night
It is the best social place for everyone.

Nice park, easily accessible via public transportation in Seoul. The hike up to the old city wall is only about 20 minutes and not too intense. The views of the northern part of Seoul are quite nice.

Small but nice forest park located in the deep corner of Buk-Ak mountain, but not far from downtown. There you may be surprised to feel just like in a forest remote from city. It takes about 30 minutes encircling the trail around the park. From the top of the trail you can go up to Malbawi(Horse-shaped rock), which commands great view of northern Seoul, and to the old wall surrounding old area of Seoul, along which is also a much longer trail worth being taken. Back to Samcheong Park, There is a bath with tub full of crystal clean mountain stream, but it is not easy to find it since there's no sign leading there
For children, it looks nice to learn "the street". Thanks to Mercedes who supports it.

column2: 카마리오 제일장로교회 Korean First Presbyterian Church of Camarillo
column7: Great church, amazing people, and very good pastor!
Nice and fun, but could be better. Things appear cheaply done, obvious cameras and ride triggers for example. Others are poorly laid grass turf and stuffed animals in rides.

column1: Nice prices for food and souvenirs etc (much better than Disneyland). Cheap stroller rentals with an easy process. No real stroller parking that way marked though so busy 'wherever' worked.
Great time for the children with lots for them to do (ages 5, 3, 10 months.) Great rides they loved and a fun parade etc.

Some staff not very enthusiastic and seemed to be just putting in their time while others were great. One concern was one of the ride workers checking her hair in her phone while securing the kids to the moon/Sun ride. Way to many staff had their phones out and weren't paying attention.
Overall a good experience and definitely worth a visit if you like theme parks. Awesome for kids and great baby facilities.

column7: Fun amusement park with a good amount of rides to last about half a day. Definitely don't recommend you come from first thing in the morning, as you'd pay for the full day. We went on a summer weekend day and still managed to ride everything we wanted despite getting there at 4.

Great indoor theme park as well as the island! I suggest going after 4 pm because there is a discount on the price. Also, if you are a tourist wanting to visit Lotte World, make sure to bring you T Money tour card for a discount. The rides were nice and safe and there is something for the whole family to enjoy. Food is expensive though.

Lotte World was pretty enjoyable. However, when I visited, some of the rides were under renovation. Most of the queues moved quickly. Indoors, the hot air balloon ride has one of the longest queues, so be prepared to wait up to 1 hour for your turn. The hot air balloon ride was nice to see the entire indoor Lotte World. If the monorail is working, I would take that instead.

Great place to bring kids. Plenty of food and the rides are very enjoyable. Unlike other theme parks and such they have places where you can reserve a spot at a ride for a certain time and so you don't have to wait in line at all. There is also an app for free fast passes. The shows are fantastic with a lot of energy. Especially the center stage and the parades.

Namsan Park sits at the bottom of N Seoul Tower and offers quite a view of Seoul and its surrounding. There are several shows here during different timing of the day, where people light up the beacons on the hill to reenact a ritual from the past. Good to check the timings before you come.

column1: Aside from that nothing really special, except the place is just a park you pass by on the way to N Seoul Tower.

column7: Went to Namsan Park by bus at night. Upon reaching the top, the views of the city greeted me. A lot of people were also up here. You can go around the N Seoul Tower complex - there are restaurants and shops here. There are numerous exhibits that allow couples to declare their love for one another.
It's very wonderful place in Soul of South Korea.

column1: Everyday there is lot of people are gathering here to visit the whole city from this mountain.

column7: Varied activities to enjoy inside the park; a great way to reconnect with nature.

After a few days in Seoul we felt like some walk and this park was more or less just behind our Hotel (Pacific). A short walk brought us to the cable car station. A one-way ticket cost just 6000 won (two-way 8000). The plan was to have a stroll around on top and walk back down to the city.

column1: There was quite a line. It was always moving, but still took a bit more than an hour to get us into the actual cable car. The ride up is a matter of only a few minutes....in a very very packed cable car.
The top was a lot busier than expected. And had lots of shops and even more restaurants, really didn't see that coming.

The first thing that catches you eye surely is the Seoul Tower. But the views of the city are already quite nice from the several platforms, so we didn't go up the tower (and avoided wasting more time standing in another line).

Like I said, there are several platforms offering really nice city views. You can see quite far. Then there's the wall with the love locks. You can purchase some locks if you are interested in doing so. We didn't ... too old for this kinda thing :)

There are at least two restaurants with great city views. One is a beer / fast food place, which looked fun, but all tables were taken. The other one (indoors, but with huge windows) still had tables....but menus that cost way too much (50'000 won and up). So we just enjoyed the views without some food or drinks.
We were also lucky to catch a free show.... some warriors doing weapons-training. Quite impressive!

After an hour or so we started walking down. It's a pretty easy walk and there are several roads and trails leading back to the city. We took the one that ends around the public library at the bottom with the city walls. An very lovely walk, pretty easy with a nice little park (Baekbeom Square Park) at the end. From there it's not far to the Namdaemun Market, where we did some (more) shopping. Walk along the city wall, a nice thing to do.
All in all a good way to spend a few hours. If you have time on your hands, surely a thing that you shouldn't miss. Get some views, get some air...have a walk.

column7: Nice place to walk your dog or take your kids to. Also good if you just want to relax in a little bit of nature in a big city.

A Little Oasis with a well-cared matured landscape work but has a  neglected and poorly laid and undervisited Memorial building for celebration of patriotic support of Ahn, Chang-ho and his comrades in the formation of early Korea.

column1: It was really ugly to spot the fake faces and occasionally loud tourist groups for the photo shooting in and out of the park.
The local area to and from the park is still quite untidy with chaotic vehicle uses and behaviors where the municipality neglects its enforcement.
The park needs to have more tranquility that it deserves.

column7: Place where you can feel extreme silent
Real good park in gangnam. Surrounded by elite area consisting boutique and cafè...
15 minutes of walk from Apgujeong subway station. Nice place to walk in the evening.

Worth a visit! A peaceful and resting place in vivid Seoul. The park is a great place to enjoy a walk either with the family or more lonely. You can also jog, but I would recommend to attend earlier in the day. Nice path through trees, view on the Olympic stadium... I had a great time.
Huge park to go for a quick sightseeing. Drop by the alone tree for a photoesque site. You will see free roaming rabbits here!

Lovely park in any season. I recently went here to run the 89th Seoul Marathon 10K. It has numerous things to do and enjoy within and around the park. Take your time to visit this huge park on a sunny day in spring. You will love it and make good memories here!
This huge park is so incredibly breathtaking, I felt at peace just by being present and appreciating nature. There are also gym stops with equipment, where you can do a small workout.

I dream about this park, if ever there was a successful post Olympics venue this is it, massive rolling lawns, fantastic events, and art thrown around the place like it's no one's business. One could easily spend days here at what I would consider the earliest of parks. Oh did I mention the entrance? It's spectacular, an engineering achievement.
Cozy place with a cafe. Good for spending an hour for reading with puppies. Trees and empty benches.
Good and safe place for walking and excercise...
good place for resting, walking and jogging

I send my warm greetings to the President of the Republic of South Korea Moon Jae-in  and to all the leaders of the State, the Government, the Ministry of the Interior, the Ministry of Defense and all the pillars of the army and the State . And to all representatives of the South Korean government inside and outside the country.I tell them and President Moon Jae-in  that we are ready to serve and to do our duty to be ready to cover any missions at any time. Good luck  . Yemen. Mr.Sinan

The Blue House (Korean: 청와대; Hanja: 靑瓦臺; Cheong Wa Dae; literally "pavilion of blue tiles")[1][2][3] is the executive office and official residence of the South Korean head of state, the President of the Republic of Korea, and is located in the capital city of Seoul. The Blue House is in fact a complex of buildings, built largely in the traditional Korean architectural style with some modern elements.

column1: Built upon the site of the royal garden of the Joseon Dynasty (1392–1910), the Blue House now consists of the Main Office Hall Bon-gwan (Korean: 본관; Hanja: 本館), the Presidential Residence, the State Reception House Yeongbin-gwan (Korean: 영빈관; Hanja: 迎賓館), the Chunchu-gwan (Korean: 춘추관; Hanja: 春秋館) Press Hall, and the Secretariat Buildings. The entire complex covers approximately 250,000 square metres or 62 acres.

column7: New changes since the last President was impeached and since I have lasted visited Seoul. There are new digital changes inside the Blue House that shows improvements in South Korean technology. Stopped by the cafe to try a new type of tea. There is an actual town called "White House" so don't get it confused and call the Blue House the "South Korean White House" as an American tourist.
Great experience to visit the house of the ROK President. Old and new architecture harmonizing makes the surrounding very attractive. The garden is well conserved especially the 800 years+ tree.
I hope president Moon can bring harmony to South Korean society and also have a better relationship with North Korea.
Peaceful park with huge trees. There are history guides with audiences sometimes.
Nice walking trail

면적 18만 8710㎡이다. 서울 사직단(社稷壇:사적 121)을 중심으로 하여 인왕산(仁王山) 남동쪽 기슭에 있다. 조선시대까지만 해도 성역이었던 그 일대는 일제강점기에 공원을 조성한다는 구실 아래 훼손되기 시작했는데 부지를 분할하여 학교를 신설하고 우회도로를 개설하였다. 사직단의 수난은 8·15광복 후에도 계속되어 1897년 고종이 황제가 되면서 ‘태사(太社)’ ‘태직(太稷)’이라고 높여 부르게 했던 사직단의 정문(보물 177, 건평 57.4㎡)이 1962년의 도로확장공사 때 본래의 위치에서 14m 가량 뒤쪽으로 밀려났다.

column1: 현재 공원 내에는 종로도서관·시립어린이도서관을 비롯하여 몇몇 공공건물이 들어서 있고, 그밖에 활터인 황학정과 단군성전 등이 있으며, 이이(李珥)·신사임당(申師任堂)의 동상 등이 있다. 인왕산길의 진입로가 가까이 있고 도심지에 위치한 아담한 휴식처로 산책객이 많이 찾는다.

column7: 역사가 서린 곳. 문화해설과 함께하면 좋아요.
吃烤肉的好地方!

Lots of cool places to shop, including a surprising number of Western brands. The aquarium is ginormous to say the least, taking up two hours of my six there, and when I got out, the gift shop was absolutely packed. This venue is doing extraordinarily well: lots of young Koreans love coming here. I do too.

column1: The view? Take a look for yourself and you decide.

column7: If you plan on going here, be sure to buy your tickets early because they only allow a certain amount of people up at a time. We had to wait at least 2 hours after purchasing our ticket before going up the tower. Luckily the mall is right there, so we did some shopping to kill time. I'm not sure if our timing was just bad, but I think one of the elevators to go to the top was broken. There may have been signs in Korean stating this, but it was never told to us in English. Once we entered we waited in line for over an hour until we got to the top. We also noticed the workers saying things in Korean and people bypassing our line to go to a shorter line. We finally asked someone about this and that line was to go up in the elevator without a video. Once we got to the final line to go into the elevator to the top, they again only spoke in Korean. I again asked what he said and he showed me a pamphlet in English. For Lotte being such a big company, I think they need to put a little more effort in for English speaking visitors. It was helpful that the workers spoke English, but if we didn't ask, then we never would've known what was going on. Once at the top, the view was beautiful. I liked that there was a glass bottom section that you could walk over. However, for the price, view, and experience, I preferred the Namsan Seoul Tower over this tower.

It is primarily a mall, so that's what you should expect going in. There are plenty of shops, a wide variety of restaurants, and other atypical mall amenities, such as an aquarium and art museum. Let's not forget to mention the world's 3rd tallest observation deck and the tallest in Korea. Beautiful views over-looking Seoul, including the famous sites you can see from each spot. Only 1 minute up and down on an elevator. Observation deck is 6 stories tall and includes outdoor areas and glass floors in parts.

Lotte Tower is a shoppers paradise! The new building has a myriad of high end shops and restaurants. The restaurants are local or international and the food is delicious! Look for the food truck restaurants and you will not be disappointed. There is also an observation deck for the more adventurous people out there, with a glass floor balcony looking down hundreds of feet below you. Definitely an experience to remember. The view is absolutely amazing, 360, and there are several coffee shops and souvenirs available.

column1: The elevator ride to the top is around $27 but well worth it.
Don’t forget to check out the extensive water park outside!

column7: This is the tallest building in Korea for the moment. It's really tall. Like, mind-bogglingly tall. When you stand next to it you have no idea how large is. There's a concert hall in here. There's a place where you can have tea time. They're actually a bunch of buildings connected all together. So most of the shopping you do isn't in the mega Tower. But I think at least some of the shopping to do is in the mega Tower. I can't think of another word to call it other than make a tower. Maybe Lotte World Tower. That sounds like a good name for it. Let's use that. Let's also discuss some reasons why you probably shouldn't buy a home on the 100th floor of the building. Mostly it's because when they were creating this building the lake next door suddenly started to disappear. Where did it go? Well who knows. But doesn't that make you nervous? It certainly would make me nervous. But it's a nice place. I dream that I would have a home there. And my office also there. And then permanent guest home inside of the hotel up there. You never have to leave unless you wanted to go golfing. I think I have hit the character limit on this review. Here are some more words to test that. I guess I didn't.
Beautiful scenery at center of seoul

The mountain itself is very impressive, towers over the park. Plenty of open space to hang out, and of course you can always hike up the mountain if you're not afraid of the slope. Great area, clean and convenient restrooms in the park. There is also a climbing wall for those who like to climb.
Large playground and good utilities for rock  climbing.
Sun good
Good
nice place to go to mt
멀리 가지않고 서울에서 아무 준비 없이 몸만가서 기분낼수 있는 계곡! 물이 깊지 않고 깨끗하진 않아요 근데 의외로 물이 차고 시원해서 물장구는 갸우 칠수 있어요. 닭볶음탕 6만원 한일산장

column1: 마지막 사진은 산장에서 내려오면서 찍은 다른 산장 사진

column7: 음식은 뭐 다른곳과 별반 다르지 않앗구요 물가 앞이라 물놀이는 좋앗는데 음식주문할때 인터폰하면 잘 못알아들으시기도 하고 앞치마나 그외 컵 이런거 누락 너무 많이 되구요 앞치마 받으려고 20분넘게 걸림.. 그리고 물건 갇가주시고 계산 받아가시는데.. 그분들이.. 의사소통이 서로 잘안돼어서 많이 햇갈렷어요
계곡물도 마니흐르고 시원하니 좋았어요... 한일산장 강추합니다..  음식도 깔끔하더라구요
모든시민이~자유로이 이용할수있어야하는데~계곡으로 자유롭게 들어갈수없어 불편하네요~올해같은 날씨에 쉴곳을찾아갔지만 실망했습니다,,,

The price is lower than other store because deduction of the tax. I have compared the price of cosmetics, snacks, and foods. It was very convenience shopping there for the completeness and comfort place. The location is also directly near the subway station and makes it easily to reach. Overall, this place have to be one of your must-visit checklists.

Really big and luxurious department store. Here you can find all the expensive brands from Europe. The top three floors are tax free and it can be very busy and even intimidating. When there is a sale, you see one massive crowd hunting for bargains. People standing in long lines to enter shops like Chanel and Burberry. Only some staff will speak English and you have to bring your passport and your flight details, because tax free items like Swiss watches, liquor must be picked up at the airport when you leave the country.
Anythings you can pick from here. Bring your passport to refund tax when you pay the money. Many china persion come and buy cosmetic in lotte duty free.

Always visit for my shopping needs when I'm in Seoul. Prices are fairly cheaper than elsewhere. The only downfall is the abundance of a certain type of shoppers and aggressive (has recently toned does slightly) salespeople that take away from the experience.
Information Desk Staff at Duty Free are very rude and unprofessional, they act as if they are doing Charity. Never would like to visit this Duty Free store again
Variety of choices but most staff cannot give an advise in English

I liked here because of free valet parking. But now it changed to charge system for time. If you purchase 50,000 to 100,000 won, you can park during 1 hour for free(?). 100,000 to 150,000 won, you can park 2 hours a day. Over 150,000 won, 3 hours a day. And if you purchase nothing, 3,000 won for 30 minutes, after then 1,000 won for 10 minute. There are too many Chinese people. I thought I traveling China during staying that place.
Duty free, good for shopees who likes buying local branded goods for bring back to their countries.
Too crowded..because of especially chineses. Small stores without stocks.
Very big DFS in Seoul. Variery brand and event are very helpful for customer. Nowadays so much Asian tourist visit here.
Smaller than other major palaces in Seoul. Less crowded, too. Free entrance collects office workers nearby during lunchtime.

The palace is smaller than the others, but well preserved and quiet. The entrance is free and you can see a king's portrait and an interesting rock in the palace garden. Something different from the other palaces.
경희궁을 꼭 한 번 방문해보세요

column1: The palace in Seoul is a good place for recreation.  Seoul is often stuffy and boring, but you'll feel much better if you visit the palace. When you come to Seoul, you should visit Deoksugung Palace, GyeonghuI Palace, Gyeongbokgung Palace, and Changdeok Palace. These palaces will add something special to your memory.

column7: A nice break from the urban surroundings. A less busy palace than the other larger ones nearby.
Quiet, Nothing, Sad hisory, recommend for walking after lunch
Amazing history in this palace. Always have events to show. Enjoyed the performance training. Beautiful landscape and very central location

Must see in Seoul as these are the remains of the Joseon dynasty. The houses in the palace are mostly alike and there is not much to see inside, but it is more about the context. Some of the houses are closed and you can only walk by. Take the English tour if the map alone is insufficient.

column1: There is a change of the palace guards a few times a day. This is quite the attraction and you attend the ceremony for free.

column7: Worth checking out! If you dress up in the traditional Hanboks you get to get in free until the palace. Worth checking out the changing of the guards it happens twice a day. I believe it's at 10am and 2pm if I'm not mistaken

column1: The grounds are huge! So plan about an hour or 2

column7: My kids (8 and 3) enjoyed their walk through the palace during our one day visit to GWM gate. This is a beautiful piece of Korean history. Anyone that visits Seoul should allow a day for the palace.

A good place for historic lovers. Guard changing ceremony is the best thing you can see there. It is in the first square just inside the gate. You can see it without ticket. The crew will change two times. One At 10:00 AM and at 14:00 hours
Quite area, good place to hang out. The park is just across the street and ddp is just next to it.
Great place to experience traditional Korea. Varieties of cheap  eateries and  shopping options from street bazaar to duty free mall.

Also called Heunginjimun Gate is just outside Dongdaemun Station but it is very historical. Dongdaemun translates as Great Door of the East, one of the eight gates along Seoul Fortress. The location is quite busy since around it is Dongdaemun Market.
Stunning gate.

column1: Next to it there is a hill where you can see part of the wall

column7: Visit on Sunday for awesome street shopping experience.
Combining this with the historical Society wall and the other gates can give you an opportunity to experience a large portion of the city.  This will require a lot of walking and climbing.

column1: This beautiful site is a wonderful stop in the middle of the bustling city.  Consider climbing up to Seoul tower before or after visiting.

column7: You must know the history of this gate so u can feel the meaning of this gate. Very nice place to visit while shopping near namdaemun market.
A must photo opportunity. Historic monument but shame its not 100% original.

column1: Choose visit period carefully, July 27th was +37°

column7: Nice reconstruction of one of the door to the ancient city. Walking distance from Namdaemun Market. Worth a visit of in the area.
A nice place that gives you a good look into the korean history and culture.  All you need is close, there are toilets and it's  a very clean area.

Seriously love this shopping mall. It has all kinds of different cuisine to eat at, the great movie theater, a playground and fountains, clean bathrooms throughout and is simply gorgeous. Has everything from shoes to clothes to accessories as far as stores to shop at. Likely more than just those but hey, that is what I generally shop for. Has a great little sweet shop that sells really good ice cream too and a Celtic pretzel stand (outside of the Irish pub) that serves Trinity knot pretzels in all kinds of ways from savory to sweet (with Ghirardelli chocolate sauce!). I love coming here to take walks too. Overall just really pretty and well maintained.

I visited on a Saturday night for supper with a few friends. We were four adult guys and we were hassled by some of the kids in the parking lot. I would not recommend this place for a lone woman or even a few ladies on a Saturday night.

column1: The area is probably fine on weekdays during the business day, and the shops seem to be fairly high end, but they were closed while we were there.

column7: The shopping mall is pretty big.  My grandmother likes to shop but in small spurts, so she's able to go to a different store every day or every other day and not get bored.  There's plenty of parking and a good variety of stores to pick from.

Where the elite go shopping! I have always been able to find what I need here. However the people are extremely rude. If you try to cross the street they do not slow down. There is no concept of The Pedestrian has the right of way. Love the Brazilian Steakhouse. I would not sway you away from this location I would just tell you to look both ways and watch your back.
Love this place. Lots of shopping. It's like walking around a little town. Always clean and decorated for holidays. Has a good vibe. Good places to eat, shop and see at movie at the Imax theater
Tried night hike with a meetup group. My photos are not good as the ones taken by S company's newest model. The view from the top let you forget about the sweat you shed along the way.

This mountain close to the palaces is a great place for a pleasant and not very difficult hike. The view from the top is great. You have a panoramic view of Seoul which together with the walk along the city hall is worth the efort.

These are from the trails on the East side of the mountain.  Very easy walk up.  Blue trail is stroller friendly and Red trail gives a nice hike and views.  Both trails lead to a great observation point overlooking Seoul.
Nice spot to hike if you don’t wanna drive long.

We took Inwangsan hillside by accident, We went to see Gyeongbokgung but it was close every tuesday we look around and saw a little trail up the hill in the background didn't knew is was Inwangsan hill, decided to see if there was a trail up the hill, on our way there was lot's of café shops, restaurants and we found this small burger place just before the trail starts that made some delious brugers and fries. Found out there's three peak on Inwangsan hil, you can take all three peak's if you are in good shape we took the first peak, along the trail you can look down to some amazing view's it only gets better the higher you go, getting to the top can be a bit dangerous so always go with some friends there are medical staff going up and down the trail should you injure yourself. Pick a sunny day to go and don't forget water and snacks and enjoy the journey, highly recommeded.

They offer various conference rooms and spa + hotels but I enjoy coming here for the buffets at the end of the year. They have a great selection of meat, seafood and dessert. Top it all off with that chocolate fondue 😯😯😯😯 Its near the Yeoido Han river park (my favorite) so stop by if you're in the area.

₩13,000 to go to the 63rd floor for the night view, when you could just take a short walk down to the river for an equally impressive view (for free, too!) The ladies behind the ticketing counter were extremely unhelpful and rude. There's not much else that's affordable to the average traveller in the building, so I'd say there's no point going there.
Good to see but difficult to get there with out schedule and crowdy coach. Cool to be blended into an art gallery from local designers in the same venue.

Their buffet is really nice. Lots variety and non-typical buffet food.  I've also been to the buffet at The Plaza hotel (?) in more downtown seoul area. I must say, the buffet here is much better than the plaza.

column1: I have more "North American" palate whereas my aunt is super Korean (she has lived in Korea all her life and doesn't venture outside of Korea much..). And we both preferred here than the Plaza.

column7: My family went to the aquarium at the 63 building. My thoughts on the aquarium come in comparison to that of the aquarium at Coex. The 63 Aquarium was less crowded, cleaner, easy to navigate, and my young son enjoyed the mermaid show. If we decide to go for another aquarium visit, it will definatley be at the 63 building. The only downside to this aquarium is that it is a bit on the small side.
Famous mountain in Seoul. Various routes are available to reach summit.

This was an amazing hike. We did the hike up to Jaunbong peak and the views were amazing. Be prepared to spend 4 to 6 hours here. To the peak and back was over 10 miles and it is not for the faint of heart. The trail at the top is rated expert (their highest) and it was a challenge. Even is you don't want to hike to the top stopping to picnic is very common and a good way to spend the afternoon.
MISS KOREA KIM /VERY GOOD
멋진 암릉 조망이 뛰어난 명산.   도봉산  암릉산행의 진수는  Y계곡으로서,  긴장을 유지하고 직벽에 가까운 코스를 내려갔다 다시 올라오는 로프구간은, 아슬아슬하고 스릴 넘치는 재미도 있지만, 집중이 필요합니다.    Y계곡을 지나 신선대에서 마주 보이는 자운봉과 주변을 둘러싸고 있는 암릉경관은 가히 절경입니다.

column1: 또한 서쪽 방향으로 오봉, 여성봉까지는 연결되는 코스는 큰 어려움 없는 구간인데, 이 코스에서 보이는 능선 또한 어디에도 뒤지지 않는 훌륭한 조망이라 하겠습니다.   다녀간 분들만이 왜 그렇게 부르는지 안다는 Y계곡과 함께, 뛰어난 암릉미를 자랑하는 도봉산은 산을 사랑하시는 분들께 꼭 한번 산행하시기를 권하고 싶습니다.

column7: I'd like to visit here again and again whenever I'm in Seoul.

column1: Bukhansan National Park is the best hiking place in Seoul with so many trails, so everyone can easily pick the most suitable trail to hike.
The mountains inside are not high but the topography is amazing beautiful especially near the mountain top.
以後來首爾一定會再來的地方。
北漢山國家公園，是首爾市郊區的熱門登山健行地點，有許多不同的入口及山頭可以選擇，所有的人都適合去走走。
而且搭捷運再走一小段路就能到達圓圈。
韓國喜歡登山健行的人真的不少，從搭捷運往北漢山國家公園的路上，就看到滿滿的登山客，完全不怕迷路。
爬完山後在山下的小販區吃個魚板和熱湯，或是辣炒年糕、鯛魚燒，真是美好的一天。

column7: 깊은 산속에 숨어있는 절. 승가대사상과 커다란 마애여래상이 인상적이다. 여러개의 계단을 오르는게 힘들지만 불상의 아름다움이 지친 몸을 달래준다.
산속 깊은곳이 위치해있어  사찰에서 바라보는 경관이 아름답습니다
풍광과 마애불이 장엄 합니다
길이 가파르고 사찰버스 기사 못됨
A Zen and peaceful place to worship the outer and inner divine.  This temple located mid way to Bibong peak is beautiful.
북한산(명산)등산로와어우러진좋은절임니다
주차 가능
절안에 주차장이 있으므로 몸이 불편하신분은 차량을 이용하여 올라오시면 됩니다
Such a beautiful temple close to the city surrounded by Bukhan Mountain. Quiet and clean.

Jingwansa is a large Korean Buddhist temple.  They offer a "TempleStay" program where foreigners can stay for a while.  Once arranged you can spend quality time with the monks and see what life is like on the inside.  According to the sign, "Templestay is a cultural program that gives you the chance to experience the 1700 year old history of Korean Buddhists and the life of Buddhist practitioners at temples that literally live and breathe the traditions and natural beauty of Korea".  Check the air quality forecast before venturing on a long trek through Bukhansan.  Depending on the winds, China's vast smog cloud often makes breathing the natural beauty of Korea a bit difficult.  As for the Templestay, an alternative is to simply walk in  and have a look around.  Lots of art, some depicting graphic violence which seems odd, and a nice little cafe.
I spent the night in 진관사 for temple stay. The whole period was very enlightening
The temple is famous for its temple stay programs for foreigners and temple foods
Good to have a cup of Korean style tea with fruits
Beautiful and confortable. Now i'm ready to play basketball and waiting someone. If you wanna play with me you should come here with ball :)
Real cozy, good to get a break from all the tall buildings and traffic. Nice piece of nature
Good location to visit, especially after riding the subway. Has historic landmarks, i.e. of Korean martyrs.
It is a beautiful and greenery park. Here all the physical activity instruments are available in free, there is no restrictions to use that instruments.
Great park.  Right across from the baseball stadium.  This park has a great exercise for older people.  And myself.   😀
Good relaxing place to stay. Needs more shade though.
아이들과 뛰어놀기 좋다

column1: 그늘막텐트,돗자리등 나무아래 깔고 독서,게임등 하면좋습니다 간단한 간식거리 싸오셔도되고요~
다만 주말에늦게오면 주차장자리 나무아래 자리가없다 참고하시길~~
그리고 주차장 무료로 개방하시오 돈은 왜받아~

column7: 난지한강공원은 서울의 서쪽에 위치한 공원 중 가장 주목할만한 공원이라고 할 수 있습니다. 한강과 함께 조화를 이루고 있는 수풀은 굉장히 아름다우며, 강변을 따라 천천히 거닐며 주변의 분위기를 느끼는 일 또한 즐거운 일입니다. 단지 난지한강공원 자체를 즐기러 가는 것도 좋지만, 그 주변에 있는 하늘공원, 서울월드컵경기장 등 다른 공원/시설들과 함께 코스에 넣어 즐긴다면 좀 더 효율적이고 알찬 경험을 할 수 있을 것입니다.

column1: 개인적인 팁을 적자면, 따뜻한 계절에 방문하시는 분의 경우 주변 공원을 거닐다 보면 가족이 함께 나와 피크닉을 즐기는 것을 쉽게 볼 수 있는데, 이런 따뜻한 광경을 쉽게 볼 수 있다는 점이 이 장소의 또다른 장점이라고 생각합니다.

column7: 날도 더운데 도서도할겸 갔는데 정말 좋았어요. 바람도 불고 그늘만 있으면 도서하긴 정말 좋아요~ 담에 또 가려고요.
강바람 시원~ 풍력발전도 해요. 난지야구장, 난지캠핑장 야외 수영장, 하늘공원까지 세트로 경험 가능
Open space. Ideal for exercising and outdoor activities. Safe area for kids to play and run.
From the tomb lunar eclipse was beatiful
nice historical site

한성백제 왕족 귀족들의 백제 고분 입니다! 석촌고분 3호 고분은 백제 근초고왕의 추정묘이기도 하구요!

column1: 이 습격으로 1년 넘게 키우던 앵무새는 고양이들의 먹이가돼었고 그갓을 지켜보던 딸아이는 고양이를 잡으려다 고양이에게 손을 물렸습니다.

첨에는 직원인줄알았던 관계자들이와서 병원도대려가고해서 조금씩 안정을 찾아가려하는데 이게왠일..............
그분들의 말에 따르면 계약을할때 이런문제들은 자기들이 책임지기로했다는군요..하지만 그런계약은 ak측과 하청을나오신측과의 계약이지 고객들과는 무관한것이 아닌기하는 생각이들었습니다.그리고 갑자기 이런생각이 들더군요.고객이다치던말던 주차장에서는 하청업체가책임이니 ak에서는사과뿐아니라 현장에 올필요도없다고 생각하는구나 라구요
제가 이런글을 올리기 전까진 그래 그럴수있지뭐 하는생각도 했습니다.
하지만 화가난저에게 보험이들어있으니 보험에서 피해보상을 다해줄겁니다 라는 말을하더군요.
말이야 바른 말이지만 그당시 듣기에는 너무 거북했습니다.

column7: Beautiful park with the temples and the glass house. Been to the evening opening, that was a bit disappointed. There are performances, but many areas are closed and not a place for photographers hoping for a beautiful shot in the lights.

The Blue House (Korean: 청와대; Hanja: 靑瓦臺; Cheong Wa Dae; literally "pavilion of blue tiles")[1][2][3] is the executive office and official residence of the South Korean head of state, the President of the Republic of Korea, and is located in the capital city of Seoul. The Blue House is in fact a complex of buildings, built largely in the traditional Korean architectural style with some modern elements.

column1: Built upon the site of the royal garden of the Joseon Dynasty (1392–1910), the Blue House now consists of the Main Office Hall Bon-gwan (Korean: 본관; Hanja: 本館), the Presidential Residence, the State Reception House Yeongbin-gwan (Korean: 영빈관; Hanja: 迎賓館), the Chunchu-gwan (Korean: 춘추관; Hanja: 春秋館) Press Hall, and the Secretariat Buildings. The entire complex covers approximately 250,000 square metres or 62 acres.

column7: New changes since the last President was impeached and since I have lasted visited Seoul. There are new digital changes inside the Blue House that shows improvements in South Korean technology. Stopped by the cafe to try a new type of tea. There is an actual town called "White House" so don't get it confused and call the Blue House the "South Korean White House" as an American tourist.
Great experience to visit the house of the ROK President. Old and new architecture harmonizing makes the surrounding very attractive. The garden is well conserved especially the 800 years+ tree.
I hope president Moon can bring harmony to South Korean society and also have a better relationship with North Korea.

column1: This is supposed to be a traditional village in the middle of Seoul.
We went when the weather was extremely hot, and traveling with young kids.  The information center was under construction and we didn’t know where to go to appreciate this site.
We walked around aimlessly for a half hour (with whining and whimpering kids) before we gave up and walked down to the palace area.
We saw some old style homes and streets, but I’m not sure what the big deal is.  With the steep streets to traverse (with kids) it wasn’t a great experience for us.
I guess if we had found the one street where you look down through multiple old style homes / roofs, it would have been a cool photo spot.
I did find a postcard painting of that famous photo spot so at least I got that!

column7: This is the most beautiful place I've ever been. It was breath taking. People complain I see about not having it layed out for tourists - it isn't for tourists. It's a village kept original and it's beautiful with amazing views, gorgeous buildings, and the most gorgeous girls in hanbok dresses. It was like being whisked away to another world for a little while. Explore, stay quite to respect the area, and enjoy every minute of this beautiful area.
Pros:

column1: - It's a great site to take pictures in and has some craft stores along the route.
- It's a route and not a proper tourist site so we had to walk around for 20 mins trying to find some sites (1 street and many alley ways.
- It has become a residental area, it's not preserved. So the residents aren't really happy with tourist and has lots of warning signs. (Ex: GO AWAY, NOT TOURIST SITE)
Overall: If u want to take pictures here, it's a real effort to come here especially in this heatwave.

column7: The most beautiful hanok village in Seoul and, I think, in South Korea. Very nice houses and very nice view above Seoul. It's a must on your travel list, but if you go there please be quiet when you visit. People still live there and I met a lot of turists who made noise. All of the walls were full of posters "please, be quiet!" or "just visit and pass away".
Historical part of Seoul with a modern twist. Many shop's restaurants, boutique's, shop's that have some nicknack's. Bukchon Hanok Village is worth checking out.

음? ㅋㅋㅋㅋ 백화점이긴 한데.. 아울렛 느낌도 나면서 뭐랄까 서울 외곽에 위치한 한적한 종합 쇼핑몰 느낌? 평일에 방문해서 그런지 몰라도 손님은 굉장히 적었어요. 그리고 분명 일반 백화점 브랜드가 들어와있긴한데 디피 되어있는 옷들이 좀 촌스러운 느낌이랄까.. 직원분들이 친절하긴 한데 부담스럽게 적극적으로 설명해주시더라구여 하하 지하에 위치한 푸드코트 굉장히 저렴함... 옆에 식품관은 리뉴얼 공사중이었어요!!!
아쉬운곳. 백화점이라 하기엔 너무 싸구려만있고 푸드코너 음식들도 별로다. 좀더 브랜드나 백화점 내부적으로 퀄리티를 좀 높였으면 좋겠다만 점점 더 시장 물건으로 가득차는 느낌.. 딱히 쇼핑을하러 가고싶은 곳은 아님
오래된 백화점

column1: 주차 가능한데 구입금액에 따라 주차시간 있어요.

column7: 가족과 어릴 때부터 많이 간 곳. 요즘엔 옷 사러 많이 갑니다. 친절한 직원분들 덕분에 자꾸 가게되요. 친한 누나랑 가는데 자꾸 엄마랑 아들로 착각하시는 분들이... 아드님 아드님 소리 들으면 저랑 누나 둘 다 뻘쭘해요...

A quiet park. It's a catholic shrine so the atmosphere is religious. Nevertheless it's good to walk around and clear your head. I went there on weekdays afternoon so there aren't much people. Most visitors are adult to elders.
It's my first time to Seoul alone.i visited the museum and bought some gift.

Mr. Sung bought me here & even he's an atheist, he knows every story of each grave, every corner of the museum & church. This place is open to everybody, even a Christian Korean old lady offered us seats in the church hall.
Nice and quiet place.
150 year of anniversary. Pray & RIP.

This is a big tower in the middle of the city on top of a hill. It's kind of a nice place. I would walk up the hill if I were you. There's some nice yellow buses that will take you to the top. There's also a cable car that you can pay money to wait in line for a long time before you ride. Some days the line is not so long. But mostly it's long. You can also pay money to go to the top of this Tower. Like I said it's a nice Tower.

N Seoul Tower is the signature observatory tower of Seoul, sitting on top of Namsan Park. It also houses thematic museums, cafes, restaurants and souvenir shops, so you have plenty of options on what to do.

column1: At 10,000 won per entry, N Seoul Tower is one of the cheapest observatories that I have been to. You can mix and match your ticket to have museum entries, food or dining experience to go with it. For a really romantic night, you can make advanced booking (they don't accept walk-ins) for n.Grill, a high class French restaurant.

Really enjoyed my experience here. We had a lovely coffee at the cafe on the observatory tower with an equally lovely view. Highly recommend in for an evening outing paired with dinner so you get to see both the day and night view.

column7: Call it cheesy.... but it's just so romantic here. The ride up was beautiful. Unfortunately when we went we had no view as it was raining and very foggy. Regardless, walking around and seeing the thousands of rainbow heart shaped locks, signed in every language and sealed with words of love, it was so beautiful. We of course bought a lock and signed it. Bring your own lock to save some money!
It's pretty cool.

column1: You can go at night and take some pretty good pics of the skyline. It also might be nice to see the sunset there.
Lots of couples and families, lots of tourists. Prepare thyself.
(Also, I don't think that paying to go up in the elevator is 100% worth it. You can check out the love lock terrace for free)

column7: A great place to get a view of the city. Do take the cable car to get here especially if you have kids you need to carry or elderly as no car or tour bus can go up to the base of the tower. A challenging short hike a steep hill from where the car/bus stop. To avoid the crowd, go during weekdays. We went in the morning as soon as the cable car started to operate so there was hardly any queue to get on the cable car.
It's a nice Buddhist temple nearest subway station sadang
Buddhist temple close to Sadang subway station.

나름 관악산 주변에 있는 사찰 가운데 전경과 배경이 멋지고 훌륭한 곳입니다. 아래쪽으로는 사당역을 향하는 길이 있어 도보와 차로 드나들 수 있고, 위와 옆으로는 등산길이 있어 관악산을 바라보며 천천히 오를 수 있습니다. 주말에 차량이 꽤 있어 불편함을 주기도 하지만, 화려한 산새를 끼고 있어 보는 내내 감탄사가 저절로 나옵니다. 특히 사찰 옆이나 관음사 국기봉에서 내려다볼 때에는 한폭의 그림처럼 아름답게 보입니다. 마치 드론을 띄워 위에서 아래를 내려다보는 느낌과 아주 비슷하다고 할까요? 바로 앞에서 보는 사찰의 느낌에 3차원 공간적 시각이 덧붙여져 입체를 보는 것 같습니다. 꼭 산 위에 올라서 보시는 것을 추천합니다. 관음사의 화려한 외관을 마음껏 즐길 수 있거든요. ^^
저의 개인경험으로 말씀드리자면, 관세음보살님의 영험과 부처님의 기운이 느껴지는 곳입니다.

column1: 관악산산맥의 정기를 받아 지기와 천기가 우주기운으로 느껴집니다

column7: 서울 내 불교사찰 치곤 조용한 편. 주차공간은 비교적 양호하나, 주말 등산객들이 몰리면 사당동에서 올라오는 외길이 불법주차로 진퇴양난에 빠지기 십상이다. 그렇다고 대중교통으로 올 경우엔 급경사 등반을 각오해야 함.
샤워장에 탈수기가 없어서 불편합니다.

column1: 주차 공간이 많지 않은데, 회원들이 편안하게 사용해야 할 주차장을 직원들이 많이 점령하고 있습니다. 특히 전면 주차장을 보면 거의 다 직원 차량입니다.

column7: 시설은 노후화되어 있음.  프로그램은 무난
아쿠아 월수금 3시반 쌤이 잘 하십니다^^
해수풀이 있어 눈이따갑거나 피부트러블이 안생겨서 좋아요
락스냄새 안납니다. 해수풀
nice
주차시설 좋고  입구하고 가까워서 주차하고 바로 올라오면 좋아요    음식 반입 안된다구 하는데그때 그때 달라요    아가풀 부터 성인풀까지 다양하고 넓어요  가격 싸고
좋아요. 입장료도 부담없고 가족끼리 간단하게 즐기기 좋아요.주위에 그늘막도 잘 만들어져 있궁ᆢㄷ
실시간 사진이예요ㅎ넓어서 좋아요 사람이 좀 있는편인데도 크게 복작이지 않네요~ 현장입장권 1만원 위메프서 5500원 사서왓어요 음식과 물은 싸오면 돈안들고 괜찮은듯~~ 미끄럼틀은 사진에 보이는 에어바운스 한개랑 워터슬라이드 한가지만 운행하네요~ 정보와 다름 참고하세요
친정집과 가까워 여름엔 수영장, 겨울엔 썰매장 으로 자주 이용한다. 나름 저렴한 입장료로 신나게 놀수있다
수영장이었던 곳을 헤스장으로 만들어 천장이 3층높이 이상이라 괭장히 좋습니다.. 근데 골프연습장, 부대시설 등이 노후되었는데 개선을 안하네요 ㅜㅜ
기구도 지속적으로 교체하고 트레이너들도 친절하지만 너무 pt권유가 심함
이용료가 상대적으로 저렴..
코치들이 괞찬음
깔끔하고 회원들을 다 기억해주심
This is the best swimming pool because it's really close to my house and I love going there and it's really clean and safe
Very clean and well kept. Must wear swimming cap:)
Swimming pool for warm weather use.
Not a bad place to visit and tan during the day
일단 다른 한강수영장에 비해 가족단위 방문인원이 적음 주중에는 태닝족반 가족단위 반 정도..

column1: 수조바닥은 최근 타일로 교체해서 맨발로도 좋으나,  수영장 전체 바닥컨디션이 별로 안좋음
화장실은 간이이동식 화장실이 한동씩 동 서 로 위치. 일단 수조규모에 비해 갯수가 적음. 그래도 사람들이 별로 없어서 줄서기 본적이 별로 없음.
수영장고정 그늘막 갯수도 적긴한데 파라솔도 남아돌아서 ... 굳이 개인그늘막이 필요없긴함.

column7: Good customer service
수영장 이용했어요..
체육관내 주차장이 넓게 준비되어있으나 가까운 곳이 아닌 주차장은 조금 멀리 있어 걸어가야하는 불편한 점도 약간 있다.

column1: 그러나, 수영, 헬스, 각종 콘서트 및  TV 방송 프로그램등이 열리는 활용도가 높은 체육관이다.

column7: 평일 자유수영.  않좋은 소문을 많이 들어서 기대하지

column1: 않았으나 생각보다 물 깨끗하고 길막도 별로 없었음.

column7: 건물내가 좁긴 확실히 좁다 주차공간도 적고 ㅠ 콘서트 볼 목적으로 갔는데 뭐 나름 그럭저럭이었음
Nice fitness center with basketball court
Close to home
시설이 다소 낡긴 했지만 집이나 직장에서 가깝다면 추천
대관을 한후에 이용하는 장소이고, 농구 및 각종 시설이 있습니다.
스노쿨링 하기 좋고 뭣보다 사람들이 많이 없어 너무 좋아요^^
수영이랑 헬스 지금 다니고 있는데 수영시설도 괜찮고 따뜻한물도 잘 나와서 좋습니다.

column1: 근데 유의해야될 점이 시설에서 타올이나 헬스복 등 기타용품을 제공하지 않아서 개인이 다 들고 가셔야되요~

column7: 수영 수강 신청해서 다닙니다...탈의실이 좀 협소하구 드라이기두 기다렸다 사용해서 좀 불편한거 빼고는 괜찮아요~~~^^
수영장 가격 저렴하고
냉난방 잘 되구요, 일단 시설은 좋습니다^^

column1: 수영장도 리모델링 중이라 아마 리모델링 끝나면 더~좋아질 것 같아요!

column7: 신림체육센터 수영장 깨끗하고 저렴하게 이용할수있고 좋네요..
관악산이 잘 보여서 기분이 좋은 곳. 화장실이 엄청깨끗하고 잔디 상태도 나쁘지않다. 살짝 세로도 작고 가로도 작은 듯 하지만 11명이 차기 문제가 있는 정도는 아님. 요즘 서울리그한다고 자주 가고 있는데 잘 차고 있음
주민에게 꼭 필요한 운동장! 깨끗한 관리 감사드려요 ~
다 좋은데 모기가 미친듯이 많습니다.
언덕길에 주차를 해야하는데 주차공간은 협소합니다.
축구장, 농구장, 테니스장이 있다.

column1: 축구장은 관악구민으로 구성된 축구팀을 등록해야 예약할 수 있다. 인조잔디구장으로 작은 스탠드가 있고 스탠드 중앙은 비를 피할 수 있는 천장이 있다. 구장은 작은편. 골대-골대 간 거리는 평균-평균이하 정도고, 가로 길이는 짧은 편이다.

column7: 워커힐 풀파티 참석 차 방문. 워커힐 이름값을 너무 기대했나? 대단한 콘텐츠가 있진 않았음. 규모는 생각보다 적고 (성인 풀 기준), 선배드는 비싸다 하여 대여할 고민조차 안 함. 워커힐에 기분내러 오는 정도로 생각.
가격이 비싸서 인지 사람이 붐비진 않아요. 근데 탈건 없고 풀만 ..부페는 갠적으로 나쁘진 않아요
한강과 아차산중간에 있서 공기좋고 야경도좋고 명월관 피자힐 라이브러리까지 완벽하게 힐링할수있는곳입니다
너무 좋았지만 물이 좀 더러움 ㅠㅠ
입장료 비쌈. 썬베드 대여료 있고 비쌈. 얕은 풀이 있는 쪽에는 돗자리 무료로 펼 수 있음. 샤워실 수준은 동네풀장 수준. 비싸서 그런지 많이 붐비지 않아 좋고, 한쪽방향으로 흐르는 풀이 있어 떠다니기 좋음.
서울 유일의 향교.
역사적가치 조상의 모시는 예법을 볼수있다
아이들과 함께 가 볼만 합니다
도심에서 즐기는옛 발자취
서울에 있는 유일한 향교.
상당히 멋진 곳인데 관악산 밑자락에 붙어 있고, 등산로와는 동떨어져 있어 아쉽기만 하네요. 이런 문화유적지가 묻혀 있다는 것이 안타까울뿐
Quick and easy climb. Good views.
Very good

In my opinion one of the best viewpoints to see nearly the whole city of Seoul. You can easley get up the small 300 meters high Ansan mountain. From anywhere close to the Yonsei University it will take you about 30-45 minutes to get to the viewpoint with the historical signal beacon.
great Morning Walk up the hill. Nice views of Seoul.
Always a great hike to the top of Ansan!
집근처의 개와 같이 가는 산책 코스.. 조용하고 잘 정리 됨.
삼국시대 고분으로 백제나 신라에서 만들었을 것으로 추정되고 있지만 확실한 사실은 아직 밝혀지지 않은 곳입니다.
가볍게 한바퀴 돌며 둘러볼 수 있습니다.

column1: 고분에 사람은 없는 편이지만 주차장에 주차를 많이 해놔서 고분에 갈때는 대중교통 이용을 추천합니다.

column7: 방이동 고분군에 남아있는고분은 생각보다는 많네요. 현제3호분은  복원,정비중.
조용하게산책하기에좋음
Actually there is nothing special to see except the sign telling you what this National Treasure is about
A interesting place to see the hangang-river and the busy expressway, from a site with history. Good stopover on way to Mangwon Hangang Park.

It's a nice place, Mr. Sung brought me here. A 25 minutes walk from the church. Need to take off the shoes & taking off the shoes after 1 day in it feels heaven. After we head back to the nearest subway station, hapjeong.
cozy historic place not big.
It ok
잠시 망중한즐길 서울 몇안되는장소 바로앞  정광수 돈가스가 있어서 더좋음
오늘 추석이라 방문객들이 꽤 오셨는데 어로옆 잔듸에 눕거나 아기들과 공놀이하는 모습은 제재하기이전에 기본인식이 부족한거 같네요.휴일에도 개방을 하였으면 관리을 제대로하였으면 합니다.화장실옆 지나는데 담배연기 냄새도 나고...
조용하고 작은 능. 인당 천원
너무좋은곳
고종황제의 후궁 엄귀인의 무덤으로 후궁의 무덤이라 원이라고한다.
서울의 가장 큰 장점 중 하나인 시내 고분. 한적한 산책에 너무 좋습니다.
Not so lively but a great place for a little walk.
Good Place
국립현충원은 애국지사, 국가원수, 임시정부의 순국선열, 국가유공자, 국군장병, 경찰관, 소방공무원 등 나라를 위해 일하시다 가신 분들을 안장하는 국립묘지입니다

column1: 시설특성상 수목 경관이 잘 관리되고 있고 계절마다 아름다운 자연을 만날 수 있기때문일 겁니다
작지만 매점, 화장실, 주차장 있고 벤치도 마련되어 있어서 가족단위 방문객이 많습니다
(간혹 소란스럽게 움직이는 분들이 계신데..) 묘역과 무관하게 방문하더라도 경건한 마음을 가지고 이동하면 좋겠다는 생각이 듭니다

column7: 잘생겼다로 밀어 부치는 서울시의 전시행정이

column1: 절대로 손 댈 수 없는 서울의 폐 Lung 녹색공간.

column7: 오늘 정치사에 거인 김종필 전총리께서 타계하셨다.  애도하는 마음으로 국립현충원

column1: 묘소를 창배하며 나라를위하여 주님께 간절한 마음으로 이나라를 이끌어주시길 기도했다.

column7: Good place
아주 멋져요. 처음 봤을 때는 공포감 마저 들었지만, 장소와 아주 잘 어울립니다. 마루에 앉아 놀다가, 나무 앞으로 잠깐 흙을 밟으며 산책해 보세요.
서울에서  이런 은행나무를 볼수있는 장소가 또있을지~!
映銀杏樹必去的聖地之一
가을에 완전 좋아요.
Well-organized place. Very sacred and religious place.
I simply love the place as I walk around and relax there from the big city life
외국인 선교사 묘원, 묘원 자체의 이야기 꺼리가 풍성하고, 선교사 한 분 마다 선교의 열정과 쏟은 세월의 헌신 만큼이나 뭉클한 감동이 살아 있는 곳입니다.

column1: 이 땅을 사랑하고 높은 사명감으로 사역을 감당한 후 이곳에 잠들어 있습니다.
오늘날 사회로부터 욕먹는기독교인들이 이곳에서 정화되었으면 합니다.
체계적인 관리와 전문적인 안내 시스템을 갖추고 있으며 안내 봉사자들의 안내 수준이 매우 훌륭합니다.
한국 현대사를 알고 싶다면 이곳에 꼭 들러봐야할 장소입니다.

column7: 선교사님들의 헌신과 사랑 그리고 하나님의 일하심.  말씀의 소중함을 깊이 묵상하게되는 너무 좋은 시간이었습니다. 영상과 현장 가이드 분의 설명과 전시장에서 친절하게 잘 설명해주셔서 더 깊은 묵상에 도움이 많이 된것 같습니다. 감사합니다
가슴이 뭉클 했답니다. 고맙습니다선교사님.사랑합니다 하나님

Nice place to get away from the city.  As of August 2018 there is a lot of construction on some of the pathways.  If you want to take a 15 minute stroll through the forest and see some interesting tombs (that have almost no explanation about them) then this is a good spot.
Very interesting place. Fascinating to follow history. Nice place even to just walk around.

There are 3 Royal Tombs preserved in this park. It is one of the most traquil and beautiful places in this hectic city. Especially, its forest is so breathtaking. In every season, you can enjoy different scenaries.

column1: Joseon dynasty's Royal Tombs are very special because these are the only Royal Tombs in that all of them are remained and preserved until now.
You can enjoy modern and ancient scenary at the same time and video that how our ancestors built these tombs. :-)

column7: Beautiful serene park. Great escape from the businesses of the city. Well worth the trip if you are looking to connect with nature.
Nice pocket forest in the middle of the city. Great for walks, reading, or learning about Korea history.

Great views on Mt. Bukak. There is a couple of restaurants, cafes, and a convenience store on the top so you can rest while looking around. The drive up to the place is also very nice, and not a lot of cars on weekdays, allowing for a slow leisurely ride up and down. There are also numerous decent cafes along the way and at the bottom.
Awesome views of Seoul. However it's hard to get there unless you have a car.
Great to visit on late night with lover.

column1: Reminder: Only can get here by cars.

column7: The place to visit day and night

column1: Capture a beautiful sunrise or moon view. It is considered a date course dont be surprised by the number of couples. Lots of photo points too.

column7: Great views!  Definitely worth the trip!.  Eat before you go there though, the little restaurant they have there is not good.
It's little bit far from central seoul, and the exhibitions are quite short in scale.
Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area. Small and quaint exhibition venue with a lot of relatively unknown artists displayed.
If you love paintings and pictures, this place is worth the visit. 그리고 분위기 좋다!^^
A bit out of the way, but worth the trip if you like old houses.  The former Belgian Legation building offers an intimate venue for exhibitions.
A branch of SEMA near Sadang. Interesting colonial-looking building. Good for a visit.
숨어있는 서울의 역사적 장소

이곳에서  골프스윙연습은 앙돼용
궁산 소악루

column1: 세검정은 1941년 화재로 소실된 뒤 70년대 복원되었다고 합니다. 하지만 복원이 제대로 되지 못해서, 차를 타고 가다보면 흔한 동네 정자처럼 보입니다. 원래 있던 담벼락도 없습니다.
정선의 세검정이라는 부채 그림과, 소설가 이상이 고교때 친구들과 찍은 사진 등이 남아 원형의 모습을 추정할 수 있습니다.
정자를 하늘에서 보면 고무래 정(丁) 형태로 보이며, 칼을 씻었던 곳이라는 의미외에도, 정약용이 친구들과 자주 놀았던 일화 등이 남아 있습니다.
완전하지 못한 복원에 대한 아쉬움(?)인지 안내문의 명칭은 '세검정 터'로 되어 있습니다.

column7: 아주 맛있어요
세검정이 그 아레계곡에서 실록같은
분위기 내기 좋아요 다소 비싼것은 흠
보기 좋아요~

column2: COEX Convention Center Grand Ball Room
column7: This place is excellent for large scale events. It is well connected through the city subway and with local transportation. Also from Ibis hotel you can get a van for free that takes you there (if you are a guest at that hotel of course). The venue has a very large auditorium and plenty smaller rooms. It's great for conferences. This is also connected to a Mall and you can easily get from Coex to the mall and subway!

column2: COEX Convention Center Grand Ball Room
column7: Totally awesome. The number and quality of restaurants and shopping in the basement (reasonable prices), the wide choice of hotels nearby (also reasonably priced), excellent convention halls and the great connections to the airports make this the best convention center I've seen in the world.

column2: COEX Convention Center Grand Ball Room
column7: Excellent Convention center. Easy to access the convention center. Well connected to the rail system and other public transport systems. Several hotels are around the area. There is a big shopping area in the ground floor. Food court and several cafes are around. Well maintained.

column2: COEX Convention Center Grand Ball Room
column7: There are a lot of restorants(food court) in B1(under floor) and these restorants are really good. To be specific, they are little bit expensive(15 $ avg) but various kinds of food and good quality. However, coex is so big convention hall, so if you visit here at the first time, you may easily lost where you are.

column2: COEX Convention Center Grand Ball Room
column7: This is a great place to held a big event! Good wi-fi and variety of food inside Coex mall.
관악산 신림동(현. 삼성동) 약수사

column1: 2017년 지독하게 가물다가 장대비가 며칠 쏟아지더니 급기야는 산신각 약수바위는 폭포수를 뿜어내는 장관을 연출하네요. 영험있는 절은 무언가 특색이 있다는 거겠죠. 아름다운 약수사.

column7: 은평뉴타운 8단지와 연결되는 약수사 가는길! 가을의 정취를 느낄 수 있어요!
good

A great place to watch the sun rise on New Year's Day. Quite a popular one too, so expect it to be crowded.
Nice little hike in the heart of Seoul

시내에 이런 녹지대가 있는건 좋은것 같다. 지하철 5,8호선 천호약에서 내리명 좋다. 시내에서 자주보던 석성이 아니고 토성이라 신기해 보인다. 천호대로쪽(동쪽성벽)은 성벽이 되게 높은데 서쪽성벽은 상대적으로 낮다. 서쪽성벽에는 전망대도 있다.
산책로, 운동하기 좋다. 아산병원으로 이어져 있음.

column1: 토기 그릇 등 유물 조각 과

column7: 그울타리에 발견된유물도잇고 주변에볼거리도많아서 좋습니다
성곽이 별로 남아있지는 않지만,산책로,경당역사공원(건물지,우물지 등)이 있어서 좋아요.

성심여중고 안에 위치해 있습니다. 그래서 평일에 가려면 정문 경비실을 통해 들어가야 하는데, 신분증이 없으면 못들어 갈 수도 있습니다. 성당 자체는 무척 신비로웠고 이뻤습니다.
옛 용산 신학교 성당인 성심 성당은 조적조 양식으로 명동 주교좌성당과 중림동 약현 성당을 설계한 코스트 신부가 설계한 신학교 성당입니다

column1: 일반 교구 성당과는 달리 평면 형식을 가진 이 성당은 지형의 특성을 잘 이용하여 지은 아담한 성당으로 현재 성심 기념관 (구 용산 신학교 생활관)과 더불어 사적 제255 호로 지정되어 보존되고 있습니다.
6.25 전란 때 일부 파괴된 건물을 보수하여 사용하다 2007 년 완전하게 복원하였습니다.

column7: 일요일 저녁 여학생들의 아름다운 합창과 함께 드리는 은혜로운 미사 있습니다
